name: Foreign Startups Mixer n Pitch
Book Club: The Library at Mount Char by Scott Hawkins
description:
A missing God.
A library with the secrets to the universe.
A woman too busy to notice her heart slipping away.

Carolyn's not so different from the other people around her. She likes guacamole and cigarettes and steak. She knows how to use a phone. Clothes are a bit tricky, but everyone says nice things about her outfit with the Christmas sweater over the gold bicycle shorts.

After all, she was a normal American herself once.

That was a long time ago, of course. Before her parents died. Before she and the others were taken in by the man they called Father.

In the years since then, Carolyn hasn't had a chance to get out much. Instead, she and her adopted siblings have been raised according to Father's ancient customs. They've studied the books in his Library and learned some of the secrets of his power. And sometimes, they've wondered if their cruel tutor might secretly be God.

Now, Father is missing—perhaps even dead—and the Library that holds his secrets stands unguarded. And with it, control over all of creation.

As Carolyn gathers the tools she needs for the battle to come, fierce competitors for this prize align against her, all of them with powers that far exceed her own.

But Carolyn has accounted for this.

And Carolyn has a plan.

The only trouble is that in the war to make a new God, she's forgotten to protect the things that make her human.

Populated by an unforgettable cast of characters and propelled by a plot that will shock you again and again, The Library at Mount Char is at once horrifying and hilarious, mind-blowingly alien and heartbreakingly human, sweepingly visionary and nail-bitingly thrilling—and signals the arrival of a major new voice in fantasy.

name: Wizarding World Book Club: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
description:
I took a break from hosting these, but we definitely need to finish up! Next up, the Half-Blood Prince. As usual, I'll also host a book club meeting on the Peninsula. I'll post it as soon as I have a date worked out.

Last year, pottermore.com started an online book club that covered each of the seven books. Every Friday they host a chat on Twitter (@wwbookclub) and Facebook by posting questions for members to respond to. (For more info, go to https://my.pottermore.com/wizarding-world-book-club (https://my.pottermore.com/wizarding-world-book-club)

Let's continue to meet in person and discuss the topics face-to-face at the end of each book. Here are the questions for Half-Blood Prince:

Theme 1: Persuasion (Ch. 1-4)
• What persuades Slughorn to return to Hogwarts?
• Is Narcissa a good mother?
• Do the Dursleys trust Dumbledore?

Theme 2: Humor (Ch. 5-8)
• Are the Weasley twins scared of Voldemort?
• Who is the funniest Harry Potter character?
• Is being in the Slug Club a good thing?

Theme 3: Ancestry and Heritage (Ch. 9-12)
• Is using the Half-Blood Prince’s book cheating?
• Is Voldermort proud of his Gaunt family roots?
• What are the dangers of using the Pensieve?

Theme 4: Luck (Ch. 13-16)
• What are the similarities between Harry and Tom Riddle?
• Why does Ron get nervous playing Quidditch?
• Should Slughorn have offered Felix Felicis as a prize?

Theme 5: Romance (Ch. (17-20)
• Who is the better Keeper, Cormac or Ron?
• Are Ron and Hermione a good match?
• Should Harry consider Ron as he develops feelings for Ginny?

Theme 6: The Professors of Hogwarts (Ch. 21-24)
• What was the most important lesson Dumbledore taught Harry?
• What makes McGonagall a Gryffindor?
• Why does Snape want to teach Defense Against the Dark Arts?

Theme 7: Fear (Ch. (25-28)
• Do you think Draco would have been able to kill Dumbledore?
• What do you think Dumbledore fear the most?
• In your opinion, what makes Harry brave?

Theme 8: Choices (Ch. 29-30)
• Is Harry right to choose Horcruxes over Hogwarts?
• Why do Ron and Hermione decide to accompany Harry?
• What was your favorite Half-Blood Prince moment?

name: Bookclub: Sunshine by Robin Mckinley
description:
From award-winning and national bestselling author, Robin McKinley, comes this dark, sensual vampire fairy tale. "A gripping, funny, page-turning, pretty much perfect work of magical literature."--Neil Gaiman

There hadn't been any trouble out at the lake in years. Sunshine just needed a spot where she could be alone with her thoughts for a minute. But then the vampires found her . . . Now, chained and imprisoned in a once-beautiful decaying mansion, alone but for the vampire, Constantine, shackled next to her, Sunshine realizes that she must call on her own hidden strength if she is to survive. But Constantine is not what she expected of a vampire, and soon Sunshine discovers that it is he who needs her, more than either of them know.
Originally published as an adult novel, but now in YA for the first time, Sunshine is an alluring and captivating vampire story that will ensnare fans of paranormals everywhere.

name: Bookclub: The Three-Body Problem by Cixin Liu
description:
The Three-Body Problem is the first chance for English-speaking readers to experience the Hugo Award-winning phenomenon from China's most beloved science fiction author, Liu Cixin.

Set against the backdrop of China's Cultural Revolution, a secret military project sends signals into space to establish contact with aliens. An alien civilization on the brink of destruction captures the signal and plans to invade Earth. Meanwhile, on Earth, different camps start forming, planning to either welcome the superior beings and help them take over a world seen as corrupt, or to fight against the invasion. The result is a science fiction masterpiece of enormous scope and vision.

name: Bookclub: Oathbringer (Book 3) by Brandon Sanderson
description:
The #1 New York Times bestselling sequel to Words of Radiance, from epic fantasy author Brandon Sanderson at the top of his game.

In Oathbringer, the third volume of the New York Times bestselling Stormlight Archive, humanity faces a new Desolation with the return of the Voidbringers, a foe with numbers as great as their thirst for vengeance.

Dalinar Kholin’s Alethi armies won a fleeting victory at a terrible cost: The enemy Parshendi summoned the violent Everstorm, which now sweeps the world with destruction, and in its passing awakens the once peaceful and subservient parshmen to the horror of their millennia-long enslavement by humans. While on a desperate flight to warn his family of the threat, Kaladin Stormblessed must come to grips with the fact that the newly kindled anger of the parshmen may be wholly justified.

Nestled in the mountains high above the storms, in the tower city of Urithiru, Shallan Davar investigates the wonders of the ancient stronghold of the Knights Radiant and unearths dark secrets lurking in its depths. And Dalinar realizes that his holy mission to unite his homeland of Alethkar was too narrow in scope. Unless all the nations of Roshar can put aside Dalinar’s blood-soaked past and stand together―and unless Dalinar himself can confront that past―even the restoration of the Knights Radiant will not prevent the end of civilization.

name: Mini Law School: Should judges make laws?
description:
The contested nomination of Brett Kavanaugh highlights the fact that many Americans on the left and the right look to the Supreme Court to decide some of society's big questions: whether abortion should be legal, whether corporations can spend freely on elections, whether all citizens who are real persons have the right to vote.

Why do we invest so much power in the "third branch of government," the one that Alexander Hamilton referred to in Federalist Papers No. 78 as the "weakest" branch because it had "no influence over either the sword or the purse"? Is it because of judicial activism? Are we better off with original intent or living constitutionalism? Or should we just abandon judicial philosophy - in other words just accept the reality that judges are political and be sure we get the right ones in order to get the right results?

We will examine these intriguing questions in the next segment of the Mini Law School.

RSVP REQUIRED: This event venue requires us to submit a list of attendees before the event, so it's very important that you RSVP if you're thinking of coming.

name: Eleanor Oliphant Is Completely Fine by Gail Honeyman
description:
“Beautifully written and incredibly funny, Eleanor Oliphant Is Completely Fine is about the importance of friendship and human connection. I fell in love with Eleanor, an eccentric and regimented loner whose life beautifully unfolds after a chance encounter with a stranger; I think you will fall in love, too!” —Reese Witherspoon

No one’s ever told Eleanor that life should be better than fine.

Meet Eleanor Oliphant: She struggles with appropriate social skills and tends to say exactly what she’s thinking. Nothing is missing in her carefully timetabled life of avoiding social interactions, where weekends are punctuated by frozen pizza, vodka, and phone chats with Mummy.

But everything changes when Eleanor meets Raymond, the bumbling and deeply unhygienic IT guy from her office. When she and Raymond together save Sammy, an elderly gentleman who has fallen on the sidewalk, the three become the kinds of friends who rescue one another from the lives of isolation they have each been living. And it is Raymond’s big heart that will ultimately help Eleanor find the way to repair her own profoundly damaged one.

Soon to be a major motion picture produced by Reese Witherspoon, Eleanor Oliphant Is Completely Fine is the smart, warm, and uplifting story of an out-of-the-ordinary heroine whose deadpan weirdness and unconscious wit make for an irresistible journey as she realizes. . .

The only way to survive is to open your heart.

(You guessed it, soon to be a major motion picture)

name: The Mars Room by Rachel Kushner
description:
LONGLISTED for the MAN BOOKER PRIZE

“Gritty, empathetic, finely rendered, no sugary toppings, and a lot of punches, none of them pulled.” —Margaret Atwood via Twitter

“A page turner… one of those books that enrage you even as they break your heart.” —The New York Times Book Review (cover review)

“Brilliant and devastating… a heartbreaking, true, and nearly flawless novel.” —NPR

“With her richly textured third novel, Kushner certifies her place as one of the great American novelists of the 21st century.” —Entertainment Weekly

From twice National Book Award–nominated Rachel Kushner, whose Flamethrowers was called “the best, most brazen, most interesting book of the year” (Kathryn Schulz, New York magazine), comes a spectacularly compelling, heart-stopping novel about a life gone off the rails in contemporary America.

It’s 2003 and Romy Hall is at the start of two consecutive life sentences at Stanville Women’s Correctional Facility, deep in California’s Central Valley. Outside is the world from which she has been severed: the San Francisco of her youth and her young son, Jackson. Inside is a new reality: thousands of women hustling for the bare essentials needed to survive; the bluffing and pageantry and casual acts of violence by guards and prisoners alike; and the deadpan absurdities of institutional living, which Kushner evokes with great humor and precision.

Stunning and unsentimental, The Mars Room demonstrates new levels of mastery and depth in Kushner’s work. It is audacious and tragic, propulsive and yet beautifully refined. As James Wood said in The New Yorker, her fiction “succeeds because it is so full of vibrantly different stories and histories, all of them particular, all of them brilliantly alive.”

name: Homegoing by Yaa Gyasi
description:
Winner of the PEN/ Hemingway Award
Winner of the NBCC's John Leonard Award
Shortlisted for the British Book Award - Debut of the Year
A New York Times Notable Book
A Washington Post Notable Book
One of the Best Books of the Year: NPR, Time, Oprah.com, Harper’s Bazaar, San Francisco Chronicle, Mother Jones, Esquire, Elle, Paste, Entertainment Weekly, the Skimm, PopSugar, Minneapolis Star Tribune, BuzzFeed, The Guardian, Financial Times

Ghana, eighteenth century: two half sisters are born into different villages, each unaware of the other. One will marry an Englishman and lead a life of comfort in the palatial rooms of the Cape Coast Castle. The other will be captured in a raid on her village, imprisoned in the very same castle, and sold into slavery.

Homegoing follows the parallel paths of these sisters and their descendants through eight generations: from the Gold Coast to the plantations of Mississippi, from the American Civil War to Jazz Age Harlem. Yaa Gyasi’s extraordinary novel illuminates slavery’s troubled legacy both for those who were taken and those who stayed—and shows how the memory of captivity has been inscribed on the soul of our nation.

name: Lake Success by Gary Shteyngart
description:
“Stupendous . . . a novel that seems to have been created in real time, reflecting with perfect comedy and horrible tragedy exactly what America feels like right this minute.”—Elizabeth Gilbert

The bestselling author of Super Sad True Love Story returns with a biting, brilliant, emotionally resonant novel very much of our times.

Narcissistic, hilariously self-deluded, and divorced from the real world as most of us know it, hedge-fund manager Barry Cohen oversees $2.4 billion in assets. Deeply stressed by an SEC investigation and by his three-year-old son’s diagnosis of autism, he flees New York on a Greyhound bus in search of a simpler, more romantic life with his old college sweetheart. Meanwhile, his super-smart wife, Seema—a driven first-generation American who craved the picture-perfect life that comes with wealth—has her own demons to face. How these two flawed characters navigate the Shteyngartian chaos of their own making is at the heart of this piercing exploration of the 0.1 Percent, a poignant tale of familial longing and an unsentimental ode to what really makes America great.

name: Let's exchange languages!
description:
Welcome one and all to another multilingual mingling event! This is a fun, casual get-together where you can flex your linguistic muscles in any language or just learn about languages you might want to study some day.

PLEASE feel free to bring drinks and snacks to share. Some people mentioned they would like to bring wine and some snacks to share and you are all more than welcome. We think it would add to the festivities, so don't be shy!

Come practice any language you are learning, share your native language and meet fascinating people from all over the world. Our language exchange Meetups take place in a language school setting and are free of charge. Make friends, find language exchange partners and spend a fun evening chatting in any language you choose. We will help you find native speakers of the language you are learning and encourage you to share your own language. Feel free to bring any drinks or snacks you may want to enjoy during our Meetup.

See you soon ABC Languages & ELI

name: Third Saturday Evening at La Promenade Café
description:
It's time for our monthly meetup at La Promenade Café! Please bring The Daily Ukulele (the Yellow Book) and The Daily Ukulele Leap Year Edition (the Blue Book), your instrument(s), a floor or table music stand, your singing voices, and your fabulous ukulele spirit!

We'll begin with a couple of warm-up songs to be posted soon.

After that, we'll go around the room so that everyone can pick songs to play. If you pick a song, you will be encouraged (but not required) to lead it. If you'd like to let the group know in advance which songs you plan to select, please post the songs you choose in the comments, and we'll play one of those songs each time it's your turn to pick a song. You can also brings songs to share that are not in the Yellow Book or the Blue Book; just please bring enough copies of the sheet music to share.

A donation of $5 to defray Meetup website costs is appreciated.

To thank La Promenade Café for hosting us, everyone is encouraged to purchase some of the cafe's fabulous food and beverages.

name: Monday Ukulele at Andronico's
description: At Second Monday at Andronico's, we take turns picking songs out of the The Daily Ukulele (Yellow Book). Park in the back parking lot and enter Andronico's through a back door on the far left side as you're facing the back of the building. We'll be meeting in a room with tables and chairs situated between the back parking lot and the checkout area. Food (including bakery snacks, a deli counter, a hot food bar, and a salad bar) is available at Andronico's. Bring your instrument, your voice, your Aloha, and a table stand or music stand (if you have one).

name: Don't Fear Templates! Using Twig Templates with Nodes, Views & Layout Initiative
description:
Join the San Francisco Drupal User Group (SFDUG) to network, co-work and socialize with fellow Drupal users and hear Jason Mickela, co-founder of Rootid present "Don't Fear Templates! Using Twig Templates with Nodes, Views & and the New Layout Initiative."

When: Thursday, November 8, 2018
Where: Mission Center Building, UCSF Room MCB 126
1855 Folsom St., San Francisco, CA, 94103, USA
The building entrance is on a parking lot which is entered from 15th Street or Harrison

Agenda
5:30 pm to 6:00 pm Delicious food sponsored by... (pls contact us to be a food sponsor!)

6:00 pm to 6:15 pm “Your Dose of Drupal Dialogue”
— Discussion on what’s in Drupal news
— Who is hiring in the SF Bay Area? Who needs to hire?

6:15 pm to 7:15 SFDUG Drupal Talk - "Don't Fear Templates! Using Twig Templates with Nodes, Views & and the New Layout Initiative."

7:15 - 7:30 pm: wrap up, more hanging out and chatting up Drupal

7:30 pm Head to the local watering hole, Wooden Nickel at 1900 Folsom St.

We will post a Zoom link the day of to join remotely, just be sure to join us on slack to get the link: http://sfdrupal.herokuapp.com

Don't Fear Templates! Using Twig Templates with Nodes, Views & and the New Layout Initiative.

Even today, with Twig templates in Drupal 8, it's common to see sites being made with some of the hacks to avoid writing templates (I'm looking at you hidden Views fields being used in a psudotemplate) and people using a wide range of modules that often do nothing but add a small amount of static HTML to node output (social sharing, social commenting, third-party integrations in general), or layout tools that essentially just shift the hassle of writing templates to the hassle of theming extremely generic output.

While the array of layout tools at our disposal today have their place, they don't replace the need for simple templates. I'll go over some common use cases where Twig templates are an easy and efficient solution including site hero/banner images, social sharing, Views output, and nested Paragraphs. How to create and add new template files, and I'll also touch on the new Layout Initiative.

Topics:
- How to know what to name template files and how to add new template suggestions.
- Writing simple Node templates
- Views templates that output either one item per row, or three items per row.
- Creating a simple gallery widget with nested Paragraphs and Twig templates.

Join us on slack: http://sfdrupal.herokuapp.com

venue.name: Mission Center Building, Room MCB 126, UCSF

Join the San Francisco, Bay Area Drupal community the second Thursday of the month.

General Agenda:

* 7:00 - 7:30 pm: wrap up, more hanging out and chatting up Drupal

1855 Folsom St., San Francisco, CA, 94103, USA

name: The San Francisco Electronic Music Monthly Meetup
description: Join the discussion with your electronic music friends: share your work or projects, bring up an interesting topic of discussion, and meet others!

name: Adults DBSA Support Group
Go out to coffee after Saturday group
Young adults support group
Friends and Family Support Group
Education Night
San Bruno Mountain Trail Run
description: Approximately 6-mile hilly trail run to the summit of San Bruno Mountain via the Old Guadalupe Trail, Bog Trail, and Summit Loop Trail starting at the Crocker Gate trailhead https://goo.gl/maps/adjB8zG31Cx. There’s plenty of street parking at the trailhead, and there are less hilly and shorter options if you’re not up for the summit climb. Spectacular views when it’s clear, but it can be super foggy and windy (especially in the summer). The run starts at 6:30 p.m. sharp so we can be sure to finish before the park closes at 8:00

name: Tuesday Run- Ferry Building (6-8 miles).  Burrito & Tacos after
description:
Awesome Tuesday run down the Embarcadero, through fisherman's Wharf, Crissy filed, San Francisco Bay Trail and back. Post run bites and beer at Orale Orale on 113 Sacramento St (Reserved for SF trail runners every Tuesday)

FAQ: What's the pace of the group? All paces welcome! This is a out and back route. As long as you can either get back to Ferry building or Orale Orale. You will find the group.

FAQ: How far is the run? Any distance is fine. People do just a couple miles or up to 8. The most common distance is 6 miles.

name: Kezar Stadium Track Workout
description:
Join us for a speed workout!

Where to meet: locate the group in the middle of the straightaway on the South side of the track near the 400m start and finish line. After the run portion of the workout, there will be a core session.

name: 2018 California International Marathon
description:
• What we'll do
Great downhill fast course from Folsom to the steps of the Capital Building in Sacramento. This marathon is great for both first time marathon runners and veteran marathon runners. It is the #1 Boston Qualifier and is known as the fastest course in the West. Bonus this year, CIM will also serve as the 2018 USA Marathon Champion. Don't miss your chance to start on the line with the nation best marathon runners.

CIM has provided SF Trail Runners a discount. Use the code SFRUNNER10

Register at the following link. https://runsra.org/california-international-marathon/Registration/ and click on 'Register Now' link.

• What to bring

• Important to know

name: SF Open Studios Art
description:
Hi y'all! It's that time of year again for Open Studios. A few of us will go check out some art Saturday October 20th. We will wander starting at 1pm until we've seen everything. I'm guesstimating that it'll be about an hour and half's time.

This is a free event. Bring a friend, or two! The more the merrier!

Full Event Description here:
https://www.eventbrite.com/e/sf-open-studios-2018-weekend-2-hunters-point-shipyard-tickets-47877855956

name: Friday Night Social
description:
Let's meet for an informal happy hour at Flore on Market (previously Cafe Flore) in the Castro. It's a great opportunity to meet other single gays who want kids someday (or are already parents).

There's no cost to attend, but please do purchase something from Flore on Market.

name: Bay Bridge-Port of Oakland Park Loop | 25 fast and flat miles!
description:
This scenic ride will take us across the Bay Bridge for a beautiful view of the East Bay. Then comes a gradual fast descent and we exit Burma St. to quiet Maritime St. and ride to Middle Harbor Shoreline Park with views of SF.

We'll then take a loop in the bike lanes around Lake Merritt and back to BART.

Pace: 14-20 MPH Fast Pace on the flats!

We stop at all turns. Sorry, no sweeper. No cue sheet available, as I know the route by heart and streets are subject to change. Verbal cues are given at turning points.

Brings Snacks. There will be a restroom stop both at the end of the bridge and Shoreline Park.

Annual Meetup Fee: 10.00 to help support my Meetup dues and planning. This applies to first timers and anyone who last paid in 10/2017 or before. There is a notation under your name. Thank you.

Lunch after the ride optional and TBD.

name: Oakland Hills:  Redwood Rd. / Skyline Loop | 30 miles, 3000'
description:
Classic Oakland Hills!

This ride will take us up the classic roads to Skyline and Redwood. We'll ride the rollers out and back to Keller on Redwood Rd. Then we'll climb Skyline until it meets Grizzly Peak to descend down Claremont. From there, we'll take the Temescal Lake bike path into Montclair and back down Park. St. to return.

Optional lunch in Montclair or at the finish.

Pace: 14-20 MPH on the flats, 10 min. catchup at the top of hills.

Social Pace Not a Race! Group ride.

We stop at all turns. Sorry, no sweeper. No cue sheet available, as I know the route by heart and streets are subject to change. Verbal cues are given at turning points.

Brings Snacks. There will be a restroom stop at Redwood Regional Park.

Annual Meetup Fee: 10.00 to help support my Meetup dues and planning. This applies to first timers and anyone who last paid in 10/2017 or before. There is a notation under your name. Thank you.

name: Montebello Rd. to Ridge Vineyards for Wine Tasting! | 35 mi., 2500' (South Bay)
description:
"Haven't been to Ridge Vineyards in years, but remember the view is one of the best in the South Bay." William G.

Here's a special ride being led by one of our members, William G. (Bill) through the Montebello Preserve, a lovely wooded region to Ridge Vineyards Winery.

There are some steep climbs, but we have a 10 minute catch up time at the top of all hills. I'm sorry, there is no sweeper, I'll put a "cue sheet" at the bottom of this write-up provided by Bill.

Social Pace Not a Race! This is a group ride.

Fees:

Annual Membership fee: 10.00 to help support my Meetup Dues and planning. This only applies first-timers any anyone who last paid 11/2017 or earlier. Thank you.

Optional Wine tasting fee:

10.00 for 4 samples from their non-estate selections.
15.00 for 4 samples from grapes grown on their own estate.

I will collect fees at the start of the ride and pay the winery with my credit card for everyone as that is their preference. Let them know which flight you have chosen.

Bring all snacks and fluids but we will have a rest stop in Saratoga Village.

See you there!

Rain cancels :(

********************************************

Start: Peet's coffee 798-1 Blossom Hill Rd, Los Gatos Left on Los Gatos Blvd. (1.25 mi) Proceed onto E Main St. (0.75 mi) Right on N Santa Cruz Ave (ride thru downtown Los Gatos) (0.5 mi) Left on Los Gatos-Saratoga Road (Hwy 9) 3.6 mi Left on Big Basin Way (Starbucks rest stop at corner) 0.8 Mi Ride thru Saratoga Village Right on Toll Gate Rd (0.8 mi). Note steep road... (Alternate route is to continue up Big Basin Way another mile to Pierce Road) Continue up onto Saratoga Heights Drive Right on Pierce Road 1.0 mi Left on Mount Eden Road (4.0 mi) (some steep climbs) Left onto Montebello Road (4.2 mi up to Ridge Vineyards) Same way on return except turn left at N Santa Cruz Ave off of Los Gatos-Saratoga Road (Hwy 9) (0.5 Mi) Right on Blossom Hill Road (1.0 Mi to Peet's Coffee)

name: Open Decks @ OMG
description:
Line-up:

6:00PM - DJ Pilz

6:45PM - Qualafox

7:30PM - Catatonic Bob

8:15PM - Remote Access

9:00PM - John Dru

If you are new to the group, please come along and say hi, then you'll be able to play at a future meetup.

OMG has 2 Pioneer CDJs and a Pioneer Mixer (no turntables sorry) plus plenty of space in the booth for a controller and laptop stand.

name: 60% off Crash Course at Chinese Language Academy. Learn Chinese in 16 Hours
description:
The Chinese Language Academy of San Francisco is offering a 4 week Mandarin Chinese crash course from October 14th to November 4th and they will offer a 60% off discount (original price is $400, the discounted price is $150.00) to all members of our group in October 2018. Here is their website:

https://www.clachinese.com/san-francisco

This is a weekend program of FOUR afternoons (16 hours total), will run on Sundays 2-6pm, commencing October 14th and ending on November 4th.

This Crash Course is a powerful sixteen-hour program designed to introduce the beginner student to the structure of the Mandarin language and build a foundation to develop their skills in listening, speaking, reading, and writing in Mandarin Chinese. This program is CLA's featured program, and thousands of students in LA and DC have attended this program and successfully reached their learning goal. Here is a video about this program:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=RY5qUToLrhc

This is what the students are expected to achieve at the end of the 16 hours' program:

• Have a solid understanding of the structure of Mandarin Chinese (pronunciation, writing system and grammar).
• Have basic communicative skills to begin building relationships with your Chinese friends and business contacts.
• Learn to write at least 100 Chinese Characters and recognize many more.
• Be able to use the Pinyin system to pronounce any new Mandarin Chinese word you encounter in the future with correct tones.
• Be able to type Chinese on a regular keyboard.

We welcome all members of this meetup group to join our class. Registration is required. The class size is limited so we will not be able to accommodate you if you don't sign up and pay in advance. For the registration discount and more information regarding this class, please email [masked]

Thank you. We look forward to seeing you at our class!

https://www.clachinese.com/san-francisco
(415)[masked]
[masked]
100 Pine St., Suite 1250, San Francisco, CA 94111

name: SF Social Language Lovers Meet Up
description:
Hello SF Social Language Lovers!

We're happy to welcome you back to Hotel Rex.

The Meetup takes place in the Hotel's beautiful lobby next to the bar.

Once arrived grab one of the name tags from the Host and write down your Name and the Languages that you: (want to) speak, are learning, are interested to learn or...all the above!

Then find a language-exchange partner, and/or share your native language and culture with people who are learning.

• ONE DRINK MINIMUM - This is a free group, which is great, but we do have to keep our venues welcoming us back. This means your minimum contribution is to buy yourself one drink or appetizer. Also, please do not forget to leave a TIP for the bartenders (typically $1-$2 per drink).

• Take advantage of the Happy Hour by arriving before 7pm.

• Please remember the bar is a public place and you're responsible for your personal possessions.

*The Goal of this Meetup is to help people learn languages and make friends in a comfortable environment. If something or someone makes you uncomfortable please tell the host. Most importantly, just have fun!*

We look forward to seeing you all soon!

Giovanni

PS: this Meetup is scheduled for every 3rd Wednesdays of the month, save the date!

name: After Work Networking (San Francisco)
description:
[*** IMPORTANT ***] FILL OUT THE FORM NOW & FOLLOW 3 STEPS

https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSdjI90MIEDAvIvYXX-7W4ERINFGPdO7ER_2jV4-8SY7S_E-cA/viewform (<= CLICK NOW)

This is a big city with so many great people to network with. But how valuable is it to be in a city with great networking opportunities if you don't get out and network with biz and tech professionals.

1. Fill out LEARN-YOUR-BEST-MATCHES form given above.

2. Check your match-making email about 3 hours before the event.

3. Reach out to your potential matches and plan to meet as they confirm.

If you are interested in becoming an event host, let us know.

*** There may not be an EVENT HOST at the venue to guide you. ***

When you arrive at the venue, search for attendees, introduce yourself, share business cards, and meet your matches.

NOTE: Use your best judgment and discretion and do your due diligence and research before you share your info and meet with other attendees.

name: Ultimate Halloween Business and Tech Professionals Gathering
description:
This will be an ultimate gathering for the tech and startup community of Silicon Valley and the Bay Area to mingle and have fun and dress up after a long weeks work. All while celebrating Halloween.

MUST COMPLETE RSVP ON EVENTBRITE, AN RSVP on MEETUP DOES NOT COUNT AS A FULL RSVP https://www.eventbrite.com/e/ultimate-halloween-business-and-tech-professionals-gathering-tickets-51033416322

name: Upcoming trips 2018/2019 : Cuba - Myanmar - Croatia, etc. - Africa - Tuscany!
description:
Amazing upcoming trips in 2018! See below for some details. Email [masked] if interested in a trip or if you have questions. Detail for each trip can be seen here : http://globe-drifters.com.

-----
CUBA (9 days / 8 nights)

Small groups usually between 5-10 people and mostly solo travelers. Local and authentic trips with stays in Cuban privately-run B&B style accommodations.

November 17 - 25, 2019 // December 26, 2018 - January 3, 2019
*6 SPOTS LEFT!*
1 solo female and male looking for roommates.

-----
MYANMAR (15 days / 14 nights)

Myanmar has been shrouded in mystery for many travelers over the last half century, but has recently opened to tourists. It is much more than golden pagodas as far as the eye can see though. We'll explore the serenity and diversity of Inle Lake, wander among extensive stretches of fields filled with ancient pagodas in Bagan, visit the newly opened Chin State with many distinct ethnic tribes and unique customs.

December 27, 2018 - January 10, 2019
*6 SPOTS LEFT!*
1 solo female and male looking for roommates.

-----
EASTERN CUBA (10 days / 9 nights)

Travel the Cuba that few travelers get to see. It is the birthplace of the revolution and home to Cuba’s oldest city. With its pristine beaches, charming colonial towns, and a captivating history, Eastern Cuba is full of fiercely proud people with an independent spirit.

February 3 - 12, 2019
1 solo female and male looking for roommates.

-----
TURKEY (11 days / 10 nights)

Historic churches, mosques and palaces of Istanbul. Subterranean tunnels and homes that date back to the 7th century B.C in Cappadocia. Crystal-blue, natural thermal pools at the ‘Cotton Castle’ of Pamukkale. Sunrise hot air ballooning over fairy tale valleys. And more!

May 11 - 21, 2019

-----
TUSCANY VILLA STAY (2 / 4 weeks)

We’ll enjoy life at a slower pace as we soak up the culture, food and amazing vistas of the Italian countryside. Head to the local markets to pick out some cheese and wine and stroll through narrow passageways that will take us back to medieval times. Ride a bike or take a leisurely walk to back to our 18th century luxury villa while passing olive groves during an amazing Tuscan sunset. This is the Italy that few tourists get to see!

4 week trip : May 4 - June 1, 2019

2 week trip : May 4 - 18, 2019 // August 24 - September 7, 2019

-----
CROATIA, BOSNIA, SLOVENIA & MONTENEGRO (11 days / 10 nights)

Discover Croatia’s cascading waterfalls at Plitvice National Park, old towns with remnants of a heartbreaking past in Bosnia-Hercegovina, the picturesque Kotor Bay of Montenegro and fairytale-like castles and lakes in Slovenia!

April 17 - 27, 2019

-----
ZIMBABWE, BOTSWANA & SOUTH AFRICA (13 days / 12 nights)

Explore stunning landscapes, amazing wildlife and majestic waterfalls in Zimbabwe, Botswana and South Africa. Witness the power of Victoria Falls. Try to spot the Big Five and other beautiful animals. Go camping in the park of Africa’s largest elephant population as you fall asleep under a night sky full of sparkling stars.

June 8 - 20, 2019

Enlightened Cinema - "Coco"
description:
This fantastic animated Oscar-winning movie “Coco.” with its wonderful display of afterlife gave us so much more than the look and feel of Mexico’s Día de Muertos.

It is the story of a family whose mourning and loss are eased by a guitar-playing little boy, Miguel who confronts his family’s ancestral ban on music, enters the realm of Spirit Land to find his great-great-grandfather, a legendary singer. Miguel finds himself in the stunning and colorful Land of the Dead following a mysterious chain of events.

The movie also shows the importance of honoring those who have gone before us, acknowledging the afterlife, having a passion for life, and creating family solidarity through rituals.

"Sounds a lot like Spiritualism? I certainly think so. Please join me, perhaps with tissues in hand, to laugh and cry with this beautiful and enchanting story. ~ James Bae"

Come join us every last Friday of the month for an inspiring, thought-provoking cinema from around the world and watch on the big screen. Gathering in a social setting for entertainment, discussion.

name: CASTLE ROCK STATE PARK
description:
This hike will be about 6.5 miles with an elevation gain of about 1250'. If you have access to a car we can either meet you at Safeway or at the Park. PLEASE CARPOOL! PARKING IS REALLY LIMITED. (We'll arrive at the park around 11 AM and start hiking at 11:15.) We're never sure whether we'll have cars for everyone at Safeway.
There are a couple of tricky areas but overall it's a moderate hike.
Castle Rock State Park is known for its "tafoni" or Swiss-cheese rock formations, and having about the highest elevation in the Santa Cruz mountains, outstanding views of the mountains and the Pacific. We'll begin at the Summit Rock/Skyline parking area, then go up Skyline to the main park entrance parking area on Skyline/Highway 35. We'll then head up to Castle Rock itself, then follow the Saratoga Gap, Ridge, Loghry Woods Trails to make a beautiful loop through the park. There are several incredible rock formations along the way, and view points that we'll hike out to. The park has some enormous madrones, live and California black oaks and Douglas firs. We'll be in the shade for about 90% of the hike. Hopefully we'll have some clear skies to take advantage of the views.

Bring plenty of water, lunch, snacks, hiking shoes with good treads, sunscreen, layers and insect repellent.

Alternative Meeting Place: We'll meet at the Summit Rock/Skyline Trail Parking Area on Skyline/Highway 35, around 1.4 miles south of Saratoga Gap/Big Basin Way/Highway 9. Parking is in short supply. If this smaller lot is full we can try the main lot which is 1.2 miles farther south on the right. After you've passed the Saratoga Gap/Highway 9 intersection, start looking on the left (east) for the dirt parking area. The sign says something like: Sanborn/Skyline/Summit Rock. Google Maps link: https://www.google.com/maps/place/Parking+Summit+Rock/@37.2413703,-122.1059509,19.03z/data=!4m12!1m6!3m5!1s0x808e4cb8a4cd75d7:0x935e7127f159670c!2sParking+Summit+Rock!8m2!3d37.2413676!4d-122.1057673!3m4!1s0x808e4cb8a4cd75d7:0x935e7127f159670c!8m2!3d37.2413676!4d-122.1057673

We'll arrive at the parking lot around 11 and leave around 11:15.

PLEASE CARPOOL!

name: MONTARA MOUNTAIN (PACIFICA) HIKE - 8 MILES
description:
If you have access to a car we can also meet you at 9AM under the Safeway sign on Market and Dolores. We'll be to the left of See's Candies. Let us know if are able to meet us there. [masked].
On a clear day (pray for it!), the views on the trail up to Montara (just above Pacifica) are stunning, with panoramic vistas of the Pacific Ocean, Pacifica, Mount Tamalpais. The hike will be 8 miles - most of it exposed with a good stiff uphill climb.

name: COYOTE HILLS REGIONAL PARK SUNDAY HIKE
description:
This will be a 7-mile walk with only 400' elevation gain. Coyote Hills Regional Park along the southeast side of San Francisco Bay is a wonderful place to see shorebird life and marsh habitats during autumnal bird migration. (Bring your binoculars!!!) We will start with a short walk through the inner marshes on boardwalks, then cross over Red Hill to the bayside of the hills before entering the Don Edwards Wildlife Refuge along the salt evaporation ponds and breakwater near the open bay. We return to Coyote Hills, steeply climbing Glider Hill before ending at the Visitor Center. Leashed dogs are permitted with a $2.00 fee in Coyote Hills Park but are not allowed in the wildlife refuge.
Bring / Wear: lunch, water, sturdy shoes, layers of clothing (the bayside can be windy), hat, sunscreen, and BINOCULARS.

Dogs are allowed with a $2 fee.

If you have access to a car, you can either meet under the Safeway sign on Market @ Dolores at 9AM or at the Visitor Center at 10:15. Kathy Diamond is the hikeleader, but won't be at the Safeway to meet in SF.

Meet leader at 10:15am at Coyote Hills Regional Park Visitor Center. Driving directions from SF: US 101 S to Marsh Rd/Dumbarton Br (Exit #406 in Redwood City) and turn left onto CA 84 eastbound; follow signs for Dumbarton Br; cross bridge and take first exit, Thornton Avenue/Paseo Padre Pkwy and turn left; continue on Paseo Padre Pkwy 1.2 mi, left onto Patterson Ranch Road to kiosk ($5 parking fee) and to visitor center parking lot at end of the road. From East Bay: I-880 to Decoto Rd/Dumbarton Br exit (Exit #21 in Fremont) and turn west onto CA-84 W toward Dumbarton Br; west 1.8 mi to Thornton Avenue/Paseo Padre Pkwy and turn right; continue on Paseo Padre Pkwy 1.2 mi, left onto Patterson Ranch Road to kiosk ($5 parking fee) and to visitor center parking lot at end of the road. (Or use: https://www.google.com/maps/place/8000+Patterson+Ranch+Rd,+Fremont, +CA+94555/@[masked],[masked],17z)

name: COWELL-PURISIMA COASTAL TRAIL
description:
Once upon a time, hikers wanting miles of level coastal bluff trails had to travel to Sonoma or Mendocino County. Cowell-Purisima Coastal Trail, opened in the summer of 2011, now provides this in our backyard. Tucked between the Pacific Ocean and the western slope of the Santa Cruz Mountains, it offers spectacular views of the ocean, offshore rocks, inaccessible beaches favored by harbor seals and shorebirds. Lunch will be at a bluff-top promontory. Sorry, no dogs are allowed due to adjacent fields of artichokes, Brussels sprouts, and mustard.

If you have access to a car you can either meet us under the Safeway sign on Market @ Dolores at 9AM, or at the Trailhead at 10:15. Kathy Diamond, the hikeleader will not be meeting at the Safeway.

Meet leader at Cowell Ranch Beach Trailhead parking lot at 10:15am. NOTE: this is NOT Purisima Creek Redwoods in the hills near Skyline Blvd; it is the relatively new trail along the bluffs south of Half Moon Bay. I-280 S to CA-92W (toward Half Moon Bay). Go west 7 miles, left onto Highway 1, south 3 miles to parking lot on right. Lot is small, but there is plenty of parking along Highway 1.
Google Maps: https://www.google.com/maps/dir//Cowell+Ranch+Beach+Access,+Half+Moon+Bay,+CA+94019/@37.4199716,-122.4369383,17z/data=!4m9!4m8!1m0!1m5!1m1!1s0x808f0b9ccadeb659:0x96f4d5890507b474!2m2!1d-122.4347496!2d37.4199716!3e0

Bring / Wear: Lunch, water (at least one liter), hat, sunscreen, and the usual layers for beach weather. Comfortable walking shoes are recommended for this well groomed trail.

name: Overnight Backpacking East Lake, Hoover Wilderness
description:
NOTE: Oct is a bridge month. The weather might continue to be fine or we might see early storms. Regardless, the nights will be colder for sure. Just something to keep in mind.

WHAT
This is a 2-day, overnight trip to East Lake. It is a 15 mile (RT) out-and-back starting at 9,850’, over an 11,100’ pass, and camping at East Lake at 9,500’. This is my first time into this area and exploring somewhere new. It seems like a pretty straight-forward kind of trail but with this amount of climbing, it’ll be a butt kicker.

This trip has 10 spots. If you would like to go, please RSVP and that will put you on the waiting list in a first come, first serve order. You will be moved to going once the fee is collected.

WHEN
Oct 13-14, 2018. We'll meet Sat at 10:00 am, hiking by 10:30 am.

WHERE
Meet at the Virginia Lakes Trailhead.
There are restrooms and water in the area of the trailhead.
https://goo.gl/maps/sA6RS6yXuF12

The drive should take about 5 hours from the SF Bay Bridge.

A fire permit is required. California requires you to have a fire permit to operate a cooking stove in the backcountry.
http://www.preventwildfireca.org/Campfire-Permit/

A bear canister is required for this trip.
Do not store food, trash or scented items in your vehicle.
All food and scented items must be stored in bear lockers.
For more information about traveling in bear bear country, click here...

COST
$14 to reserve a spot and cover permit cost. Non-Refundable. You will be moved from waitlist to going once payment is received. Fees offset the cot of running the group and any associated permits.
http://paypal.me/giovannimeetup

WEATHER
Monitor the weather forecast from NOAA:
https://forecast.weather.gov/MapClick.php?lon=-119.30255530422178&lat=38.072219336860655#.W35O9RplCf1

MOON:
Phase: Waxing Crescent
Illumination: 20%
Sunset: 6:20 pm
Moonset: 10:30 pm
Galactic Center: 8:00 pm to 9:30 pm

ESSENTIAL GEAR
■ Maps
■ Bear resistant food storage containers
■ Stove, water filter, meals, and all other backpacking items to be self-sufficient
■ Fire permit for stove use
■ Tent
■ Sleeping bag
■ Appropriate clothing
■ Photography gear (optional)

By signing up for this trip you acknowledge that the purpose of this event is to bring to bring together seasoned backpackers for shared adventures and that you are completely responsible for your own safety and well-being. You should be comfortable with your skills and prepared to be entirely self-sufficient. The event organizer is a volunteer and not a guide.

name: Lost Coast Intermediate Backpack
description:
drive up on Thursday, car camp at the Horse Mountain Campground on King Peak Road.
Friday walk south to Horse Mountain Creek trail take it to the shore. go north, spend the night at Big Flat on the coast.
We may need to wait on the beach for a bit to pass at low tide:
https://ca.usharbors.com/monthly-tides/California-North%20Coast/Shelter%20Cove/2018-09
Saturday go up Rattlesnake Ridge trail, stay the night at Maple Camp. maybe explore.
Sunday head down King Crest trail and back to Horse Mountain Campground (where we left the cars).

name: Beginning backpacking trip Point Reyes National Seashore
description:
This is for anyone just starting out and experienced backpackers too. Coast Camp is a relatively easy 2 miles down the beach from the trail head. The perfect chance to work out the kinks in your new gear and figure out what not to do, or maybe get tips from others and see what gear they are using. Winter on the north coast is often clear and warm, and the beach/ocean photography can be very good.
We'll meet in Point Reyes Station for coffee and baked goods, and then proceed to Limantour Beach trail head. I am maxing out the group camp site at 20+ participants, so let's try to car pool..:-)

As December approaches, I will list the minimal gear needed for a basic overnight backpack like this one.

COST: $5
http://paypal.me/giovannimeetup

name: Entre dos Mundos: Spanish-English Bilingual Book club - 4th. meeting
description:
Join us for our next meeting of our bilingual Spanish-English bookclub “Entre dos mundos” on Saturday, October 13 at 3 pm.

We will be commenting Alejandro Zambra's Formas de volver a casa, either in its original Spanish version or in its English translation by Megan McDowell, Ways to Go Home.

This is the fun thing about this book club! It’s totally up to you: you can choose to read the book either in Spanish or in its English translation, or in both! During the meeting, we will have bilingual discussions on different aspects of the book, including topics that are interesting to translators, such as the linguistic, stylistic and cultural choices made in translation.

You can find descriptions and reviews about the book here: https://www.theguardian.com/books/2013/jan/13/ways-going-home-zambra-review, and https://www.elcultural.com/revista/letras/Formas-de-volver-a-casa/29560.

This book can be purchased at Green Apple Books and online at Barnes & Noble or Amazon.

Green Apple Books:
Only available in English: https://www.greenapplebooks.com/book/9780374534356

Barnes & Noble:
Spanish: https://www.barnesandnoble.com/w/formas-de-volver-a-casa-alejandro-zambra/1114778008?ean=9788433977434
English: https://www.barnesandnoble.com/w/ways-of-going-home-alejandro-zambra/1111414265?ean=9780374534356

Amazon:
Spanish: https://www.amazon.com/Formas-volver-Coleccion-Compactos-Spanish/dp/8433977431/ref=sr_1_1?s=books&ie=UTF8&qid=1537258175&sr=1-1&keywords=formas+de+volver+a+casa
English: https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/0374534357?pf_rd_p=d1f45e03-8b73-4c9a-9beb-4819111bef9a&pf_rd_r=QE0Z1TR8CZ5ZVTD655Y3

Always check your local bookstore or library! They might have it or order it for you!

This Book Club started in New York City last November, and it will now run simultaneously in New York and in San Francisco.

For more information on the original idea and the previous books discussed in New York City, you can visit: https://clubdelecturanyc.wordpress.com/.

Happy bilingual reading and see you soon!

name: NCTA in NOLA - Let's have lunch together!
description:
We would love to get together with our NCTA members attending ATA59!

We know you will find yourself sparking new conversations at every step of the conference, but it is very pleasant to see a “familiar face” - like your fellow NCTA members.

Let's enjoy a typical New Orleans dish together and reinvigorate for the conference. We want to thank all members for being part of our association as we celebrate 40 years, and we have a token of appreciation for the members that join us for lunch! Are you on pins and needles wondering what it is?

See more info about the restaurant here: http://www.commercerest.com/welcome.html

name: Sonoma County Meetup
description:

Please RSVP as soon as you can to help us make the reservation.

name: WORKSHOP: WEBSITE L10N & THE L10N ECOSYSTEM THAT IS NEEDED TO MAKE IT HAPPEN
description:
In the vast universe of the localization process, website localization is one important vehicle to communicate a company’s brand, style, and product portfolio. In this workshop, you will learn how NetApp localizes websites, and also learn about the localization ecosystem that is needed to make it happen. From strategy to execution, including technology, project and vendor management, Edith will give an overview of how NetApp goes to market in over 150+ countries.

About the Presenter:

Edith Bendermacher is a native of Poland, grew up in Germany, and ended up in California 18 years ago. Today, Edith is Head of Localization and Globalization Strategy at NetApp, based in Sunnyvale, California. Her team oversees localization at NetApp in 15 languages under a Center of Excellence, and they are responsible for the strategic planning for globalization across all departments, as well as the delivery, uptake and return of the globalization investments.
In her spare time, Edith and her family love to travel around the world. She is also an avid photographer, looking for meaningful fragments through the lens of her camera, most recently focusing on the newest member of her family, Boba, the blue Boston Terrier. Find her on Twitter at @EdithBeee.

Cost:

NCTA Members EB – $25 (until 11/4/2018)
Non-NCTA Members EB – $35 (until 11/4/2018)
NCTA Members (after 11/4/2018) – $35
Non-NCTA Members (after 11/4/2018) – $45

REGISTER AT https://ncta.org/event/workshop-website-localization-and-the-localization-eco-system-that-is-needed-to-make-it-happen/

-------------------------------
Continuing Education: ATA-certified members will earn 2 Continuing Education points.

Registration: Early payment is advised in order to secure participation and help reach the workshop minimum participation. Unfortunately, workshops may occasionally have to be canceled or rescheduled if the confirmed participation in advance is very low. NCTA will not be responsible for any consequential losses to participants arising from this.

Cancellation policy: Refunds are issued only if notice of cancellation is received one week prior to the applicable workshop date. A cancellation fee of $10 is charged for all cancellations.

name: Pub Crawl with International Travelers (EVERY WEDNESDAY)
description:
This pub crawl is EVERY WEDNESDAY!! NOTE: The date changes on meetup as it gets closer to the event start time because this is a recurring event, but this event happens every Wednesday at 9PM!

The crawl is run by volunteers at hostels in SF so that there's a place for backpackers and locals to meet each other. The event gets a bunch of travelers from all over the city along with locals. (And we always get a very international group - travelers from France, Germany, Spain, etc). Come join us, have some drinks, and meet some new peeps. We will be joining my friend's meetup group and there will be people picking up a groups of backpackers from local hostels - here is the main event link with all the details, meeting point, etc: http://www.meetup.com/San-Francisco-things-to-do/events/82926222/

Hope to see you on Wednesday for some fun! :)

description:

www.sfhostelparty.com (http://www.sfhostelparty.com/)

name: Main Monthly Meeting - Topic TBD
description:
How are you doing on your real estate investing dream?

For Investors who are still looking for a way to take your real estate investing to the next level, here are the three pieces that we use to get clear and take action.  It's a new kind of association or REIA.  We'd like to share these with you because we know that

                                WE ARE UNBEATABLE TOGETHER

              An investing strategy that can make the difference

                                                            or

                   A source of funding that can make the difference

                                                             or 

                       A way to get yourself to take consistent action

If you’re pretty sure it's not going the way you want it to, then you’re in the right place because when it comes to your dream, nothing is more important than figuring out what’s missing and changing it.  

Almost every real estate investor, including myself, has big dreams, big goals.  That’s what I love about this business.  Yet, as motivated and self-directed entrepreneurs who are willing to invest and do whatever it takes, an astonishingly small number of us actually break into the ranks of true, professional investing.  I’ve done it myself and my mission is to make that, and much, much more,  happen for you as well.  

I can’t believe how much great information and strategies on real estate investing are now readily available everywhere, in live events, books, audios and online.  It’s crazy how good the information is and how accessible, in fact, we are drowning in information and content, So, obviously, If it was about great information and content, you probably wouldn’t even be here.  You’d be out doing deals or on the beach somewhere.  We’re both here for one reason.  As investors who want more, the one thing we all have in common is that we’re not at the level we want to be at yet.  We believe that closing the gap for you and me and our fellow members requires a trusted network and community.  

That’s why we’re here.  To bridge the gap between having great information and strategies and turning that into the action, profits and life we all want.  

This is our Launch event showcasing a new format and way of  getting you great information and strategies on real estate investing, PLUS access to the information, strategies and how-tos on using and becoming an expert at Private lending.  

The missing piece is what a Tony Robbins or perhaps some other great coach you once had in your life would call emotional mastery or grit  That’s the piece that gets you to go beyond getting the information, beyond taking a little action.  The piece that gets you to consistently use it, master it and profit from it.

This is not a pitchfest.  There will be no hidden agendas or surprise pitches.  Instead, this month’s meeting is all about breaking through what’s stopping you from mastering your Real Estate Investing.

Come learn and experience the Four keys of mastery in any arena and to becoming a successful real estate investor and more starts here.  We have the keys to Peak Performance of Master Investors and we want to share them with you:

THE SKILLS -  We not only connect you to skills, tools, and strategies that will help you succeed but also to the experts to show you how to implement those skills, tools, and strategies.

THE TOOLS - As a part of a national network including National REIA and REIFA (Real Estate Investors Funding Association) we will connect you to the tools, resources and benefits available as a result of 40,000+ investor members collaborating and working together.

YOUR EMOTIONS - Your results are a reflection of your actions, your actions are a result of your emotions, your emotions and how you take control and direct them is the key.  You get access to the 90 days Breakthrough Invest-In-You program from one of the few coaches ever to earn the title of Master Coach from Tony Robbins, Scott Whaley

The Power of a Trusted SUPPORT TEAM and COMMUNITY -  As a member, you become part of a nationwide network of over 40,000 + investors that include both local and national experts and trainers.  You get connected to our own virtual, Google supported, proprietary community, REIFANET, to provide you with the tools, events, and support network that every investor needs in order to succeed in a hyper connected, fast changing investing world we live in.

Scott Whaley, past president of National REIA, Real Estate Investor, lender and broker and Founder of REIFA and one of less than a handful of people who Tony Robbins personally trained and hired as a coach and promoted to Master coach while working for Robbins Research. Scott is offering his expertise on the spot at our next meeting.  If you aren’t getting the results you want in your real estate investing come to the meeting and let Scott help you create it.  

At this meeting you will see and experience for yourself a breakthrough.  The psychology and emotional mastery that Tony Robbins uses will be performed and demonstrated for you by an expert in this arena called Peak Performance.

BONUS PROGRAM (advance registration required)

For those extra success hungry individuals who can’t wait and want to Breakthrough to the next investing level there is a special promotional accelerated program being offered but it is only available for advance registrants who read this and want to start right away.

Warning, first time guests attend for free.  The registration for this program is $1.00 per mo for three months!

This is a special promotional one-time offer being offered to attendees but only in advance and only to the first 12 people to register.  

To find out more and before the meeting happens go and look over the programs’ details by CLICKING HERE.

name: Learning Club: No Wall They Can Build
Nonprofit Workers: Discuss our workplace experiences
Intro SQL for Business
description:
Structural Query Language (SQL) is a highly-demanded database programming language used by data analysts, data scientists, marketers, managers and anyone else who uses data to make informed business choices. You will gain the foundational tools needed to make data-driven business decisions, and walk away knowing how to segment, query, and retrieve data in SQL.

This hands-on SQL workshop from Northeastern University's Level Bootcamp will expose you to foundational concepts related to how businesses store and access structured data. Over the course of one day, you will:

Use MySQL to answer business questions
Learn how relational databases are designed and implemented
Work with MySQL databases to access and query data

There are no prerequisites, but we recommend you come with a basic understanding of Excel, stats, and/or charts. Register here: https://www.eventbrite.com/e/intro-to-sql-for-business-boston-tickets-50310575285

About the Instructor: Sean P. Cornelius earned his Ph.D. in Physics & Astronomy from Northwestern University in 2014. Since then, he has been a research scientist at the Network Science Institute of Northeastern University. His research focuses nonlinear dynamics on networks, control of complex systems, cascading failures, and applications to ecology, cellular biology, and critical infrastructure systems. Dr. Cornelius teaches network science within NEU's Department of Physics, and is a lecturer for the University's Master in Professional Studies in Analytics (MPSA) degree program.

name: Data Visualization in Healthcare
description:
Join Level and the Co-Founder and Principal of HealthDataViz, Kathy Rowell, October 15th at WeWork One Beacon St, Boston, MA 02108 to hear how she helps healthcare organizations communicate data clearly through data visualization.

Agenda:
6:00 - 6:30: Registration and Dinner
6:30 - 7:15: Presentation from Kathy Rowell
7:15 - 7:30: Question and Answers
7:30 - 8:30: Networking

About the presenter:

Kathy is Co-founder and principal of Katherine S. Rowell and HealthDataViz, a Boston firm that specializes in helping healthcare organizations organize, design and present visual displays of data to inform their decisions and stimulate effective action. I advise providers, payers, policymakers and regulatory agencies how to align systems, design reports, and develop staff to communicate data clearly.

name: Databases and Dashboards Workshop
description:
This workshop entails of weekly Tuesday evening sessions held over the course of five weeks.
Databases and analytics dashboards work hand-in-hand to communicate the value of your data, by allowing people to quickly understand and identify which metrics matter to your organization, team or project. In our 5 week workshop, you will work hands on with SQL, the ubiquitous database programming language, and Tableau, one of today’s most widely used visualization softwares, to learn how to organize and present data in the most effective ways.

During this workshop, you will:
Work with MySQL databases to organize, access and query data
Learn how relational databases are designed and implemented
Connect your MySQL databases to Tableau for analysis & presentation
Use MySQL, analysis and presentation techniques to answer business questions
Create Tableau dashboards to visualize data insights in the most effective ways

THIS WORKSHOP IS FOR: Those looking for a deeper understanding of databases and visualization techniques

PRE-REQUISITES: We recommend you come with a basic understanding of Excel, stats, and/or charts.

Please register at https://www.eventbrite.com/e/databases-dashboards-boston-tickets-50533961439

name: Anatomy of the IoT Stack Webinar
description:
Join Level's IoT Program Director Sam Tawfik to learn what makes up the full IoT Stack.

http://info.leveledu.com/anatomy-iot-stack

The Internet of Things (IoT) can bring connectivity to a range of products; everyday objects can now become internet-enabled. How does this all work? What are the different levels of this technology that come together to form an IoT solution or product?

This webinar, geared towards non-IoT professionals and tech-interested professionals, will introduce you to the components of the IoT stack so you can better understand the underlying technology of the IoT.

In this webinar you will learn about:

The basics of each component of the stack
How each level of the stack combine to form the stack
Deeper knowledge of IoT Endpoints
Examples of endpoints in our daily lives

This event is at 9:00am PST
*Please Register Here for access to the webinar*
http://info.leveledu.com/anatomy-iot-stack

About The Presenter:
Sam Tawfik - Level’s IoT Program Director and instructor - has an expansive background in analytics and IoT with a focus on solutions architecture and product marketing. He played a key role in directing the development of IoT industry solutions to help customers bridge the gap between Information Technology (IT) and Operational Technology (OT). His mission is to share his knowledge and make IoT thinkers out of Level’s students.

description:
Share all things data and IoT, and learn what makes other members of the Bay Area tech community passionate. All are welcome, regardless of your experience, industry or interests. Anyone interested in big data, data analytics, or IoT are welcome to come network and meet others with similar interests and roles!

Appetizers will be provided and drinks are on happy hour from 3-6pm.

name: Level Data Analytics and IoT Social
description:
Join the Level community at The Warehouse Bar and Grille on Thursday, October 25th at 5:30 for a spooktacular social event!

Meet current students, alumni and the Level staff and join our Data Analytics and IoT community. We will be kicking back and relaxing with a night of networking, appetizers and good company. We hope you can make it!

name: Data Visualization Workshop
description:
Data visualization is the process of communicating data in order to derive actionable insights and tell a story. Creating compelling visualizations can have a make-or-break effect when it comes to the impact of your data.
This hands-on workshop will expose you to foundational concepts related to data visualization.
During this workshop, you will:
Explore a new dataset and answer business-related questions using data visualization
Learn and apply data visualization best practices
Work with Tableau

There are no prerequisites for this workshop, but please bring your own laptop.

About the instructor: Sean P. Cornelius earned his Ph.D. in Physics & Astronomy from Northwestern University in 2014. Since then, he has been a research scientist at the Network Science Institute of Northeastern University. His research focuses nonlinear dynamics on networks, control of complex systems, cascading failures, and applications to ecology, cellular biology, and critical infrastructure systems. Dr. Cornelius teaches network science within NEU's Department of Physics, and is a lecturer for the University's Master in Professional Studies in Analytics (MPSA) degree program.

Please register here: https://www.eventbrite.com/e/data-visualization-workshop-boston-tickets-50355071374

name: Smart Fridges and Cyber Crime: How to Protect The Connected Home
description:
The IoT technology has given rise to countless products that make our lives better- our devices, cars, cities, and homes are now 'smarter' and more connected. But have you ever considered how this could put you at risk for a data breach or cyber attack? What steps can you take to protect your smart home from these risks?

Avira's Nicolas Binford will be presenting on this topic and offer insight on how malware and cyber attacks happen, and how you can protect your home.

Details:
6:00-6:30pm : Registration, networking, snacks
6:30-7:15pm : Smart Fridges and Cyber Crime Presentation by Nicolas Binford
7:15-7:30pm : Q & A
7:30-8:30pm : Networking and wrap-up

About the Presenter: Nicolas Binford
Nicolas is a Solutions Engineer at Avira, a multinational software company specializing in security. His prior software experience includes computer networks, embedded design, and robotics. He knows many languages (and not just programming languages!) and works with global teams towards a goal of making our products and cyber activity more secure.

name: Demystifying IoT for Managers
description:
In this one day lecture/workshop program, Level IoT Director Sam Tawfik will give you a foundational understanding of IoT. Broad topics covered will include the sensors, devices, communications, and data management of IoT. You will gain a broad understanding of all aspects of IoT and IoT solution implementation to help you manage or lead the evaluation and implementation of your new IoT solution.

Topics Covered:

Introduction to IoT
IoT for Business
IoT Prototyping with Hands-on Project
IoT Wireless Communications
IoT Protocols
IoT Stack
IoT Architecture Considerations
Device Management
Fog Computing
IoT in the Cloud
IoT Data Management
IoT Security
Machine Learning and IoT

Register here: https://www.leveledu.com/forms/sign-up-3/?course=478

About the Instructor:
Sam Tawfik - Level’s IoT Program Director and instructor - has an expansive background in analytics and IoT with a focus on solutions architecture and product marketing. He played a key role at Cisco (a leading Internet solutions company & the creator of the IoT lab for Level) in directing the development of IoT industry solutions to help customers bridge the gap between Information Technology (IT) and Operational Technology (OT). His mission is to share his knowledge and make IoT thinkers out of Level’s students.

name: Thoughtful Analytics To Drive Product Success
description:
Do you want to know how you can use data to make your product more successful? Join Salesforce's very own Shailvi Wakhlu at WeWork 600 California St at 5:30PM as we talk about using analytics to quantify customer feedback, make smarter decisions, and create a successful product. There will of course be good food, your Level community and great networking.

Agenda:

7:10 - 7:20 : About Level Education from Northeastern University
7:20 - 8:00 : Snacks and Networking

Shailvi Wakhlu

Shailvi has been with Salesforce for 1.5 years, and is an accomplished analytics leader with 12 years of experience in B2B, consumer start-ups and large enterprises. She has led global analytics & engineering teams across USA, Europe and Asia, and influences key business decisions using strong data analytics skills and an entrepreneurial mindset. Shailvi is a natural problem-solver who started coding at the age of 8 and uses data to derive insights and to make more informed decisions.

Festive Holiday Season drinks!
The House of the Spirits - Isabel Allende
description:
The House of the Spirits brings to life the triumphs and tragedies of three generations of the Trueba family. The patriarch Esteban is a volatile, proud man whose voracious pursuit of political power is tempered only by his love for his delicate wife, Clara, a woman with a mystical connection to the spirit world. When their daughter Blanca embarks on a forbidden love affair in defiance of her implacable father, the result is an unexpected gift to Esteban: his adored granddaughter Alba, a beautiful and strong-willed child who will lead her family and her country into a revolutionary future.

One of the most important novels of the twentieth century, The House of the Spirits is an enthralling epic that spans decades and lives, weaving the personal and the political into a universal story of love, magic, and fate.

name: Snow - Orhan Pamuk
description: Dread, yearning, identity, intrigue, the lethal chemistry between secular doubt and Islamic fanaticism–these are the elements that Orhan Pamuk anneals in this masterful, disquieting novel. An exiled poet named Ka returns to Turkey and travels to the forlorn city of Kars. His ostensible purpose is to report on a wave of suicides among religious girls forbidden to wear their head-scarves. But Ka is also drawn by his memories of the radiant Ipek, now recently divorced. Amid blanketing snowfall and universal suspicion, Ka finds himself pursued by figures ranging from Ipek’s ex-husband to a charismatic terrorist. A lost gift returns with ecstatic suddenness. A theatrical evening climaxes in a massacre. And finding god may be the prelude to losing everything else. Touching, slyly comic, and humming with cerebral suspense, Snow is of immense relevance to our present moment.

name: Pride and Prejudice - Jane Austen
description:
One of the most universally loved and admired English novels, Pride and Prejudice was penned as a popular entertainment. But the consummate artistry of Jane Austen (1775–1817) transformed this effervescent tale of rural romance into a witty, shrewdly observed satire of English country life that is now regarded as one of the principal treasures of English language.
In a remote Hertfordshire village, far off the good coach roads of George III's England, a country squire of no great means must marry off his five vivacious daughters. At the heart of this all-consuming enterprise are his headstrong second daughter Elizabeth Bennet and her aristocratic suitor Fitzwilliam Darcy — two lovers whose pride must be humbled and prejudices dissolved before the novel can come to its splendid conclusion.

name: The Elegance of the Hedgehog - Muriel Barbery
description:
We are in an elegant hôtel particulier in the center of Paris. Renée, the building's concierge, is short, ugly, and plump. She has bunions on her feet. She is cantankerous and addicted to television soaps. Her only genuine attachment is to her cat, Leo. In short, she is everything society expects from a concierge at a bourgeois building in a posh Parisian neighborhood. But Renée has a secret: she is a ferocious autodidact who furtively devours art, philosophy, music, and Japanese culture. With biting humor she scrutinizes the lives of the building's tenants—her inferiors in every way except that of material wealth.

Then there's Paloma, a super-smart twelve-year-old and the youngest daughter of the Josses, who live on the fifth floor. Talented, precocious, and startingly lucid, she has come to terms with life's seeming futility and has decided to end her own on the day of her thirteenth birthday. Until then she will continue hiding her extraordinary intelligence behind a mask of mediocrity, acting the part of an average pre-teen high on pop subculture, a good but not an outstanding student, an obedient if obstinate daughter.

Paloma and Renée hide both their true talents and their finest qualities from a world they suspect cannot or will not appreciate them. They discover their kindred souls when a wealthy Japanese man named Ozu arrives in the building. Only he is able to gain Paloma's trust and to see through Renée's timeworn disguise to the secret that haunts her. This is a moving, funny, triumphant novel that exalts the quiet victories of the inconspicuous among us.

name: 10th Annual Bar-B-Qchre
description:
SAVE THE DATE for the TENTH Annual Bar-B-Quchre in Golden Gate Park!

TIMING
Arrive any time after Noon. Grill at 1pm. Wrap things up by 6pm.

WHAT WILL BE PROVIDED
-Hot dogs, sausages, buns
-Condiments
-Plates, Napkins, Utensils, & Cups
-Grill, Charcoal, Matches
-Water
-Cards

WHAT TO BRING
-Whatever else you'd like to grill if sausages don't float your boat
-Side dish/snack/dessert to share
-BYOB (Alcohol is permitted)
-Jacket, Hat, Sun Screen, Sun Glasses, Blanket, Camping Chairs
-Any other fun picnic stuff: Football, Frisbee, Bocce, etc.

LOCATION
Stow Lake Picnic Area in Golden Gate Park. We have 8 tables and 2 grills with bathrooms nearby. The picnic area is located at the far end of the parking lot, across from the Stow Lake Boathouse.

http://sfrecpark.org/destination/golden-gate-park/ggp-stow-lake-boathouse-picnic-area-2/

GETTING THERE BY CAR-On Saturdays (Apr-Sept) and Sundays (year round), no cars are allowed on JFK Drive; access is only from MLK Drive. Use Maps or use Waze. You can Mapquest it, but who really uses Mapquest anymore? This spot is closer to the Academy of Sciences and DeYoung, so parking might require a tad more patience. We are adjacent to the Stow Lake Boathouse parking lot, but I suspect that parking lot will be in high demand.

BY BUS- Use Maps...or Next Bus! The closest lines are the 5, 7, 28, 31.

BY BART-If you're coming in via BART, get off downtown and grab a Bus or cab or taxi.

BY GOLDEN GATE PARK SHUTTLE-Golden Gate Park has a FREE shuttle that runs on weekends from 9am-6pm. You can catch it at McLaren Lodge which is located at the Stanyan entrance of the park at the end of Fell/Oak streets. Here's the link to the shuttle map: http://sfrecpark.org/parks-open-spaces/golden-gate-park-guide/free-golden-gate-park-shuttle/

If you have any questions, comments or suggestions, or want one of our cell numbers in case you need to contact us while we're at the park, drop a line.

Thanks,

Susie O & CJ

name: Join us to design and build autonomous robots!
description:
As a group, we're currently working on an unmanned autonomous quadcopter (drone).

We're currently tinkering with the audio subsystem: writing software and integrating the audio array to the drone. We're redesigning the power system as the current battery size and configuration may not support added features to the quadcopter. Finally, we're also working on getting our drone to Hover and loiter in QGround Control.
