http://vimeo.com/5302326#t=21s

Bonus: Fancy chocolates, homemade cookies, fresh fruit, and refreshments are provided by ATC.

RSVP: Please update your RSVP immediately if your plans change. They are counting on us for our help.

Afterparty: We can grab a bite nearby on Market Street. If you meet other volunteers at ATC who are not with our group, invite them along too!

At The Crossroads (http://www.atthecrossroads.org) reaches out to homeless youth at their point of need (street outreach) and works with them to build healthy and fulfilling lives. They provide supplies and counseling to over 200 clients weekly.

name: VIP Investor Dinner and Tech Trends
description:
Details

Join the 6th exclusive VIP accredited investor dinner and mixer produced by Angel Launch this summer. Our past events were a huge success with over 100 investors and 300 startups attending. We offer free tickets to accredited investors and you can view the list in advance on our site. Event includes networking, Demo tables, free delicious buffet dinner and drinks.
YOU MUST USE THIS LINK TO RSVP
https://angellaunchoct23b.eventbrite.com

Startups from general tech, blockchain or crypto can attend or pitch the investors. Everyone can participate in the Speed Networking with investors for 1 on1 Meetings.

COMPS FOR ACCREDITED INVESTORS:
Accredited investors (angels, VCs, corporate, strategic) attend for free once you are approved. We give you a red lanyard to identify you as an investor.

STARTUPS CAN GIVE DEMO PITCH AND HEAR FEEDBACK
We offer a short DEMO PITCH for startups before the dinner. This sells out since we only allow 30 minutes of total pitching for up to 8 startups, so register now.

SPEED NETWORKING PITCH WITH INVESTORS FOR 1 on 1 PRIVATE MEETINGS
All full attendees can join the Speed Networking for a short pitch to investors. All the investors will give an introduction. They are seated around the room. Startups stand in line for 2 minutes fast pitch meetings for a total of 20 minutes before dinner. The investors will then invite you to sit with them for further discussion if they want to learn moreCA.

CASUAL NETWORKING STYLE DINNER WITH DEMO SHOWCASE
After the pitch, enjoy a casual two hour networking dinner with drinks where you can roam around the room, sit at tables, and meet many startups and investors

FEATURED VENTURE CAPITAL SPEAKER
JAY EUM, MANAGING DIRECTOR, TRANSLINK CAPITAL

INVESTORS GET COMP TICKETS:
Register on our link. Our events are free to accredited investors (angels, VCs, corporate or strategic) once we verify your status subject to our discretion. We identify on your name tag if you are INVESTOR or STARTUP or CORPORATE PARTNER or SERVICE PROVIDER. This helps you quickly identify whom you want to meet. INVESTORS GET RED LANYARDS SO YOU CAN FIND THEM.

Startups Attend, Pitch or Host Demo Table:
You can register to attend or pitch entire audience. We offer a short DEMO PITCH before the dinner which includes a demo table. This sells out since we only allow 30 minutes of total pitching for up to 8 startups, so register now. You also get to go to FRONT OF LINE for speed networking ptich for each investor meeting

You will meet many accredited investors actively looking for investing opportunities.
All full attendees can join the Speed Networking for a short pitch to investors

Then you can't miss our VIP Investor dinner!

WHO SHOULD ATTEND:

Tech Apps, Platforms, Services or Devices
Blockchain, Tokens or Crypto

Startups from all areas of tech can purchase tickets to attend the dinner. Investors will identify their areas so we can match you up during speed networking.All areas of tech include: sensors, hardware, blockchain, ICOS, Bitcoin, devices and platforms for enterprise or consumer apps, fintech, mobile, Internet of Things, automotive, energy, security, hardware, agriculture.

SCHEDULE:

3:00-4:00 Networking, Demo Showcase, Drinks

4:00-4:30 Keynote: Jay Eum, Managing Director and Co-Founder, TransLink Capital

Emerging Tech and Investing Trends:
AI/Robotics, Blockchain/Crypto, Connected Cars, Doing Deals with Asia

4:30-5:10 Startup Presenters: Pitch followed by q/a from audience. 3 to 10 minutes each.

5:15-5:30 Investor introductions

Each investor will give name, company, type of funding, market sector

5:30-5:50 Speed Networking Pitch (open to all attendees, Presenters go to front of the line)
Investors are seated at tables around the room with a sign with their name, and markets where they invest. Attendees will stand in line, and meet with investors for 2 minutes each and then will rotate to meet other investors

5:30 to 7:30 Investor Networking Dinner

name: sfMambo Dancing Social,2nd SUN in SF Complimentary BEG & INT Salsa Classes @ 5pm
description:
COME EARLY!!!

Latest info on Facebook community page:
https://www.facebook.com/pg/sfmambo/events/?ref=page_internal

2 FREEEEEE Beginner and Intermediate salsa/mambo classes with entry to the social @ 5pm. Entry $12 (Including the class AND the social dance party). Taking class only? That is also $12. The Two classes take place at the same time.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?time_continue=2&v=1-lziwmQiRU

(Facebook event page above. sfMambo and iHeartMambo are two of the biggest monthly salsa/mambo dancing socials in the Bay Area. Most of the dancers already know about the socials many are regular and attend the social without checking/clicking "going" on facebook. We have been hosting this monthly social for the past 3 years. We are celebrating our 3rd Year Anniversary this April)

PLEASE NOTE THE FACEBOOK ATTENDEE TOTAL ON BOTH FACEBOOK AND MEETUP DO NOT REFLECT THE ACTUAL #. SFMAMBO HAS BEEN HOSTING THE CLASS AND SOCAL DANCING FOR THE PAST 3+ YEARS AND WE HAVE NOT SKIPPED A MONTH. MOST ATTENDEES ALREADY KNOW ABOUT THIS MONTHLY EVENT.

(sfMambo 3rd Year Anniversary coming up-Featuring the internationally world renown Alien Ramirez)

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=DlFUQaZV2is

(Some of our previous nationally renown invited guests-- Above is DJ Jojo flew in from Los Angeles)

-----------------------------------------------------

BASIC DESCRIPTIONS:

sfMambo Social- Monthly dancing social featuring Bay Area favorite DJ Willie Martinez and/or Guest DJs. Playing only the best salsa/mambo/chacha/Pachanga for the dancers.

sfMambo is one of the very best salsa/mambo dancing socials in the Bay Area here you find some of the most passionate salseros and mamberos in our Bay Area scene.

We are the active dancers in our scene and this social is an expression of our love for the music and social dancing. Us organizers are those that are quite active locally, nationally and internationally. Basically, all of us travel all over the country and the world regularly to get our salsa fix! name: Outdoor Rock Climbing - Beginner & Experienced Climbers Welcome
description:
Consumnes River Gorge offers exceptionally high quality rock climbing, without the need to drive to Yosemite or Lake Tahoe. This is a beautiful location with an easy 5 minute walk to the climbing area, where we’ll set spend the day climbing right next to a gorgeous river. Bring a sandwich, plenty of water, and your rock shoes, harness, chalk bag, and helmet. With routes ranging from easy to very advanced, Consumes River Gorge offers something for novices and veteran climbers alike. Members may bring 2 guests. Please note that it’s fine to share helmets, but we do require helmets at our outdoor climbing events.

While this event is open to new climbers, you do need to bring the items mentioned above. This is an ideal day out climbing if you’ve been a gym climber and want to transition to the outdoors. The rock is high quality granite, which is great for those friction-based moves on steep rock. Interestingly, this location is the premiere spot on the whole west coast for slack liners, we often watch slack liners walking a 500’ line while we climb!

We’ll arrive at 9:00 am, plan to spend the whole day climbing, leaving around 5pm. It’s a bit of a schlep from the bay area, but highly worth it. This is the real deal in terms of top-quality climbing routes featuring a variety of climbing techniques from chimney climbing, slab, crack, stemming, crimps, and lie-backs. Very few places afford the ability to practice nearly all different styles of climbing right next to each other.

Just Google "Consumnes River Gorge Placerville" for parking location. Meet at parking area, and we'll walk in together.

name: Mt Kilimanjaro (19,341'), Tsavo Park, & East African Cultural Expedition
description:
Ok - here it is, the trip of a lifetime guided by someone who knows the language, culture, and people very well (myself). We've done big trips before, but this will be by far the biggest. We'll be climbing Mt Kilimanjaro, Africa's highest peak as well as exploring Tsavo National Park in Kenya, and getting to sample East Africa's wonderful people, culture, food, and language. Please don't sign up unless you are serious about committing at least 2 weeks and have the funds for a trip like this. As we get closer I will require a non-refundable $1,000 per person fee for this event, which is not inclusive of any other incurred expenses. This event is open to 15 attendees. Members may bring 1 guest. Sign up now to reserve your spot, and don't worry if you are on the waiting list - I'll do my best to accommodate everyone.

Here's the story - I have 2 Kenyan sons and will likely be living more than 1/2 time in Kenya by the time this trip occurs as I have started a social enterprise organization in Kenya. My sons and likely several Kenyan friends will be with us during this trip. As such, this affords our members an experience money can't buy - a real honest, local experience. That being said, it's not cheap. Expect to spent $5,000 at least all told on this trip (airfare, climbing/porter fees, guides, travel, lodging, etc.). Day to day costs are low, as food/transportation, etc is much cheaper there (other than climbing permits and airfare). I don't and have never traveled like a tourist, and you won't be either. You'll be eating where the locals eat, staying at hotels where Africans stay, etc. If you are looking for a high end, luxury experience look elsewhere. The best part of this trip will be its legitimacy, an opportunity to learn about another culture in a shared experience with locals.

At the start of this trip, we'll meet in Kenya and spend a few days getting to know East African culture. I will teach everyone enough basic Swahili during the first few days that it will make it easier to get around, and you'll get a much friendlier reception than the average tourist does. We'll start by spending time in Nairobi enjoying the big city experience Kenyan style, including Nairobi's bumping nightlife, learning about the Maasai people, and visiting a local LGBT refugee organization, Team No Sleep Foundation to learn about the realities of LGBT life in Africa and purchase beautiful handmade bags, curtains, clothes, etc. that are made in support of Team No Sleep.

After Nairobi we'll head to Moshi, Tanzania, to climb Kilimanjaro. This will take 7days/6 nights days to climb as we must go up slowly to acclimate to the elevation. DO train for this event, or you won't make it - the mountain has about a 70% success rate. Though we have porters who carry tents and most gear and there is gear needed, this is a big mountain with real consequences.

After Kilimanjaro we'll head back to Kenya for a 3 day safari trip to see The Great Migration in Masai Mara Game Reserve - often regarded as the best wildlife reserve in the entire world. This truly is an East African experience that few people other than locals ever get to experience. Bring a sense of adventure, a camera, and more than anything else a respectful, friendly attitude.

name: Yoga & Psychedelics
A Journey to the Heart - Cacao & Connection Experience
Enhance Your Social Intelligence
description:
Are you ever stuck making small talk or unable to get up the courage to approach that awesome person at the party? Do you wonder why some people exude magnetism and charisma? Fortunately, this fall, Jaunty is here to help rejuvenate your social skills with our effective, free workshop!

This fun, interactive workshop is Jaunty's first step into social mastery and includes a mix of theory, exercises, and in-person socialization. We’ll look into the science of attraction and practice of tried and tested techniques that will enhance the way you connect with people. Our workshop covers body language, conversational agility, and belief systems, and examines what may be holding you back from your highest potential.

If you want to become the social dynamo of your friendships, romantic endeavors, or business relations, join us!

Seating is limited. Please arrive early.

About your Instructor:

Eric Waisman is Jaunty’s founder. A fourth generation entrepreneur, Eric left his corporate career with MetLife, Merrill Lynch and American Express to follow his true passions – teaching communications and being social. He has spent the past ten years studying human behavior and the science of attraction.

Eric holds a bachelor’s degree in business from the University of Northern Colorado and studied cultural studies at the University of Jerusalem. A former punk rock musician, in his spare time Eric enjoys traveling, playing his guitar, exercising and of course...socializing.

FAQs

What are my transit/parking options?
By MUNI: The WeWork building is located at 25 Taylor Street (@ Market and Taylor), just two short blocks from the Powell MUNI/BART station and the Civic Center MUNI/Bart Station.

Bus lines: 5, 6, 12, 14, 8X, 9, 21, 30, 31

By Car: There are multiple parking garages that are close to the WeWork building. Locate or book parking here (https://www.parkwhiz.com/wework-golden-gate-parking/).

What should I bring to the event?
Please bring an open mind.

How can I contact the organizer with any questions?
Contact us anytime at: www.jaunty.org (http://www.jaunty.org/)

We hope to see you there!

name: Hardware Startup Pitching Online
description:
Meet hardware & IoT startup founders and learn about their innovative products in this live online event.
Want to present your own hardware startup in front of a global audience? Apply via the link below.

**** Please register using this link, spaces are limited **** https://webinar.startupblink.com/hardware-pitching/

Why attend?
Pitching your hardware startup is an essential skill you can’t do without. It requires practice and feedback so you can improve next time. Whether you present your startup or just observe as an audience you'll get to learn from questions and the feedback by our mentors. This is your chance to get better prepared for that most important pitch in front of your potential investors or clients.

Each month we have space for 5 interesting hardware startups from around the world to pitch. Each of them will get 4 minutes to present, and another 6 minutes will be for Q&A from the audience and feedback from our mentors. This is your chance to ask questions, dig deeper and gain from the experience of the project founders. Don't miss it!

Want to pitch your startup?
Let us know through the registration link above. Our team will select the 5 most interesting hardware startups for the event! Extra bonus from us if you get selected - you’ll be featured on the StartupBlink Blog post!

Looking for a virtual prototype of your product?
ANSYS Startup Program supplies discounted simulation products for early stage Startups, building virtual prototypes of new products. Check it out and apply to build your amazing virtual prototype with the ANSYS Startup Program. https://ansys.startupblink.com/

Join our facebook group: https://www.facebook.com/groups/1682306738742144/

description:

ABOUT THIS EVENT

This event is organized by b8ta

b8ta's Founders Series continues, where we reopen the doors at our stores and invite you to learn more about the journeys of companies and teams leading the way in the tech industry.

We're onto our 9th installment with Ben Einstein, managing director of Bolt.

Ben is an experienced product designer and venture capitalist. Prior to founding Bolt in 2013, Ben ran Brainstream Design, a product design and development consultancy in Massachusetts. Ben has been directly responsible for bringing a long list of products to market covering diverse sectors including consumer electronics, high-performance audio, sporting goods, and green energy. Ben is a writer and speaker on the topics of venture capital investing for hardware startups.

For this month's Founders Series, Ben Einstein of Bolt will sit down and chat with b8ta's CEO and co-founder Vibhu Norby about Ben's journeys in product design and the world of investing. Join us for a casual evening of networking and friendly discussion, complete with drinks and snacks, at our flagship store in Hayes Valley.

Thursday, October 18th at b8ta San Francisco, 6:30–9 p.m.

name: Accessibility in the Zendesk Garden Design System
description:
Accessibility and inclusive design are integral to success in product design and development. In this talk, the Zendesk Garden Design Systems team gives an overview of accessible and inclusive design, does a deep dive into creating an accessible color system for UI, and delves into the ways in which our design system provides both accessibility and flexibility to the designers and developers that use it.

SPEAKERS

Allison Shaw

Allison is a lead product designer with more than 10 years of experience across consumer and enterprise tech. She has a passion for design systems and a knack for shipping products with major impact for both customers and bottom lines. Currently, she leads design for Zendesk’s design system, with a focus on accessibility, design tooling, documentation, and design/engineering collaboration. Previously, she drove the customer experience on Thumbtack, helped grow a world wide audience at Twitter, and led the design of Yelp.com. You can find her all over the web as @allisonacs.

Austin Green

Austin is a Senior Software Engineer on the Garden Design Systems team at Zendesk where he focuses on creating shared front-end tooling and helping bridge the gap between engineering and design. Prior to Zendesk, Austin worked as a Full-Stack developer in the data virtualization, sports management, and avionics fields. He rarely tweets @austingreendev.

name: How Wells Fargo designs with inclusive principles in mind
description:
You’re responsible for how your customers interact with your brand in digital channels, and you want your websites to give life to your end-to-end vision. In this session, you’ll learn about inclusive design principles, UI/UX design heuristics and omnichannel considerations from a digital leadership lens, amplifying your ability to both strategize and deliver thoughtful and engaging online experiences.

Speaker

Like many people active in the web content space today, Serafina Frongia started out wanting to be a journalist. Through a digital marketing-focused career with stints in the e-commerce, high-tech and finance industries and tenure with companies including Sitecore and Wells Fargo, Serafina began to specialize in an area that combined her love of words and passion for structure: content strategy.

Since joining the Wells Fargo Digital Solutions for Business team in 2013, Serafina has established the content strategy team as a core expertise, demonstrating the value of strategic content thinking within the UI/UX discipline. This includes creating holistic end-to-end messaging and user assistance experiences, defining and documenting voice and tone brand guidelines and developing omni-channel digital experience designs.

name: After Work Tennis
description: Come play some after work tennis! We will rally and/or play singles or doubles depending on the number of players. We encourage players with at least an intermediate level to attend. The max is 6 attendees so if you sign up but can't make it please cancel at least 24 hours in advance so others can take your spot. We know life is unpredictable but canceling a few hours before is not very courteous to other players. Several no-shows without cancellation AND same day cancellations will result in us dropping you from future meet-ups. To enforce this, you have until 9 pm the day before the meet-up to cancel before the RSVP window closes. Please also note that if you are wait-listed or just simply want to drop in, we ask that you NOT show up. While we want to be inclusionary, ten people to a court just doesn't make for fun tennis. So please respect the RSVP and waitlists with the aim of providing a more quality experience for those who are signed up. Now let's get some exercise and have some fun!

description:
Janet Beach is hosting this event. This is a friendly share.

I had found it insightful and useful, for those seeking employment in San Francisco. Here is an effort to assist with those whom have asked and are seeking employment in local creative, tech and management professions.

The Job Forum is a FREE community service aimed at helping people find jobs in the San Francisco Bay Area. We help you to be more successful in getting the job you want. The emphasis is on intelligently planning and conducting the job finding campaign. The Job Forum has local SF Bay Area managers who tell you the truth about a modern job search and brainstorm ways to help you succeed!

The event offers job search coaching, customized brainstorming and problem-solving to jobseekers and career changers. We discuss each individual's job search questions one by one and offer helpful job search suggestions in an open forum. It gives one ideas and actions to move forward.

Typical Topics Include:
Resumes • Contacts • Interviews • Networking • Job Goals • Online Job Search • Career Changes • First Time Job Searches • Job Information Sources • Long Absences from the Labor Market • Long & Short-Term Career Objectives• Voluntary & Involuntary Terminations • Problems of the Disabled • Recent Graduates • Newcomers to the Community • Internet Job Search

Good Luck, Everyone!

Are you interested in having more fun? Better friendships? All different types of people come to BenchMarks which makes it a unique experience every time.

BenchMarks are a fun way to get to know people, even if you've been friends with them for years. Imagine going to a party, but instead of the usual "How's it going?" "What do you do for work?" type of questions, you got to ask anything that you were interested in. BenchMarks aim to get below the surface and have people really get to know each other.

A BenchMark is a structured social evening that is comprised of 4 different games based around communication. Through these games, people can give and get as much attention as they want, find out about more about the other people there, and let people get to know them, too-- if they so choose.

This event is $11 or whatever. Please arrive a few minutes early, we'll be starting on time. You're welcome to bring friends - we look forward to meeting you!

name: Dancers' Den Monthly Lindy/Charleston Lessons + Dance ~ Oakland
description:
In 2017, The Dancers' Den will be on the 2nd Friday of every month. Lessons [Lindy/Charleston] by popular teachers Jean (formerly Ma) and Bromley Palamountain. Some of the music is also suitable for Balboa.

Schedule for the night:

7 - 8 pm: Intermediate Lesson with Jean and Bromley

8 - 9 pm: Beginner Lesson with Jean and Bromley

9 - 11:30 pm: Social Dance

@Oakland Asian Cultural Center

388 9th St #290

Oakland, California 94607

All tickets will be sold at the door. Cash only please.

$15 for Social Dance Only

$20 for One Class + Social Dance

$25 to take both Intermediate and Beginner Classes + Social Dance

Class Descriptions:

Intermediate Lindy Hop: Stylish Lindy - While the song goes, "It taint what you do but how you do it," we believe it's actually a little of both. In this class we will be working on some fun moves and rhythms that will add contrast and musicality to your dancing (what you do) while also working on lines and dancing with your whole body (how you do it).

Students should be familiar with and can easily execute the following moves: swingouts, Lindy circles, basic Charleston, and can easily switch between 6 count and 8 count Lindy.

No partner necessary

Beginner 8 Count Lindy Hop - No experience and no partner necessary. Jean and Bromley will introduce you to the wonderful world of 8 count Lindy Hop by focusing on creating good habits and strong fundamentals. By the end of this class you will have a grasp on the rhythms, footwork and fun variations that will keep you dancing to the band all night long!

For more info about Jean and Bromley, check out www.jeanandbromley.com

Parking and BART Info

The Dancers' Den will be held at the Oakland Asian Cultural Center which is located at 388 Ninth Street between Franklin and Webster Street on the second floor of the Pacific Renaissance Plaza in Oakland's Chinatown.

Parking

• Underground in the Pacific Renaissance Plaza: We do not validate for parking. The garage closes at 11:45pm even though their signs say midnight. So if you park there, please make sure to have your car out by 11:45pm. In the Plaza, take the elevator to the 2nd floor. OACC is the first suite on the left.

• Franklin 88 Parking Garage on Franklin Street between 9th and 10th Street across the street from Pacific Renaissance Plaza

• A garage on the corner of Webster and 11th Street

• Street parking free after 6pm

From BART

The closest BART station is 12th Street Station at Broadway in Oakland. Walk south on Broadway to 11th Street and turn left. Continue on 11th Street and turn right on Franklin to enter the Pacific Renaissance Plaza

Silicon Valley TGIF Business & Social Networking
description:
PLEASE READ THE ENTIRE EVENT DESCRIPTION.

Enter the Hyatt Regency via the main entrance on the front side of the hotel. Look to your right. Go to the bar area in the hotel lobby. Look for people with name tags. Look for the Meetup sign.

This event is free to attend.

Attendees must purchase their own liquid refreshments and food.

There's no content or speaker at this event -- just business and social networking.

Build your business and social network - face to face!

Come out and enjoy a great evening of good food, liquid refreshments, and connecting. Come prepared with your best smile, a firm handshake, and a great personality.

You may meet your next business collaborator, client, employer, employee, friend, or tennis partner!

Getting away from a screen for a few hours will do you some good! : -)

Meet Silicon Valley movers and shakers - Internet entrepreneurs, developers, engineers, mobile app coders, attorneys, bloggers, academics, financiers, and investors!

It's okay if you have to come late and/or leave early. Feel free to drop in whenever you can. You can stay for 30 minutes or for two hours.

PARKING:

Park in the parking structure. Parking is free.

COST: FREE to attend.

All attendees will purchase their own liquid refreshments and food.

Please support our host venue by purchasing at least one or two beverages.

(Non-alcoholic beverages are okay.)

Swayamvar is for people in Category 1 and Category 2 please read below to understand what it means. I hope to see more people coming to this event as the word spreads. You have enough time to let everyone know! Will give you all a questionnaire to fill in to know your basic - NAME / AGE / PROFESSION / RELIGION / EDUCATION / COUNTRY OF ORIGIN / Partner Expectations

Attention: This will be a long event! I have traveled to east and west coast and at one an event I heard that Desis are more single in numbers than ever before. This is spreading like an epidemic....We meet people but look for better ones! We will never settle on one! That is our major problem.

I have tried Shaadi.com, online dating, arranged, even singles conferences.. there is a lack of events for people of various categories...maybe that's what needs to be changed..so these are the categories:

1) Serious and ready to settle (Duration: Few months) 2) Serious and looking (1 -2 years) 3) Not serious but looking (3 - 4 years)

This event is for category 1 & 2 (Serious and Looking)

The category 1 people keep meeting category 3 and so on which does not lead to anything!

We all fall in one of these categories...and I think all of you should be given a chance to come to an event catering to these three categories separately...

We need to help each other out. Let's cater to the Category 1 & 2.

Event:

Event Details coming soon ~~~~~

Policy: after event is over we share email ids of each attendee with first name, email, age (if you don't want let us know 1 week in advance). We also won't do Your Matching you choose your own matches...we allow exchange of emails.

SOME GOOD RULES: If you as a guy don't move to the next table after 6 minutes and bell rings you will be given one warning and second time u will be removrd. Rules are very strict.

1. Round 1 and Round 2 are Mandatory...

2. If the bell rings and you don't move to the next table / next chair as a guy or girl (as per instructions) then you will be given warning then removed. (Fair policy).

3. Time sensitivity- Please make sure you have 3 - 4 hours in your schedule that day of the event. You want to make most out of it. If you are time sensitive that day please don't attend.

4. If you leave in between you will not be allowed in next event. Fair policy to those who are here for the rounds to meet you. We consider it rude to walk out of an Event which ppl have paid for.

5. Don't like anyone no issue attend next one for free.

Most important - HAVE FUN!

SWAYAMWAR WILL BE ONE OF THE BIGGEST EVENT OF THIS YEAR PLEASE DON'T MISS THIS OUT!!

name: Swayamvar - # 1 in California
description:
This is free event! You are lucky to be part of this. We want to make sure you all enjoy being there. I will come online via video chat.

Launch of Swayamvar in SFO.

Time: 1 pm to 4 pm......is the time people enjoy talking n meeting and then in the evening go on a date.

We expect around 35 to 40 candidates.

SINGLE SOUTH ASIANS & INDIAN EVENT for 27 - 43 years. This event will be for 3 hours. BE FLEXIBLE.

Any questions - please leave a message in meetup.
If late? - you should be there by 1:30 p.m. max to meet all candidates.
Next event will be paid :)

Who are invited?

- South Asians & Indians born in USA

- SA & Indians born in India

- SA & Indians born anywhere

- Ages 27 + come out

Swayamvar is for people in Category 1 and Category 2 please read below to understand what it means. I hope to see more people coming to this event as the word spreads. You have enough time to let everyone know! Will give you all a questionnaire to fill in to know your basic - NAME / AGE / PROFESSION / RELIGION / EDUCATION / COUNTRY OF ORIGIN / Partner Expectations

Attention: This will be a long event! I have traveled to east and west coast and at one an event I heard that Desis are more single in numbers than ever before. This is spreading like an epidemic....We meet people but look for better ones! We will never settle on one! That is our major problem.

I have tried Shaadi.com, online dating, arranged, even singles conferences.. there is a lack of events for people of various categories...maybe that's what needs to be changed..so these are the categories:

1) Serious and ready to settle (Duration: Few months) 2) Serious and looking (1 -2 years) 3) Not serious but looking (3 - 4 years)

This event is for category 1 & 2 (Serious and Looking)

The category 1 people keep meeting category 3 and so on which does not lead to anything!

We all fall in one of these categories...and I think all of you should be given a chance to come to an event catering to these three categories separately...

We need to help each other out. Let's cater to the Category 1 & 2.

Event:

First round is introduction of everyone attending the event and they will be given Biodata of everyone (If you provide).

ASK Contact details ---- we will not provide email id's.

Round 1: Each table will have 1 guy and 1 girl sitting across each other. The people will get a chance to talk...(you will be matched randomly). Guys will then move to the next table if standing move to the next girl.
Time - 5 minutes per table

Break- 20 minutes (Buy your food)

Round 2- This round will last only 6 minutes....we will arrange in such a way that each girl gets to meet guys individually. In this round the boys will move and girls will not move.

RULE: If you as a guy don't move to the next table after 6 minutes and bell rings you will be given one warning and second time u will be removrd. Rules are very strict.

End of the EVENT please don't ask for contacts you can use your phone for it.

Rules:

Round 1 and Round 2 are mandatory if you want to participate in the event.

Rules: If the bell rings and you don't move to the next table / next chair as a guy or girl (as per instructions) then you will be given 1 warning and even then if you don't MOVE you will not be able to participate in the event. This is a fair policy so that everyone gets to meet each person.

Time: Please make sure you have 3 - 4 hours in your schedule that day of the event. You want to make most out of it.

If you leave in between - You will be allowed to but next time you will not be invited.

Most important - HAVE FUN!

SWAYAMWAR WILL BE ONE OF THE BIGGEST EVENT OF THIS YEAR PLEASE DON'T MISS THIS OUT!!

name: It's Movie Nite at Opera Plaza!  "Foxed," "The Walrus Whisperer" and More!
description:
IT'S MOVE NITE AT OPERA PLAZA! WED. OCT. 17 AT 6 PM

This coming Wednesday, Oct. 17 at 6 pm, enjoy HEARTWARMING short movies about beautiful interaction between animals and humans. CRUELTY-FREE! No stomach-turning, heart-wrenching scenes of cruelty to animals. These movies will leave you feeling warm and happy all over!

The movies include "Foxed." Here is what the producer says about it:

"Last summer my life changed forever when a little fox cub visited my urban garden whilst I was watering the lawn. I thought this might have been a one-off fascinating close-up encounter, but later the cub returned and this time brought its siblings along. Together they explored, played and turned my garden into their playground. I soon became hooked on watching and filming them daily and have been completely enchanted, or as some might say ‘foxed’, by these beautiful, clever and gentle creatures. This is the story of Freya, Faith and Me; a cross-species friendship"

Then there is "The Walrus Whisperer." Former animal trainer Phil Demers tells the story of his unique bond with a walrus named Smooshi and his ongoing fight against Marineland. And more! Enjoy an evening of short films about animals, from around the world! It will make a beautiful ending to your day!

First, enjoy a DELICIOUS, FULL-COURSE vegan dinner. NOT just hors d'ouevres! Not just snacks. But a real dinner! Including beverages and desserts! ALL vegan. ALL health-supporting. And . . . ALL you care to eat! Planned, designed by a CERTIFIED Nutritionist with a reputation for excellence throughout the Bay Area. Patricia Allen Koot, NE, NC.

This is WAY more than you would get in any theater! And for LESS than you would pay for a movie ticked plus appetizers. You get dinner, and adorable movies, MUCH more, for MUCH less!

Yes, only a Fifteen Dollar requested donation gets you all of it! Why? Because the Nutritionist donates her time. And we are here to serve the community, not to make a buck.

And, you get still more! In a theater, you sit in a chair and watch a movie. Not much socializing goes on. But here, you will have opportunity to socialize and share over dinner, with a roomful of like-minded people.

Just this week, someone commented on how warm and friendly the Wellness Central dinner events are. She had found nothing else like it in the city!

Location? The Opera Plaza Community Room, 601 Van Ness, San Francisco. Take the elevator to the mezzanine, then follow the sign down the hall to the right.

Hurry! Reserve your place! Space is limited. Do so here, or email to: [masked] OR call (888)[masked].

So, come ENJOY a full evening of fine vegan dining, pleasant socializing and heartwarming movies.

See you there!

name: Discover Her Secrets!  with Patricia Allen Koot, NE, NC
description:
DISCOVER HER SECRETS! WITH PATRICIA ALLEN KOOT, NE, NC, SAT. OCT. 27 AT 10:45 AM

What are those special touches that make HEALTHY vegan dishes irresistible? Find out! Patricia Allen Koot, NE, NC, has been creating DELICIOUS vegan dinners for fourteen years. People from around the world have acclaimed her culinary expertise.

Yet, she does it WITHOUT OIL. That is unusual. Almost without exception, every vegan restaurant (including the so-called 'underground' vegan restaurants) uses oil in recipes. We understand why. People are used to it, they like it. And a restaurant is a business that needs paying customers, who will come back for more.

What Patricia does is different. She DOES NOT USE OIL in her recipes. Yet, her vegan dishes, served up at Opera Plaza every Wednesday evening, continue to receive rave reviews. HOW DOES SHE DO IT? Without oil. Without refined sweeteners. TOTALLY HEALTHY.

Now, you can find out! Patricia will share some of her most closely held culinary secrets, with YOU! Come to her live demo at the World Veg Fest. You will enjoy tasty samples. AND you will take home with you some valuable pointers to help make YOUR vegan dishes IRRESISTIBLE!

That's on Sat. Oct. 27 at 10:45 am. Location is the San Francisco County Fair Building, Recreation Room,[masked]th Ave., San Francisco.

FREE ADMISSION for SF Veg Society members. For non-members, there is a $10. entrance fee for the Veg Fest.

DON'T MISS this great opportunity to discover the secrets of one of the Bay Area's best!

See you there!

name: San Antonio, TX: Where to Invest in 2018 by Forbes
description:
~ FREE WEBINAR ~

In order to receive the Webinar ID and Access Code to join, you must register here: https://www.marshallreddick.com/event/d9fb0a00-e9b6-462a-35b6-5b842f251d33

Marshall Reddick Real Estate has chosen San Antonio, TX as the location for our very first out of state office! Since receiving our broker’s license in Texas, we have set up a “Dream Team” team of Realtors, Leasing Agents and Property Managers to support all of the growth we are seeing in real estate and property management.

Meet our Realtor in San Antonio online who will be giving you all of the latest facts and information on the real estate market, rental market, job market, and all of the growth happening there right now.

Actual hand-picked investment properties will be shown including single-family and multi-family properties with positive cash flow. Last year and this year consecutively, San Antonio ranked in the Top 20 list of Forbes’ "Where To Invest In Housing.” San Antonio’s economy is focused primarily within the military, healthcare, government services, financial services, oil and gas, and tourism services which has helped to drive the city’s dynamic and diverse economy. It is home to 4 massive military bases between the Army and Air force as well as 5 fortune 500 companies. The roots of San Antonio’s dramatic business growth and economic vibrancy can be traced to a superb infrastructure, pro-business local government and a culture that embraces entrepreneurial spirit.

Here are some topics and stats we will discuss in more detail:

- New construction homes and multi-units with positive cash flow!
- Why the rental market is on fire in San Antonio
- Why it’s considered the 2nd fasting growing city in the U.S.
- 1-year home price growth: 7% (Forbes)
- 3-year price growth forecast: 20% (Forbes)
- 3.0% unemployment rate as of 11/17!
- Which suburbs and neighborhoods are the best to buy in
- Property management services and fees

For more details, go to: https://www.marshallreddick.com/event/d9fb0a00-e9b6-462a-35b6-5b842f251d33

name: How To Buy Investment Property
description:
~ FREE EVENT ~

Parking will be validated upon completion of the event.

Our premier presentation that includes an entire overview of real estate investing from A-Z. This is the most comprehensive 2-hour presentation on real estate investing on the planet. In fact, countless attendees have said, “I learned more here in 2 hours than I have in 2-3 day boot camps that I paid hundreds of dollars for.”

Hear real-life stories in an easy-to-follow, step-by-step format. Guest speakers include mortgage and loan experts, asset protection specialists, and Real Estate Advisors who are all available for questions before and after the presentation. The best part is, by attending this presentation you will have the opportunity to work with a Real Estate Advisor afterwards who can walk you through the entire process or provide any assistance you’d like for absolutely no cost. We do not charge a penny for mentoring!

During this presentation, the following roadmap will be covered in detail:

-Assessing your current financial situation and setting goals
-Determining your purchasing power
-Conducting due diligence
-Property management
-Tax benefits of owning rental property
-How to evaluate an investment property
-Conventional financing, private financing, and retirement account rollovers
-How to choose where to invest
-How to analyze the financials (actual deals)
-How to eliminate as much risk as possible
-What to do next!

For more information, please click here:
https://www.marshallreddick.com/event/6597f50d-92c1-24e0-168c-5ba3e7b50fa7

PLEASE NOTE: We do not condone or want any affiliation with those looking to make a quick buck or are a part of some get-rich-quick scheme with a fly-by-night strategy. We do not believe in WHOLESALING, and we believe FLIPPING property is a full time job. Our clients have successful careers, love what they do, and are looking to invest their hard-earned money for passive income and building wealth. Our philosophy to grow ones net worth comes from the tax benefits, passive income, principal pay down and long-term appreciation with the safe use of leverage from real estate ownership.

Please be aware that NO SOLICITATION of any kind will be permitted at this or any of our events. Providing a safe, pressure free environment gives everyone a fun and enjoyable learning experience. If you do not follow this rule you will be kindly asked to leave. We work very hard to deliver a clear and specific educational message for each event on exactly what works in real estate and what does not and have zero tolerance for "wheel-and-dealers."

name: Play some music at "The Chieftain"
description:
All,

Please come and join in for some savage craic agus ceol! The Chieftain is a great location and provides a great spot in the bar for us to get together and play some fantastic intermediate speed session music!

Sláinte!!!

About the Chieftain:

The Chieftain is an authentic Irish pub located one block from the Moscone Convention Center, and a short walk from many of downtown San Francisco's most familiar hotels, attractions and eclectic businesses.

Named after the first High King of Ireland, Brian Boru (c. [masked]) and a more recent Irish Chieftain, Michael Collins (known as "The Big Fellow") who in December 1921 signed an Anglo-Irish treaty agreement with Britain which was later ratified by Dail Eireann & the British House of Commons, enacting the Irish Free State.

The Chieftain's identity is intertwined with the 50 million Americans who claim Irish heritage. It's this Celtic identity that inspired two sets of brothers from Ireland, the Nagle's from County Kerry and the McVeigh's from County Clare, to place their Irish roots in the form of an authentic Irish Pub & Restaurant in Downtown San Francisco.

The building where The Chieftain calls home is a historical landmark built in 1912; originally called the M&M Tavern, it was opened by Martin McVeigh in 1934 just after the Prohibition repeal.

The M&M became the cornerstone of journalism in San Francisco, as the home for all level of workers from the nearby San Francisco Chronicle & Examiner newspapers. After World War II, Martin McVeigh's son Al returned from the Navy and took over the family business. Al owned and managed the M&M Tavern from 1946 to 1989.

Check out The Chieftains website and look under "Links" for fun and interesting stories and pictures from the M&M days.

The Chieftain was primarily built with mahogany wood and Belgian castle stone, creating a beautiful acoustic environment that is enjoyed at all our live music and sporting events.

The Chieftain has hosted hundreds of parties and we are a recognized gathering place to come and enjoy your favorite American as well as International sporting matches, including soccer, rugby, baseball and football to name a few.

The Chieftain offers a large selection of the Worlds finest beers and spirits, including an outstanding 20oz "Perfect Pint" of Guinness!

Join the conversation and share memories...

**During football season, the owner Mark Nagle requests that we start after the Sunday night football game ends, usually about 8:45 p.m. **

name: Wednesday night session
description:
We are a group of musicians interested in learning and playing traditional Irish tunes and songs in a supportive, encouraging environment. We meet every Wednesday night from 7-9 pm at St. Isabella's School, 1 Trinity Way, San Rafael.
We start with three featured tunes (go to marinirishmusic.com to see our semester list and download sheet music), then we review last week’s tunes. We then have open play and take turns calling tunes around the circle. When it's your turn, you set the speed we play the tune, so if you are learning and want to take it slow, that's fine. We end with a review of this week’s tunes. Everyone is welcome!
To receive weekly emails with the upcoming week’s tunes, send an email to [masked].

name: Groundbreakin Trad Session
description:
The O'Keefe's session heir apparent (in the same timeslot) is now the new Michael Collins Irish Bar on Haight St. This formerly Martin Mack's pub recently changed ownership, and they have some exciting plans. The space is quite large and we can play in the back or in the front by the window. We'll see what works best.

All the established etiquette naturally will apply. Jigs, reels, hornpipes, marches, polkas, slides, slip jigs, slow airs, and the occasional song. It's what we do best. It is our forte. Please limit the chatting and moving about during the tunes. Respect the music, if not one another. This is an open session, and we follow the Round Robin protocol, which gives each musician the chance to contribute a tune he can play well. Usually, though hardly strictly, we play each tune 3x, and signal a transition with either a butt-lift, leg-lift, a verbal hup!, or an eye twinkle.

Beverage benefits are available.
Colum Crowley is our owner; Adrian & Sandra are at the bar;

name: 1st Saturday Trad Session @ UICC
description:

Come along with your instrument and/or voice.  There will be tunes, songs and a few set dances as well!

Everyone is most welcome. Spread the word and join the invite if you can.

name: Gay Book Discussion: "A History of Violence," by Eduoard Louis
description:
This 2018 autobiographical novel is about surviving a shocking sexual assault and coping with the post-traumatic stress disorder of its aftermath. A bestseller in France, it is a short nonfiction novel in the tradition of Truman Capote’s “In Cold Blood,” but with the victim as its subject. Moving seamlessly and hypnotically between past and present, between Louis’s voice and the voice of an imagined narrator, it has the exactness of a police report and the searching, unflinching curiosity of memoir at its best.

This is a casual gathering held on the second Sunday of the month for fun and stimulating discussions about quality gay literature. Books are selected by participants several months in advance, and the only requirements for attending are to RSVP, to have read a substantial part of what’s being discussed, and to bring a snack or beverage to share. Arrive as early at 6:00, discussion begins at 6:45 and ends by 8:30.

Sign up for open mic is 7:30, show at 8:00 pm.

name: Gay Book Discussion:  "Conundrum:  The Evolution of Homosexuality"
description:
This month we’ll discuss “Conundrum: The Evolution of Homosexuality,” by N.J. Peters, which is a pro-gay, pro-science look at a vexing issue. Evolutionary biology suggests that individual living things are designed to reproduce, so why does homosexuality exist? Wouldn't a gay gene ensure its own demise? Conundrum pulls together information from biology, anthropology, and recent lesbian and gay history, and suggests that both nature and nurture are involved in the evolution of homosexuality.

This is a casual gathering held on the second Sunday of the month for fun and stimulating discussions about quality gay literature. Books are selected by participants several months in advance, and the only requirements for attending are to RSVP, to have read a substantial part of what’s being discussed, and to bring a snack or beverage to share. name: Gay Book Discussion:  "A Streetcar Named Desire," by Tennessee Williams
description:
This month we’ll discuss Tennessee Williams’s Pulitzer Prize winning play, “A Streetcar Named Desire.” It is often regarded as among the finest plays of the 20th century, and is considered by many to be Williams' greatest work. The story recounts how the faded and promiscuous Blanche DuBois is pushed over the edge by her sexy and brutal brother-in-law, Stanley Kowalski. In the movie adaptation, they were played by Vivian Lee and Marlon Brando.

This is a casual gathering held on the second Sunday of the month for fun and stimulating discussions about quality gay literature. Books are selected by participants several months in advance, and the only requirements for attending are to RSVP, to have read a substantial part of what’s being discussed, and to bring a snack or beverage to share. name: Meetup: How Positivity Can Fuel our Movement & Ourselves
description:
Every Saturday at 11am we have meetups for everyone and anyone who cares about animals and making the world a better place!
We serve a delicious homemade vegan brunch (by suggested donation) starting at 11am. At 11:30 we begin a brief 15-minute presentation on updates from the animal rights community and a special weekly topic followed by a quick Q&A.
Then we transition to a group activity, work party or strategy session where you can offer some much-needed help or talk with organizers to find out how you can help DxE SF Bay achieve its 2018 goals of maximizing mobilization, open rescue and legislative change.

Together, we will change the world for animals - starting right NOW!

Learn more about our values here: https://www.directactioneverywhere.com/organizing-principles/

---

Direct Action Everywhere (DxE) is a grassroots network of animal rights activists. Through open rescue, demonstration, and disruption, we are creating a world where every animal is safe, happy and free.

name: Meetup: How the “Humane” Lie Backfires on the Industry
description:
Every Saturday at 11am we have meetups for everyone and anyone who cares about animals and making the world a better place!
We serve a delicious homemade vegan brunch (by suggested donation) starting at 11am. At 11:30 we begin a brief 15-minute presentation on updates from the animal rights community and a special weekly topic followed by a quick Q&A.
Then we transition to a group activity, work party or strategy session where you can offer some much-needed help or talk with organizers to find out how you can help DxE SF Bay achieve its 2018 goals of maximizing mobilization, open rescue and legislative change.

Together, we will change the world for animals - starting right NOW!

name: The Haunting of SF: March for Animals
description:
This October, we will be taking to the streets of San Francisco with a simple message: That there is something haunting in the city of SF. What’s haunting is that there are 150 million animals being killed for this city alone and it’s being hidden like a dark, heavily guarded secret. San Francisco is holding this dark secret by allowing companies like Amazon and Whole Foods to propagate their lies and throw activists in prison!
We want the city to remember the lives that were lost and this will be our chance to bring their voices back to life and amplify their cries for all of San Francisco to hear.

WHEN: October 27th, 6:30pm

WHERE: San Francisco, CA

WHO: Anyone and everyone!

Together, we will change the world for animals - starting right NOW!

---

Direct Action Everywhere (DxE) is a grassroots network of animal rights activists. Through open rescue, demonstration, and disruption, we are creating a world where every animal is safe, happy and free.

name: Self-Care for Sensitives Support Group
description:
-Are you a highly sensitive person and/or someone with psychic/empathic abilities that you are not quite sure how to manage?

-Would you like a safe place to meet with people like you to cultivate a community of support, sharing, and understanding?

-Would like to learn how to better manage your energy and take care of your health on all levels (physical, emotional, mental, energetic, and spiritual)?

If you said yes to any of these questions, this support group is for you!

The intention of this group is to offer you a place for sharing mutual support and discussion around your struggles and triumphs in dealing with life as an extra sensitive and/or psychic/empathic person. We will discuss a variety of self-care topics from nutrition to how to protect and care for yourself energetically, as well as practicing guided meditations, mini-constellations, and getting into our bodies with yoga and dance warm-ups.

Please bring whatever questions or topics you would like to discuss with the group, and also feel free to bring ideas for exercises, guided meditations, etc. While I will be moderating and planning a loose format for each meetup, I encourage co-creation and participation from everyone who joins. We all have valuable things to contribute and share with one another! Let's play together!

***Please bring a donation of $5-15 to help pay for the rental of the space.
**No one turned away for lack of funds.

name: Murder Mystery Pub & Grub Crawl! Drink, Dine & Solve Crime! (EVERY SUNDAY)
Akwaeke Emezi at MoAD!
description:
The author of October's African Book Club selection at LitQuake!
Co-presented by Museum of the African Diaspora & Lambda Literary

A rising star in today's Nigerian novel boom, the trans and non-binary Akwaeke Emezi has brought us Freshwater, an autobiographical debut written with stylistic brilliance, exploring the metaphysics of identity and being, plunging the reader into the mysteries of self. Currently long-listed for the Center for Fiction's First Novel Prize and the Brooklyn Public Library Literary Prize. In conversation with Whiting Award-winning novelist Esmé Weijun Wang.

Akwaeke Emezi is an Igbo and Tamil writer and artist based in liminal spaces. Born and raised in Nigeria, she received her MPA from New York University and was awarded a 2015 Miles Morland Writing Scholarship. She won the 2017 Commonwealth Short Story Prize for Africa. Her work has been published in various literary magazines, including Granta. Freshwater is her debut novel.

TICKETS NECESSARY: $10 general / $5 students, seniors, MoAD members
More Info: https://litquake2018.sched.com/speaker/akwaeke_emezi.1ydkhs48

venue.name: MoAD - Museum of the African Diaspora

name: [SOCIAL/NETWORK] - Fourth Thursday Happy Hour w/ Carib Friends
description:
Close your computers, forget about work deadlines, then swing by Level 13 for our happy hour.

Totally casual... just look for the group, sip a drink, and connect with new folks. RSVP and see you there!

name: African Book Club: Freshwater (Nigeria)
description:
We're back with a new time and new list! For our 28th installment, we'll be discussing FRESHWATER, by Akwaeke Emezi (Novel, Nigeria),

In her remarkable and daring debut novel, “Freshwater,” Akwaeke Emezi draws in part from her own life to tell the story of Ada, a young Igbo and Tamil woman haunted by the ogbanje — an Igbo spirit. The story, narrated by Ada’s multiple personalities, and occasionally by Ada herself, explores metaphysical identity and resist the binary split between spirit and body. Author Emezi herself is “Nigerian,” “Black,” “trans,” and gender “non-binary.”

https://www.newyorker.com/books/page-turner/akwaeke-emezi-startling-debut-novel-explores-the-freedom-of-being-multiple

https://www.nytimes.com/2018/02/26/books/review/freshwater-akwaeke-emezi.html

https://www.npr.org/2018/02/17/586112614/in-freshwater-a-college-student-learns-to-live-with-separate-selves

https://broadly.vice.com/en_us/article/neq4mq/akwaeke-emezi-freshwater-book-interview

http://www.latimes.com/books/la-ca-jc-freshwater-20180216-htmlstory.html

This LAST TUESDAY we meet over eats/drinks (available for purchase) to discuss the latest, hottest, award-winning, best-selling books out of Africa. All you have to do to join is read as much of the book as you can and show up prepared for a lively (but respectful) conversation. You may attend as few or as many sessions as you'd like.

The venue is one of the East Bay's premiere cafés/bookstores/literary spaces 4.5 blocks (0.3 mile) from 19th Street BART in Oakland. PLEASE SUPPORT our generous hosts by enjoying the wide variety of options available for purchase: Beer, wine, tea, espresso drinks, delicious salads and sandwiches, treats.

name: African Book Club: Our Lady of the Nile (Rwanda)
description:
We're back with a new time and new list! For our 29th installment, we'll be discussing Our Lady of the Nile by Scholastique Mukasonga (Rwanda).

"African francophone literature, and particularly that written by women, continues to be underrepresented in English, and as a result, we are not only missing out on compelling stories, but on an important political project. Scholastique Mukasonga, and likely many of her colleagues whom we have yet to translate, is working to correct the frustratingly persistent Western narratives about Africa and its history."

"In part, this is a good-humored yearbook of the adventures and scandals among the all-girl school’s precocious teenage charges, where the greatest peril to morality is the arrival of a male teacher with long blond hair. But soon the school, abetted by its hypocritical administrators (including those Belgian civilizers), becomes a petri dish for Hutu militancy, and normal adolescent pranks take on horrifying consequences."

A Publishers Weekly Book of the Year for 2014

Shortlisted for the International Dublin Literary Award

name: African Book Club: The Ultimate Tragedy (Guinea Bissau)
description:
For our 30th (!!!) installment, we'll be discussing The Ultimate Tragedy, by Abdulai Sila (Novel, Guinea Bissau).

The first novel to be translated into English from Guinea Bissau, The Ultimate Tragedy is a tale of love and emerging political awareness in an Africa beginning to challenge Portuguese colonial rule.

Ndani leaves her village to seek a better life in the capital, finding work as a maid for a Portuguese family. The mistress of the house, Dona Deolinda, embarks on a mission to save Ndani's soul through religious teaching, but the master of the house has less righteous intentions. By turns humorous, heartrending and wise, The Ultimate Tragedy is a captivating novel that brings this little-known country to colourful, vivid life.

This ONE-TIME THURSDAY we meet over eats/drinks (available for purchase) to discuss the latest, hottest, award-winning, best-selling books out of Africa. name: Bring a Book to Swap at the Owl Tree!
description:
The Library Bar is closed for renovations, but that won't stop the swap! Join us at The Owl Tree.

How does the book swap work? Bring a book of your choice that you are willing to give away. Each book swapper will draw a number at approximately 7:30 p.m. Number 1 will select the book they would like first, then number 2, and so on. If there are books left over, those are up for grabs. Usually if you bring a book or two, you take a book or two, but there are no strict rules about the number you bring and the number you take. Oh, and feel free to grab a drink or two as well. Let's keep our bartenders happy. See you there!

description:
You’re invited to our San Francisco Bay Area Local Business Networking Mixer and Yelp 101 Workshop by Yelp Local Business Manager Matt Donzella on Tuesday, 10/[masked] from 6pm-8pm at Yelp Headquarters located at 140 Montgomery Street, San Francisco, CA.

RSVP Now! An RSVP on Meetup does not grant you a valid RSVP ticket for this event. RSVP on Eventbrite https://san-francisco-local-business-networking.eventbrite.com

This event is perfect for anyone looking to learn more about increasing their brand awareness and improving their online reputation. Meet represatives from Yelp, along with other local business owners. Have fun, learn and connect with other San Francisco Bay Area business owners.

Everyone is welcome to join this special event. We encourage anyone to join the event, regardless of your industry and background, come network and learn with us.

RSVP Now at https://san-francisco-local-business-networking.eventbrite.com

Event Agenda and Info:
6:00pm to 6:20pm: Networking & Check-in (Drinks and Snacks)
6:20pm to 6:40pm: Presentation by Matt Donzella | Local Business Outreach, Yelp Inc.
6:40pm to 8:00pm: Networking (Drinks and Snacks) and one on one hands-on trainings as needed

Complimentary snacks and drinks provided by our lead sponsor Yelp.

RSVP Now at https://san-francisco-local-business-networking.eventbrite.com

~~ Workshop ~~

From restaurant owners to auto shops, ghost tour businesses and more, learn how to best utilize Yelp to bring brand awareness to your business and deal with reputation management.

Matt Donzella is the local Yelp For Business Owners educator in the Bay Area. Matt provides training for local business organizations on the free tools available on Yelp. IMatt goal is to build a thriving network of Bay Area business owners and take actionable feedback from the Bay Area business community to the different business owner-focused divisions at Yelp HQ.

Yelp is a crowd-sourced review forum, as well as an American multinational corporation headquartered in San Francisco, California. It develops, hosts and markets Yelp.com and the Yelp mobile app, which publish crowd-sourced reviews about local businesses, as well as the online reservation service Yelp Reservations.

Our Event Host - David Mitroff, Ph.D.

David is a sought-after speaker on a wide range of topics from social media to peak performance. Through his consulting, lectures, training and keynotes David Mitroff, Ph.D. (www.DavidMitroff.com) has educated more than 25,000 business owners. He is an Instructor for the University of California at Berkeley's Internal Diploma Business program and a Google Mentor for the Google Developers Launchpad program. He has been featured media expert for NBC, ABC, San Francisco Business Times, Hospitality Technology, California Lawyer, and more.

Porefessional-Connector-Event

Professional Connector: a vision of Piedmont Avenue Consulting, Inc.
@ProfConnector @DavidMitroff

Professional Connector. A vision of Piedmont Avenue Consulting, Inc.
We organize and promote hundreds of Bay Area business networking and social mixers to specifically target Business Strategies and Small Medium Business Enterprises and provide industry professionals with a chance to make new business and personal connections, build their network, find new clients, and expand their business. We bring the SF Bay Area working community together and strive to promote positive business relationships.

FREQUENTLY ASKED QUESTIONS

Why & Who should attend this event?
Professionals who want to socialize, entrepreneurs, business owners, attorneys, bankers, real estate developers, physicians, technology gurus, sales and marketing experts, and others will greatly benefit from attending and networking with each other at this event.

Want to learn more about digital marketing strategies? Join us for the event to find out more.

Want to learn more about Cryptocurrency? Join us during the event to find out more.

Want to know some traits a successful CEO has or how to Think Like A CEO? Come check out our event and we will talk about this topic.

How many people show up?
Our events usually see anywhere from 45 to 400 people depending on the venue. We make sure people are open and approachable, regardless of how many people show up. You will be able to meet and talk to anyone; our greeters will be there to make introductions and keep things moving.

What to Bring:
Bring your business cards. Bring at least one card for the event organizer, so we can enter you in a raffle.

How to Dress:
This is after work networking, so even if you did not work...pretend and dress like you did! We all look good when we dress professionally. We always take pictures at our events, so you want to look your best!

Photography:
Our events are photographed for our Websites and Social Media sites. By attending our event, you give us permission to take photographs and use the images. All participants at our events are beautiful people and are subject to be photographed and used to promote future events.

RSVP Now at https://san-francisco-local-business-networking.eventbrite.com

name: Family Constellations Ancestral Healing – Oct 18th
description:
You are invited to attend these Family & Systemic Constellations, a group ancestral healing format.

For those new to constellation work, here in an introductory article: http://nlpsanfrancisco.com/the-5-top-things-you-should-know-about-family-systemic-constellations/

We all inherit patterns from our families. These patterns are unconscious ways of being that usually support us—but sometimes they limit us. Ancestral patterns can impact our relationships, career and finances, even our health.

Constellations are about revealing the patterns that hold us back from the experiences we want in life so that we can let them go. In the process we find the original strength of our ancestry so that it becomes a support rather than a limitation.

Family constellations are in service to creating real change in your life. The kind of change that moves and heals even the really stuck stuff.

Participating:
All of this happens in a safe and supportive group environment. It’s free to attend as a participant to observe, support, and learn more about this amazing healing work. Anyone who is interested in growth & healing is welcome to attend the event. A small donation ($5) is asked to help cover the cost of the venue. Everyone receives healing and learning just by being part of the evening.

Client slots:
If you are interested in having a constellation done for yourself, please contact me at [masked] to discern together if a constellation would be a good fit for you at this time.

People come to constellations when they have something they want to change in their lives. When people think they might want a constellation, or want help with change, I do a consultation call with them so we can determine whether or not it would be a good fit to work together and how. Sometimes it’s a constellation, sometimes it’s one-on-one sessions, sometimes it’s a combination of both.

Schedule:
Constellation evenings are held on the Third Thursdays of the month. A themed workshop happens the evening of the next Monday after that. You can view all upcoming events at http://www.nlpsanfrancisco.com/calendar

Logistics:
Please do your best to arrive on time or a little early. It helps so much when we can start on time and not have interruptions for late arrivals.

Please plan to stay the entire time. It’s best that constellations not be interrupted once they’re in progress. Constellations do move a lot of energy, so be prepared—even if you’re just watching, you are participating in a healing for everybody in the room.

Cost:
Suggested donation $5 for participants to help cover the cost of the space

Parking:
Street parking in the Castro is limited. The location is 6 blocks from Castro MUNI station and right on the 33 bus line.

About the facilitator:
Josh Alexander completed constellation training at NLP Marin in 2013 and completed Master NLP Practitioner certification in 2014. Since then he has taken Advanced Facilitator training through Convivium Constellations and facilitated constellations for clients in places ranging from California to New York, London, and Paris. He has also facilitated community constellations on topics ranging from gun violence to colonization & genocide. He volunteered with the 2015 North American Systemic Constellations Conference, helped produce the 2017 West Coast Constellations Intensive, and is working on the 2018 Intensive next.

name: ¡Constelaciones Familiares en Los Gatos, 21 de Octubre!
description:
En esta sesión, primero vamos a hacer una pequeña introducción, luego haremos un ejercicio donde todos pueden participar, aprender y beneficiarse. Por último haremos una o dos Constelaciones.

Cuando hemos tratado de cambiar algo en nuestras vidas y no lo hemos logrado es porque tiene un propósito en nuestro Sistema Familiar. Es imposible entender y sanar a menos que podamos ver las “lealtades o enredos” en nuestro Sistema Familiar. Podemos hacer esto por medio de las Constelaciones Familiares.

Hacer una Constelación nos puede ayudar en muchas áreas de nuestras vidas. Por ejemplo:

* Con nuestras relaciones personales

* Con nuestra vida profesional

* Con nuestra salud

* Para llevar acabo una decisión importante

* Para entender una situación especifica

* Para ser exitoso y tener abundancia en nuestra vida

No es necesario que los miembros de tu familia estén presentes al hacer una Constelación Familiar. Los otros participantes del grupo van a representar a los miembros de tu familia. Dentro de menos te conocen, mejor!

* Por favor ven temprano para poder aprovechar el tiempo que tenemos juntos.

* Precio: $10 por participante.

- Las personas interesadas en hacer una Constelación Familiar me deben contactar para reservar su lugar.

Un saludo,

Liza Miron
[masked]
www.coachingandconstellations.com

• Qué necesitas traer:
¡Muchas ganas de aprender, de conocer a otras personas, de sanar!

• Qué necesitas saber:
* Es fundamental mantener la privacidad y confianza de los miembros del grupo. Por esta razón, todos los participantes se comprometen a mantener toda la información y experiencia de las demás personas en el grupo de forma confidencial.

* El trabajo de Constelaciones Familiares puede tener una mejora en la salud de las personas. A pesar de esto, uno nunca debe dejar de tomar los medicamentos o terapia sin ser esto aprobado por el médico o terapeuta. Al participar en la sesión, confirmas que no sufres de ninguna condición médica (física o mental) que pueda desaconsejar que participes en la sesión.

name: Family Constellations in Los Gatos, October 21st!
description:
In this meeting, we will first have a small introduction and then we will continue with an exercise where everyone will be able to participate, learn and benefit. Then we will do one or two constellations!

Do you feel stuck in your life?

Are you looking for loving relationships and think you have no luck in love? Are you having problems with your partner?

Do you have financial problems despite working and trying hard to solve them?

Do you have difficult relationships with your children? Do your children have difficulties in their lives?

Do you have complicated illnesses or have had serious or repeated accidents in your life?

Are you trapped in a pattern that you are not able to break?

Do you feel you are following a life that is not yours?

When we have tried to change something and haven’t been successful, it is often because we are carrying it for someone from our Family System.

It is impossible to understand and heal this unless we are able to “see the entanglements” in our Family System. We are able to do this through the Family Constellation.

Doing a Family Constellation can help you in many ways! For example, it can help you with:

* Your personal relationships
* Your professional life
* Your health
* To take an important decision
* To understand a specific situation
* To be successful and have abundance

Come and join us in the meeting of the New Family Constellations! You don’t need prior experience with Family Constellations to join.

It is not necessary for your family to be present to do a Family Constellation. The other participants will represent the members of your family needed to do a constellation. The less they know about your family, the better.

* Price: $10 contribution per participant

- Anybody interested in doing a Family Constellations, please contact me for details.

* Privacy and trust among the group members are fundamental for Constellations. For that reason, by agreeing to participate you commit to keeping all information disclosed during the sessions as confidential.

* Constellations can have a positive impact on your well-being. However, you should never stop taking medication, therapy or treatment without the approval of your doctor or therapist. By participating, you confirm that you do not suffer from any mental or medical condition, disorder or injury that could make it inadvisable for you to participate in the session.

I look forward to seeing you.

Liza Miron

[masked]
www.coachingandconstellations.com
