name: Family Constellations Ancestral Healing – Nov 15th
description:
You are invited to attend these Family & Systemic Constellations, a group ancestral healing format.

For those new to constellation work, here in an introductory article: http://nlpsanfrancisco.com/the-5-top-things-you-should-know-about-family-systemic-constellations/

We all inherit patterns from our families. These patterns are unconscious ways of being that usually support us—but sometimes they limit us. Ancestral patterns can impact our relationships, career and finances, even our health.

Constellations are about revealing the patterns that hold us back from the experiences we want in life so that we can let them go. In the process we find the original strength of our ancestry so that it becomes a support rather than a limitation.

Family constellations are in service to creating real change in your life. The kind of change that moves and heals even the really stuck stuff.

Participating:
All of this happens in a safe and supportive group environment. It’s free to attend as a participant to observe, support, and learn more about this amazing healing work. Anyone who is interested in growth & healing is welcome to attend the event. A small donation ($5) is asked to help cover the cost of the venue. Everyone receives healing and learning just by being part of the evening.

Client slots:
If you are interested in having a constellation done for yourself, please contact me at [masked] to discern together if a constellation would be a good fit for you at this time.

People come to constellations when they have something they want to change in their lives. When people think they might want a constellation, or want help with change, I do a consultation call with them so we can determine whether or not it would be a good fit to work together and how. Sometimes it’s a constellation, sometimes it’s one-on-one sessions, sometimes it’s a combination of both.

Schedule:
Constellation evenings are held on the Third Thursdays of the month. A themed workshop happens the evening of the next Monday after that. You can view all upcoming events at http://www.nlpsanfrancisco.com/calendar

Logistics:
Please do your best to arrive on time or a little early. It helps so much when we can start on time and not have interruptions for late arrivals.

Please plan to stay the entire time. It’s best that constellations not be interrupted once they’re in progress. Constellations do move a lot of energy, so be prepared—even if you’re just watching, you are participating in a healing for everybody in the room.

Cost:
Suggested donation $5 for participants to help cover the cost of the space

Parking:
Street parking in the Castro is limited. The location is 6 blocks from Castro MUNI station and right on the 33 bus line.

About the facilitator:
Josh Alexander completed constellation training at NLP Marin in 2013 and completed Master NLP Practitioner certification in 2014. Since then he has taken Advanced Facilitator training through Convivium Constellations and facilitated constellations for clients in places ranging from California to New York, London, and Paris. He has also facilitated community constellations on topics ranging from gun violence to colonization & genocide. He volunteered with the 2015 North American Systemic Constellations Conference, helped produce the 2017 West Coast Constellations Intensive, and is working on the 2018 Intensive next.

name: SF Family Constellations - Ancestral Healing Evening!
description:
Now the 2nd Tuesday of every month!

Come join us for an evening of personal, transpersonal and ancestral healing, as we come together for a Family Constellations evening in San Francisco. Whether this is your first constellation experience, or you're a seasoned representative, all are welcome. All you need to participate is yourself, an open perspective, and maybe a friend or two.

Family Constellations are a group healing modality, focused on restoring the flow of life force energy and love in a family system, on behalf of someone who has come forward with an issue that they want some help in understanding and resolving. These issues are often connected to the pain of those who suffered in our families before us, to great wars and deep lost loves, to secrets and to things never spoken, all which have distorted our experiences of life and love, today, now. Participants come together in the "knowing field" allowing movement in old and stuck places, disentangling us from the past and bringing our lives more and more into a brighter present.

If you're familiar with "morphic resonance" or the "morphic field" of Rupert Sheldrake, you can consider this a real-time experience of that phenomena. Come experience it while helping some of your peers!

Healing happens in community, and when we come together in service and healing, we all benefit. The mechanics of a constellation are easier experienced than explained, and no previous experience is required. Anyone can come and support, participate, or sit in witness to the events unfolding. All are welcome!

The event is $5 to attend.

**ABOUT THE VENUE**

The entrance to the SF Wellness & Arts suite in on Market Street (the top floor of the "All-Star Donuts" building.) Press the blue button to be let in. Proceed up the stairs to the third floor. There is no elevator, and this space is not wheelchair accessible. Please arrive on time (and no earlier than 7PM,) as once we've begun, the doors will be locked for privacy.

Feel free to contact the organizer with any questions. See you there!

name: A Call to Optimism: West Coast Constellations Intensive
description:
Would you like a constellations “deep dive” with some of the best trainers on the West Coast?

Join international trainers Suzi Tucker, Sarah Peyton and Peter DeVries for an amazing retreat experience. This will be a 5-day constellation deep dive for personal healing and ancestral exploration. Re-discover our deep connectedness, find support from our ancestors, understand our culture’s divisions in a new way, and seek some rest.

This is for you if:

* You are looking for some personal healing.
* You are a seeker, interested in new ways of growing and connecting.
* You are a healer or coach, wanting to find out more about how constellations can expand your work.
* You love the ancestors, and want deeper connection with your roots.
* You are a constellations fan and love playing in the Field with others.
* You are a constellations professional and want to uplevel your work.

Save up to $300 through January 10th! For more information and to register, go to: http://www.westcoastconstellations.com/.

For questions, contact me directly at [masked].

name: Accountability Meetup
Book Club
Fourth Wednesday (Monthly Meetup)
Litquake 2018!!
description:
Another year, another Litquake!! San Francisco's literary festival is upon us and it features some spectacular events with some amazing authors and special guests. Yours truly will even be a part of a panel talking about this very MeetUp (I will create a separate event for that specific event). I will list below the events that strike my fancy, but you can go and check out the schedule here.

Thursday, Oct. 11 @ 8 p.m. - The Hobnob: Litquake Opening Night @ The University Club

Friday, Oct. 12 @ 7 p.m. - Strong Medicine: The Poetry of Addiction feat. Kim Addonizio @ San Francisco Center of the Book

• The Art of the Short Story @ 2:30 p.m. @ CCA Writers Studio

• Advice: A Night of Stories w/Porchlight @ 8 p.m. @ Swedish American Hall

Tuesday, Oct. 16

• Bad Poetry & Bad Stories: A Celebration of the Awful in All of Us @ 7 p.m. @ The Make-Out Room 

• Straight, No Chaser: Writers at the Bar @ 7:30 p.m. @ Vesuvio's

Wednesday, Oct. 17 @ 7:15 p.m. - Literary Death Match @ The Elbo Room

Thursday, Oct. 18

• Springfield Confidential: Mike Reiss & The Simpsons @ 6:30 p.m. @ Contemporary Jewish Museum

• Worlds of Ursula K. Le Guin: Arwen Curry & Michael Chabon @ 7 p.m. @ Alamo Drafthouse

• Rachel Kushner: Voice of Witness @ 7:30 p.m. @ Make-Out Room

Friday, Oct. 19

• S.F. Legends: Amy Tan & Armistead Maupin @ 7 p.m. @ Swedish American Hall

• Paul Madonna Are Drunk: What Better Way to End the Festival? @ 7:30 p.m. @ The Bindery

Saturday, Oct. 20 @ 12:30 p.m. - Lit Crawl Book Fair @ The Chapel

name: Litquake presents Pursuit of Publishing: It Takes a Village
description:
For the first time ever, I will be part of a panel at Litquake!! I'm super pumped. The panel is all about what it takes to create and sustain a writing community. CCA's Leslie Roberts will moderate the discussion with Mary Volmer (Hedgebrook), Scott James (Castro Writers Coop), Casey Bennett (Lit Events for the Lit-Minded), and Becca Gomez Farrell (East Bay Science Fiction and Fantasy Writers Meetup).

I created this group for writers and readers to meet and support fellow writers and readers. The San Francisco Bay Area is a great literary hub and home to a great supportive literary community. It would be wonderful to see y'all there!!

Get your tickets here (https://www.flipcause.com/secure/cause_pdetails/NDA0Njk=). Admission includes all four of the Pursuit of Publishing panels. Register in advance to guarantee a seat. A limited number of people will be admitted at the door.

name: Word for Word Presents The Glass Essay by Anne Carson
description:
Off the Page staged readings are the first step in developing a Word for Word production—taking a short story from the page to the stage. Join us for “The Glass Essay” by Anne Carson. Read more here: http://www.zspace.org/otpannecarson?utm_source=RushTix

You can join my RushTix group (https://rushtix.com/cur/caseybennett/) at 50% off (limited time) and get deals on tickets to this and hundreds of other events each month included in your membership.

name: Play chess this coming Sunday! Just for fun!
description:
Come for the chess; stay for the fun people and conversations, good food, beer and wine. Ideal players are adults who know at least the basic rules, but don't have to take the game too seriously. You should have a very relaxed attitude about winning/losing. Just for fun, fun, fun, and the chance to learn and/or stay in practice.

If you have a chess set (board and pieces) and/or a chess clock, it'd be helpful if you bring it. But if you don't, that's fine too. (After all, only half the players need to bring a set!)

We meet at the Crepe House (1132 Valencia) in the Mission < http://goo.gl/yItDVq >, whose management is very welcoming of our group and very generously gives us a large table for our games. Please recognize the Crepe House's generosity by some win-win giving back: consider buying dinner there or, if you're arriving later, maybe dessert (e.g., nutella crepe!); or at least wine/beer/coffee, etc. (Here's their menu: http://goo.gl/u13rY1 .) Please help make sure we'll continue to be welcomed in the future! (It goes without saying that you shouldn't import alien food or drink!)

name: Essential Dating & Relationship Skills- Free Webinar
description:
Would you like to:

• Identify your unconscious conditioning about relationships, and the key to personal growth in romance?

• Understand which parts of your "relationship blueprint" are programmed for exhilarating romance and pleasure, and which for mediocre levels of intimacy and connection?

• Master the skills necessary for each of the 3 stages of romantic relationship?

• Recognize how you can reach your full potential for sexual pleasure?

Join us at our free webinar- Essential Dating & Relationship Skllls, and learn the key elements to creating a thriving love life- whether you are single or already in a relationship.

You will also learn more about The Pleasure Course in San Francisco and The Yoga of Relationship retreat course in Mexico- where Erwan & Alicia train singles and couples intensively in creating love lives they love!

Link to the webinar https://zoom.us/j/386369481

Questions? Email [masked]

name: Could your Love Life Use a Boost?
description:
Bringing Romance, Passion & Turn-on back into Everyday life!

Is your love-life on life support? Nowadays many people find themselves distracted from or not able to fully enjoy loving turned-on relationships. Difficulties from the recent or far past can impact our ability to lovingly connect with others and form juicy romantic relationships. On top of that is how hectic modern life can be pulling you out of your heart and into your head.

Singles can have trouble getting into passionate relationships and couples often end up as companions vs soul-mates as other, often less important concerns, take over.

Love is central to everyone’s heart and deepest desires but tends to take a back seat as we focus on other things. People’s love-lives suffer and there are few effective resources to powerfully address.

Oct 18th Erwan and Alicia will cover exactly what you can do about it. They have been teaching singles and couples how to create and thrive in loving relationships for a combined 40 years. They are married, have a family and their love life is better than ever. What is their secret?

Come learn:

1. Specific daily practices to connect heart to heart with someone
2. How to handle sex… everything from techniques to how to communicate
3. How to overcome the most common pitfalls, defenses and blocks to loving yourself and another.

Erwan and Alicia will also take questions so that each person’s personal situation is powerfully addressed and you have practical steps forward to realizing a passionate romantic future full of Love!

Toward the end of the evening you will also have the opportunity to find out how to work more deeply with Erwan and Alicia.

Erwan Davon has taught thousands of singles and couples how to have exceptional romantic relationships over the last 17 years. He is the founder, senior teacher, and president of San Francisco based Erwan Davon Teachings. Erwan, who grew up in New York, has a straight-talking style that gets through to anyone so you can see your blind spots in your romantic relationships and then take your romance to new heights. He graduated with a degree in psychology and soon began teaching personal development for one of the world’s largest personal growth organizations. He then branched out on his own to support people in their relationships, and in 1993 founded Beyond Education, which later became Erwan Davon Teachings. Thousands of people have taken Erwan’s Pleasure Course and advanced programs to move past their limitations in relationships and make their romance shine.

Alicia Davon has been giving relationship advice in the Pleasure Course with Erwan since 2004. Alicia graduated with a Masters Degree in the field of Integral Psychology from John F Kennedy University, with a focus in women’s romantic and sensual expression. Prior to teaching the Pleasure Course with Erwan she was a facilitator of women’s groups devoted to female libido, pleasure, and fulfillment in all aspects of life from career to relationship. She was drawn to the “work” of Erwan Davon Teachings because of the enormous difference the organization had made in her life and the lives of so many around her.

name: Is Your Sex Life Dead? - What can be done to revive life’s ultimate pleasure!
description:
Do you find yourself with a lingering hankering for a more sensual sexual life, but stopped by how confronting it seems, or how to squeeze it into an already packed schedule? Nowadays people are overburdened by all there is to do and handle and all the information that comes at us a mile a minute from the phones in our pockets to our computer screens to quick data packed conversations and on and on. Would you like to clear some space to be in your body more often, maybe with someone else… maybe being sensual with them?

Then there are all of the emotional concerns and fears about rejection or being pressured or simply not knowing what to do. Interestingly these concerns apply to couples as much as to singles, sometimes more so... especially if the “honeymoon” period is over.

The good news is that these are not uncommon concerns and there is a lot you can do about it. Erwan and Alicia have been teaching singles and couples how to successfully navigate the biggest challenges to having thrilling sex lives for over a combined 40 years. They are married, have a family and their love life is better than ever. What is their secret?

Join us Oct 24th to learn:

1. What are the most important sexual skills

2. How do men tend to blow it and what are the common mistakes women make

3. How to create time and space for a sensual sexual life

4. What approaches work for those with partners and those without partners

Erwan and Alicia will also take questions, so your particular concerns are addressed thoroughly. You will leave the evening with a powerful opening to loving sex and having more of it!

Toward the end of the evening you will also have the opportunity to find out how to work more deeply with Erwan and Alicia.

Tickets can be purchased at:
https://www.eventbrite.com/e/is-your-sex-life-dead-what-can-be-done-to-revive-lifes-ultimate-pleasure-tickets-50928976941

He is the founder, senior teacher, and president of San Francisco based Erwan Davon Teachings. Erwan, who grew up in New York, has a straight-talking style that gets through to anyone so you can see your blind spots in your romantic relationships and then take your romance to new heights. He graduated with a degree in psychology and soon began teaching personal development for one of the world’s largest personal growth organizations. He then branched out on his own to support people in their relationships, and in 1993 founded Beyond Education, which later became Erwan Davon Teachings. Thousands of people have taken Erwan’s Pleasure Course and advanced programs to move past their limitations in relationships and make their romance shine.

name: The Rise of the Operational Analytic Data Stores
description:
Note: we need a venue to host us in San Francisco!
-----
For more analytics pipelines, join us at http://scale.bythebay.io, 11/14-17, at Twitter HQ.
-----

Operational analytic data stores are a new emerging class of databases that merges ideas of logsearch systems (Elastic, Splunk, etc) and traditional analytic databases (Vertica, Teradata, etc). Popular projects in this class include Apache Druid (incubating), Scuba (from Facebook), Clickhouse (from Yandex), Pinot (from LI), Palo (from Baidu), and more. We will discuss the motivation behind these databases, and discuss in the detail the history, architecture, and future of Druid.

Speaker:
Gian Merlino is an Apache Druid (incubating) PMC member and a co-founder of Imply. Previously, Gian led the data ingestion team at Metamarkets (now a part of Snapchat) and held senior engineering positions at Yahoo. He holds a BS in Computer Science from Caltech.

name: Scale By the Bay 2018 Program and Registration are Now Live
description:
Dear Friends — we are proud to announce the program of Scale By the Bay 2018, our sixth year of the flagship, and by now iconic, independent developer conference By the Bay. (Tl;dr: get your spot at http://scale.bythebay.io while supplies last, and especially when Early Bird is in effect until August 31.)

The conference follows the established three-day, three track structure, hosted for the third year in a row by Twitter HQ in its wonderful modern building, with all of its spacious tracks, community spaces, cozy booths, and the commons area where so many connections are made during the hallway track.

This year, Martin Odersky, the creator of Scala, opens the main conference on November 15. Neha Narkhede, the co-creator of Kafka and cofounder of Confluent, is keynoting the day 2.

The three tracks are
— Functional and Thoughtful Programming
— Reactive Microservices and Streaming Architectures
— End-to-end Data Pipelines all the way up to Machine Learning and AI

The 100 sessions include technology leaders such as Twitter, IBM, Microsoft, Salesforce, Fauna, DataStax, Databricks, Confluent, Credit Karma, Sumo Logic, GoPro, Buoyant, Workday, Zignal Labs, and many more. We cover your tools with JetBrains, your shopping with Best Buy and Target, your vacations with HomeAway, your listening with Spotify, your viewing with Netflix, your reading with Medium, and your banking with JP Morgan Chase. The list goes on and on and on — we have the most of the advanced stacks and approaches employed by the best that Silicon Valley offers to the world at scale, shared as best practices, with code, yours to learn, take home, and build upon.

Our speakers span the whole spectrum from the first-time presenters with leading companies to veterans of SBTB going all the way back to 2013, evolving their craft before our eyes. You can follow their progress by watching their previous talks on http://functional.tv and the photos of the past conferences at
https://meetup.bythebay.photo/Conferences/Scale-By-the-Bay

The three panels, closing each day, are:

— Thoughtful Software Engineering
— Data Engineering for AI, and
— Cloud, Edge, and Silver Lining.

Each day begins with a hot breakfast, that begins an uninterruptible supply of Philz coffee through the whole day, and lunch is provided. On the first two days, the closing panels are followed by our signature happy hours, with great drinks, food, and conversation. The hallway tracks are legendary.

SBTB is famous for its bespoke, all-day, build-yourself-a-company training. This year, we double it. Cliff Click, the legend of software engineering, is teaching a full day Advanced Software Engineering workshop on 11/13, followed by Ryan Knight, now of Fauna, leading cloud-native data pipelines on 11/14. The workshops are limited by 80 participants each.

As last year, we’ll plan an unconference track for those who want to share their ideas in an intimate setting for joint brainstorming.

The only thing moderate about SBTB is its size — we cap at 600 attendees to preserve the immediate and direct nature of the communication that happens, sparks that fly, and serendipity that always occurs. We are always sold out by the time the conference begins in November — so reserve your seat early at http://scale.bythebay.io! And enjoy the Early Bird that is in effect until August 31.

name: Next-Generation Therapeutics in Cancer, Gene Therapy, and Neurodegeneration
description:
Traditional drug development of high-throughput screening of small molecules, engineered biologics, and selective indications is stagnating the industry’s creativity of approaches. It is now up to startups to try the most risky endevours in attempting to cure the human body of diseases.

Come hear exciting new strategies for treating cancer by metabolic regulation and immunotherapy, genetic disorders with gene therapy, and neurodegeneration with stem cells.

Drinks and snacks served.

Speakers:

Xiyan Li, CEO of Filtricine (http://filtricine.com)

Filtricine is developing a drug-free nutrient deprivation therapy to exploit metabolic dependencies to kill cancer cells.

Cody Shirriff, CEO of Serenity Bioworks (http://serenitybioworks.com)

Serenity Bioworks is developing an immune tolerance platform for biologics. Their first product will unlock redosable gene therapy for Hemophilia.

Yingxin Li, CEO of StemXpress (http://stemxpress.com)

StemXpress is developing a new approach to cell therapy to enable killing of solid tumors, which are currently untreatable with CAR-T.

Subhadeep Das, CEO of Convalesce (http://convalesce.co)

Convalesce is developing stem cell therapies for neurodegenerative diseases, starting with Parkinson’s. With a proprietary biomaterial they create a brainlike micro-environment suited for stem cell differentiation.

Agenda:

6:30pm Doors open & networking
7:00pm Talks & panel discussion
8:00pm Networking & IndieBio tour

name: Cultured Meat Symposium
description:
Discussing the Impact, Future, and Flavor of cultured meat and cell-based meat technologies.

Join us in San Francisco on November 1, 2018 as we highlight the top industry insights of the cell-based meat revolution.

Bringing clean meat to the masses requires a lot more than just the technology behind the scenes. This 2018 symposium focuses on impact, future, and flavor. Learn more at www.CMS18.com.

Use code BIONET40 for 40% off General Admission tickets.

Learn more and RSVP:
https://www.eventbrite.com/e/cultured-meat-symposium-2018-tickets-46737735826

name: Morning Series: Media Tech & Coffee (XR, Film, Animation)
description:
Wednesdays can feel like a hurdle sometimes..
Thankfully, Monday has passed, but Friday seems so far away..

That's why Filmologic wants to help you boost your creativity and energy!
Join us for our first morning series where we all grab coffees and talk about startups, technology, and all things media related.

Regardless of whether you’re a newcomer or a seasoned pro, there’s always more to learn. So, don’t be shy—just start asking questions!

Coffees will be on us!! (limited to black coffees, no mint mojitos, sorry!) so come out and share any creative ideas you have, industry questions, suggestions about the meetup, etc.

name: Trick or Treat! Workshop
description:
Come out for a discussion to learn & share tricks that optimize strategies in evaluation and research. SFBAE is holding the first of its kind speed dating for tricks & strategies used by professionals in the field.

This informal workshop will give members an opportunity to learn about and discuss common strategies to navigate the complex practice of evaluation. Come out for some fun & treats, leave with tips & tricks you can apply in your job!

(P.S- there will definitely be lots of yummy treats)

name: Data Science & Evaluation: Innovating for Social Impact
description:
Data science is the field of study that combines domain expertise, programming skills, and knowledge of math and statistics to extract meaningful insights from data. Regardless of your industry or size, more and more organizations are coming to realize the importance of data science, AI, and machine learning. But what is it really? Why is data science important in the social sector space? And what tools and tips can you take with you.

This session will bring industry experts, Suzanne Yuen (Salesforce.org's first Data Science Director) and Aman Ahuja (Data Scientist at the Data Guild and chapter leader of DataKind SFBA), who will provide resources and share insight into the intersection of data science in the social space.

Agenda:
- Welcome
- Data Science in the social sector
- Data tools and tricks
- Q&A Panel discussion with our experts

Come out for a lively facilitated discussion and discuss challenges in this theme shared by professionals in both Data Science and the Social Sector.

name: SFBAE Bi-Annual Meetup!
description:
Come join us for an informal gathering about evaluation and applied research (both practice and theory). We are a newly started meetup for people who practice program evaluation or applied research. We share resources, bring up and discuss new ideas, ask deep questions and talk about the latest innovations in our field and network. These gatherings will be held quarterly and we invite folks to present a lighting talk or recommend guest speakers/topics.

Join us!

name: Learn public speaking with Rainbow Toastmasters, SF's only LGBTQ club
description:
Rainbow Toastmasters (http://rainbowtoastmasters.org) is a group of 30-40 people working to build their communication and leadership skills. We meet every Thursday from 6 to 7:30 p.m. Visitors are always welcome. If you come as a visitor, we'll ask you to introduce yourself, but that's it! If you think you might want to join, we ask you to visit three times before submitting an application for membership.

What is special about Rainbow? We are San Francisco's only LGBTQ Toastmasters club, and we feel free to express our queer, fabulous selves at every meeting. (Our membership is made up of LGBTQ people, straight allies, and anyone else who wants a slice of our Rainbow heaven!) In a 90-minute meeting, you'll hear humorous and inspirational speeches, see people think on their feet with impromptu responses, and observe members giving one another praise and constructive feedback through evaluations.

Why Toastmasters? We are part of an international organization that helps to build public speaking skills, develop new leaders and practice communicating in thoughtful and articulate ways. It is great for professional development, or to just have a fun creative outlet with likeminded people! We go to dinner together afterwards, and all visitors are welcome to join us!

For more info, visit our website (http://rainbowtoastmasters.org)

name: ODSC West 2018 - The Leading Applied Data Science and AI Conference
description:
In partnership with the ODSC organizing team, we're excited to invite you to ODSC West. Note this meetup will not count as a ticket, you need to get those here: https://odsc.com/california. Use code COMM30 on Eventbrite to save 30% on passes.

ODSC West 2018 will host an incredible lineup of 200+ expert presenters to give you a sweeping understanding of the latest frameworks, tools, and breakthroughs in Data Science and AI.

Speakers and Sessions include:

- Naveen Swamy, Software Developer at Amazon AI - Deep Learning, Research to Production
- Jose Portilla, Head of Data Science at Pieran Data Inc - Analyzing Data Efficiently with Pandas and Python
- Kevin Kuo, Software Engineer at R Studio - Scalable Data Science and Deep Learning with R
- Andre Karpathy, Director of AI at Tesla
- Seth Weidman, Senior Data Scientist at Metis - Latest Developments in GANS
- Andreas Mueller, PhD, Core Contributor of scikit-learn and Author of Introduction to Machine Learning with Python - Advanced Machine Learning with scikit-learn
Julien Simon, Principal Evangelist at Amazon - Deep Learning for Developers
- Avneesh Saluja, Senior Research Scientist at Airbnb - Deep Learning and Processing at Airbnb
- Check the full schedule here: http://bit.ly/west2018schedule

name: PHOTO SHOOT WITH MODEL VIKTORY ON SATURDAY, OCTOBER  27 IN HAYWARD
PHOTO SHOOT IN DEATH VALLEY WITH AMAZING MODEL VIKTORY
Thunder Blockchain Developer MeetUp
description:
DESCRIPTION
With SF Blockchain Week around the corner, in preparation for the biggest Bay Area blockchain events, let's get together over some drinks and discuss the latest updates inside the blockchain technology space.

Time: 6:30pm-9:00pm

Venue: Loft House

Topic: Review of the current Blockchain Industry and how Thunder stands out.

Agenda:

6:30pm-7:00pm: Registration

7:00pm-7:45pm: Speech

7:45-8:15pm: Q&A

8:15-8:45pm: Social Time

8:45-9pm: A tour to Thunder office (across the street from Venue)

***Refreshments and light snacks will be provided

Speaker Bio:

Chris Li: Chris is a long time Linux kernel hacker, ext3 directory index, and Linux sparse check maintainer on git.kernel.org. He is an expert on kernel, file systems, high performance systems, virtual machines and hypervisors. He designed and implemented the USB virtualization stack used in VMware. It was the first in the world to use USB isochronous transfer in virtual machine (patent granted). He is formerly the CTO of Hover Camera, the real-time flight control system created from scratch.

About us:

Thunder is the world's fastest EVM-compatible public blockchain. Our TestNet is now live. High TPS, sub-second confirmations, and maximum security. All with full EVM-compatibility. Unleash your DApp—or build for tomorrow—starting today.

Special note:

Sign up now as seating is limited to 30 people.

name: Distrikt Retrospekt 2018
SF Decompression 2018: Black Top City
Welcome New Members (Quarterly Newsletter, not an event)
[o/n] North Fork Grizzly Century 2-day
description:
We will ride the Grizzly Century over 2 days, with dispersed NF camping in Sierra National Forest on Saturday night near the Soda Springs Campground (which is closed).

No services, no open campgrounds due to the late season and tree fall risks.

I'll be using a bear hang for storing food at night.
Other leave-no-trace practices in effect.

Use of camp stove require a free online campfire permit:
http://www.preventwildfireca.org/Campfire-Permit/
There are no other permits needed.

***Limited water availability. Chiquita Creek is flowing.
Day 2 water is uncertain. I will be using iodine tablets and carrying 1 gal at all possible times.

Meeting place is still the Buckhorn Saloon in North Fork. Coffee and breakfast, before 8:30, and then then we'll re-park the cars.

Park near here at the dirt lot across from where Central Camp Rd intersects 271. Ranger says that's where all the cyclists park.
https://goo.gl/maps/5w2cxrayb3u

I will not be driving from or returning to the Bay Area, so I can't help with carpooling, unfortunately.

Approx. Routes

Saturday, Day 1: Bass Lake (CCW) to Soda Springs CG
https://ridewithgps.com/routes/28762259
46 miles, +4800ft

Sunday, Day 2: Soda Springs CG (CCW) to Bass Lake
https://ridewithgps.com/routes/28762488
48 miles, 4900ft

We can't actually camp at Soda Springs CG because it is closed due to tree fall hazards, but we will look nearby. Chiquita Creek is nearby for filtering water.

There are no stores until Day 2, mile 32/48, the Jones Store, so practically speaking we need to bring all our food for both days.

This is a last minute trip and pretty physically challenging. Be prepared to communicate quickly by email and phone when you RSVP or contact me with interest.

name: Russian River Watershed Ride
description:
Meet Friday, 3:30 pm: Larkspur Ferry from SF Ferry Building, then ride to
3:59 SMART train and ride from San Rafael to Cotati, then
bike 25 miles to Bodega Dunes Campground (hike/bike)
(expect to arrive in Bodega Bay around 7:00 pm)

Saturday: (100 flat miles/9:30 minutes of riding):
Ride from Bodega Dunes Campground to
Russian River and follow the river to
camping at Lake Mendocino (RSVP so I reserve a spot)

Sunday: (65 miles) Ride from Lake Mendocino to
Sonoma County Airport SMART train station
3:16-4:23 SMART Train to San Rafael
4:44 - 5:35 Ferry to SF (last ferry of the day)

Bring: Camping gear. I plan to stop for lunch Saturday and Sunday and go out for dinner both nights (Mexican restaurant or chowder in Bodega, Co-op or other in Ukiah). I tend to prepare my own breakfast, and either go out for the first coffee I can find, or make a pot.

Clipper Cards recommended for all transit for best fare.

I'll be riding this route alone if no one alse shows. If only one or two people RSVP, I'd be open to sharing a hotel in Ukiah if someone had a strong preference for that. There is a also a Warmshowers host there who may take us in if it's a small group.

I tend to ride at about 15 mph, and it would be great to find a few people who can form a pace line and rotate lead for some portions of the trip.

There are more scenic routes of Sonoma County, and more leisurely rides with wine tour stops, etc.

name: [o/n] Thanksgiving Tour of the Southern Sierra; Sequoia Nat. Forest
description:
At this point the consensus is that we will carpool to Famoso Thursday.

Spend the night at the Famoso Inn.Leave the cars there,and start the ride 9:00AM Friday morning.

Contact me about your train/carpool plans---

An intermediate/advanced ride (not all flat!).
Some "good" dirt road on the last day,otherwise the route is paved.

If anyone wants to take the train from Jack London Sq. Thurs.pm Nov.22th to Wasco Ca they can meet us Fri.am at the Famoso Inn, Famoso Ca.

Friday an early start for the hilliest days ride 58.9 miles to Sierra Vista Motel Wofford Heights Ca.93285 . Camping option : Rivernook Campground, Kernville.

Saturday 48 miles to California Hot Springs Resort.
Sunday,back to the Wasco train station 62 miles,mostly downhill.

Or leaving and returning from the Famoso Inn will make the last day 55 miles.

Links for maps of the route

Friday Nov. 23 http://www.mapmyride.com/us/mcfarland-ca/famoso-to-kernville-route-314595549

Saturday Nov. 24 http://goo.gl/maps/b5bpF

Sunday Nov.25 http://www.mapmyride.com/us/alta-sierra-ca/california-hot-springs-to-wasco-train-st-route-314611617

description:

name: Drop In Dodgeball: World Food Day Theme
description:
Trinity Dodgeball League is hosting it's 6th week of Season 2!! The theme of the night is World Food Day! Feel free to bring in a non-perishable food item to donate instead of paying the $10 entry fee. Otherwise, it is $10 with an onsite waiver autograph for returning players to roll through and chuck some balls with us! If it is your first time playing at TDL it is FREE as long as you signup for this meetup event by 4pm on Tuesday 10/16/18! Doors open at 7:15pm, so please show up around this time to get checked in! It is free to watch as well for those that want to cheer on their friends. Unfortunately, we do not have a water fountain on site, so please bring a water bottle or two because you will get your sweat on. We will be providing no-sting balls as well as 8.5 balls. No experience needed, come on in and have some fun! We recommend wearing comfortable active wear as well as costumes. Cloth or other non-hard shell knee pads are encouraged for those that think they might be rolling and diving but are not mandatory. There are around 40 + dodgeballers each night that attend! We will provide the balls, the court, the sweet jams and you get to bring your awesomeness. Court 1 will be for league play and court 2 is open for open gym play. Lastly, the gym is located on Fair Oaks, which is up and to the left from the 24th st address listed. Just follow the joyous sounds of dodgeball and look for an orange cone by the gym doors. Afterwards we will head to our local sponsor bar, Dubliner of Noe Valley from some sweet drink specials and fun times!

More info at: www.trinitydodgeball.com

name: Holiday Potluck & Cookie Exchange
description:
Open r.s.v.p. will begin November 24, 2017.

Break out your holiday spirit and come join us for what promises to be a terrific potluck and cookie exchange!

This Meetup group is for serious cooks who enjoy participating in collaborative menu planning in advance of the event, so please post your planned contribution to our menu when you RSVP, and please keep your commitment to show up with that dish because the rest of us will be planning our menu around you. If you are new to this group, the idea is for each person to read the comments already posted, and then post a comment to add to the menu with something that does not duplicate and is complementary to the other dishes already posted. Everyone works together to help us all end up with a fairly balanced mix of appetizers, salads or side dishes, main dishes, and desserts. It's a self-managed team process, but it usually works well when everyone cooperates. We have group rules about last-minute cancellations because that adds a lot of work for event hosts who have to scramble to fill the menu holes, so please read the group rules before you RSVP too.

In addition to your dish or dishes, please bring 1 dozen of your favorite cookies for the cookie exchange. I will have large ziplock bags on hand for taking cookies home!

If you are bringing a guest, please bring two dishes.

**Please post what you are bringing, dish or dishes and your cookies within 72 hours of your RSVP.

Wait List: Because of the collaborative menu-planning approach we use, we really hope people will be thoughtful with their RSVP's and not cancel (especially at the last minute!). If cancellations sometimes cannot be avoided, advancing people from the wait list is not automatic. Wait list people who really want to attend should also post a suggested dish they will bring if a spot opens up. The hosts may choose to advance a wait list person based on which dish will best fill the hole in the menu created by the cancellation, or may opt to not advance anyone if there isn't sufficient prep and cooking time for a new guest.

name: Executive Buy-In Strategies
description:
Ticket: https://www.eventbrite.com/e/executive-buy-in-strategies-tickets-48439549998

A key aspect of a PM’s job is to critically balance between consumer, technology and business. This involves involving the right people, in right ways and at the right times. Join Advancing Women in Product & Plaid on October 17th to learn on innovative strategies that you can take with you in how to involve executive leadership and sponsors in key product management decisions.

Panelists:

Scott Zuccarino // Product Manager, Thumbtack

Scott has been a product manager for ~7 years. He is currently at Thumbtack, leading teams focused on marketplace dynamics and pro experience. Prior to Thumbtack, Scott was at Google News and YouTube. He holds a degree in Applied Mathematics from Harvard University.

Kate Adamson // Product Manager, Plaid

Kate is a Product Manager at Plaid, the infrastructure that facilitates the secure exchange of financial data across applications. In this role, she's responsible for their lending product strategy, which includes accountability for their Assets and Income products as well as the exploration of new solutions that serve the lending industry. She joined Plaid from J.P. Morgan Chase, first working in their investment bank and then in the office of the corporate COO. She's inspired by Plaid's mission to enable innovation in financial services, the solutions that Plaid customers are building and delivering to market, good music and great food.

Meryam Bukhari // Product Manager, Yelp

Meryam is deeply driven to bring rigor to her work and see her team excel. As an ex-quantitative analyst who built models forecasting the impact of quantitative easing on the U.S. economy, she believes that defining the problem we're trying to solve is as important as solving it. As an ex-community organizer, that's knocked on the doors of hundreds of strangers, she knows empathy with users and relationships is critical to building good Product. She is always interested in having a conversation about Product, education, wellness, food, learning from and teaching others.

Clement Kao // Product Manager, Blend

Clement leads the expansion of consumer lending products at Blend. His team is defining how Blend and its customers deliver a multi-product origination experience, built around a complete and verified borrower financial profile.

Before Blend, Clement led the technical implementation of two new business models at Movoto Real Estate, each bringing in millions in annual revenue.

Agenda:

6:00 - 6:30 pm: Registration & AWIP Welcome

6:30 - 7:15 pm: Panel Discussion

7:15 - 7:30 pm: Q&A

7:30 - 8:00 pm: Networking & Close

name: Growing Markets for IoT Products
description:

The Internet of Things (IoT) market is expected to grow from USD 170 billion in 2017 to USD 560 billion by 2022. In this ever growing realm of IoT the key challenges are security and large scale scaling of connected systems and solutions. How to stay abreast with this extremely fast growth? What strategies to employ in your IoT products? What markets is it predicted to grow? Join us in november for an exciting talk and learn about IoT product strategies for growing markets from executive product leaders in the IoT space.

name: Crypto Underground: Traders, Investors, Hackers, Enthusiasts
Learn how to thrive with Functional Medicine!
description:
Monthly Functional Forum Meetup

Are you feeling your best and want to stay healthy?
Do you have pain, allergies, fatigue, digestive or other symptoms that persist despite working with excellent doctors?
Have you been diagnosed with a food intolerance or an autoimmune disease?
Are you considering alternatives to western medicine but don’t know where to start?

If this sounds like you or someone you know, you won't want to miss our monthly Meetup!

We start at 5:30 with informal networking - an opportunity for you to meet others interested in Functional Medicine and other holistic, integrative, and complementary approaches to better health.

At 6 PM we have a guest speaker followed by discussion and then we'll watch a pre-recorded segment of the monthly Functional Forum presentation with additional time for discussion and wrap-up.

All are welcome - Western MD's, Functional medicine practitioners, Naturopaths, Chinese Medicine doctors, health coaches, nutritionists, and other health practitioners. Let's create a community where we exchange information and support each others efforts!

FEATURED LIVE PRESENTATION

We will be featuring a local speaker each month to share their journey to better health or introduce a topic of interest or approach to better health that might be of interest to our group. Please let me know if you're interested in being a featured speaker at an upcoming meeting!

FUNCTIONAL FORUM PRESENTATION

Each month the Functional Forum has a different theme and program of featured speakers around that theme. Topics include: Cognitive Decline, Autoimmune Disease, Pediatric Integrative Health Approaches, Gut Health, New Approaches to Health Insurance, and more! Stay tuned and the Meetup will be updated as the topics are announced. The live Forum takes place in a different place around the world each month and is recorded. We will watch a segment of the recording each month and after the Meetup, I will send you a link to the full recording to watch.

The event is free but please RSVP so we can plan accordingly as space is limited.

Yummy food (including Gluten Free & Dairy Free options), wine, beer, and coffee will be available for purchase on-site so come hungry and thirsty to support our venue host, Kawika's Ocean Beach Deli.

We look forward to seeing you soon!

name: First Meetup of San Francisco Solo Travelers
description:
This will be the first Meetup of the Group. Super informal and casual. Plenty of time to talk with each other to learn travel tips and recommendations. Cafe du Soleil has a wide range menu of food, coffee, wine and other beverages.

The goal is to meet other solo travelers, learn from each other and to become inspired to try new adventures that others suggest.

Who knows, you might meet someone that shares a specific place and you may want to travel to that location together or agree to meet up along the way.

Hoping each person will have specific travel tips that have made their trips more fun, less stressful and more interesting. What off the beaten path locations might you recommend to others? What was your most unexpected experience you had as a solo traveler?

Are you a different person on the road? Do you find it easier or harder to meet other travelers in foreign spots? What have you done when you don't speak the local language and you really need some help? Have you meet people from other parts of the world that are now friends?

No agenda, just conversation and let's see what happens.

name: Stand Up & Speak OUT! How to Become a More Effective Speaker and Communicator
description:
The Golden Gate Business Association (GGBA), San Francisco's LGBTQ Chamber of Commerce, is proud to present a new program to help you become a more confident speaker and effective communicator. 'STAND UP & SPEAK OUT' is created and hosted by award-winning professional speaker, Gina Grahame.

"'STAND UP & SPEAK OUT' changes the way public speaking, executive presentation, and communication skills are taught in a group setting. Most of the public speaking programs I've seen rely on lessons and methods that haven't changed in 60+ years, yet we live in culture where disruptive innovation is continually shaking up established industries and reshaping the possibilites. I've applied the same thoughts and processes to public speaking training. "
- Gina Grahame

Develop A Strong Presence. Persuade with Passion. Empower others to take Action.
OWN YOUR VALUE

• WHAT WE DO
We focus on real-world situations rather than theory. We utilize roleplay and video in our training. The feedback you receive is multi-faceted, provided by your peers as well as the session leader.

While these are group sessions, The training and feedback you receive is tailored to you: to your current level of expertise and your personal goals. This focus makes you a more effective speaker quickly. You will literally be a more effective communicator after every session. And the more we work together, the more nuanced and skilled you will become.

• WHAT TO BRING
Bring business cards for networking and either a laptop, tablet, or pen & paper to take notes. Be ready to have fun, to learn, and to provide feedback to help others.

• IMPORTANT TO KNOW
While guests are under no obligation to participate, this is an interactive workshop and we encourage all attendees to step outside their comfort zones and participate.

- WHO IS GINA GRAHAME?
I've been a professional speaker and coach for over 25 years, and have done so in most every avenue of business you can imagine:
- Began my career after winning a national award in Extemporaneous Speaking from the Business Professionals of America
- Toured nationally as a narrating engineer for Dodge Truck Engines
- Acted in a B2B 'Industrial' films
- Pitched to VC's and secured $250k in seed funding
- Given sales presentations to companies of all sizes, from tool & die shops in Detroit to tech startups in San Francisco, including Fortune 500 companies in technology, automotive, advanced manufacturing, banking & finance
- Coached executives, scientists, salespeople, non-profit leaders, aspiring speakers, politicians, life coaches, and college students
- Given keynote speeches, hosted breakout sessions, participated in and moderated panels at conferences
- Was a Semi-finalist in the World Championships of Public Speaking by Toastmasters International
I accomplished this first as male, and then after gender transition, as female. I know first-hand the ways in which people of different genders present, communicate, are perceived, and are judged.

Gina's clients include:
Pacific Gas & Electric (PG&E), Zurich North America, YPO (Young Presidents’ Organization), Stanford Graduate School of Business, Women’s Empowerment Symposium, American Business Women’s Assoc, Wells Fargo, United Business Media, Lenos Software, Univ of California - San Fran, Greater Seattle Business Assoc, GaymerX Events, PocketGamer, East Coast Game Conference, Toastmasters Int’l Leadership Conference (District #4) - Who is the Golden Gate Business Association (GGBA)?
The GGBA is proud to be a San Francisco Bay Area LGBT business advocate!
Our mission is to champion opportunity, development, and advocacy for our LGBTQ & Allied business community.
We create opportunity for marketing, networking, procurement, and referral-based business growth; programs that support development of business skills and expertise through workshops and seminars; and we advocate for positive economic, social, and political change.

name: Marketing Trends & Discussion - Lunch @ Apple Union Square
description:
Let's talk marketing! All topics are on the table. This is a weekly lunch for professional marketers (or anyone that wants to chat with professional marketers). Super casual. Just come ready for good conversation.

HOW TO FIND US
We'll be behind the store in the small park. I'll be wearing my fluorescent yellow baseball cap.

Bring your lunch and come say hi.

name: Virtual Meetup - What if there is Nothing Wrong with you?
From Heartache to Hope and Happiness - VIRTUAL MEETING WORLDWIDE
2019 Ski/Snowboarding Season Kick Off Happy Hour
description:
I hope everyone had an awesome summer!

The 2019 ski and snowboard season is just around the corner and it's anticipated that the snow will be awesome so we are in for a great season!!!

So let's kick off the season by having the first of many monthly"Meet and Greet events" so everyone in the meetup can socialize and get to know each other so when you post an idea for a one day trip, find people for a ski lease, sign up for a trip or organized a car pool to Tahoe; there might be a very good chance that you would already know someone.

We will meeting at DADA Bar & Art Gallery (65 Post Street, San Francisco, CA) which is close to BART/public transportation.

Invitations have been extended to the San Francisco Skiers and Snowboarders Meetup group so we will be meeting other people who share our desire for the awesome snow we can have in Tahoe.

Looking forward to seeing everyone!!

Bay Area Skiing and Snowboarding Meetup Event Organizer
Leonard

name: Ski/Snowboard and Eat in Japan
description:
Join Saveur the Journey for a Skiing/boarding trip to the ultimate powder stash, Niseko (Hokkaido Prefecture), Japan! Float effortlessly through some of the driest, deepest snow in the world, while experiencing the decadent delights of Japanese hot spring baths (onsen), the rich and delicious culinary traditions, and amazing hospitality.

The snowflakes are softly building into a deep, light blanket, the the yakitori is sizzling above the binchotan charcoal, fresh fish is being turned into sushi by a master with forty years’ experience, the onsen is sending clouds of steam into the snow-filled ski.

We are going to Japan, are you coming?

January 26-February 3, 2019

$4650

9 days, 8 nights

Includes all accommodations, most meals, transportation during the trip, 5 days lift tickets, English speaking guides, organized tours and tastings/cultural outings.

Does not include airfare, alcohol, or trip insurance.

Visit Saveur the Journey ( https://www.saveurthejourney.com/trip/japan-skiing-snowboarding-eating/ ) for more information.

name: Ski and Eat in the French Alps
description:
Join Saveur the Journey (www.saveurthejourney.com) for a Ski/Snowboard trip to the French Alps March 8-16, 2019 with a focus on food, especially cheese! We will ski/board the "Portes du Soleil," 12 interconnected resorts in the French and Swiss Alps encompassing over 650km of slopes.

From miles of beautiful groomed slopes with spectacular views to challenging off-piste in bowls, woods, and chutes the Portes du Soleil has something for everyone. If you want a challenge, ride the famous "Swiss Wall," one the most difficult slopes in Europe, or spend the whole day doing a "Ski Safari," crossing the border between France and Switzerland on skis without riding the same slopes twice. Eat at beautiful slopeside restaurants serving amazing food and finish the day with cold beer or a mug of "vin chaud."

In the evening we will experience the famous cheese dishes of the region “Fondue au Fromage” (rustic bread dipped into a simmering pot of melted mountain cheeses and wine), “Raclette” (slices of creamy melting cheese poured over boiled potatoes and eaten with cured meats), “Tartiflette” (a gratin of potatoes, lardon, and onions covered with a slightly aged soft cheese called Reblochon) and more (like mountain trout, local sausage, pastries, delicious wine, and beautiful winter salads)! There is also an optional guided descent of the "Vallee Blanche;" 20km and 9000 vertical feet of guided backcountry skiing/boarding on the glacier of Mont Blanc (Chamonix).

We will visit a cheese maker to watch cheese being made, meet their cows, and visit the cheese cave, followed by a tasting while we mingle with French farmers. A stop at a charcuterie for a tour, demonstration, and tasting will help us understand the art of curing meat. Accommodations for the group will be in a beautiful mountain chalet (www.ovonetwork.com/en/la-ferme-de-marie) in the ski town of Morzine, France. Cost for the trip is $3150 for double occupancy and includes accommodations, lift tickets, transportation within France and Switzerland, almost all meals, and visits to food producers. Airfare, alcohol, and trip insurance not included. +$350 for guided descent of Mont Blanc. 9 days-8 nights. Bay area Ski and Snowboard meetup members save $200 if you book before July 1.

If you would like more information about this trip and to see photos and short videos please visit www.saveurthejourney.com/product/ski-vacation-in-france-9-days-8-nights. For bookings please email [masked]. Space is limited to 10 people. For intermediate or better skiers/boarders.

"Our “Saveur the Journey” experience exceeded our expectations. In short, the skiing was amazing and the Vallée Blanche descent was a once in a lifetime experience. Aaron and Francois toured us throughout the enormous Portes du Soleil ski resorts knowing where to find the best runs and the terrific lunch stops. The accommodations, local tours, food, trip organization, and laughter were all reflective of a tour leader who genuinely cares and wants to share his love of France. “Saveur the Journey” is an experience that is reflective of Aaron, his enthusiasm for life, and his fixation on cheese!"
-Scott & Sue Shepler-Denver, CO

name: The Age of Gold: The California Gold Rush...New American Dream (Book Discussion)
description:
The Age of Gold: The California Gold Rush and the New American Dream
By H.W. Brands (592 pages)
Recommended by Cori M.

The California Gold Rush inspired a new American dream—the “dream of instant wealth, won by audacity and good luck.” The discovery of gold on the American River in 1848 triggered the most astonishing mass movement of peoples since the Crusades. It drew fortune-seekers from the ends of the earth, accelerated America’s imperial expansion, and exacerbated the tensions that exploded in the Civil War.

H.W. Brands tells his epic story from multiple perspectives: of adventurers John and Jessie Fremont, entrepreneur Leland Stanford, and the wry observer Samuel Clemens—side by side with prospectors, soldiers, and scoundrels. He imparts a visceral sense of the distances they traveled, the suffering they endured, and the fortunes they made and lost. Impressive in its scholarship and overflowing with life, The Age of Gold is history in the grand traditions of Stephen Ambrose and David McCullough.

“An engrossing, multifaceted history.” —The New York Times

“A barn burner. . . . Masterfully sketched historical figures, subtly developed themes, and epically well-braided stories. . . . There’s only one thing to say . . . and that’s ‘Eureka!’ ” —San Francisco Chronicle

“Exuberant. . . . Entertaining, lively. . . . Brands [is] a wonderfully skilled narrative historian.” —Los Angeles Times

“Gripping. . . . Thoroughly researched. . . . An eminently readable, detail-filled book.” —Chicago Tribune

name: The World of Charles and Ray Eames (Museum Visit)
description:
MEET US--
Following our book discussion in the cafe, we'll meet in the museum lobby, in front of the desk where you can pay for admission. Meet us between 11:45 and 12 noon. We'll go into the museum together at noon.

TICKETS--
OMCA Members Free
General $15.95
Seniors (65+) & Students (with current ID) $10.95
There MAY be an additional fee for the special Eames exhibition which opens 10/13th. To be determined.

ABOUT THE EXHIBIT--
Fueled by their belief in design as a way of life, the innovative husband and wife duo Charles and Ray Eames were two of the most influential designers of the twentieth century. Go beyond their most well-known designs in this intimate and inspiring exhibition portraying their legacy and lives in California. The Eameses—who founded The Eames Office—valued knowledge and discovery, embraced the joy of trial and error, and saw no separation between life and work. Through multi-media installations, films, rare prototypes, photography, furniture, toys, products, as well as personal letters, drawings, and artwork, discover the story of the Eameses from a fresh perspective. Explore the breadth of their work across many fields in this interactive exhibition that brings their ideas and playful spirit to life.

name: Let's Toast the Holidays & Discuss "Last Christmas of the War"
description:
Registration opens 11/1/18

Another year has come and gone. Let's share a cup of good cheer (or coffee) before 2018 comes to a close. Many thanks to Sheryl for proposing this holiday-themed essay for discussion: "Last Christmas of the War" by Primo Levi. It first appeared in The New York Review of Books in 1986.

Here is the link:
https://www.nybooks.com/articles/1986/01/30/last-christmas-of-the-war/

Info coming soon about time and place.

name: The Bohemians: Mark Twain and the San Francisco Writers... (Book Discussion)
description:
REGISTRATION WILL OPEN DECEMBER 1ST

The Bohemians: Mark Twain and the San Francisco Writers Who Reinvented American Literature
By Ben Tarnoff (336 pages)

The Bohemians will bridge our Fall reading list, focused on California history, with the second place winner on our last genre/subject poll--literary history.

****
An extraordinary portrait of a fast-changing America—and the Western writers who gave voice to its emerging identity

At once an intimate portrait of an unforgettable group of writers and a history of a cultural revolution in America, The Bohemians reveals how a brief moment on the far western frontier changed our culture forever. Beginning with Mark Twain’s arrival in San Francisco in 1863, this group biography introduces readers to the other young eccentric writers seeking to create a new American voice at the country’s edge—literary golden boy Bret Harte; struggling gay poet Charles Warren Stoddard; and beautiful, haunted Ina Coolbrith, poet and protector of the group. Ben Tarnoff’s elegant, atmospheric history reveals how these four pioneering writers helped spread the Bohemian movement throughout the world, transforming American literature along the way.

“Tarnoff’s book sings with the humor and expansiveness of his subjects’ prose, capturing the intoxicating atmosphere of possibility that defined, for a time, America’s frontier.” -- The New Yorker

“Rich hauls of historical research, deeply excavated but lightly borne.... Mr. Tarnoff’s ultimate thesis is a strong one, strongly expressed: that together these writers ‘helped pry American literature away from its provincial origins in New England and push it into a broader current’.” -- Wall Street Journal

name: The Novel of the Century: ...Adventure of Les Misérables (Book Discussion)
description:
REGISTRATION WILL OPEN DECEMBER 1ST

The Novel of the Century: The Extraordinary Adventure of Les Misérables
By David Bellos (336 Pages)

Our second foray into the genre of literary history will take on The Novel of the Century. Thankfully, David Bellos' captivating story of the creation of Les Misérables is a fraction in length of Victor Hugo's book.

****
A New York Times Book Review Editors' Choice
Winner of the American Library in Paris Book Award, 2017

Les Misérables is among the most popular and enduring novels ever written. Like Inspector Javert’s dogged pursuit of Jean Valjean, its appeal has never waned, but only grown broader in its one-hundred-and-fifty-year life. Whether we encounter Victor Hugo’s story on the page, onstage, or on-screen, Les Misérables continues to captivate while also, perhaps unexpectedly, speaking to contemporary concerns. In The Novel of the Century, the acclaimed scholar and translator David Bellos tells us why.

This enchanting biography of a classic of world literature is written for “Les Mis” fanatics and novices alike. Casting decades of scholarship into accessible narrative form, Bellos brings to life the extraordinary story of how Victor Hugo managed to write his novel of the downtrodden despite a revolution, a coup d’état, and political exile; how he pulled off a pathbreaking deal to get it published; and how his approach to the “social question” would define his era’s moral imagination. More than an ode to Hugo’s masterpiece, The Novel of the Century also shows that what Les Misérables has to say about poverty, history, and revolution is full of meaning today.

https://www.npr.org/2017/03/28/520994034/novel-of-the-century-is-a-lively-companion-to-les-mis-rables

name: The Inventor & the Tycoon and/or River of Shadows (Book Discussion)
description:
Now let's sink our teeth into some juicy popular history, featuring the unsavory antics of two California movers and shakers and the technology that gave birth to the film industry.

You can choose to read Solnit's well-reviewed River of Shadows or you may opt for Ball's possibly flawed take on the same topic, in The Inventor and the Tycoon. Either way, join us for a lively discussion with some smart and friendly folks.

****
River of Shadows: Eadweard Muybridge and the Technological Wild West
By Rebecca Solnit (320 pages)

The world as we know it today began in California in the late 1800s, and Eadweard Muybridge had a lot to do with it. This striking assertion is at the heart of Rebecca Solnit’s new book, which weaves together biography, history, and fascinating insights into art and technology to create a boldly original portrait of America on the threshold of modernity. The story of Muybridge—who in 1872 succeeded in capturing high-speed motion photographically—becomes a lens for a larger story about the acceleration and industrialization of everyday life. Solnit shows how the peculiar freedoms and opportunities of post–Civil War California led directly to the two industries—Hollywood and Silicon Valley—that have most powerfully defined contemporary society.

“One finds it hard to remember what things looked like before this book appeared in the world.” —The New York Times Book Review

“The imagery of a poet, the ideas of a theoretician, the rhythm of a thoroughbred and the force of a Southern Pacific locomotive.” —San Francisco Chronicle

https://www.nytimes.com/2003/03/30/books/he-shoots-horses-doesn-t-he.html

The Inventor and the Tycoon: The Murderer Eadweard Muybridge, the Entrepreneur Leland Stanford, and the Birth of Moving Pictures
By Edward Ball (464 pages)

Nearly 140 years ago, in frontier California, photographer Eadweard Muybridge captured time with his camera and played it back on a flickering screen, inventing the breakthrough technology of moving pictures. Yet the visionary inventor Muybridge was also a murderer who killed coolly and meticulously, and his trial became a national sensation. Despite Muybridge’s crime, the artist’s patron, railroad tycoon Leland Stanford, founder of Stanford University, hired the photographer to answer the question of whether the four hooves of a running horse ever left the ground all at once—and together these two unlikely men launched the age of visual media. Written with style and passion by National Book Award-winner Edward Ball, this riveting true-crime tale of the partnership between the murderer who invented the movies and the robber baron who built the railroads puts on display the virtues and vices of the great American West.

https://www.washingtonpost.com/opinions/the-inventor-and-the-tycoon-a-gilded-age-murder-and-the-birth-of-moving-pictures-by-edward-ball/2013/02/01/bed4edbc-64ab-11e2-b84d-21c7b65985ee_story.html?utm_term=.77f7a55fb95d

name: "All Quiet on the Western Front" by Erich Maria Remarque
description:
November 2018 marks the 100th anniversary of the end of World War I, "the war to end all wars." Join us for our discussion of the most famous literary depiction of the horrors of that war.

"All Quiet on the Western Front is a novel by Erich Maria Remarque, a German veteran of World War I. Remarque's famous tale describes the German soldiers' extreme physical and mental stress during that war, and the detachment from civilian life felt by many of these soldiers upon returning home from the front."

"The novel tells the story of Paul Bäumer, a German soldier who—urged on by his school teacher—joins the German army shortly after the start of World War I. His class was 'scattered over the platoons amongst Frisian fishermen, peasants, and labourers'.... Bäumer and his comrades have to engage in frequent battles and endure the treacherous and filthy conditions of trench warfare.

At the very beginning of the book, Erich Maria Remarque says 'This book is to be neither an accusation nor a confession, and least of all an adventure, for death is not an adventure to those who stand face to face with it. It will try simply to tell of a generation of men who, even though they may have escaped (its) shells, were destroyed by the war.' The book does not focus on heroic stories of bravery, but rather gives a view of the conditions in which the soldiers find themselves."

venue.name: San Francisco Public Library
venue.address_1: Paley Room (3rd Floor by the Paging Desk), 100 Larkin St.

name: "Death on the Installment Plan" by Louis-Ferdinand Celine
description: "In Death on Credit, Ferdinand, Céline's alter ego, is a doctor in Paris, treating the poor who seldom pay him but take every advantage of his availability. The action is not continuous but goes back in time to earlier memories and often moves into fantasy, especially in Ferdinand's sexual escapades; the style becomes deliberately rougher and sentences disintegrate to catch the flavor of the teeming world of everyday Parisian tragedies, struggles to make a living, illness, venereal disease, the sordid stories of families whose destiny is governed by their own stupidity, malice, lust and greed....Celine's novel offers a profound vision of the nature of individual human existence, rooted in suffering and inertia. The anti-heroic genius of Ferdinand's search for a livable life in 20th century Paris forms a direct literary metaphor for modern humanity: to search and search again for happiness and meaning in a complex world and to often come up empty. Or more precisely, to find words, stories, experiences, and ideas that stretch the boundaries of consciousness while providing little or no structure with which to assign any meaning to life as a whole."

name: "Blood and Guts in High School" by Kathy Acker
description:
"A masterpiece of surrealist fiction, steeped in controversy upon its first publication in 1984, Blood and Guts in High School is the book that established Kathy Acker as the preeminent voice of post-punk feminism.

In the Mexican city of Merida, ten-year-old Janey lives with Johnny―her 'boyfriend, brother, sister, money, amusement, and father'―until he leaves her for another woman. Bereft, Janey travels to New York City, plunging into an underworld of gangs and prostitution. After escaping imprisonment, she flees to Tangiers where she meets Jean Genet, and they begin a torrid affair that will lead Janey to her demise. Fantastical, sensual, and fearlessly radical, this hallucinatory collage is both a comic and tragic portrait of erotic awakening."

name: "Angle of Repose" by Wallace Stegner
description:
"An American masterpiece and iconic novel of the West by National Book Award and Pulitzer Prize winner Wallace Stegner—a deeply moving narrative of one family and the traditions of our national past.

Lyman Ward is a retired professor of history, recently confined to a wheelchair by a crippling bone disease and dependent on others for his every need. Amid the chaos of 1970s counterculture he retreats to his ancestral home of Grass Valley, California, to write the biography of his grandmother: an elegant and headstrong artist and pioneer who, together with her engineer husband, made her own journey through the hardscrabble West nearly a hundred years before. In discovering her story he excavates his own, probing the shadows of his experience and the America that has come of age around him."

PLEASE NOTE THE NEW LOCATION OF THIS MEETUP.

venue.name: Wallace Stegner Environmental Center - 5th Floor (SF Public Library)

name: "It Can't Happen Here" by Sinclair Lewis
description:
"It Can't Happen Here is the only one of Sinclair Lewis's later novels to match the power of Main Street, Babbitt , and Arrowsmith . A cautionary tale about the fragility of democracy, it is an alarming, eerily timeless look at how fascism could take hold in America.

Written during the Great Depression, when the country was largely oblivious to Hitler's aggression, it juxtaposes sharp political satire with the chillingly realistic rise of a president who becomes a dictator to save the nation from welfare cheats, sex, crime, and a liberal press.

Called 'a message to thinking Americans' by the Springfield Republican when it was published in 1935, It Can't Happen Here is a shockingly prescient novel that remains as fresh and contemporary as today's news."

"The novel that foreshadowed Donald Trump's authoritarian appeal."--Salon

venue.name: San Francisco Public Library
venue.address_1: Paley Room (3rd Floor by the Paging Desk)

name: "Narrative of the Life of Frederick Douglass"
description:
"Born into a life of bondage, Frederick Douglass secretly taught himself to read and write. It was a crime punishable by death, but it resulted in one of the most eloquent indictments of slavery ever recorded. His gripping narrative takes us into the fields, cabins, and manors of pre-Civil War plantations in the South and reveals the daily terrors he suffered as a slave.

Written more than a century and a half ago by an African-American who went on to become a famous orator, U.S. minister to Haiti, and leader of his people, this timeless classic still speaks directly to our age. It is a record of savagery and inhumanity that goes far to explain why America still suffers from the great injustices of the past."
PLEASE NOTE THE NEW DATE AND LOCATION.

name: "The Mandarins" by Simone de Beauvoir
description: "In her most famous novel, The Mandarins, Simone de Beauvoir takes an unflinching look at Parisian intellectual society at the end of World War II. In fictionally relating the stories of those around her ― Jean-Paul Sartre, Albert Camus, Arthur Koestler, Nelson Algren ― de Beauvoir dissects the emotional and philosophical currents of her time. At once an engrossing drama and an intriguing political tale, The Mandarins is the emotional odyssey of a woman torn between her inner desires and her public life."

venue.name: San Francisco Public Library
venue.address_1: Paley Room (3rd Floor by the Paging Desk)

name: "Spoon River Anthology" by Edgar Lee Masters
description: "A literary sensation when it appeared in 1915, Spoon River Anthology earned Edgar Lee Masters comparisons to T. S. Eliot and Walt Whitman. The characters who speak here tarnish the pure image of their Midwestern hamlet by holding forth from the grave with tales of illicit love affairs, betrayed confidences, political corruption, and miserable marriages. The first serious work of psychological naturalism, this artful indictment of small-town hypocrisy influenced Theodore Dreiser, William Faulkner, and other luminaries."

venue.name: San Francisco Public Library
venue.address_1: Paley Room (3rd Floor by the Paging Desk)

name: "America Is in the Heart" by Carlos Bulosan
description:
First published in 1943, this classic memoir by well-known Filipino poet Carlos Bulosan describes his boyhood in the Philippines, his voyage to America, and his years of hardship and despair as an itinerant laborer following the harvest trail in the rural West.
PLEASE NOTE THE NEW DATE AND LOCATION.

name: "Before Night Falls" by Reinaldo Arenas
description:
"The shocking memoir by visionary Cuban writer Reinaldo Arenas 'is a book above all about being free,' said The New York Review of Books --sexually, politically, artistically. Arenas recounts a stunning odyssey from his poverty-stricken childhood in rural Cuba and his adolescence as a rebel fighting for Castro, through his supression as a writer, imprisonment as a homosexual, his flight from Cuba via the Mariel boat lift, and his subsequent life and the events leading to his death in New York. In what The Miami Herald calls his "deathbed ode to eroticism," Arenas breaks through the code of secrecy and silence that protects the privileged in a state where homosexuality is a political crime. Recorded in simple, straightforward prose, this is the true story of the Kafkaesque life and world re-created in the author's acclaimed novels."

PLEASE NOTE THE NEW DATE AND LOCATION.

Aug-Dec Bootcamp: Learn Python and Socialize!

Learning to code in Python.

name: The Fall Ball - Largest SF Singles Dance Party
East Bay Singles Halloween Costume Party & Dance
November Journey Circle
description:
Theme: Walking the secret path, finding the mirror door, facing the shadow and passing beyond. Tonight's theme will support you in finding your place on the path, and exploration.
---
Journey on a drum beat. This is a practicing journey group for those who have some knowledge or experience of shamanism. I invite those who have learned about shamanism already through a workshop or individual studies. This is the place to come and practice among others who are interested in furthering their shamanic knowledge and practice. So often we take a workshop or read a book, but lack a community to support us in the work that comes after we step through that door. I am holding space for us to learn more and go in deeper to the other realms. During our meeting we will call in and release sacred space; have 2 journey sessions, which I drum for; and have time for sharing of the stories, dreams, and wisdom we retrieve. Let's come together and share our explorations and knowledge, and support each other to recover our ancestral heritage and further our own healing so that we can apply our gifts to better heal our society and world. Sliding donation $5-20.

Hosted by Herschell Larrick.

For more information about shamanism and one on one sessions:
Contact: Herschell: hlarrick @ gmail.com

I invite those who have learned about shamanism already through a workshop or individual studies. This is the place to come and practice among others who are interested in furthering their shamanic knowledge and practice. So often we take a workshop or read a book, but lack a community to support us in the work that comes after we step through that door. I am holding space for you to learn more and go in deeper to the other realms. During our meeting we will call in and release sacred space; have 2 journey sessions, which I drum for; and have time for sharing of the stories, dreams, and wisdom we retrieve. Let's come together and share our explorations and knowledge, and support each other to recover our ancestral heritage and further our own healing so that we can apply our gifts to better heal our society and world. Sliding donation $5-20.

Hosted by Herschell Larrick.

For more information about shamanism and one on one sessions:
Contact: Herschell @ [masked]
