name: Intro to Improv - Improv Games
description:
A taste of improv where we play improv games!

This Meetup is for beginners and improvisers of all skill levels. The focus is sharpening fundamentals, something that improvisors of all experience levels can benefit from.

Why Improv?

Improv helps people:
- Listen and be present
- Tap into creativity
- Be better communicators
- Celebrate making mistakes and be more resilient
- Gracefully deal with uncertainty
- Make your partners look good and collaborate more effectively

YES AND in addition to being useful, improv is fun! Join us for an intro to improv through improv games!

You will learn:
- Foundation principles of improv (e.g. YES AND, happy healthy well, being present, eye contact and listening, making your partner look good, be obvious, etc.)
- Fun improv games that improve listening skills, teamwork and communication
- Improv games that you can teach to your team, friends and family!

Who Should Attend (audience)
Anyone who wants to try improv, play games and have fun!

What kinds of people attend? All sorts, including:
- Developers / Engineers
- Actors who want to be more in the moment and flexible on set
- Directors looking for a creative outlet
- Founders and executives
- Designers
- Product Managers
- etc.

*Note:
- Limited to 25 in person attendees. First come, first served at the location.
- Donations ($25 to $45) are encouraged but not required. We accept cash or Venmo @jaredpolivka
(Most improv drop in classes in SF are between $40 and $60)

Check out these posts about improv:
- https://www.forbes.com/sites/forbesleadershipforum/2014/06/27/why-improv-training-is-great-business-training/#[masked]a6bcb

- https://medium.com/personal-growth/what-improv-can-teach-you-about-startup-life-a699c55a1548

- https://blog.hootsuite.com/brainstorm-lessons-from-improv

- https://medium.com/startup-grind/two-words-that-make-you-a-better-founder-8b226b0bbc0a

name: Board of Supervisors meeting –        Come get on TV for a good cause!
description:
The San Francisco Board of Supervisors meets every Tuesday at 2:00 p.m. at City Hall (corner of Polk and Grove) in Room 250, the main chamber on the second floor (from the Polk street entrance, just walk straight back across the rotunda and up the big stairway, and it's the room directly behind the top of the stairs on the 2nd floor).

========================================================
Among the items on the agenda for this week's meeting – http://sfbos.org/sites/default/files/bag041018_agenda.pdf :

• (Item 8) Non-Standard Vehicle Permits (Municipal Transportation Agency) - If future generations someday wonder how San Francisco lost its unique quirkiness and began to morph into just another soulless metropolis, they may look at regulations like this one, an "Ordinance amending the Transportation Code to prohibit Non-Standard Vehicles from operating without a permit". Don't you dare be non-conformist without our permission! (And pay us a fee, of course!)

• (Item 13) Mayoral "Question Time" (Supervisors Peskin, Ronen) – The intriguing description of this item is that it would is that it would "modify the process for the Mayor to appear at the Board of Supervisors for a question-and-answer session". Since a couple of the leftist Supes are the sponsors, the mayor whom it would immediately affect is a moderate, and another moderate Supe (Stefani) dissented, it would presumably change the rules to increase mayoral accountability, so probably a positive (if cynically political) change!

• (Items 14-33) A whole slew of "Memorandums of Understanding" with various unions, to implement a "Union Access to New Employees" program (Mayor's office). This could be inconsequential and benign, or it could be something that would greatly strengthen the power of government employee unions; hard to say from the descriptions

• (Items 34-36) Receiving and approving the annual reports of the "Community Benefit Districts" in the Yerba Buena Gardens, Union Square, and Castro areas. CBDs are mechanisms whereby the majority of merchants in an area vote to impose new taxes on themselves as well as on an unwilling minority, for purposes of street cleaning, security, and like services which the city government is failing to provide with the ample tax monies it already steals.

• (Item 39) Temporary suspension of business registration & fee requirements for taxi and rideshare drivers (Supervisor Peskin). Who knows what the reasoning behind this one is, but any break on registration and extortion requirements sounds like a good thing.

(Items 41-44) The Visitacion Valley Planning Alliance is seeking to block or delay a new development of five homes to replace an existing church building at 590 Leland Avenue by requiring them to submit to an environmental review under the CEQA law. Because they can!

========================================================

If you've never been inside SF City Hall, you should come just for the architecture. It's one of the most beautiful and impressive buildings in the city.

Sadly, and more relevantly from a libertarian perspective, it's also a place where a lot of harm is caused, and where our influence on the legislative process is desperately needed! Virtually every Board meeting has lots of opportunities for public comment – I believe the Supervisors are required to take public comment on any item that they debate or intend to vote on, and there's also time for general comments on any other matter under their jurisdiction but not on the agenda.

For each comment, you usually get up to two minutes. In addition to speaking, you can also bring printed material of size 8.5" x 11" or smaller to put on the overhead projector during your comments.

All the Board meetings, including all the public comments, are video-recorded and broadcast on Channel 26, also online at SFgovTV.org. Here's a clip of some public comments from the most recent Board meeting on Sept. 4, 2017, in which you can see yours truly take the Supervisors to task and suggest they respond directly on the record to questions from the public! (I'm the 5th speaker, at around 4:01:40):

http://sanfrancisco.granicus.com/MediaPlayer.php?view_id=10&clip_id=28658

Note the 2nd and 4th speakers use the overhead projector option; the 4th speaker spins a top on a map. :-) There are definitely some characters (check out the 7th speaker). Some people have used public comment time to sing, or do other performance art! You could probably even use your time to read a passage from a pro-freedom book, e.g. George Orwell's "1984", as long as you somehow relate it to city policy, e.g. "This is what the city government's policy of putting cameras on Muni buses reminds me of..."

Anyway, this Meetup, which will recur every Tuesday when the Board is in session, is your chance to be a minor TV star for a good cause! (I've actually had somebody come up to me on the street and say they recognized me from public comment at a Board meeting!) The Supervisors may or may not listen to you, but your libertarian views will be on the record, and numerous people both in the chambers, live on TV, and later online, will see you. (Note that you're not obliged to give your name or any other personal info unless you want to, and you don't even have to give any public comment unless you feel like it – being there for moral support of those who do, while educating yourself about local politics, is okay too. You could educate others too, by sitting there in the audience and liveblogging on Twitter or something!)

If you plan to come, text me at (415) 625-FREE so you can connect with any other Libertarians showing up that day. Depending what's on the agenda and how long the meeting goes, or how long we feel like staying – Board meetings can last only an hour or two, or up to 7 hours or more – we may go out for dinner or drinks afterward!

name: The Gold Standard: History, Theory, & Fallacy - Chris Silber, Economics Lecture
description:
The Gold Standard: History, Theory, and Fallacy
An Economics Lecture by Chris Silber

The gold standard has plenty of advocates and even more critics. But what exactly is the gold standard? Is it a singular monetary system or have multiple versions of the gold standard operated in different countries at different times throughout history?

What are the gold standard's virtues and what are the challenges and objections to returning to gold-based money?

Chris Silber's second and last monetary economics lecture of 2018 integrates a brief history of the gold standard with the theoretical concepts that govern its operation including the market-driven monetary base, gold's role in monetary aggregates, Gresham's Law, and inflation/deflation.

The talk will conclude with a list of fallacies and objections cited by enemies and even friends of gold against replacing today's dominant fiat monetary systems with a gold standard.

Chris Silber is a frequent attendee of GGLR and Free Exchange meetings and has previously presented on monetary history, business cycles, and the Great Depression.

**************

Our meetings are FREE and open to the public.

Our monthly meetings are on the 4th Monday of the month.
Meeting time has permanently changed to 7:30 pm, Doors open at 7:20 pm.

OVERTIME Social:

At about 9:40 - 10 pm a social gathering follows around the corner @:

Overtime Sports Bar & Restaurant
4134 Geary Blvd. (between 6th & 5th Ave.)
San Francisco, CA

Please join us for the social gathering and discussion.

May the Force of Freedom be with you . . . Always!

description:
On Saturdays we are hosting "Art in the Garden" - an active outdoor workspace for artists of all ages and levels.

Bring your easel, paints, pencils, or other projects and join us as we share the lovely outdoor setting to work on artworks. Work on individual projects, or join in group art and craft projects.

We will meet every Saturday from 12-4 in the garden. Look forward to meeting you!

Donations of art materials or a small cash donation to support the space are welcome but not required.

name: Sunday: Writing & Weeding
description:
Join us Sundays for Writing & Weeding!

Weed out your thoughts, or if you hit a writer's block, join us in the garden and pull some actual weeds!! Getting our hands in the dirt can sometimes inspire creative flow.

Theme is open. Poetry, prose, fiction, non-fiction. Bring your own project to work on, or use the suggested themes and writing prompts announced at each meeting. Writers are free to share from their writing or not, as they wish.

Introductions at 12:00.

12:10-1:00 open writing/weeding time

1:00-1:15 break, discussion, share writing if inspired

1:15-2:00 - writing/weeding session

2:00 - stay on if you wish to discuss, share, or continue writing

ALL ARE WELCOME!

Note, currently there is no power hooked up in the garden site, so if you are planning to write on your laptop, please bring fully charged.

There is no fee for the meetup.

Donations to support Hayes Valley Art Works are welcome (donation jar), but not required.

Help build these creative journals by incorporating quotes, sketches, images, words, and designs that are inspired by HAYES VALLEY ART WORKS.

name: ACTION SPEAKS -residential redevelopment mixer
description:
• What we'll do
Hi this is a meetup that explores all the ins and outs of residential redevelopment and all other real investment strategies. We get together every second Saturday of the month to keep up to date with the market. In this we will explore the entire bay area such as average price per square foot per area. We are constantly looking for properties at a list price that is 70% of the ARV. Wholesalers , private money, contractors, stagers, lawyers, CPA’s, investors and partners is the goal. This is a way to develop long lasting business relationships. In the future the topics that will be discussed will be about asset protection, tax saving, partnership set up such as llc’s, REIT’s, Condo conversion, TIC conversion, Permits, and the list goes on.

• What to bring
Business partners and colleagues are welcome

• Important to know
Investors, wholesalers, private loans, conventional loans, etc....

name: Morning Ride to Hawk Hill
description:
We'll be going on a short ride up to Hawk Hill and possibly the back route as well for more climbing!

The main climb is about 171m (564ft) and the back route would be an additional 120m (400ft).

Road conditions are good so any tires work well. We usually bring road or multipurpose bikes. The mornings can be sometimes foggy, wet and cold so bring light warm clothing - jackets can get a bit too hot though.

Be sure to bring:
- water
- some snacks
- sunglasses/cap
- warm clothing

Nice to haves are:
- lights

The route resembles this (depending on where you're arriving from): https://www.strava.com/local/us/san-francisco/cycling/routes/598

If you have any trouble finding us or on the ride itself please contact me at [masked].

name: The San Francisco Chamber of Commerce Job Forum
description:
Come join us and meet managers from well known companies such as Salesforce, Levi Strauss, Facebook, Intel, Visa, UCSF, and many more!

The Job Forum is a FREE community service aimed at helping people find jobs in the San Francisco Bay Area. We help you to be more successful in getting the job you want. The emphasis is on intelligently planning and conducting the job finding campaign. The Job Forum has local SF Bay Area managers who tell you the truth about a modern job search and brainstorm ways to help you succeed! We offer job search coaching, customized brainstorming and problem solving to jobseekers and career changers. We discuss each individual's job search questions one by one and offer helpful job search suggestions in an open forum. You get great ideas and can gain a lot from the ideas from others (if we do not have time to discuss your situation (due to numbers) you can go first the following week!

Typical Topics Include:

Resumes • Contacts • Interviews • Networking • Job Goals • Online Job Search • Career Changes • First Time Job Searches • Job Information Sources • Long Absences from the Labor Market • Long & Short-Term Career Objectives• Voluntary & Involuntary Terminations • Problems of the Disabled • Recent Graduates • Newcomers to the Community • Internet Job Search

name: Murder Mystery Pub & Grub Crawl. Drink, Dine & Solve Crime (EVERY SUNDAY)
Girls in Tech Presents: Unity Beginner Coding Bootcamp
description:
Tickets here: https://www.eventbrite.com/e/girls-in-tech-presents-unity-beginner-coding-bootcamp-tickets-50198476996

Unity is the creator of the world’s most widely used real-time 3D (RT3D) development platform, giving developers around the world the tools to create rich, interactive 2D, 3D, VR and AR experiences. Our 800+ person engineering team keeps Unity at the bleeding-edge of technology by working alongside partners such as Facebook, Google, Microsoft, and Oculus to ensure optimized support for the latest releases and platforms. Unity is one of the top emerging skills in the market.

This workshop will provide a basic introduction to Unity, and is for those new to Unity who are looking to get familiar with engine. The class starts with the must-know basics, building up to a some intermediate concepts of development. Food and beverage will be provided.

Required Materials: Laptop w/power supply and Unity installed (you may download Unity here: https://unity3d.com/get-unity/download)

* PLEASE HAVE UNITY INSTALLED PRIOR TO THE BOOTCAMP *

description:

Join Girls in Tech and Warby Parker for a speaker series and networking event in which some of the best and brightest female leaders in digitally native retail will share their unique stories about thriving in tech.

Hear from a panel of dynamic leaders in technology from top brands, including Warby Parker, Thirdlove, Atoms. Our panelists will engage in honest discussions about being a tech leader, success strategies for every phase of your career, and steering through challenges and unseen barriers on the way to the top.

Relax with some delicious hor d'oeuvres and drinks. 3 Warby Parker gift cards will be raffled throughout the night! This is also a great chance for you to enjoy after-hours shopping at Warby Parker located in Union Square -- store associates with be present, and you’ll be able to place your order.

name: 2019 AFL Grand Final San Francisco Official Beer Olympics Party & Sausage Sizzle
End of summer pool and hot tub party! [Mission Bay][Premium]
description:
Summer is almost over... Don't be sad, let's celebrate the last warm days with a pool party! Mark has graciously offered to host a party at his place in Mission Bay and we happily accepted. His complex comes with a heated pool AND a giant hot tub. Can you say hell yea?!

This will be a potluck party so everyone is expected to bring food and/or drinks to share. For food please bring a dish that can serve at least 10 people. Good examples are: a large pizza, a bucket of chicken, dumplings, sushi, fruit salad, etc. Please don't just bring chips and salsa, we always have too much. For drinks beer, wine, cider, champagne, etc are all good. Non-alcoholic drinks are also welcome!

In addition to the food and drinks we'll have music and games. We can play foosball or ping pong in the large community room. Mark can also set up Jackbox so we can play that hilarious game.

Sign up now because space is limited!

name: Intro to Beach Volleyball Clinic [Ocean Beach][Public]
description:
Learning how to play a new team sport can really suck sometimes. Fortunately, beach volleyball is super easy for almost anyone to pick up as long as you know the basics and a few key moves. And that's exactly what this free Intro to Beach Volleyball Clinic aims to accomplish. Attendees will learn the basic rules of beach volleyball and a few key techniques to start playing and having fun.

The clinic is designed for people with no prior experience or those who haven’t played in a while and need a refresher.

SF Beach Volleyball Meetup (https://www.meetup.com/San-Francisco-Beach-Volleyball/events/255239275/?_xtd=gqFyqTI2MTUxMTg4OaFwo3dlYg&from=ref) is a friendly social volleyball community. Players of all levels/skills are welcome. Games are fun and reasonably competitive but the group is not made up of serious hardcore players. If you are an absolute beginner, please bring an open mind to learn/improve your skills. Otherwise, bring a positive attitude and good sportsmanship!

Parking is free at the beach parking lot and it's usually easy to find parking right next to where we play.

Click Here to Follow Our Events Calendar (https://www.calendarx.com/calendarpage/cw71248)

Host: Brandon Upchurch

Registration Price
No Registration Fee
Anyone including non-members can register for this event

The Plan
11:00 AM: Meet at Ocean Beach on the section between Balboa and the Cliff house
11:15 AM: Let's Play!
1:00 PM: End of Event, Post-clinic hangout

What to Bring
Make sure you bring sunscreen, water, and a sweatshirt/jacket (in case if it gets windy/cold).

name: Pub Trivia at Blackthorn Tavern [Inner Sunset][Public]
description:
Blackthorn Tavern's Monday night trivia night was named one of San Francisco's 8 best trivia nights by Thrillist (https://www.thrillist.com/drink/san-francisco/sf-pub-quiz-trivia-night-bars).

Quizmaster Peter Malone asks 6 rounds of questions (which progressively gets more challenging) ranging from entertainment to sports to history to geography. He also includes a picture round and a "Name That Artist/Group" music round.

We usually get a decent sized team for this trivia. Beginners are welcome. You don't have to be good at trivia, you just need to have a good time!

Arrive early for a seat at the table because the bar gets crowded. Since we do pretty well at this trivia, we usually have drink tickets to buy free beer with!

Click Here to Follow Our Events Calendar: https://www.calendarx.com/calendarpage/cw71248
Host: Kimble Torres

Registration Price
Free to all members

The Plan
8:00 PM: Meet to save a table & socialize with the group
9:00 PM: Trivia begins!
11:00 PM: Event Ends

What to bring
Your dinner! Blackthorn allows you to bring outside food/snacks. So pick up your dinner at a nearby establishment and eat it here.

name: Tuesday Lunch at Rooster & Rice [Fidi][Members]
description:
Khao mun gai, a popular dish in Thailand, consists of poached chicken served over a bed of rice cooked in chicken broth and topped with a spicy fermented soybean sauce with ginger, chili and garlic. It's accompanied by sliced cucumber, cilantro, and a bowl of chicken broth for sipping.

While Rooster & Rice offers the classic version of the dish, it also has some variations, including a low-carb version with brown rice, a vegetarian version with tofu, and a paleo version with seasonal vegetables in place of the rice.

Check out the Menu, here (http://www.roosterandrice.com/menu.html).

It's time for Thai chicken and rice!

Click Here to Follow Our Events Calendar (https://www.calendarx.com/calendarpage/cw71248)

Host: Andy Huang

Registration Price
Free for all members

The Plan
12:00 PM: Meet at Rooster & Rice
12:15 PM: Eat a delicious lunch!

name: Murder Mystery Dinner: A Taste for Wine and Murder [Inner Sunset][Premium]
description:
Ever imagined being a part of a murder mystery game?! Now's your chance! Adulting doesn't have to always be so drab. Also...wine?! Yes, please!

The annual wine-tasting festival in California Wine Country is in full swing when the body of local vineyard owner, Barry Underwood, is found hidden beneath his wine cellar. Barry has been missing for six long years but with the discovery of his body comes a wealth of new clues to solve the mystery. It's a vintage murder and you may be a suspect.

Murder's on the menu, and everyone's a suspect in this game for eight players.

The suspects are: Otton Von Schnapps, Marilyn Merlot, Tiny Bubbles, Ralph Rottingrape, Papa Vito, and Hedy Shablee. Extra guests are Bonny Lass and Bud Wizer.

The characters and costume suggestions will be provided in advance of the event

When you RSVP, please let us know if you have any dietary restrictions. Andy will be preparing dinner! Wine will be provided.

Click Here to Follow Our Event Calendar: https://www.calendarx.com/calendarpage/cw71248
Host: Andy Huang

Registration Price
Premium Members: $25

The Plan
7:00pm: Intros & Character information review to get into character
7:30pm: During dinner we will go through the stages of the game and reveal character secrets, lying, deceiving and sleuthing our way to uncover the murderer.
9:00pm: After dinner/game - hang out and play more games or go to one of the local bars

What to bring
Please bring (or arrive in) costumes
An appetite for fun..and Andy's yummy food.

name: Sunset Sailing on The Bay [Pier 39][Members]
description:
We're going on a sunset sailing trip around the Bay. Yes, this time it's on a sail boat! This is one of the best ways to experience the bay and the beauty that San Francisco offers. Imagine watching the sunset over the SF city skyline with a glass of champagne in your hands. It doesn't get more romantic than that!

About the 2 hour tour:

Whether you are looking for romantic ambiance, or just a fun time with your friends, the Sunset Sail of the Bay is perfect for both. Avoid the crowds on larger boats with a maximum of 28 passengers per trip the San Francisco Sailing Company offers the unique experience of sailing under the Golden Gate Bridge aboard a private yacht.

Trips depart from Pier 39 in San Francisco's historic Fisherman's Wharf district. Highlights of this 2 hour cruise include:

- Experience the beauty of the San Francisco Bay at Sunset - there is nothing like it!
- Sail under the Golden Gate Bridge Sail past Alcatraz Island
- Sail up close the Oakland Bay Bridge
- Panoramic views of the entire SF City Front, Angel Island, Tiburon, Sausalito, and Belvedere
- Your 2 drinks include: Beer, Wine, Soda or Water
- The friendliest and most experienced captains and crew!
- And much more!

The crew is available to answer any of your questions, serve you drinks, take photos and they'll even play the music you want. Don't miss out on the beauty and peacefulness of the San Francisco Bay.
What Is Not Included? Gratuities for your Captain & First Mate, although not required, are always appreciated! While drinks are included, food is not. If you wish to eat while on the cruise, please bring snacks along. We do require you to have 1 hand free at all times, so we suggest bringing finger foods.

Host: Andy Huang

Registration price:
Premium members: Free
Free members: $10

You must also buy the Groupon here to join the sunset sail: https://www.groupon.com/deals/the-san-francisco-sailing-company-6?r_attr=70ee25fd-bda7-409a-9e50-3b59edf0dd90

The Plan:
04:00 PM: Meet at Pier 39 Dock F for intros
04:15 PM: Meet the captain and the crew
04:30 PM: Depart for the sunset sail!
06:30 PM: Epic sunset over SF
07:00 PM: Post sailing hang out

name: SpookFest Film Fest 2018 [Mission][Members][$13]
description:
Something wicked, this way comes. Buckle your seat belts for the fright of your life with the return of SpookFest to the Roxie Theater. This annual event bringing together fear-fans showcases 13 new, independent short films about the "monsters among us". They're everywherrrreeeee! (video link: https://vimeo.com/279866412)

This year, Roxie Theater transforms into a full-on haunted house, kicking off each screening with a costume contest, and concluding with the audience-voted OSCARE Awards, presented by their ghoulish hosts. It’s one hell of a monster mash!

Come out for a night of fun and a chance to catch some new horror greats!

name: Fine Wine Tasting Happy Hour at Press Club [Soma][Members]
description:
Press Club (http://pressclubsf.com) is one of the most beautiful bars in San Francisco. It is a great place to enjoy some of the finest wines from around the world.

"As you walk down the stairs into this expansive underground wine mecca in SoMa, you’ll feel like you’re entering a secret society of cool where a staff of real pros caters to trendy patrons perched on comfy couches amid a stylish, modern setting; yes, the outrageous tabs will pack a wallop, but you can sample wonderfully presented appetizers and generous pours of vinos that are hard to find elsewhere, many from lesser-known California producers." - Zagat (https://www.zagat.com/r/press-club-san-francisco)

Their wine list (http://pressclubsf.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/07/Press-Club-Wine-List-102017.pdf) is 19 pages long! Let's be fancy and enjoy some wine!

name: Crabbing Under the Golden Gate Bridge [Members]
description:
Alex Goffo is a chef and an avid outdoorsmen who's true passion is crabbing. He developed The Art of Crabbing because he thinks too many people have a disconnect between their food and where it comes from. The Art of Crabbing program started out as an AirBnB Experiences offering, but after gaining so much demand and rave reviews, Alex was able to expand it to include solo and private group offerings and full time! What a life! Come see what all the buzz if about and enjoy a day out by the water with Alex and his merry band of fishing rods.

Crabbing is a respectful sport so we aim to catch only what we can eat.

Check out this first-timer catching a Dungeness crab! This could be you... https://youtu.be/N-NNFX8UgdA

Click Here to Follow Our Event Calendar: https://www.calendarx.com/calendarpage/cw71248
Host: Alex Goffo

Registration Price
Premium Members: $40 (regular $45)
Free Members: $50

The Plan

5:30 PM: Head to the Torpedo Wharf Pier to begin Crabbing!
8:00 PM: Event Ends

What to Bring
Weather-appropriate attire
Comfortable shoes - you must be able to stand for at least 3 hours (or you can bring a portable chair if you'd like too!)
Water, Beer/wine (cans only), Snacks
Sunblock
A positive mindset
An understanding that you will be learning a skill not catching your family dinner!
Buckets or coolers if you plan to keep any Rock crab that you may catch

What Will be Provided
Fishing gear
Rods/reels, Snares for crab, bait, knives, crab pot, measuring gauges, buckets, bags, strong neon line, weights

name: Hotpot Karaoke: All You Can Eat, Dri­nk, and Karaoke! [Inner Richmond][Members]
description:
Look at that delicious spread. This is not a test. This is the real deal. You could be enjoying this with us! This event also comes with unlimited beer to serve as karaoke liquid courage - because your shower songs deserve to be heard. You're basically Beyonce.

Food, drinks, karaoke - Sign us up!

Hot pot refers to several East Asian varieties of stew, consisting of a simmering metal pot of stock at the center of the dining table.

While the hot pot is kept simmering, ingredients are placed into the pot and are cooked at the table. Typical hot pot dishes include thinly sliced meat, leaf vegetables, mushrooms, tofu, egg dumplings, and seafood. The cooked food is usually eaten with a dipping sauce. In many areas, hot pot meals are often eaten in the winter during supper time.

Grand Hotpot Lounge (http://www.hotpotsf.com) in the Richmond has an all-you-can-eat and drink hotpot deal for $28. The deal also comes with unlimited beer, wine, and sake, our own private room, and unlimited karaoke! This may be the best deal in all of San Francisco.

Don't miss out!

Click Here to Follow Our Event Calendar: https://www.calendarx.com/calendarpage/cw71248

name: Sunday Movie Screening: IMDB Top 250 movies [Inner Sunset][Members]
description:
End your week in the most relaxing way - Movie binging with friends!! No, you don't have to be alone with your Netflix. You're a social butterfly and you know it!

There are so many great movies out there that we should watch. Here is IMDB's list of their top 250 movies of all time and they're all amazing (https://www.imdb.com/chart/top). This is the event where we go through that list one movie at a time.

We do not decide on the movies ahead of time. Each attendee can offer 2 choices of movies to watch. Once we're all together, we can pick 2 movies from the combined movie list. Here are a couple of examples of movies we can watch:

One Flew Over the Cuckoo's Nest (1975) - https://youtu.be/2WSyJgydTsA
The Usual Suspects (1995) - https://youtu.be/oiXdPolca5w

name: Afterwork Hike with Drinks [Castro][Members]
description:
Had to deal with a annoying customers all day? Is your cubicle crushing your vibes? Vitamin D is just the trick for that! Let's go for a hike after work, and then enjoy some drinks in the Haight.

We will start off in the Castro at Twin Peaks Tavern (http://www.twinpeakstavern.com). From there we will climb the hill to Corona Heights Park (http://sfrecpark.org/destination/corona-heights-park/) for an epic panoramic view of San Francisco. Then we'll continue climbing all the way to the top of Buena Vista Park (http://sfrecpark.org/destination/buena-vista-park/) where we can catch a glimpse of the Golden Gate Bridge. Finally we'll descend down into the Haight and grab a bite to eat and then a classic martini at Zam Zam (https://www.zagat.com/r/zam-zam-san-francisco)!

Click Here to Follow Our Event Calendar: https://www.calendarx.com/calendarpage/cw71248

name: Philosophy Night: What is Self? Can it Change? [TBD][Members]
description:
What is Philosophy Night?: Middle Circle's (http://www.middlecircle.org/calendar/philoaug18-g7c2n-d8bps) monthly philosophy night creates a place for friends or strangers to dig into the topics that mean the most in our lives. Each gathering is hosted and facilitated by Middle Circle community members and centers on an age-old philosophical question. What If I Haven't Studied Philosophy? You don't need to be well versed in philosophy to participate. Philosophy literally means love of wisdom. All that's needed is an interest in having a great conversation about a meaningful topic with good company.

name: Pub Trivia at Blackthorn Tavern [Inner Sunset][Members]
description:
Blackthorn Tavern's Monday night trivia night was named one of San Francisco's 8 best trivia nights by Thrillist (https://www.thrillist.com/drink/san-francisco/sf-pub-quiz-trivia-night-bars).

Quizmaster Peter Malone asks 6 rounds of questions (which progressively gets more challenging) ranging from entertainment to sports to history to geography. He also includes a picture round and a "Name That Artist/Group" music round.

We usually get a decent sized team for this trivia. Beginners are welcome. You don't have to be good at trivia, you just need to have a good time!

Arrive early for a seat at the table because the bar gets crowded. Since we do pretty well at this trivia, we usually have drink tickets to buy free beer with!

name: Best Steaks in The City at House of Prime Rib [Nob Hill][Premium]
description:
The House of Prime Rib (http://houseofprimerib.net/#home) prides themselves in serving tender, mouthwatering cuts of beef that are selected from the top 2% of the market selection. Their prime rib was even featured on Food Network's "Best Thing I Ever Ate". We'd say that's a pretty good reason to give it a try!

"The original House of Prime Rib opened in 1949 and has since become a San Francisco institution known unsurprisingly for its 21-day aged prime rib. Every dinner order comes with a bevy of accompaniments: tossed salad, mashed potatoes or a baked potato, and Yorkshire pudding. The English-style dining rooms have fireplaces and cozy leather banquettes, making this space as intimate as it is iconic." - Thrillist (https://www.thrillist.com/venue/eat/san-francisco/restaurants/house-of-prime-rib-3477968)

name: Speakeasy Cocktails at Bourbon & Branch [Tenderloin][Premium]
description:
Unlike many other themed venues that specialize in cocktails, Bourbon & Branch (http://www.bourbonandbranch.com) did not need to build up a kitschy platform to meet its speakeasy theme. This place was ACTUALLY a speakeasy during the prohibition era [masked]) complete with five secret passageways.

The term "speakeasy" comes from a patron's manner of ordering alcohol without raising suspicion - a bartender would tell a patron to be quiet and 'speak easy'.

Although the prohibition era is long behind us (thank goodness), Bourbon & Branch keeps up with the style and has a simple set of house rules (http://www.bourbonandbranch.com/?caseid=rules) to make sure guests feel easily transported to the sultry time period.

Join us as we step back in time and enjoy some hand-crafted cocktails.

description:

The iconic and tasteful decor add a delicate appeal to this happy hour feast for the senses. Local Edition was even listed as one of the 24 Most Unique Bars in America (http://sarahscoop.com/24-unique-bars-america/). "Expect period favorites like gimlets and highballs, created with quality spirits and syrups made in-house." - Serious Eats (https://drinks.seriouseats.com/2012/04/first-look-local-edition-cocktails-from-bourbon-branch-rickhouse-san-francisco-new-bar-live-music.html)

To set that mood, interiors boast a neon-lit, night market atmosphere with frozen drinks, string lights and a centerpiece wheatpaste by Seattle artist Cheyenne Randall. name: Urban Hike: Mt Sutro, Tank Hill, Twin Peaks, & Kite Hill [Inner Sunset][Members]
description:
This urban hike combines several parks in San Francisco that are often overlooked. However, they each have their own unique views and are worth seeing.

We start off at the Garden for the Environment in the Inner Sunset, which is a community garden specializing in education on urban gardening. You can explore the garden while we wait.

Next we will climb into the Mt. Sutro Open Space Preserve and explore the Mount Sutro Cloud Forest. There we will "escape" the city and walk through the dense forests. It's a good place to appreciate the nature that's available in San Francisco.

We then reach Tank Hill park where we'll get gorgeous views of SF.

Next we begin the climb up to Twin Peaks, where we can get a panoramic view of the Bay Area.

From here we'll descend down to Kite Hill Park, a popular spot for flying kites because of the high winds. Bring a kite if you have one!

Lastly we'll go to the Seward street slides and have some fun!

We'll finish off the hike with some food or drinks in the Castro. After this urban hike, you definitely have earned it!

Click Here to Follow Our Events Calendar (https://www.calendarx.com/calendarpage/cw71248)

Host: Andy Huang

Registration Price
Premium members: $5
Free members: $15

The Plan
11:00 AM: Meet at Garden for the Environment
11:15 AM: Depart for the hike
2:30 PM: Reach Twin Peaks
3:00 PM: Post hike food in the Castro

What to bring
This is a relatively easy hike but there will be steep sections requiring shoes with good traction.

Hiking shoes/boots
Water, snacks
Layers in case it gets windy and chilly
Hat, sunblock, sunglasses
A kite

San Jose-Monday: Deeksha Evening
description:
Silicon Valley Oneness

Oneness Blessings and get together. 

Every Monday at 7–8:30 PM

The sanctuary, Community of Infinite Spirit
1540 Hicks Ave., San Jose, 95125

Free. Love offerings are welcome to help pay for rent. 

We have Q&A, meditation, Deeksha, and then sharing. 

Oneness Blessings are for Awakening Permanently into who we really are as spiritual beings. It also helps us discover and experience our own personal relationship with the Divine. These blessings, also known as Deeksha, can also facilitate finding our path, and any kind of healing or intention.
Come and connect with your Higher Power!

Oneness Blessings are a phenomenon of Divine transmissions. It is not affiliated with any religion but is inclusive to all and excludes no one person or tradition. The blessings flow Grace that initiate the process of moving our attention from the daydreaming mind to the compassionate heart, and towards awareness of the present moment and senses.

Deeksha is the way the Divine transforms our neuro-biology and is the active ingredient of the Oneness Process of Awakening to feeling more and more Loved.  These sessions are cumulative and a life long process. Giving Deeksha puts us in the flow of the transforming energy just the same as receiving Deeksha.  However we must either receive or give Deeksha in order to benefit from it. 

Namaste…

name: Hayward Oneness Blessing (Deeksha)
description:
Deeksha is an energy transfer that brings about growth in consciousness.  As consciousness rises, there is greater awareness, joy, love, togetherness, and focus in everything that you do and experience. 

The Deeksha neither requires practicing a particular way of living nor following a new path, and does not bind one to any philosophy or ideology.  It transcends religious and cultural barriers in the fact that it only awakens individuals to their own spiritual tradition, which is done by facilitating a neurobiological shift. Thus, making religion a matter of personal choice and convenience.  Therefore, people belonging to any faith or age group can comfortably receive the Deeksha.Deeksha is given by laying hands on the recipient’s head, or sometimes through intent.  In this case, the giver holds the receiver in his or her awareness for a few minutes and allows the Deeksha to flow.  In this way, the Deeksha can be given at a distance of thousands of miles or to a large group of people all at the same time. Deeksha unfolds differently in every individual as it depends on what the recipient may need most.

One can experience greater effects by receiving Deeksha often, with common benefits including but not limited to:

* Awakens creative potentials, abilities and intelligence.

*Increases ability to learn.

*Resolves inner conflict leading to inner peace and harmony.

*Brings love to relationships.

*Heals emotional hurts and reduces thought burden.

*Evokes affection, friendship and a sense of connectedness with the other.

*Awakens compassion.

* Infuses vitality Heals the body by healing the mind.

* Relaxes the body and relieves stress.

*Helps build love and appreciation for the body.

*Invokes auspicious energies Removes blocks that hinder success.

*Makes possible a mental frame for abundance.

*Initiates a journey into experiencing unconditional love and joy.

*Initiates a journey into Awakening and God Realisation

venue.name: Home of Nalini Singh-Hart - Hayward Oneness Blessing (Deeksha)

name: Lake Merritt Oneness Blessing Meditation at Residence
description:
The purpose of Lake Merritt Oneness is to support the awakening of humanity. Generally, after introductions, we engage in a meditative or non-physical yogic practice.  Then we share the Oneness Blessing aka Deeksha.  The Oneness Blessing is a transmission of Divine energy that opens the heart and quiets the mind.  The Blessing activates the kundalini energy in the body and accelerates one's awakening into unity consciousness or oneness consciousness.  This is a nondenominational gathering.  All are welcome.

The group is open and inviting.  Oneness is not a religion or a path.  It offers a set of universal teachings and tools that help one have a direct experience of the Divine.

There is no fee, however, donations are accepted to help defray expenses.

 

The group is facilitated by Gwendolyn Mitchell and Kathryn Pielage.

Join the 2nd unofficial Halloween-themed strategy board game meetup, co-hosted by Alice & Liz! Feel free to come in costume (where you can still sit comfortably and play.)

We will have 1 table of "Betrayal at House on the Hill". (https://boardgamegeek.com/boardgame/10547/betrayal-house-hill).

Depending on the number on the waitlist, I might be able to get another table going for a 2nd set of gamers. (Other Euro-style strategy games are welcomed.)

Some treats available, additional are always welcome. No tricks unless you're trying to get the most victory points!
==========
Other Host Info:
* ADDRESS: I will send my address out ~1-2 days before the event; This gives people who RSVP'd YES to change their minds and let wait-listers get on.

* NO-SHOW POLICY: If you no-show or cancel your RSVP last minute 3 times in a row you will be removed and banned from the group. If you have regular no-shows and cancellations, you will receive a warning with possible removal of the group to follow.

The host takes time to prepare & select games for the number of attendees. Your cancellation can impact what game options one can play, and preparation time.

If you are sick, 1 no-show will NOT get you banned because life happens, hence why the cap is at 3.

* KEEP RSVP ACCURATE: If your plans change, please be considerate and update your status. RSVPs will end 5 days before to give waitlisters some advance notice.

• Shoes-off residence

• Light snacks will be provided but please feel free to bring something to share too.

• My place has had dogs in it as well as cat owners, though I do not own any pets

• IMPORTANT!!! If you've read this far and want to join - make sure your Meetup settings allow you to receive email notifications! Otherwise you'll be scrambling beforehand to figure out where my place is.

• Location is in Lower Pacific Heights in SF. Close to bus lines (1, 2, 3, 22, 24, 38). Parking is hit or miss depending on nearby Japantown & church events.

name: Life and Relationship Coaching Workshop
description:
• What we'll do
A New Year a New Journey,

A chance to gather to come together to debrief our journey's and life path's and finding a unique common bond that joins us together. Life coaching is a process of motivating our energy levels to raise our consciousness and find a strength to move past negative energy and increase our own awareness towards purpose and identity.

http://www.davidbussiere.com

We will explore a number of topics:

-Identity

-Sexuality

-Life Purpose

-Mental Health

-Relationships: Intimate, familiar, friends

-Career

-Mentoring

-Judgement

-Energy Blocks

-Success

and many more

The session will help gay men tap into their higher purpose and find connections with their primary relationship: the one they have with themselves. A goal for the session is to find a direction, purpose, and goal for everyone to focus their anabolic energy on. Anyone suffering from depression or anxiety should attend as we will be focusing our energy on engaging the ego that moves someone through depressive episodes.

As your coach, you can find information about my coaching style, methods and background at http://www.davidbussiere.com

We will be having deep, meaningful conversations that will tackle very personal issues. We need to be receptive, respectful, and compassionate to everyone participating in the workshop.

• What to bring

• Important to know
Life empowerment, actualization and connection to the future you have wished for.

name: Play some poker!
description:
Join this 9-person, no-limit Texas Holdem cash game ideally suited for casual players looking to meet new people and play a friendly poker game. I host in my apartment in Potrero once per month on Sunday evenings from 7:30-10:30PM. Note that this is a cash game, not tournament-style playing. House rules are listed below. RSVP's will open 2 weeks prior to game night. Please sign up only if you are absolutely positive that you will attend. Should a conflict arise, please contact the organizer immediately. Because I am limited to the number of members in the group, I will remove members who are not reliable with their attendance.

House Rules
-Arrive around 7:20-25PM to say hi and buy in
-Game starts promptly at 7:30PM
-$20 Buy-in
-25/50 cent blinds
-Minimum bet is 50 cents (1 big blind)
-Raise amount must be at least equal to previous bet or raise in the same round
-No limit on number of raises allowed
-Blinds and bet limits do not increase throughout the evening
-Re-buys (3 MAX) ONLY if/when you loose all the chips in front of you
-No rake or fee
-Game ends at 10:30PM, which is when all players cash out
-Unacceptable to cash out of game early
-No cell phone use at table
-BYOB and/or snacks
-2 Cats in-home (bring a Benadryl if your are allergic)

Address and instructions will be emailed to players.

name: Pretty In Pink-A Bollywood Ladies Night Dinner & Dance Fundraiser!
description:
Pretty In Pink-A Bollywood Ladies Night Benefiting Project Nanhi Kali-Saving The Girl Child!

Happy Navratri Ladies!!! This Navratri, let us make a pledge to help as many little girls as we can <3 Education is one thing that moves mountains and sends people to the moon and does so many wonderful things

In honor of all the little Durgas who need our help in this world For the next 2 days (Until Oct 12th) use discount code "Navratri" at http://www.Hungamacity.com/Prettyinpink for $5 off each dinner ticket

A little about this event. I have personally seen many ladies who just were not educated because they were girls and all they were thought to be was marriage material so all their lives they were trained to be the perfect housewife and not the perfect asset to society. These poor ladies went through years of mental abuse, physical abuse, so much hardship and they could not get out only because they were not educated enough to be able to find a job to have the courage to leave on their own. My mission since the time I witnessed such situations is to help as many as I can and that starts with children. Little girls who are educated grow to be strong confident ladies who can support themselves. They do not have to tolerate abuse they do not have to tolerate attacks and they have what it takes to make this world such an amazing place. Educating a boy brings 1 more person educated but educating a girl educates a whole family.

We hope to see you all there to support this wonderful cause and event <3 Thank you from all of the sweet Nanhi Kali's you will be supporting
* Fashion-Featuring the highlight of the evening

* Once again, bigger venue, bigger dance floor, upscale decor with a full bar

* Dance till you drop-Bay Area's Top DJ's in the mix spinning the latest in Bollywood, Int'l & Classic Oldies to have you on your feet all night!

* Talent- Bay Area's Top Singers for an entertaining dinner show

* Entertainment-Dance Shows**: Bollywood and Bellydance Performances by some of the best performers in the Bay ft MoreUPbeat Dance Fusion Group and Radhika Tilak

So come on ladies, grab your closest girlfriends and make it an unforgettable evening you will cherish for a lifetime. Here is a little of what we have in store for you
********************************************************************
Pretty In Pink-A Bollywood Ladies Night & Fundraiser

Ticket Link: http://www.Hungamacity.com/prettyinpink

$45 Online Ticket Price Includes Dinner!
Golden Peacock Banquet Hall-24989 Santa Clara St, Hayward, CA

* Elegance-Decor By - Orange Petals

* Suggested Dress Code: Western or Indian Attire. Suggested Color Theme: Pink or Black

********************************************************************
21+ w/valid ID; Ladies Only

Online Ticket Sales Strongly Encouraged. Tickets may not be available at the door
******************************************************************
Sponsorship, performance opportunities or Questions Contact Shanna[masked] or [masked]

We are proud to announce that this ladies night we will be benefiting Project NanhiKali . Here is a little about Nanhikali.org

Project Nanhi Kali is jointly managed by theK C Mahindra Education Trust (KCMET) and the Naandi Foundation. We strongly believe that empowering girls with education will positively impact their families, communities and benefit India in the long term. With support from individual and corporate partners like you, Since 1996, Project Nanhi Kali has educated over 2,50,000 underprivileged girl children from poor urban, remote rural and tribal communities across the country. Our goal is to put #milliongirlsinschool.

name: Women's Monthly Range Practice
description:
Women-only monthly simulated indoor golf event every 2nd Wednesday of the month at Eagle Indoor golf. Female golfers are invited to join other women for some indoor fun out of the fog/wind/rain! This is a great way for females of all skill levels to mingle and connect. Beginners are welcome! No clubs necessary (rent for free). Come by, anytime, during the two hours to say "Hi!".

Price: $15 per female Golfer for two hours
Bring your own clubs or rent for free.

PARKING & LOCATION

BART and MUNI are 3.5 blocks away at Market Street (Powell station). To come from south bay, take caltrain to King Station and transfer to the T or N line to downtown and get off at the Powell station. There is typical SF metered street parking in the area ($3.75/hr before 6pm, free after 6pm). The Mascone Center Garage is 1.5 blocks away at 255 3rd St, San Francisco, CA 94103. $2/hour from 3-6pm, and $1/hour after 6pm.

Address: 840 Folsom, San Francisco, CA 94105

Light snacks will be provided.

ABOUT EAGLE CLUB INDOOR GOLF

Eagle indoor has simulated bays where golfers can practice at a virtual range or play 18, with launch monitors so golfers can see their ball flight on a large computer screen. It's as if the ball had flown out onto the range! For those wanting to play a full 18, there is a mode that gives golfers the option to play 18 at top courses (simulated) around the world. In this mode, you will choose different clubs for different shots as make your way down the fairway as if you were really there.

name: Fundamentals of Estate and Asset Protection & Invest in real estate with SD-IRA
description:
Fundamentals of Estate and Asset Protection & Invest in real estate with SD-IRA

Moguls,

Took a little time off to do have a vacation and do some traveling but now it is back to having some great events and meet some wonderful real estate investors, professionals and service providers. I am thrilled to have two great presenters who are going to share a wealth of knowledge that is relevant, useful and possibly very timely for all real estate investors. Attorney James O’Neil and Bill Neville of The Entrust Group (one of the most popular presenters) are going to be sharing a wealth of information with us. I hope that you will block out some time on your calendar to be with us. Free dinner will be provided to all.

Title: The Fundamentals of Estate and Asset Protection Planning for Real Estate Investors.

About James O’Neil: James O’Neil is a partner in O’Neil & Rueppel, LLP, a law firm that focuses on estate planning, administration, and litigation. The scope of his practice allows him to see how proper planning and risk management is crucial to protecting his clients’ assets so that they are available for the clients during their lives and are smoothly transitioned to the proper beneficiaries thereafter. James earned his B. A. from Oberlin College and his J.D. from the University of San Francisco School of Law in 2009.

Presentation topic: James will examine the estate planning tools and techniques available to real estate investors for structuring their assets and estates so that they are sheltered from the risks presented by the investor’s incapacity, exposure to community property liability from a spouse’s creditors, third party tort and contract claims, and related federal and state government issues.
Title: What you need to know to invest in real estate with a self-directed IRA
Description: When it comes to self-directed IRAs and specifically investing in real estate, people have a great deal of questions. Bill Neville, Business Development Manager at The Entrust Group, will walk you through the top 10 questions investors ask about investing in real estate with a self-directed IRA. After this presentation, you’ll understand:
• What is a self-directed IRA and how investors utilize this strategy
• Important rules to comply with IRS regulations
• The process of investing in real estate with a self-directed IRA
Networking, Deal Making, Have’s and Want’s
As always, we will have great networking and deal making. This is where members find capital, deals, partners, education and so much more.

SAN FRANICISCO EVENT

Where: NY Life, 425 Market St, 9th Floor, SF

Bobby

name: Electric blue and bright white of a winter snowshoe at Crater Lake
description:
DATE COULD CHANGE DEPENDING ON CONDITIONS.

SOME WILL OVERNIGHT AT KLAMATH FALLS, ABOUT AN HOUR FROM CRATER LAKE NATIONAL PARK AND MEET THE GROUP AT THE PARK ABOUT 9AM JAN. 20.

With its electric blue water heavily coated on its rim with pure white snow, Crater Lake National Park is a true winter fantasyland.

On one chilly winter day, with sun lighting the set, the scene was so electric that all other things seemed to stop. We were there early enough -- 9am -- that only a few vehicles were in the parking lot. And we were quickly on the snow, shoeing away from the lodge.

While we enjoyed the magnificent scene, hoards of visitors began showing up slipping and sliding in the parking lot entry to the snowfield, and the parking lot was just about filled.

Access was easy: The roads were plowed and the main lodge and facilities were open. Read that, restrooms, snacks, warmth, etc. Unless there are blizzard conditions, the roads seem to get lots of attention from the plow operators.

In addition to the sight-seers, we found other snowshoers, x-country skiers and winter backpackers. Everyone had a smile, even me stumbling along!

We were at the Rim and snowshoeing well before the crowds arrived. We were on snow until early afternoon and were back home before dark. The trip one-way is just over 3 hours from Redding via the Five, 97 and OR 62 west. It's another 20 minutes or so to get to the Rim visitor's center.

While some will go the night before and overnight, I do this as a day trip. We'll head out of Redding while it's still dark, breakfast big time at Black Bear Diner in KFalls about 7:30am and then hit the Park about 9:15. Be dressed for winter and in layers. Have snowshoes or x-country skis, a daypack, water, snacks, sunscreen, sun glasses, layers of clothing and what you’d wear a on winter day outside in the mountains. An option is to overnight near the park. The closest accommodations are in Klamath Falls which is about and 75 minutes from the Park. Medford is an option but it's a good 45 minutes longer.

We’ll meet at 4:45am and leave at 5 am and it’s easier and more efficient to carpool. Park passes or a daily fee of $15 I think gets you into the park. I have a pass and others may as well.

Due to the size of the group, your carpool will become your own smaller contingent. You'll be able to plan your adventure when we get to the park, including your carpool's return time, etc., so keep in touch with each other. For those meeting us along the way, use the timeline above to meet up with us if you wish. My cell is[masked]. I expect cell service to be spotty at the Park but OK along the route at least to the turnoff from Hwy 97.

Fingers x’d for sun which appears about 50% of the time either a part day or full day. Weather will postpone.

Dress in layers and bring one more layer than you think you'll need. Bring extra socks. You'll also want sunglasses, personal comfort items and a lunch. Hot cocoa, tea or coffee can warm you up.

I'll update with conditions in January 2019.

name: Memorial Day Weekend trek on the PCT from Deadfall Lake to Castle Crags
description:
This is a 30-mile, 3-day, 2-night Memorial Day trek on the Pacific Crest Trail from Deadfall Lakes west of Weed along the Trinity Divide to iconic, granite spired Castle Crags.

The trip is one-way and it's possible we'll be able to do this without a shuttle. See below.

This was a trip I wanted to do earlier this year but fires caused me to cancel.

My plan is to start on the PCT at Deadfall Lakes and get to Toad or Porcupine lakes on Day 1. If the legs are still springy and it feels right, I'd try for Seven Lakes basin about 13 miles from our start. By comparison it's 8 miles to Porcupine Lake.

On Day 2 I'd work on getting close to Castle Lake but not necessarily to Castle Lake since it's over a ridge and a more than a mile down. I stashed nearly 12 liters of water there on this leg with seasonal water availability.

On Day 3, I exit on Dog Trail, west of Castle Crags State Park.

When I planned this trek earlier I arranged a simultaneous day hike to Deadfall Lakes and Mt. Eddy. I took advantage of hikers from our group to transport backpackers from stowed vehicles at Castle Crags so the 3 day trek would not end in one of those rotten shuttles. I may try again but right now I'll just keep this simple.

You'll need food and fuel for 3 days, layers for 2 cool nights and some mornings and of course the compliment of backpacking gear.

This is a longish trip from the Bay Area. You could meet up at/near Castle Crags State Park where there is plenty of camping. This is where I hope to have a shuttle to the start at Deadfall, leaving vehicles for us at the exit.

name: Make-a-thon: Come Work On Your Project!
description:
Join us to work on your project. Open to all projects types- software, video, graphic design, 3D animation, etc. Partnering with others is welcome.

Look for the small blue sign on the table that says MAKE. We're at the Muddy's on Valencia/24th. It's cash only. If there's a waitlist just show up. See you then!

name: Meet the Doulas of the SFDG
description:
This is a great opportunity to ask questions of local Doulas and postpartum Doulas and meet them face to face. If you are considering having the support of a labor assistant before and during your birth or if you are interested in the help a postpartum Doula can provide after the baby has arrived, don't miss this event presented by the San Francisco Doula Group! 

This meetup happens the second Saturday of every month starting at 2:00 and ending at 4:00pm

2:00pm to 3:00pm: General Doula information and introduction to local Doulas 3:00pm to 4:00pm: Open House and opportunity to socialize and network with Doulas and other expectant parents.

name: Get the 411 on Home Births
description:
The second Saturday of every month, you'll find BAHC midwives hosting a free informational session about homebirth and midwifery care. The presentation covers what it's like to work with a midwife for prenatal, birth and postpartum care. You'll discuss many aspects of their care, get answers to lots of questions, and see a short video of a home waterbirth in Sausalito. All are welcome to join.

The 2nd Saturday of every month from 4:00-6:00pm

name: Play with your little one & make new friends
description:
• What we'll do - Hang with other parents and their little ones for free play time and conversation. Make friends, talk about what's up for you in your parenting, and sit and relax in the company of other local families. This group is free, self-moderated, and open to all ages.

• What to bring - Your little one!

• Important to know - Sign up here! https://www.naturalresources-sf.com/products/natural-resources-play-group Or just drop-in

name: Monthly Pregnant Mamas Meetup @ Natural Resources
description:
First, second, third.... time moms welcome! New to the city? New to the Mission? Just want to be surrounded by bellies?

Come to our FREE monthly Pregnant Moms Meetup. Meet other moms, share your story & get advice & tips from a doula, educator & mom.

Every second Monday.

Donations Gratefully Accepted benefiting the Natural Resources All Families Foundation

name: Silicon Valley Crawl #12
description:
Are you ready to take flight and discover Silicon Valley? Join us for a day of exploration and adventure. We'll be trekking the streets of SF in search of knowledge, excitement, and inspiration. The idea is to take the day and make the most of it. Truly a Carpe Diem kind of thing.

Kicking off with a breakfast, we'll dive right into meaningful conversations, planning the day ahead and gathering strength to endure the adventure that awaits. From then on you can expect visits to established and new players in the Valley, a workshop about some new concepts, to get into the mindset, and of course, some great food along the way. Impossible burger anyone?

This is a day of fun, insights, fresh thinking. If you're looking to immerse yourself in the culture of Silicon Valley, look no further.

This is the full program for the day:

08:30 Kick-off Breakfast/Intro to the culture of the Silicon Valley
10:00 Visit Autodesk and the amazing applications of a gamechanger in the Silicon Valley
11:30 Learn about the future of retail at B8ta
01:00 Walk through Stanford Campus
02:00 Apple Park in Cupertino: A State of The Art Showcase of a company presentation
02:30 Have the worldfamous IMPOSSIBLE BURGER (meatless meat) for lunch
02:30 Visit Amazon and understand why they have opened a "real" bookshop.
03:00 Visit the Tesla Flagship Store and take a seat in Model S, 3 & X
04:00 A walk through googleplex and hear some interesting facts about this giant
05:00 Foto Opt @facebook Headquarter
~06:00 End of Program, back in SF, drop off Union Square

All this, embedded in an 10hrs talk about the Silicon Valley Mindset and the difference between Linear- and Exponential Organisations.
You can call it the entry drug to our full feature programs...

Find more info and register here: http://www.siliconvalleyinspirationtours.com/onedaytour

Looking forward to meeting you in person.

description: No need

name: Ashtanga Vinyasa Yoga with Franceasca
description: Intermediate Ashtanga Vinyasa based off It's Yoga "Rocket Series." Upbeat music to go with it. Bring a smile, breath and get ready to Ashtanga

name: Begginner's Iyengar Yoga with Sharon
breathing Ecstasy: Tantric and Taoist (MCO-meditation etc)  Breathwork
description:
In this one hr fifteen min. of class ALONG WITH Various Breathing practices, movements

we will cultivate awareness and slowing down to enter subtler aspect of our body to cultivate Ecstasy with conscious breathing and guided visualization and relaxation!

8.15pm-9.30pm

Donation $10-$20

This meet up will meet once a week and occasionally in weekend to practice, to awaken and evolve in our capacity to feel good in our body, mind and heart opening the energy channels and centers . This meet up is to explore power of breathing to open the potential of bliss and happiness we have when we know how to breathe properly. we will practice varieties of breathing technique that comes from Taoist and Tantric tradition, including Micro Cosmic Orbit Breathing (Meditation).

cost $8 -$20 (Nobody will turn away for lack of Fund)

We hope to meet you here.

name: Vinnyasa flow  w/Briksha
description: Its advance Vinnyasa flow yoga class

name: Kirtan
description: Kirtan with Carol Whitney

name: Vibrational Sound Healing with Franceasca
description: Realign your chakras in a meditative vibrational sound healing class. Bring anything that makes you comfortable and your intention for the week.

name: Vinyasa Flow with Stephanie
description: Hatha Flow

name: Yoga of Deep Relaxation-Yoga Nidra -part II
description:
Yoga of Deep Relaxation (Yoga Nidra) Part II
with Mahendra Briksha
Cultivate Blissful Relaxation and Presence, releasing stress and stagnation!

Saturday, November 3rd, 2018, 11:00 am – 12:30 pm
Donation;$20.00

Yoga Nidra is an ancient yogic practice that is almost like deep sleep but with awareness. Hence it is short of Meditation that can be define as Awakened rest.
General benefit of Y.N.
~Profound relaxation in all levels of being-Blissful relaxation
~ Eliminate stress, help to overcome insomnia
~Integrate trauma, reduce anxiety, fear and anger
~Program subconscious mind to make positive change and habits
Along with practice of systematic relaxation with deep relaxation and full Awareness This workshop will include some dialogue and discussion about
~What is stress and how it becomes chronic and cause of Dis-ease
~ How to release it, cultivating relaxation and rejuvenation in cellular level
~ Yoga Nidra and Brain
~How Yoga Nidra restores health and brings transformation
~Sleep dream and Yoga Nidra
~ 5 Koshas and Process of Pratyahara
Cost: $20 (No one will be turned away for lack of funds)
RSVP is required.
To RSVP go to
briksha2Briksha was born in the small village of Himalayas, is a yogi, a certified Rebirthing Breathwork practitioner, an Integral life coach and raw vegan chef. Mahendra Briksha combines Vedantic-Yogic practices, Buddhist wisdom and Integral insights in his teaching. He has been teaching and leading breathing sessions and meditation classes for 10 years.
He is a graduate of the yoga teacher training program at the Vivekananda Yoga Research Center in Bangalore, India and holds certificates in Integral Yoga from the California Institute of Integral Studies, and Yoga Therapy from Purusha Yoga, and has over 200 hours of yoga teacher training through Urban Flow with Rusty Wells. Briksha is a resident teacher and manager of the Yoga Society of San Francisco (yogasocietysanfrancisco.com). He co-teaches the 200hr YTT for Seaside Yoga Sanctuary and Yoga Society of San Francisco.
Briksha’s main mission to share his knowledge and experience is to help people awaken in their body, breath, and mind and learn to live a peaceful and evolutionary life in the midst of a busy world.
To Know more about Rebirthing Breathwork go to http://hamsaintegralbreathwork.com

name: Sunday Touch - Don't call it a comeback
description:
Sunday touch is back on at Marina Green Drive! 2 PM Sunday 10/14 and let's aim for every Sunday thereafter.

Good experience, bad experience, no experience? No problem!

Come and join us for a beautiful day of rugby overlooking the Golden Gate Bridge - weather conditions expected to be 73 and sunny with a chance of rugby. Looking forward to seeing you all there. Please RSVP if you're coming so we get a good sense of numbers.

name: Thursday SoccerFours 7PM @ Beach Chalet
description:
4v4 pickup (4 simultaneous games if there are enough folks). First session begins at 7pm. Each session is one hour long. Teams are capped at 5 per side to ensure playing time for folks. Substitutions are enforced by the facilitator every 2 minutes so playing time is even spread evenly and everyone can just focus on having fun playing rather than worry about who's going to come out to make room for them. :)

The vibe is laid back and fun. Like all SoccerFours sessions, teams are made up at the field, and scores aren't kept. There are no leagues. It's just organized pickup soccer run by a facilitator. $8/person for the session. RSVP here and bring cash to the field or sign up on our main site if you'd like. (If the slots here are full, try our main site to see if there are any left.)

Let's have some fun! :)

name: Free Public Speaking Workshop: Turbo Charge Your Speaking Skills and Confidence
Breakfast Social - Chow on Church 10am to 12 pm
description:
NEW LOCATION: CHOW FOOD BAR at 215 CHURCH ST. near MARKET ST.

Come out and be social. This is our gathering. Meet other Dads and their kids. Kids get to be kids. No expectation of them sitting down.
Great opportunity to network and build friendships.
BEST TO ARRIVE BETWEEN 10AM AND 11AM, but were there from 10-12.
Full breakfast menu, (chowfoodbar.com), table service, high chairs!

name: Are We Spiritual Beings in Physical Body Having a Human Experience?
description:
We are Spiritual Beings in the physical body having a human experience. Most of us have heard this saying but how do we know this to be true? This Sunday, please join James Bae with this question in mind.

Before we even get to ask ourselves for what purpose and to why this is, maybe we need first to figure out that, indeed we are Spiritual Beings in the physical body. There is a simple “practice” that you can easily do which will enhance your first-hand knowledge that you are indeed Spiritual Beings.

Please come and join us this Sunday! Thank you :)

Welcome to CelebrateLIFE! "Spiritualism is a religion and philosophy of life focused on joy, harmony, and a fear-free understanding of the continuity of life. - Spiritualists believe that God or Infinite Intelligence is ALL That Is, expressing through all creation by love, light and law. Humanity, the most complex of life on earth, reaches this Divine Source through prayer, meditation, listening to the inner awareness, and service. Why service? Because every living thing is a part of God, so as we serve life we also serve the Higher Energies.

Life is consciousness - without consciousness there is no existence. Consciousness is the totality of one's thoughts, feelings, emotions and impressions on the mind. The state of thinking is how we create our consciousness. Spiritualism teaches that through the Law of Action/Reaction or Cause/Effect we take control of our lives as we control our thoughts. Positive thinking leads to happiness and assists the individual to grow" from NSAC.

name: A Progressive Spiritual Community for ALL people!!
description:
Please come and join us this Sunday! Thank you :)

Welcome to CelebrateLIFE! name: 1st Wednesday "All Message" Service
description:
Come relax and be inspired by the mediums of Celebrate LIFE!, as they create a link between the Physical World and the World of Spirit.

This special message service features our students and more experienced mediums as they connect with the Spirit World to bring through evidential messages from beyond the veil.

Featured Mediums- TBA

This midweek service includes "remote" healing, meditation and Mediumship.

We welcome ALL people. What brings us together is our shared belief in life after life - we teach and practice mediumship - and our passion for living this life with all the enthusiasm, purpose, and fun Spirit intends for us.

*A friendly reminder to please come EARLY to be seated by 7pm.*

We also have a fantastic lending library of metaphysical books on a wide range of topics.

Suggested donation $10-$20, no on turned away for lack of funds. All donations go to support Celebrate LIFE! http://www.celebratelifesf.org (http://www.celebratelifesf.org/)

name: 3rd Wednesday Spiritual and Intuitive Energy Healing Circle
description:
"Experience the energy of working with a group to heal yourself and others!"

Each month, we will "Sit in the Power" and cultivate the art of attunement with Infinite Intelligence. Inspired by Harry Edwards and other renowned spiritual healers, we will explore intuitive energy healing modalities, with an emphasis on recognizing the emotional state associated with "Attunement".

By deepening our relationship with Infinite Intelligence, we strengthen our connection with our Higher Self and our own intuitive healing abilities. Unified in healing intent, participants give and receive healing energy to each other, then send that healing energy across time and space to all in need. Together, we make this world a better place for ALL. Come join us as we "raise our vibration" to heal ourselves and others!

Donation sliding scale $10-$20, no one turned away for lack of funds:)

All proceeds go to Celebrate Life! Progressive Spiritualist Community.

Facilitator: DeeDee Freeman

name: Raise Your Energetic Frequency to Its Highest Potential! Private Sessions in SF
description:
Dear Friends, Next Thursday-Sunday, my good friend, James Hyman, founder of the Deep Emotional Release Bodywork and Quantum-Theta Healing will be in the S.F. area offering private sessions of his powerful system of healing. These 1 1/2 hour sessions for most people, are life-changing, in that James helps you to identify and release long-held repressed emotional energy from the chakras and other energy centers in the body, as well as negative patterns from the subconscious mind that are keeping you blocked and stuck. The release of this blocked energy and unwanted patterns helps all of the body's energy fields come into balance, for a person, usually, for the first time in many years. They feel, "themselves", again, and better able to connect with their world from an authentic place of personal power and creative self-expression. Also, they're more connected with their intuition, instinct, Higher Self, and emotional and physical well-being.

Every time we work with James, stuff comes up that we're not expecting, and it goes deep, and it gets cleared. After that, life feels more deeply in balance. We never know what's going to come up in the session, until we're there, but it feels so good to shake off the cobwebs, go to the core of our emotional issues, gain clarity, and feel that radiant energy surging through our body once again. Colors seem brighter, meditation seems deeper. I remember the first time someone scheduled 5 sessions back to back. We couldn't believe it! That person left an entirely different human being. She proceeded to write several best-selling books and become a nationally known psychic and friend to the famous.

James has worked with many amazing people, and some of the most famous people in the world. They use his work, as many do, as a tool to help them attain their highest potential, and a support system to help them get through the toughest of times.

Please feel free to call, text or email Barbara (me) for any information about Jim's work. I'll be happy to answer any questions you may have. I've worked with James now for over 30 years. I'll break down the session for you, if you like, and explain the various techniques he applies, and help you understand what you can expect from the work, in terms of results, and experience. Contact Barbara at (323)[masked]; call, text, msg. or emotionalrelease(at)gmail.com

Love and much light,
Barbara
(323)[masked] phone/text

I've added some testimonials here:

Testimonials

"I found James' website on the internet, and felt right away that this was what I needed. After my session I felt more calm, and color looked brighter. I cried my eyes out during the session. I couldn't remember all of the problems that were on my mind before the session. After the session, I wanted to do art, go to the beach, and meditate more."

﻿"I hadn't worked with James in a few years, and I didn't know what I needed to release, I just knew I was feeling angry all the time, and sad. So much was underneath those feelings. When I got to the bottom of them in my session, James just had me feel how all of those thoug

• What to bring

• Important to know

name: Weekly Meeting - RotaCare Bay Area Clinics
description:
Since 1989, the 10 RotaCare Bay Area Free Medical Clinics have provided free health care, including exams, diagnostics and pharmaceuticals. Last year, RotaCare handled over 10,000 patient visits throughout the greater San Francisco Bay Area. RotaCare’s mission is to bring free medical care for to those who have the most need and the least access to medical care.

At our upcoming meeting, we will hear from the CEO of RotaCare Bay Area, JP Sahi. We hope you will join us to welcome her to our club and find out more of how these clinics are helping our communities.

This is a weekly meeting for The Rotary Club of San Francisco Evening, open to all Rotarians, visiting Rotarians, prospective members and guests.

Food provided; drinks are available for purchase from the bar.

There is a $20 fee at the door for visiting Rotarians and returning guests; cash, check and credit card payment options available. First time guests are FREE!

name: Community Service - The Human Rights Campaign  Gala
description:
We had a great time volunteering at this event last year, so we’re doing it again!

The Human Rights Campaign represents a force of more than 3 million members and supporters nationwide. As the largest national lesbian, gay, bisexual, transgender and queer civil rights organization, HRC envisions a world where LGBTQ people are ensured of their basic equal rights, and can be open, honest and safe at home, at work and in the community.

The Gala needs ENERGETIC, TECH SAVVY, and QUICK volunteers to help with both the silent and live auction! This is one of the most fun opportunities to experience. In addition to helping guests bid on items, you'll be helping raise funds for EQUALITY by being a part of the Live Auction. Dress Code: Cocktail, Black Tie or Formal Wear REQUIRED for ALL volunteers.

RSVP on Facebook at SF Evening Rotary

name: Live Online  Breathing Session
description:
Start the week off right and join Chuck for an online Zoom breathwork session at 9pm on Monday. In this session you will get the chance to learn or improve your Wim Hof Method breathing. You will be guided by Chuck and have the opportunity to learn about the power of your breath. There will also be time for questions after the breathing.

The Wim Hof Method breathing not only leaves you feeling amazing, but has powerful effects on the body as well. An essential and fun part of the method, take your breathing to the next level!

This event is online only.

Make sure to download Zoom before the event, or call in using the instructions below:

Topic: Chuck McGee III's Wim Hof Method Breathwork session
Time: Every Monday at 9pm PST to 9:30 PST

Join from PC, Mac, Linux, iOS or Android: https://zoom.us/j/750599401

Or iPhone one-tap :

Or Telephone:

Meeting ID:[masked]

name: The Ripple Effect
description:
We will discuss Ripple's consensus model, tokenomics, history, team, and it's long-term objective of enabling frictionless and borderless payments.

description: We'll meditate using an ancient Vajrayana chakra meditation practice designed for Western professionals. There will be two 15-minute meditations with music with a discussion in between.
