description:
Afterwork is a monthly meetup where people working in the news industry come after work to network, meet peers and talk about the state and the future of journalism. Afterwork is every first Tuesday of the month.

This is a free event, we welcome everyone working in the industry as well as students.

name: Study percussion with Omar Ledezma Jr.
description:
Study percussion with one of the great Bay Area legends, Omar Ledezma Jr! He is a Grammy-Award winning performer, teacher and world class musician who plays with the Pacific Mambo Orchestra and is endorsed by Soultone cymbals and Pearl drums.

His Latin Percussion Ensemble for all levels meets on Mondays from 6:30-8pm. See the description below.

Latin Percussion Ensemble:

Develop a solid foundation on all of the major Latin percussion instruments through various musical styles and rhythms, including son, salsa, cumbia, merengue, bachata, Brazilian and timba. Learn technique on congas, bongos, timbales, bells, and other auxiliary percussion instruments. The class will explore soloing techniques and typical breaks, song forms, team work, and musicianship. Students will also work on singing while playing percussion. This class provides a good foundation for the Cuban Charanga Ensemble.

Ages: Adults, older teens (high school students)

Instruments: Congas, bongos, timbales, bells, and other auxiliary percussion instruments. Class is open to vocalists as well. Bring your instruments if you have them!

Musical Styles: Latin grooves typical of son, salsa, cumbia, merengue, bachata, Brazilian, Latin jazz and timba

Prerequisites: None

Class size: 4-6 students

Tuition assistance available.

For more information visit: https://sfcmc.org/adults/group-classes-and-ensembles/latin/#latin
For enrollment, please make an appointment with CMC’s registration team at https://sfcmc.org/enrollment/

name: Cuban Dance Music class starting up!
description:
Community Music Center is starting a Cuban Dance Music class.

Learn the fundamental rhythms that are key to Afro-Cuban music including how clave and percussion parts relate to each instrument’s role and improvisation within the style. Students will play Cuban danzón, cha-cha-chá, son montuno, learning how different instrumental parts fit together and the musical form of each style. Charts will be provided by the instructor

Ages: Adults, older teens (high school students)

Instruments: Voice, woodwinds, brass, violin, cello, bass, piano, and percussion (bongo, congas, guiro, claves, and timbales)

Musical Styles: Cha-cha-chá, danzón, guaracha, bolero, son, salsa, and other Afro-Cuban music

Prerequisites: Proficiency on an instrument, reading skills, and interest in Latin music. Admission with instructor’s consent.

Class Size: 4-8 students

Location, Day and Time: Mission District Branch, Wednesdays, 5:30 – 7:00pm

Instructor: Tregar Otton

Tuition: $494 Fall (13 weeks), $456 Winter (12 weeks), $380 Spring (10 weeks), $304 Summer (8 weeks)

Students enrolled in private lessons at CMC receive 50% discount.
Tuition assistance available.

name: Indian Dinner, Comedy & BYOB! (EVERY THURSDAY)
description:
NOTE: This is a recurring event that happens every Thursday. The date will change on the event invitation as it gets close to the event starting time, but the event is still happening this Thursday at 7:45PM!

RSVP is *required*. You *must* meet us outside Score Bar (490 Broadway St) between 7:45PM and 8PM if you're planning to attend. Do NOT try to meet up with us after 8PM or you will be turned away.

We'll be heading out with a group of travelers for Indian dinner followed by a live Comedy Show. The Indian restaurant is BYOB, so feel free to bring your own beer, wine, alcohol, etc. Option to also stop at a dueling piano bar and also a popular bar in SF with 100 beers on tap, skeeball & games at the end of the night.

We'll be joining the international travelers group and picking up a groups of backpackers from local hostels - since the menu selections and restaurant changes sometimes, here is the main event link with all the info, the full menu choices for our group, etc:

http://www.meetup.com/SanFranciscoHostel/events/193699332/

EVENT INFO:

www.sfhostelparty.com ( http://www.sfhostelparty.com/ )

$11.75 + $3.25 tax/tip includes entry to Comedy Show (save $15 ticket fee!), and an Indian curry combo meal - includes rice, naan, salad and your choice of two curries (tax & tip are included). Plus you can bring your own booze to the restaurant!

NOTE: The Dinner & Comedy show is all ages. If you're planning to go to the piano bar or the bar with 100 beers, be sure to bring your ID that shows you are 21+. If you have an out of country ID, it is best to bring a passport since some places do not accept international drivers licenses.

=====================================

For choice of Curries & Entrees, see the main event link:

http://www.meetup.com/SanFranciscoHostel/events/193699332/

As this will be a large group, the food choices have been pre-organized - so there are NO ADDITIONAL FOOD SUBSTITUTIONS!

======================================

See you Thursday!

name: Taking Sustainability Advice From China
description:
Sustainable urban design can create social, economic and climate benefits when it is prioritized. California has typically led the world in sustainability policy but has a mixed record in urban form, while China is in the middle of an urban design transition from auto-oriented to people-oriented cities. What lessons can we learn from these two dynamic worlds? Hear how China’s urban growth could help build a sustainable and prosperous California.

Speakers: Hal Harvey, Energy Innovation
Peter Calthorpe, Calthorpe Associates

name: Gauged Panels: The Future in Tile
description:
In this class, StonePeak Ceramics will teach the newest innovative solutions in the porcelain tile industry: the ANSI 137.3 Standards for Gauged Porcelain Tiles & Gauged Porcelain Tile Panels/Slabs. This standard has set forth the newest trends in floor and wall installations by re-defining the manufacturing process. StonePeak will also review the new ANSI A108.19 specifications for the installation procedures for these new large-format panels.

Attendees will learn the sustainability aspects of recycled content, closed-loop processes, energy savings, better indoor air quality, ADA complaint slip-resistant surfaces, and Environmental Product Declarations using Green Squared standards. Participants will see the unlimited design potential of this new technology from furniture to floors to walls to interior artworks to exterior ventilated facades using case history studies.

description:

He will discuss how films aid campaigns that change the climate of opinion. Most will speak about visual storytelling as an effective form of public education on crucial subjects that mass media tend to ignore, misrepresent or present without adequate context. Addressing the challenges nonfiction filmmakers face in showing arts’ complexities and unprecedented realities, Most will read passages from his book, Stories Make the World: Reflections on Storytelling and the Art of the Documentary.

California is leading the way to a decarbonized future where energy efficiency and demand management are key game changers. The state’s 2030 climate goals mean that California needs to change the way these resources are valued, procured and leveraged. Join us for a full day conference on October 25, 2018 to hear from experts and leaders at the center of this movement. name: Two Degrees: Cities, Architecture and Our Changing Environments
description:
The Earth's temperature has been rising. To limit catastrophic outcomes, we must limit warming to no more than two degrees Celsius (3.6 degrees Fahrenheit) average temperature rise. Economists agree we will save trillions of dollars by acting early. But how do we act successfully? What is the plan if we fall short? Bridging climate science, design, psychology, politics and religion, we explore the practical steps to reduce global warming and to adapt to the inevitable, all the while improving the bottom line, beautifying our communities and increasing human health for all of us who occupy and shape our environment.

Catalysis pyrolysis is the thermal decomposition of materials at elevated temperatures in an inert atmosphere using a catalyst to increase the rate of chemical reaction. An example is the processes of charring wood. This conference includes topics such as environmental and green catalysis.

Sheraton Grand Sacramento Hotel

name: Fall Soul-Rhythm-Blues Concert (same place/time as our normal weekly meeting)
description:
We're taking a week off from our normal DRR meeting and our "Boundaries" video series to enjoy an annual fall soul/R&B concert offered by our host church Unity Spiritual Center. Performers will include local musicians Karen Drucker, Patrick Meier, Liz Kessler and Michael Hatfield.

SPECIAL TICKET OFFER! Tickets are available in advance for $25 by calling[masked] – or at the door on Sunday for $30 – but we have a LIMITED NUMBER OF $10 TICKETS FOR DRR PARTICIPANTS. Reserve one of those now by texting your name and the desired quality to Davis Fields at[masked] - and then appear Sunday with $10 per person, in cash - correct change please - and you'll be in!

Web sites of the artists:
Karen Drucker www.karendrucker.com
Patrick Meier www.patrickmaier.net
Michael Hatfield www.michaelhatfield.com

We'll return to our "Boundaries" series and normal DRR process next Sunday the 21st. Details at www.meetup.com/DRR-SF-Stonestown/events/bghkfqyxnbcc

name: Information and support group - and "Boundaries" ⑤
description:
Are you tired of saying "yes" when you want to say "no"? Of having other people's priorities consume your time and energy? Of doing things for others you know they should be doing for themselves? Have other people rolled over you in relationships? Do you feel guilty standing up for yourself and your wants and needs?

If you're nodding "yes" to any of these questions, then you need to join us for this life-changing video/book series with Drs. Henry Cloud and John Townsend. "Boundaries" will change the way you choose, manage and build all the relationships in your life.

Weekly schedule for this series:
Session 1: Introduction
Session 2: Boundary Problems / Boundary Development
Sessions 3+4: Ten Laws of Boundaries
Session 5: Myths about Boundaries
Session 6: A Course of Recovery
Session 7; Resistance to Boundaries
Session 8: Measuring Success / A Day in the Life

You are welcome without regard to your relationship type or situation, timeline, circumstances or faith background. Learn more about our weekly meetings below.

➜ Lots of free street parking in the area on Sundays! The newly-reopened SF MUNI M-Ocean line also stops just a few steps from our door, at Ocean Avenue! Details at: www.sfmta.com/routes/m-ocean-view

➜ Our meetings are offered free of charge, but we would be grateful for a donation of $10 per meeting, made either in person (via cash or check) or through a monthly online donation at: https://divorceandrelationshiprecovery.networkforgood.com/projects/24066

Let's play some cards!
description:

Games are held in private home in Ingleside Terraces, near Stonestown Galleria. Address will be e-mailed to attending members. • What to bring
Bring your favorite beverage and a good friendly attitude.

name: Short Film Festival- MMTB Challenge Edition
Actors & Directors MMTB Short Film Challenge- Production/Potluck
ACTORS EXPRESSION REEL Building - ON CAMERA
WRITERS & Actors MMTB Short Film Challenge Production/Potluck
Feature Film Challenge- COMEDY Weekend Edition!
'MUSIC VIDEO n a DAY'! Challenge- Production/Potluck
BEER/WINE PONG & 90's PARTY with International Travelers & Locals
description:
NOTE: This event is EVERY FRIDAY!! The date changes on meetup as it gets closer to the event start time because this is a recurring event, but this event happens every Friday at 9PM! Signup is at 9PM - YOU MUST ARRIVE BEFORE 9:30PM TO PLAY IN THE GAMES. ENTRY IS THROUGH SCORE BAR (next door to Horizon).

We will be joining the international travelers group - here is the main event link: http://www.meetup.com/SanFranciscoHostel/events/220819213/

Additionally, there will be several tour groups of solo international travelers joining us who have been dropped off at the event. These groups have not RSVPed on the meetup and the head count varies week-to-week, so expect join in with other people than those listed on the meetup RSVP list.

They will place you on a team based on your country and your team will rotate around the room & play beer pong, flip cup, and relays against the other teams. ***The point of this event is to meet the others in the room while competing.

Come join us, have some drinks, and meet some new people. When you arrive, tell the girl at the door you're with the meet up if you'd like to be teammates with others in the group. RSVP is *required* for planning purposes. Thanks!

Here's the INFO:

We do a weekly tournament on Fridays - we mainly get about 50-60 backpackers who are staying at hostels around the city, along with locals who want to meet new people and share travel stories.

FREE to play! FREE entry before 10PM with a drink special purchase and RSVP!

Drink Special: 6 CUPS of WINE for $12 before 9:30PM, 6 BEERS for $18 before 9:30PM, 6 WELL SPIRITS for $24 before 9:30PM.

Win Prizes!
Games: Beer Pong, Flip Cup, Relays

--> Everyone's placed on a team based on your country (to make it easy to meet people).
--> Teams compete at flip cup, relays, and beer pong.
--> Play -or- just watch, drink cheap beer and be social!

Meet & compete against travelers, locals, au pairs and students!

'Like' us on Facebook *and* RSVP that you're attending & get a $1 shot!
LIKE US HERE: https://www.facebook.com/beerpubcrawl
RSVP HERE: http://www.sfhostelparty.com (http://www.sfhostelparty.com/)

******************************************************
WHEN: EVERY FRIDAY!!
WHERE: HORIZON LOUNGE - 498 Broadway St, near the corner of Kearny St & Broadway
(Signup with the Beer Olympics coordinator)
TIME: Signup at 9PM - Be sure to arrive by 9:30PM to play!
******************************************************

name: WTF open work hours at Bike Kitchen
description:
The Bike Kitchen is open exclusively to WTF* folks every 2nd and 4th Monday of the month from 6:30-9pm.

Come join us for a night of wrenching on our bikes. Bring your bike by and we can help you troubleshoot and adjust your bike so it's running smooth.

Bike Kitchen's WTF night provides a safe and supportive atmosphere for WTF folks of all skill levels to experiment and explore while learning bike mechanics and maintenance.

Free for Bike Kitchen members or $6 / night for non-members

* Women Trans* Femme (WTF) hours and classes are open to anyone who identifies as female, transgender, femme, genderqueer, trans-masculine, trans-feminine, or feels that their socialization or treatment as a woman, transperson*, femme has impeded their participation in bicycle mechanics.

name: Could your Love Life Use a Boost?
description:
Bringing Romance, Passion & Turn-on back into Everyday life!

Is your love-life on life support? Nowadays many people find themselves distracted from or not able to fully enjoy loving turned-on relationships. Difficulties from the recent or far past can impact our ability to lovingly connect with others and form juicy romantic relationships. On top of that is how hectic modern life can be pulling you out of your heart and into your head.

Singles can have trouble getting into passionate relationships and couples often end up as companions vs soul-mates as other, often less important concerns, take over.

Love is central to everyone’s heart and deepest desires but tends to take a back seat as we focus on other things. People’s love-lives suffer and there are few effective resources to powerfully address.

Oct 18th Erwan and Alicia will cover exactly what you can do about it. They have been teaching singles and couples how to create and thrive in loving relationships for a combined 40 years. They are married, have a family and their love life is better than ever. What is their secret?

Come learn:

1. Specific daily practices to connect heart to heart with someone
2. How to handle sex… everything from techniques to how to communicate
3. How to overcome the most common pitfalls, defenses and blocks to loving yourself and another.

Erwan and Alicia will also take questions so that each person’s personal situation is powerfully addressed and you have practical steps forward to realizing a passionate romantic future full of Love!

Toward the end of the evening you will also have the opportunity to find out how to work more deeply with Erwan and Alicia.

Erwan Davon has taught thousands of singles and couples how to have exceptional romantic relationships over the last 17 years. He is the founder, senior teacher, and president of San Francisco based Erwan Davon Teachings. Erwan, who grew up in New York, has a straight-talking style that gets through to anyone so you can see your blind spots in your romantic relationships and then take your romance to new heights. He graduated with a degree in psychology and soon began teaching personal development for one of the world’s largest personal growth organizations. He then branched out on his own to support people in their relationships, and in 1993 founded Beyond Education, which later became Erwan Davon Teachings. Thousands of people have taken Erwan’s Pleasure Course and advanced programs to move past their limitations in relationships and make their romance shine.

Alicia Davon has been giving relationship advice in the Pleasure Course with Erwan since 2004. Alicia graduated with a Masters Degree in the field of Integral Psychology from John F Kennedy University, with a focus in women’s romantic and sensual expression. Prior to teaching the Pleasure Course with Erwan she was a facilitator of women’s groups devoted to female libido, pleasure, and fulfillment in all aspects of life from career to relationship. She was drawn to the “work” of Erwan Davon Teachings because of the enormous difference the organization had made in her life and the lives of so many around her.

name: Peer Support for Narcissistic Abuse Recovery!
SF Games Sunday gaming
description:
The Sunday gaming
From 10 to 25 or so people playing all kinds of board and card games. If you like a large selection of games to play with a variety of people, this is the group for you. Five hours of games!

We meet Sunday afternoons, 2pm (sharp!) to usually around 5 to 7pm.

DESCRIPTION: While we are serious about games, SF Games is a friendly social club with games, not a group just for intense gamers.

SF Games is a collective name for a group of people who get together and play board games and card games every week. We're not sponsored by any cafe or games company. Some of us have been playing games for years, others only a few months. What we share is our love of games, all kinds. SF Games is free to attend, but please buy something at the cafe. Bring your favorite games to play if you have them. Be prepared to learn a new game. Come early or you might not get into the early games! Don't know how to play? We'll teach you.

IF YOU ARRIVE AFTER 2:00: You're absolutely still welcome! Many of us stay all afternoon, but many of us also come and go. If you come after 2:00, simply hang out until you see a game end. In most games you're welcome to sit at the edge of the table and watch until the game ends. Be sure to introduce yourself. Since our main group runs several hours, you will be able to get into a game if you wait until the next break. Most people can get in more than one game during the afternoon.

Feel free to RSVP to this meetup but be aware that many of us who attend regularly do not. Even if no one has RSVP'd to the meetup there will be several people in attendance each and every week. Also, feel free to post questions to the Meetup.

FAQ

1 - WHO ATTENDS? All kinds of people ages 17 to about 70, male, female, straight, gay, bi have come to SF Games over the years. Everybody who can play games is welcome to attend. The number of people varies from about 20 to 45 out of a universe of about 200.

2 - WHAT KIND OF GAMES? What we play depends on who comes and what they bring.

STRATEGY GAMES: Among the most common popular board games we play are Container, Ticket To Ride, Manhattan Project, Dead of Winter, Power Grid, Acquire, Arctic Scavengers, Race for the Galaxy, Carcassonne, Hansa Teutonica, Tigris & Euphrates, Alhambra, Cosmic Encounter, Ra, Chinatown, Alien Frontiers, Glory to Rome, Terra Mystica, Imperial Settlers, Splendor, Agricola, Ora et Labora, Chicago Express and numerous other European-style board games both new and old.

SPECIAL DECK CARD GAMES: We also play games that use special packs such as For Sale, Zendo, RoboRally, San Juan, Bohnanza, Coloretto, Modern Art, Condottiere and Bang.

3 - DO YOU PLAY MY FAVORITE GAME? Don't ask us if we play a game -- come by and bring your game and see!

4 - DOES SF GAMES MEET EVERY WEEK? This is probably the most frequent question. SF Games meets almost every Sunday of the year. Because it's right by the park, there are times we try to move it to another location when there is a large event like Outside Lands, or Hardly Strictly, because parking just becomes impossible. Otherwise we meet, rain or shine.

HISTORY OF SF GAMES: SF Games was founded July 5, 1995 by David Kaye. SF Games was begun not as a games group but as a social group with games. This important difference we feel has contributed to the longevity of the group and the continued enjoyment by members year in and year out. Welcome to our visitors from other countries! Many of our games are of German origin, and many can be played without extensive knowledge of English. People from all over the world have joined us during their vacations in San Francisco. We have also been featured in stories appearing in the press in Italy and Germany.

[url=www.sfgames.org/]Our Homepage[/url]

[url=http://www.sfgate.com/cgi-bin/article.cgi?file=/chronicle/archive/2003/01/19/LV212070.DTL]Chronicle Coverage of Us[/url]

name: SF Games Friday gaming.
description:
FRIDAY SF GAMES:
15 to 40 people playing all kinds of board and card games. If you like a large selection of games to play with a variety of people, this is the group for you. Five or more hours of games!

We meet Friday nights, 7:00pm (sharp!) to 12:00 midnight (yes, 5 hours!) and sometimes even later! You don't have to stay all night though :)

DESCRIPTION: While we are serious about games, SF Games is a friendly social club with games, not a group just for intense gamers.

SF Games is a collective name for a group of people who get together and play board games and card games every week. We're not sponsored by any cafe or games company. Some of us have been playing games for years, others only a few months. What we share is our love of games, all kinds. SF Games is free to attend, but please buy something at the Taqueria. Bring your favorite games to play if you have them. Be prepared to learn a new game. Come early or you might not get into the early games! Don't know how to play? We'll teach you.

IF YOU ARRIVE AFTER 7:00: You're absolutely still welcome! Many of us stay all night, but many of us also come and go. If you come after 7:00, simply hang out until you see a game end. In most games you're welcome to sit at the edge of the table and watch until the game ends. Be sure to introduce yourself. Since our main group runs 5 hours, you will be able to get into a game if you wait until the next break. Most people can get in 3 games during the evening.

Feel free to RSVP to this meetup but be aware that many of us who attend regularly do not. Even if no one has RSVP'd to the meetup there will be several people in attendance each and every week. Also, feel free to post questions to the Meetup. 

FAQ

1 - WHO ATTENDS? All kinds of people ages 17 to about 70, male, female, straight, gay, bi have come to SF Games over the years. Everybody who can play games is welcome to attend. The number of people varies from about 15 to 40 out of a universe of about 200.

2 - WHAT KIND OF GAMES? What we play depends on who comes and what they bring. Generally, games can be divided into two groups: strategy games and social games.

STRATEGY GAMES: Among the most common popular board games we play are Container, Ticket To Ride, Manhattan Project, Dead of Winter, Power Grid, Acquire, Arctic Scavengers, Race for the Galaxy, Carcassonne, Hansa Teutonica, Tigris & Euphrates, Alhambra, Cosmic Encounter, Ra, Chinatown, Alien Frontiers, Glory to Rome, Terra Mystica, Imperial Settlers, Splendor, Agricola, Ora et Labora, Chicago Express and numerous other European-style board games both new and old.

SOCIAL GAMES: These are for people who like lots of conversation and laughs, where having a good time is more important than refining your game-winning strategy. Examples of social games we play are: Codenames, Apples to Apples, Taboo, Can't Stop, Set, Fluxx, Boggle and Hoopla. Feel free to bring other social games.

SPECIAL DECK CARD GAMES: We also play games that use special packs such as Tichu, Hanabi, San Juan, Bohnanza, Coloretto, Modern Art, Condottiere and Bang.

3 - DO YOU PLAY MY FAVORITE GAME? Don't ask us if we play a game -- come by and bring your game and see!

4 - DOES SF GAMES MEET EVERY WEEK? This is probably the most frequent question. SF Games meets every Friday of the year unless Christmas Eve or Day falls on a game night. Then we don't meet. Otherwise we meet, rain or shine.

HISTORY OF SF GAMES: SF Games was founded July 5, 1995 by David Kaye. SF Games was begun not as a games group but as a social group with games. This important difference we feel has contributed to the longevity of the group and the continued enjoyment by members year in and year out. Welcome to our visitors from other countries! Many of our games are of German origin, and many can be played without extensive knowledge of English. People from all over the world have joined us during their vacations in San Francisco. We have also been featured in stories appearing in the press in Italy and Germany.

www.sfgames.org

http://www.sfgate.com/cgi-bin/article.cgi?file=/chronicle/archive/2003/01/19/LV212070.DTL

name: Cosmic Thunder & Lightning: Gravitational Waves, Neutron Stars, and Cosmic Gold
description:
In October 2017, Earthlings detected gravitational waves, or ripples in the fabric of spacetime, from the violent merger of two ultra-dense neutron stars. This triggered nearly every big telescope to point in the direction of the source, which was subsequently seen in colors across the electromagnetic spectrum. This was the first detection of both gravitational waves and light — the “thunder" and the “lightning" — from the same event. In addition to providing a powerful test of our best theory of gravity, the signals showed that debris spit out in the stellar collision assembled into heavy elements, such as gold and platinum, providing an explanation for the cosmic origin of these special materials.

Our Wonderfest speaker is Dr. Dan Kasen, Associate Professor of Physics and of Astronomy at UC Berkeley.

name: CAPTAIN CLAWHAND---
description:
Salutations Puppet Pushers,

We are going to continue our Captain Clawhand project each Thursday as well as additional days which we will discuss at this next meetup.

Notice that we are making it 7 pm once again so it is easier for those who have expressed a preference for an earlier schedule.  Don't worry if you are late though, we want everyone who wants to participate to be a part of this. 

J & I did an initial impromptu location scout at Dolores Park & we would like to share the unedited photographs of the location with you all in the hopes that it will get everyone as excited as we are about this project.

Keep in mind that it was getting dark; we plan on doing a proper scout with real cameras (these photos are unedited, as is, from phone cameras. We just want to give everyone an idea of how awesome this project is going to be).

I will post them in the pages area since that is the place to post photos to give you an idea of what a great location Nicole actually picked out for this piece.  It ended up surpassing our expectations greatly!

We hope that you all will be as excited as we are & will join us on our next location scout with better equipment during daylight hours.

Thanks to everyone who participated in the Coraline screening.  It was truly magickal & we hope that you will continue with us in our quest to create a space that is productive, inspirational & fun!!!

Remember to check out these first photos to give everyone an idea of the awesome location we are working with!!!

Also, for those who have had trouble opening the script we will have an updated version of the script this week in the Discussion area & Brian will create a google docs section that we can utilize for these issues.

Can't wait to see everyone!!!

name: Have dinner and discuss life with OCD
description:
How to find us:

Enter the main lobby of the Marquis Marriott hotel from 4th St. As you near the lobby bar, make a hard right and take the escalator next to the info desk up to the 2nd floor atrium. There are a variety of tables and sofas in the second-floor atrium. I can't predict which table or seats will be available, but we're usually able to get one of the tables. Look for a meetup.com sign taped to a chair and a group of regular people sitting near that sign.

Please don't ask hotel staff to find the Meetup; they won't know where to find us because they don't know we meet there on a regular basis.

The Marriott Marquis is 1/2 block from the Powell BART Station, 1/2 block from the large Mission & 5th Garage and so close to countless MUNI lines.

Also feel free to grab dinner at The Metreon food court next door and bring it with you since we're meeting around dinner time.

name: Take a FUN Improv Class - then After Party!
description:
Welcome to the fun!!! Here are all the details:

Step 1.) You must register and pay $15 on Eventbrite (https://thursdayimprovclass.eventbrite.com) to secure your place in the class (not just on this Meetup). Online registration ends at 6:30pm every Monday for that week. $15 discounted online registration for the class is located here: https://thursdayimprovclass.eventbrite.com

You can just show up and pay $20 (cash only) at the door. However class size is limited and it often sells out. So I'd recommend signing up online if you want a guaranteed place in the class (it's cheaper too) - you must do this on Eventbrite (https://thursdayimprovclass.eventbrite.com) (not just on this Meetup).

Step 2.) Everyone meets inside the SF Chronicle building lobby, checks-in, and takes the elevator upstairs to the third floor classroom. Following the class there's usually an after party at the Chieftain Irish Pub & Restaurant around the corner (5th and Howard). It's a great time, hope to see you there!

This Meetup is for people who currently improvise or are interested in trying out improv. We get together and attend Leela's weekly Monday night drop-in improv class: The Art of Improvisation (see below).

"Come play, bring a friend, and meet new people in Leela's weekly drop-in improv class. This fun-filled improv class is a valuable opportunity for experienced actors/improvisors to sharpen their skills, and newbies to get introduced to the wonderful world of improvisation. Connect, play, grow..."

Visit http://www.leela-sf.com for more information about Leela.

description: Join us to restore habitat for the Coastal Green Hairstreak butterfly, and learn about the plants and animals that are also thriving in this true urban wildlife corridor. Visit the Corridor on iNaturalist to see what's living there: https://www.inaturalist.org/places/green-hairstreak-corridor

name: Adah's Stairway Community Volunteer Workday
description:
Adah's Stairway is a new community partnership: a public stairway and park located in the Buena Vista Park and Haight Ashbury neighborhoods. Nature in the City is working with local residents to enhance the wildlife potential for this park – a forgotten place, which had become blighted by illegal dumping and graffiti.

We are helping to organize the community and facilitate monthly volunteer workdays to transform this area into a tribute to local walking guru Adah Bakalinsky, author of the Stairway Walks in San Francisco. What's more, our work here will create a bird sanctuary for resident and migrating birds designed with the Cedar Waxwing (Bombycilla cedrorum) in mind. Cedar Waxwings are gorgeous birds that pass through San Francisco during spring and fall feeding on berries and fruits along the Pacific Flyway migration route.

name: Alemany Farm "Natives" Habitat Restoration Volunteer Workday
description:
The work day will consist of weeding, planting, and mulching in the various ecotones displayed in the Alemany Natives space at the heart of Alemany Farm. Volunteers are welcome to stay after 4:00pm to join in on the farm harvest where seasonal goodies will be shared by all, bring a tote or grocery bag.

Directions and more info can be found at http://www.alemanyfarm.org/get-involved/

Remember that there is no restroom on site, to wear layers, and bring sunscreen, water & snacks. Water proof shoes would be preferable for those who would like to work in the stream.

name: Palou Phelps Park and Community Garden Volunteer Day
description:
On the first Saturday of every month we meet at the base of the Palou Phelps hill and join the Friends of Palou Phelps community group on their volunteer work day.

Nature in the City started the Palou Phelps project as a means to preserve a native grassland habitat from the threat of development. The habitat is one of the few native grasslands remaining in San Francisco and is vital to local pollinators. This project has since expanded to include the revitalization of a community garden across the street!

Our work days will vary every Saturday, but both the hill and the garden will be the focus on these days. So come ready to get your hands dirty!

name: Are Human Pheromones Still Important in Human Interactions?
description:
October's topic will be conducted by Brother Jenel Murray on a study of Freemasonry: Are Human Pheromones Still Important in Human Interactions? After a short lecture, a discussion and debate by the group will follow.

Pheromones have been demonstrated clearly in other species but their existence and ability to affect humans is still under debate. Several studies have been conducted that have reached different conclusions, some pheromone effects seen in other mammals are definitely present in humans.We choose those in our "tribe" based on many factors, especially those using our senses, pheromones may simply be a way humans communicate. In Freemasonry, we place a special emphasis on our humanity, including those of our senses. We will discuss how this form of communication matters in human interactions, including those of "group" membership, like Freemasonry.

Mission Statement
The Masonic Philosophical Society embraces the concept of learning, not for school, but for life, and believes that all men, who seek it, deserve access to continued education. We further embrace the concept of a community environment, where ideas can be shared and debated in an open forum. From the seven liberal arts to the arcane, we seek to gain and to share the knowledge that is the legacy of mankind.

More Resources
Website: http://www.philosophicalsociety.org
Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/masonicphilosophicalsociety
Learn more about Freemasonry: http://www.universalfreemasonry.org

name: Is Diplomacy Important?
description:
November's topic will be conducted by Brother Kristine Wilson-Slack on a study of Freemasonry: Is Diplomacy Important? After a short lecture, a discussion and debate by the group will follow.

Diplomacy is the art of dealing with people in a sensitive and effective way, whether those people are nations, groups, or other individuals. Without diplomacy, you can neither protect your own interests and further your standing in life, nor can you work with others to accomplish more for yourself and others. Yet, many great leaders were terrible diplomats - boorish, crude, and thoroughly ignorant - and still accomplished much. Steve Jobs created a world class company worth billions and was horrible to his employees, while Richard Nixon opened the doors to China and the East, yet had no internal diplomatic skills. In Antifragile, by Nassim Taleb, its argued that the things which can withstand the least "diplomatic" treatment are the things that endure. While Freemasons value the ability to work together and be diplomatic and has produced many great leaders, there may be more life and passion in creating "Chaos out of Order." Perhaps we need a lack of diplomacy to shake up and improve the status quo.

Mission Statement
The Masonic Philosophical Society embraces the concept of learning, not for school, but for life, and believes that all men, who seek it, deserve access to continued education. We further embrace the concept of a community environment, where ideas can be shared and debated in an open forum. From the seven liberal arts to the arcane, we seek to gain and to share the knowledge that is the legacy of mankind.

More Resources
Website: http://www.philosophicalsociety.org
Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/masonicphilosophicalsociety
Learn more about Freemasonry: http://www.universalfreemasonry.org

name: Could Marcus Aurelius Been the First Freemason?
description:
December's topic will be conducted by Brother Andrea Katzer on a study of Freemasonry: Could Marcus Aurelius Been the First Freemason? After a short lecture, a discussion and debate by the group will follow.

Marcus Aurelius, Roman emperor from 161 to 180, was a practitioner of Stoicism. His writing called “Meditations” is a significant source of our modern understanding of ancient Stoic philosophy and could be considered the source of Masonic morality. The goal of Stoicism is freedom from passion through the pursuit of reason and apathy, in its ancient sense of being objective, unemotional and having clear judgment. In many respects, it bears a remarkable similarity to the ethical teachings of the Buddha and the four noble truths of Buddhism, and it also bears a remarkable similarity to Masonic teachings. Well explore how the writings of Marcus Aurelius perhaps built the foundations of Modern Freemasonry.

Mission Statement
The Masonic Philosophical Society embraces the concept of learning, not for school, but for life, and believes that all men, who seek it, deserve access to continued education. We further embrace the concept of a community environment, where ideas can be shared and debated in an open forum. From the seven liberal arts to the arcane, we seek to gain and to share the knowledge that is the legacy of mankind.

Getting to know you. Our agenda is, always, to discuss issues and problems that keep us from enjoying a full and extroverted life. Social anxiety is the fear of social situations that involve interaction other people. We will discuss ways to counter that debilitating fear of engaging with strangers people in new situations.

The recent blog @ http://robertfmullen.com/Blog will be our blueprint.

As this is your meet up, the floor is open to anything you need to discuss. We will examine various therapeutic remedies and may suggest various fun exercises, however, no one is under any obligation to participate. This is an environment specifically created so that those of us with social anxiety can feel safe among friends.

name: 21-Day Emotional Detox Challenge (Interactive Virtual Course)
description:
If you could hit the reset button on the mental toxicity, rebuild your mindfulness muscles, and strengthen your confidence in less than 10 min. a day for 21 days, would you do it? Then, let's do it already! 

CLICK HERE to register!!

We love our 21 Day Emotional Detox Program and know how powerful it can be if people commit to building this habit. The biggest struggle people face is sticking to a daily regimen that builds new habits. We get it! Its tough when life is always getting in the way. So to help you have more success in boosting your self-worth, self-esteem and reclaiming emotional control, we added a layer of accountability!

It's 21 days for only $47 & 15 minutes a day. Yep, that’s it. 15 minutes a day for 21 days is all it requires to begin making change in your life. Each day you will be asked to do 2 things:

#1 – Log into your account and do that day’s assignment. There is a different assignment everyday, switching from meditation, journaling, visualizations, exercises and MP3s.

#2 – Connect with your private Facebook community daily to check-in, share your success, inspire and hold each other accountable.

That’s it! Easy. Simple. Effective.

You deserve to be happy. You deserve emotional well-being. You deserve love from yourself. This challenge is designed to help keep you accountable to doing the work and formulate a new habit of being emotionally intelligent.

CLICK HERE for access!

This program was developed by Bonnie Kelly, CPC, ELI-MP, personal development expert, motivational speaker, author & CEO of Bonnie Kelly & Associates. Our Mission: To inspire help others stop the cycle of self sabotage, break free of toxic limitations and beliefs, and to become fiercely self-reliant.

name: Kirtan & Meditation
description:
Suggested Donation $10

6:30 pm - 8:30 pm

Moksha Life Center: 405 Sansome St, 3rd Floor

Kirtan is an ancient participatory music experience. Without the work of mentally quieting the mind, kirtan can carry us effortlessly to a place of quiet, to stillness. One of the oldest sacred music traditions of the world, the kirtan call-and-response chanting genre comes to us from India. Using ancient Sanskrit mantras, the kirtan calls upon sacred energies which serve to quiet the mind, remove obstacles to meditation. Singing traditional Sanskrit mantras has a profound effect on the environment and consciousness, helping to elevate the mind, heal the body, and open the heart. No experience is necessary.

"Satsang is the shelter from the changing time and its harsh influence on life" 
Sri Sri Ravi Shankar

This event is sponsored by the Art of Living Foundation

www.artofliving.org/sf

name: San Jose Chan Meditation in the Park: Recharge Your Energy Beyond Mindfulness
description:
This class is weekly meditation class offered by Chan Meditation in the Park. Please feel free to stop by during your lunch time and learn how to meditate with Dzung. He is a well trained meditator for many years and underwent through many meditation retreats.

Contact Dzung (408)[masked]

1. This class is Free and suitable for all levels, ages and religions.
2. Bring your own yoga mat or towel to sit on.
3. When the weather is colder, we recommend to bring a towel or small blanket to cover legs during meditation sitting.

What is Chan Meditation
Chan (called "zen" in Japanese) is the most advanced form of Mahayana Buddhist meditation. We follow the tradition of Wei Yang lineage, one of five Chinese Chan schools transmitted by Grand Dharma Master Hsuan Hua. We adapt Chinese Chan training methods to the Western culture and call it "American Chan".

Instructor: Dzung
Dzung is local to San Jose and an structural engineer. He has been training under Master YongHua for several years and participate many intensive meditation retreats. He will volunteer to help you meditate on Fridays.

name: The Bay Area Chan Meditation: Beyond Mindfulness + Master YongHua's Dharma Talk
description:
The Bay Area Chan Meditation: Beyond Mindfulness Meetup at 6-7:30pm in the 7th Floor Lounge.

We present Chan Meditation which is the most advanced form of Mahayana Buddhist meditation at WeWork for your local community and WeWork community. Passed down directly from the Buddha through his lineage of Patriarchs to the present, the power of Chan Meditation has been taught to seekers of enlightenment in Asia for thousands of years.

“Chan Meditation Beyond Mindfulness” presents these ancient skills to the West in an accessible, easy to follow format so we call it "American Chan". From the basic stretches to the all-encompassing foundations of Buddhism, Chan Master YongHua & his disciples will reveal the extraordinary method of Chan Meditation, which can benefit all people, regardless of their religious affiliation.

6:00pm-6:15pm: Reception, Guests can't enter the space prior to 6pm.
6:15pm-6:40pm: Intro to Chan Meditation, posture, techniques
6:40pm-7:00pm: Silent Meditation (15-20mins)
7:00pm-7:30pm: Master YongHua's Dharma Talk.

Dharma Host
Master YongHua came to the United States in 1973 from Vietnam to attend college. He earned a BS degree in Mathematics from the University of Minnesota and an MBA degree from the University of Chicago. After working for the corporate world for decades, he decided to leave the home life to study Chan under Great Master XuanHua in 1995. In 1999, he became fully ordained under Master Mãn Giác. He then went to Taiwan to study Chinese and the Vinaya for two years. He came back to the United States in 2001. He practiced in seclusion until 2005 when he started teaching Chan and accepting disciples. He now devotes his time in propagating Mahayana Pure Land Buddhism and training left home people.

Note: Vacate the space no later than 8pm. We must reset & organize the space to its initial condition within 1 hour after 8pm.

name: DISTANCE ENERGY HEALING WORKS. Quantum Energy Healing
description:
DISTANCE QUANTUM HEALING SESSIONS

Private and one-on-one appointments . Make yours now...

Everyone has a bio-energy field. As we work with this field to raise vibrations and induce healing on psychic, physical, emotional and psychological levels, you will feel tingling and warmth, and buzzing.

In these personal one-on-one sessions , the transformation to health will begin as you feel a shift in bio- energy consciousness, vibrating at higher and faster levels than ever before.

This heightened energy shift gives you the boost to shift attention away from pain or trouble areas in your body and divert your mind to a higher plane of consciousness.

Your session will incorporate the following and include:

Next Thursday-Sunday, my good friend, shamanic healer, James Hyman, founder of the Deep Emotional Release Bodywork and Quantum-Theta Healing will be in the S.F. area offering private sessions of his powerful system of healing. These 1 1/2 hour sessions for most people, are life-changing, in that James helps you to identify and release long-held repressed emotional energy from the chakras and other energy centers in the body, as well as negative patterns from the subconscious mind that are keeping you blocked and stuck. The release of this blocked energy and unwanted patterns helps all of the body's energy fields come into balance, for a person, usually, for the first time in many years. They feel, "themselves", again, and better able to connect with their world from an authentic place of personal power and creative self-expression. Also, they're more connected with their intuition, instinct, Higher Self, and emotional and physical well-being.

Every time we work with James, stuff comes up that we're not expecting, and it goes deep, and it gets cleared. After that, life feels more deeply in balance. We never know what's going to come up in the session, until we're there, but it feels so good to shake off the cobwebs, go to the core of our emotional issues, gain clarity, and feel that radiant energy surging through our body once again. Colors seem brighter, meditation seems deeper. I remember the first time someone scheduled 5 sessions back to back. We couldn't believe it! That person left an entirely different human being. She proceeded to write several best-selling books and become a nationally known psychic and friend to the famous.

James has worked with many amazing people, and some of the most famous people in the world. They use his work, as many do, as a tool to help them attain their highest potential, and a support system to help them get through the toughest of times.

Please feel free to call, text or email Barbara (me) for any information about Jim's work. I'll be happy to answer any questions you may have. I've worked with James now for over 30 years. I'll break down the session for you, if you like, and explain the various techniques he applies, and help you understand what you can expect from the work, in terms of results, and experience.

name: PASSIONATE ABOUT CONSCIOUSNESS & SPIRITUALITY?
description:
Let's break down the silos...Come mingle and network with other like-minded individuals and communities passionate about consciousness and spirituality!

We're looking to have a monthly Happy Hour as a regular event, on the first Thursday evening each month.

This is a purely social event meant to bring together the plethora of spiritual communities in the Bay Area.

Leaders and members of meetup groups with a focus on consciousness, spirituality and healing are more than welcome, and we encourage you to share this with your group. Please feel free to use this event to bring together your members and keep connected, while building connections with other groups.

We look forward to meeting you!

name: NATURE WALK CONNECTING FAMILIES 2-5YO TODDLER PREK - FUN, ENGAGING, CHILD-LED
description:
This trip is at the suggestion of some parents in this group. The trail features beautiful wild flowers and is primarily used for hiking, walking, nature trips, birding, and is accessible year-round. Note, dogs are also able to use this trail.

What to expect:
* 9:30am Welcome - intro, share names, bring awareness to space, and body movements/stretching
* Nature walk - follow the lead and interests of children while incorporating rich and encouraging language
* 10:30am Snack break & book time - healthy nut free snacks (string cheese, fruit, cracker) to be provided (bring your own water).
* Nature walk - make our way back to meet up point
* 11:15am Closing - practice gratitude say thank you to land, space, review some highlights from walk, say our goodbyes

What to bring:
• Water bottle
• Comfortable closed toe shoes
• Change of clothes
• Long pants

Helpful info:
Bathrooms. The only bathrooms are the port-a-potties next to the parking lot.

name: Scott Ainslie
description:
Steeped in traditional music from both sides of the color line, Scott Ainslie is a renowned acoustic blues guitarist, singer and songwriter. He learned southern old-time ballads, banjo and fiddle from senior musicians in North Carolina and West Virginia and blues from his black elders in North Carolina, Virginia, South Carolina, Georgia and Mississippi: his roots are deep.

“My mother found me at the family piano picking out the melodies from the records she listened to during the day when I was three.

I’m one of the lucky ones: I’ve been a musician all my life”

– Scott Ainslie, https://cattailmusic.com/

After 8 years of hosting in Windsor, we relocated our house concert series to our friend’s home in the lovely hills above Santa Rosa CA. It is the same group of people, a consistent list of excellent entertainers, and well, the same event name because I bought the URL and no one had a better name.

Our events are private and by invitation only. If you wish to attend one of our house concerts, please send an email to scottn-at-sonic.net (replace the -at- with an @), indicating the concert you wish to attend and the requested number of seats.

We strategically place a donation basket for the artist and the requested donation is $20 per person.

We look forward to sharing a night of music with you!

name: Duo Violão Plus 1
description:
Duo Violão Plus 1: Brazilian Jazz, Samba, & Choro

On tour from Rio de Janeiro, Duo Violão Brasil presents a special evening of choro featuring compositions by Baden Powell, Pixinguinha, Radames Gnattali, as well as originals by Rogerio Souza. They will be accompanied by special guest percussionist Ami Molinelli.

Rogerio Souza – 7-string guitar
Edinho Gerber – 7-string guitar
Ami Molinelli – percussion

Duo Violão Brasil is the result of guitarists Rogério Souza and Edinho Gerber’s reverence for Brazilian guitar—the violão—and their desire to explore and expand the musical possibilities of putting two “violões” together. With a repertoire from composers like Pixinguinha, Baden Powell, and Tom Jobim, the duo navigates effortlessly through the many styles of 20th century Brazilian popular music while showcasing original works and inventive arrangements.

$15-20 sliding scale. Ticket availability at the door is limited and contingent on online sales. For details, see Red Poppy Art House (http://redpoppyarthouse.org/event/duo-violao-20181025/).

name: The Austin Lounge Lizards
description:
Halloween at the Freight
The Fright & Salvage Presents: The Austin Lounge Lizards

The Austin Lounge Lizards are arguably the perfect pairing of their hometown’s slogan, “Live Music Capital of the World,” and its unofficial motto, “Keep Austin Weird.” Since 1980, the Lizards have been spoofing topics American families try to avoid at the Thanksgiving table: subjects like politics, religion, romance, and themselves. With pointed lyrics, precise harmonies and instrumental expertise, the band has become legendary for its satirical skewering through song.

The Lizards originated in 1976 in New Jersey, when Hank Card (vocals, rhythm guitar) and Conrad Deisler (vocals, lead guitar, mandolin) met as mutual history majors at Princeton University and started songwriting together. Following graduation, both Hank, a native Oklahoman, and Conrad, a Tex-Cali-Connecticut-Venezuelan, ended up in Austin. University of Georgia philosophy graduate and banjo/dobro player Tom Pittman completed the founding-troubadour trifecta in 1980, and the Austin Lounge Lizards was born.

Wednesday, October 31st
Doors: 7:00 pm / Show: 8:00 pm
$20 ADV / $24 DOOR (plus fees)
All tickets are subject to an additional $4 per ticket facility fee.

See Freight & Salvage (https://www.thefreight.org/event/1733255-fright-salvage-austin-berkeley/) for details.

The self-proclaimed “Most Laughable Band in Show Business” features pointed lyrics, precise harmonies and instrumental expertise.

name: SF Mandolin Orchestra: "Grand Tour" (Piedmont)
description:
Three hundred years ago European men and women of means took “The Grand Tour” of the continent in search of art, culture, and learning.

And now YOU can take a musical “Grand Tour” with the SF Mandolin Orchestra. Our fall program features orchestral works from Germany, Spain, Italy, and other countries representing the heart of European culture. Our musical journey will include:

* Violin Concerto in A Minor by J.S. Bach, featuring our music director Achille Bocus as mandolin soloist
* Notturno in Sol by Italian composer Giuseppe Martucci
* March from the opera Fidelio by Ludwig van Beethoven
* Excerpts from Joaquín Rodrigo’s guitar concerto Fantasia Para un Gentilhombre, featuring soloist Nicholas Martin
…and much more.

Concerts are family-friendly. Admission is $20 general, $15 student/senior, and free for children 12 and under. Tickets may be purchased at the door, or at our ticketing site: http://www.brownpapertickets.com/producer/597471

name: Strunz & Farah
description:
“Strunz & Farah have distinguished themselves as two of the planet’s most gifted acoustic guitarists.” – Guitar Player

Strunz & Farah, performing together since 1980, have created an entirely new expression for the acoustic guitar. From Costa Rica and Iran respectively, Jorge Strunz and Ardeshir Farah have brought the cultural riches of their native lands to their highly virtuosic, rhythmic, and improvisation-rich original instrumental compositions.

Strunz and Farah’s new studio recording, Tales of Two Guitars, is the latest chapter in the continuing story of the two virtuoso guitarists who have created an original and enduring body of guitar music. Rhythmic and colorful, and recorded with 11 guest musicians, Tales is a musical storybook of a fully evolved style of playing and composing which has been highly influential among guitarists from all parts. The new recording has 13 original pieces, full of contrasts both compositionally and instrumentally, ranging from the rhythmic to the romantic to the jazzy, incorporating in varying degrees their classic mix of Latin, Middle Eastern and Jazz influences.

For details, see Freight & Salvage (https://www.thefreight.org/event/1728935-strunz-farah-berkeley/).

name: Wednesday Stitch-In
description:
These free events give you the opportunity to stitch in an inspiring environment with fellow enthusiasts. Bring along your needlework projects, embroidery, knitting, crochet, tatting, or even mending, and enjoy the company of others while you create.

San Francisco School of Needlework and Design (SNAD) is a non-profit school that teaches hand embroidery. SNAD has a library of over 3,000 books on needlework which are available for the public to browse during Stitch-Ins. There is also a small design room with a light box, rulers, colored pencils etc. that is available for your use. Additionally, a small shop of embroidery supplies is on site if you need to purchase materials but please note, there is no formal instruction during this event. Feel free to bring your lunch to eat while you stitch!

Regular Stitch-In times:
Weekly Stitch-In: Wednesdays – 11:00 am – 4:00 pm
Late Night Stitch-In: Every last Wednesday of the month – 11:00 am – 9:00 pm
Monthly Saturday Stitch-In: Second Saturday of the month – 11:00 am – 4:00 pm

name: Clothing Swap!
description:
It’s time for a fresh approach to fashion! Instead of buying new, join us at SNAD for a Clothing Swap.
The Clothing Swap will take place from 1-4 pm. Look through your closet for clothing, shoes, or accessories that are still in good condition and bring them in to swap so someone else can enjoy them and give them new life! Entry is $5 if you bring 3 or more items to swap, $8 if you bring less than 3 items, and $15 if you don’t bring any items. The number of items you bring does not dictate how many you can leave with.

There will be wine and nibbles to enjoy during the swap!

We will provide needles and thread and people can also pull from our scrap fabric.

We will demonstrate a number of techniques to the whole class (appliqué etc.) but we will focus on helping each individual with their own separate projects. Space is limited.

name: Autonomous
description: An indentured military robot and his handler track a pharma-IP pirate across the globe when a reverse-engineered work-productivity drug starts killing people.

name: Before She Sleeps by Bina Shah
description:
In modern, beautiful Green City, the capital of South West Asia, gender selection, war and disease have brought the ratio of men to women to alarmingly low levels. The government uses terror and technology to control its people, and women must take multiple husbands to have children as quickly as possible.

Yet there are women who resist, women who live in an underground collective and refuse to be part of the system. Secretly protected by the highest echelons of power, they emerge only at night, to provide to the rich and elite of Green City a type of commodity that nobody can buy: intimacy without sex. As it turns out, not even the most influential men can shield them from discovery and the dangers of ruthless punishment.

This dystopian novel from one of Pakistan’s most talented writers is a modern-day parable, The Handmaid’s Tale about women’s lives in repressive Muslim countries everywhere. It takes the patriarchal practices of female seclusion and veiling, gender selection, and control over women’s bodies, amplifies and distorts them in a truly terrifying way to imagine a world of post-religious authoritarianism.

name: Sketching in October @ Someplace Awesome [Save the Date!]
description: Save the date! The meetup will be announced when a location is decided.

name: Black Friday 2018 : Sketching @ Tilden Botanical Garden
description:
Join the East Bay Sketchers as we meet up with an existing sketching event hosted by Chris Grampp and the Design and drawing students from Merritt College's Landscape Horticulture and Landscape Architecture programs (http://merrittlandhort.com/).

Meet at the Tilden Botanical Garden, at the intersection of Wildcat Canyon Road and South Park Drive in Tilden Regional Park.

We'll gather at 11am at the entry, and spend a few hours sketching and enjoying the park.

Bring

• paper and pencils (or whatever you like to use to draw),

• a portable chair

• a lunch

• Jacket, hat, sunscreen, umbrella, depending. ;)

And bring everyone you know (including your family; if they don't sketch they can walk around this beautiful garden, and if they become impatient you can have them weed while you draw). Dress for variable weather; The past few years we have had a great time at this event, and the weather looks like...fall weather: mid 50s to low 60s (but can be quite warm in the sun).

Work off that big meal with an exciting day sketching!

Note: Parking is available in the free lot across the street; arrive early to get a spot. There is also limited parking along the road.

Bathrooms are available in the park parking lot.

name: Meditations For a Joyful Life with Kadampa Buddhist Teacher
description:
Weekly guided meditations and Buddhist teachings are offered in Downtown San Francisco for your convenience. These classes provide a basic introduction to Buddhist teachings and meditation techniques that are suitable for beginners as well as more advanced meditation practitioners. Through these classes we can learn how to use Buddha’s advice in our daily lives to solve our problems and find the peace and happiness we seek.

These classes are offered as a series, but they are also self contained and can be taken individually. Please feel free to drop in on a class-by-class basis. $8/class

No special clothing is required. No pre-registration required

name: Code for America Civic Hack Night (weekly)
description:
(This event is cross-posted from our partner, Code for SF Civic Hack Night. Their main Meetup page is here: https://www.meetup.com/Code-for-San-Francisco-Civic-Hack-Night/ )

Interested in helping San Francisco? You have found the right place!

Join neighbors, government employees, designers, coders, students and more! Our weekly hack night is focused on civic tech and making government services better in San Francisco. We hack/build and learn together every Wednesday evening.

• Contribute to the betterment of San Francisco

• Build your own portfolio of work or work on someone else's cool project

• Meet new (and different!) people

Interested in our current projects (http://codeforsanfrancisco.org/projects/)?

Schedule

6:00p doors open, socialize and eat dinner

6:30p welcome remarks, (often) a presentation, and project pitches

7:00p start hacking or stay for new member orientation

8:00p more hacking

9:00p keep on hacking

10:00p doors close and lights out.

Check out our website (http://codeforsanfrancisco.org/). Read/contribute to our code (https://github.com/sfbrigade). Communicate via our slack team (http://c4a.me/cfsfslack) (or IRC Freenode #sfbrigade).

If you have questions, please reach out over Slack, contact the organizers via meetup, or drop by on Wednesday evening.

Code for San Francisco is a chapter of the Code for America Brigade program. (http://brigade.codeforamerica.org/)

name: Impactathon® Customer Success for Good
description:
Please make sure to register on Eventbrite: https://www.eventbrite.com/e/impactathon-customer-success-for-good-tickets-50845449107 You have to be registered there to secure your spot.

SFTech4Good is paring up with Customer Success for Good, https://www.meetup.com/Customer-Success-for-Good/, and Innov8social, https://www.innov8social.com/, to explore the intersection of Customer Success and social impact

Customer Experience (CX) and Customer Success (CS) are fast-growing departments within Cloud-based companies. CX/CS leaders accelerate business growth through close engagement with customers and partners. The goal of Impactathon® Customer Success for Good is to discuss ways CX/CS professionals can drive social impact and solve societal challenges. Corporate social responsibility(CSR) goals are easier to achieve by developing a conscientious customer success program.

Join this event to:

Listen to honest, candid experiences and perspectives from thought leaders and participants in the Customer Success for Good space; hear about their successes and challenges and how they continually pivot to pursue both CS milestones and social impact.

Join teams and engage in rounds of ideation around ways Customer Success can innovate to better incorporate and pursue social impact.
Work in small groups to build an idea and 'mini pitch'. Beyond the idea, you will have a chance to build relationships with motivated, talented individuals aligned with a shared goal of creating social impact that can create community beyond Impactathon.

Meet & network with industry professionals in the Customer Success space

Enjoy light snacks with new friends

Don't forget! Please register on Eventbrite: https://www.eventbrite.com/e/impactathon-customer-success-for-good-tickets-50845449107

description:
Our monthly Coffee Club is a perfect place to meet new people, talk bikes, share tips and caffeinate together. If you’re new to riding or interested but haven’t gotten rolling yet, this is a perfect place to find riding buddies and answer some of your questions about biking in SF.

Bring your ideas, questions and friends. The more the merrier!

Women Bike SF is an SF Bicycle Coalition program that aims to encourage and inspire more women, trans* and female-identified individuals to ride bikes with social events, rides and workshops.

name: Reiki share in the Castro
description:
Hello, Reiki Healers!

Come practice giving and receiving Reiki on Wednesday, January 10th from 6:30-9:30pm. 

Treat yourself to nurturing self care and recharge your energy. Enjoy a relaxing evening and connect with friendly faces in your local Reiki community. 

We’ll drink tea, talk about Reiki, and do a short meditation… and then we’ll practice Reiki on two luxurious massage tables. 

Celebrate Life is a private space with a stereo, tea station, restroom and a crystal altar. And it's all charged up with amazing Reiki energy. :)

I’m asking a $10 donation to help cover the cost of renting the space, but no one is turned away for lack of funds. 

PLEASE BE REIKI ATTUNED (at any level) and bring your newly attuned friends!

We can't wait to see you there! 

Pure LOVE-

Tommi

Mission Dharma: Meditation and Talk with Howard Cohn
description:
Mission Dharma is a sangha led by our teacher Howard Cohn that has gathered in ​the Mission District of San Francisco for over 30 years. Sangha members come together as a community on Tuesday nights for meditation and to hear Buddhist teachings. As a sangha, we support one another in the process of awakening in order to live our lives with more mindfulness, compassion, and joy. Everyone is invited to attend. No prior meditation experience is necessary.

Format:  A forty-minute meditation period followed by a Dharma talk led by Howie or a visiting teacher. Doors open at 7pm and sit starts at 7:30.

Cost: Contributions to Mission Dharma are tax deductible.  In order to help cover the cost of our room rental, other weekly operating costs, and to adequately support our teachers, there is a suggested dana offering of $5-$25 on Tuesday nights. However, we want to be welcoming to individuals from all  financial  backgrounds and a monetary offering is never an expectation. Giving is done anonymously, so no one is ever turned away due to lack of funds. If you wish to offer dana, you are invited to offer it online or on Tuesday nights. ​

name: People of Color Meditation and Dharma Talk
description: People of Color (POC) Meditation and Dharma talk led by Victoria Cary and Tara Mulay. For self-identified people of color. 30 minute meditation followed by a dharma talk on various aspects of mindfulness and Buddhist teachings. In person at our SF center (doors open at 5:30pm, sit starts at 6pm), we usually get 25-50 non-meetup folks attending, so there's a lot more than what shows up on the Meetup page.

name: Meditation and Dharma Talk with Eve Ekman, Pawan Bareja, Chandra Easton
description: Weekly class with Eve Ekman, Pawan Bareja, Chandra Easton. 30 minute meditation followed by a dharma talk on various aspects of mindfulness and Buddhist teachings, including Tonglen and Lojong. In person at our SF center (doors open at 7pm, sit starts at 7:30), we usually get 30-50 non-meetup folks attending, so there's a lot more than what shows up on the Meetup page.

name: LGBTQ+ Thursday Job Club @ SF LGBT Center
description:
Join us weekly on Thursdays from 6:00pm-7:30pm at the SF LGBT Center: 1800 Market Street, 2nd floor.

• Connect with fellow job seekers to share successes and challenges in your recent job search

• Ask questions and receive support + resources from onsite volunteers that are professional recruiters from multiple industries (we currently have a large number of volunteers attending so you will be able to receive lots of advice and feedback)

• Improve your resume and interview skills

• Learn about upcoming events (https://www.eventbrite.com/o/sf-lgbt-community-center-2408492250) with employer partners, community partners and the Center

Your RSVP is helpful but if your plans change, feel free to join us. Please be prompt--we begin introductions early to ensure everyone gets the most out of the group.

name: Monthly Informal Coffee Meetup
description:
Start the weekend off right! Join us for our first monthly coffee meeting at Sightglass Coffee on 7th.

This is an opportunity to mingle with fellow local investors in an informal setting (rather than an office in the FiDi). No agenda, no sales pitches, no Powerpoint slides or handouts!

name: DSA SF Monthly Meeting
Intro to DSA
Ingleside: The Acts of the Apostles
description:
What was it like to be among the very first disciples of Jesus Christ? How did his teachings shape the way those people lived in community and interacted with the world around them?

Terms like “Christianity” and “church” have come to be associated with a wide variety of ideas over the centuries. In this weekly study, our intention is to go back to the beginning. We’ll observe what was being taught by Jesus’ apostles and what was being practiced by the earliest Christians. We’ll see how problems were dealt with, how doctrinal questions were answered, and how the gospel has changed lives as long as it has been preached. In looking to the Scriptures for what happened in the past, we hope to find practical answers to the questions we have today.

name: Financial District: The Psalms
description:
The Psalms contain some of the richest texts in the Bible, covering a wide range of subjects, with some of the most candid expressions of human emotion. Furthermore, many of these writings contain fascinating Messianic prophecies as the authors looked ahead to the life and work of Jesus Christ.

We hope to provide a weekly opportunity for those who might be able to spend their midday lunch break reading and discussing God's Word. Since each study will be more or less self-contained, feel free to drop in whenever your schedule allows. Invite your friends and coworkers, feel free to bring some lunch, and let's enjoy these beautiful Scriptures together.

name: The Mission: The Gospel of Mark
description:
We will be reading and talking our way through Mark's account of the Gospel. Our aim in doing this is to explore the life and ministry of Jesus of Nazareth, to consider how it affects our own life and perspective, and determine what God is asking of those who believe in Him.

Whether you are a seasoned Christian or someone who wants to see what the Bible is all about, all are welcome to join us! If you're able, bring a copy of the Bible (book or app) with you. We are looking forward to exploring and studying with you!

name: Prosperity Partners BNI Meeting - Ft. Elliot Bartz, Commercial Insurance Broker
description:
Elliot is an experienced commercial and business insurance broker with in depth knowledge about how to properly insure any type of business or property. This week, Elliot will discuss how to properly insure a mixed use commercial building. This presentation is perfect for anyone that owns property or wants to understand a little more about how insurance works when different people occupy a building owned by someone else. Questions are always welcome!

Our meetings involve a general meet and greet with refreshments, followed by a structured meeting where we discuss growing the group, our various activities, and growing each of our individual businesses. There is always a presentation by a member of the group on a topic that is pertinent to the business of that members. Guests and visitors are always welcome. We finish by passing any referrals to other members, discussing upcoming events and explaining the membership application process. We'd love to meet you! =]

name: Amazing Galapagos with Ecuador Trip
description:
MEMBERS OF SUPERFABULICOUS HIKING RECEIVES $50 OFF THIS TRIP!!

We did this trip last several years ago and it was an incredible experience. We've been getting more and more requests to repeat it, so here it is.

It's a great Galapagos package that you won’t find anywhere else featuring a 5-night package with accommodations right on 3 of the islands as well as 1-night in Quito, 3-nights in Banos, Ecuador for some great nature and adventure tours and finally 1-night in Guayaquil.

First, we’ll have just one night in Quito as our flight will arrive around midnight on the 2nd. The next morning we'll take a morning tour of the historic town and square before departing for Banos, 3-hours away. This is a new offering for us and has been highly recommended and featured in many travel articles for it's beauty and adventure tours. It’s a beautiful city with jungle activities surrounding it. CLICK HERE for some idea of the optional tours in Banos. We'll spend 3-nights in Banos at a nice boutique hotel and enjoy tours such as horseback riding, canyoning, zip-lining, hiking to a waterfall and more.

From there we fly on to the Galapagos on the 6th for our 6-day package with our 3-island tour.

We start off all together at Baltra Island but since 16 is the maximum number of people this tour will accommodate due to the limited accommodations on the island of Floreana we will then split into 2 groups. One group will visit first Floreana island for 2 nights while the other group will visit Isabella Island for 2 nights. The groups will then switch and will end up all together again for night 5 of our Galapagos adventure in Santa Cruz.

You'll be able to snorkel with sea lions and penguins, see giant land turtles, exotic birds that are not afraid of humans, iguanas that swim, baby seals that come right up to you and more unique experience that you will only experience in the Galapagos. For a complete day by day itinerary with info on what you’ll see go CLICK HERE The lodge at Floreana (photo at left) is especially cool with direct oceanfront accommodations. You'll be watching sea lions play and even look at you while you sit on your deck!

We travel between the islands by high speed boat. Each journey is about 2 hours. In January the seas are relatively calm. There will also be an option to fly.

After our Galapagos portion of the trip we will then fly to Guayquil for 1 night. You will enjoy the oceanfront boardwalk and some free time in this city before flying back home the next day.

This is an incredible singles vacation and much more interesting than a cruise, and less money too! Total cost of this package with all air and tours is just $4,750. That’s a terrific rate on this trip plus you will love spending each evening on the islands listening to all the sounds and being able to roam around. Cost also includes all food and tours while in Galapagos and daily breakfast in Quito and Guayaquil. Sign up early as we are limited to just 32 people $200 deposit to sign up.

INCLUDES:

Round trip international air from LAX

• Important to know

THIS TRIP IS BEING RUN BY ED REDER FROM SINGLES IN PARADISE

GO TO http://www.SinglesInParadise.com FOR MORE INFORMATION ON OUR COMPANY
