name: JAPAN VACATION WITH AIR 10-nights hotel, Bullet Train, daily breakfast and more!
description:
TOKYO & KYOTO

Just $3,489 with air, 10-nights hotel, Bullet Train, transfers, daily breakfast,
ground transportation and more!

Members of Superfabulicious Hiking receives $50 off this trip!!!

I've been talking up our last trip to Japan for the last several years. It was absolutely amazing in so many ways. So here you have a repeat of our 2016 trip with very few changes. Although it is known as an expensive destination, with the power of our group rates and great air contract we are very pleased at the affordability of this offering.

We depart the US on April 17th and arrive in Japan the afternoon of April 18th after a brief stop in South Korea (you are welcome to inquire about a deviation to spend time on your own there). We will have 4-nights in Tokyo to experience this amazing city.

TOURS:

We will have a variety of optional tours set up. Our itinerary will bring you to the most scenic places to enjoy mother nature.

Included in this package is a full day Tokyo tour with stops to four of Tokyo's popular sightseeing spots: Tokyo Tower, the East Gardens of the Imperial Palace, Sumida River Cruise, and Asakusa Kannon temple.

We will offer a wonderful day trip to Nikko and a cycling tour as well.

After our 4-days in Tokyo we will board the bullet train for the 3-hour ride to Kyoto. In route we will visit Mt Fuji, Japan's tallest mountain and active volcano. We will take a boat ride on Lake Ashinoko and experience the Komagatake Ropeway. This tour is also included in your package.

Kyoto has been awarded the "World's Best City" award for 2015 by Travel and Leisure magazine! It served as Japan's capital and the emperor's residence from 794 until 1868.

We will offer several different optional tours to visit the most important places and world heritage sites. One of these sites is called Daigo-ji Temple. This special place spreads across Daigo-san Mountain and is well-known as the "Temple of Flowers". The five-story pagoda, Goju-no-to is now the oldest building in Kyoto having survived the Onin War in the 1400's.

One of our day tours will take us Ton the Sagano Scenic Railway, a sightseeing train line that runs along the Hozugawa River between Arashiyama and Kameoka. From there we will take a little hike to a place called Monkey Park Iwatayama. From here we'll visit Saga-Toriimoto Preserved Street. Much of this street along the way to the Adashino Nenbutsuji Temple has been preserved in the style of the Meiji Period [masked]).

Another day tour will be a full day in Kyoto and Nara where we will discover the history and religions of ancient Japan during this 10-hour exploration of Kyoto and Nara including UNESCO World Heritage-listed Kinkaku-ji and Nijo Castle, along with its Imperial Palace. We'll also visit Nara's deer park and have a chance to feed and pet wild deer.

Another tour will take us to Eastern Kyoto where we will have number of stops including The Philosopher's Path, the historic shopping streets of the Higashiyama District, Kiyomizudera Temple and Eikando a large temple that is especially nice to visit in autumn when the leaves change.

We will have a free day in Kyoto with some suggestions including a nice walk up to the Fushimi Inari Shrine where you can enjoy a torii path across the mountain (When the wish is fulfilled the torii that wrote the name was built). It's a beautiful trail winding up a hill past several small temples.

We will send out a complete list of the optional tours as we get a little closer to the trip.

This will certainly be an amazing trip. A $200 deposit will lock in your spot.

TRIP INCLUDES:

4 Nights double occupancy in Tokyo - 6 nights in Kyoto
Daily breakfast
Full day Tokyo tour
Bullet Train from Tokyo to Kyoto
Ground Transportation for Transfers
Tour on Apri 22nd to Mt Fuji with boat ride and ropeway

TRIP DOES NOT INCLUDE:
Departure tax on the international air of $433 (subject to change up until ticketing).

SINGLE SUPPLEMENT (your own room, otherwise we will match you up with a roommate): $900

GO TO THE WEBSITE FOR THIS TRIP http://www.singlesinparadise.com/singlesvacations_japan%2019.htm

Sign up for this Trip! (https://secure.hostwizard.org/singlesinparadise.com/form/rsvp.php)

name: Thailand Deluxe Vacation with Bangkok and Krabi
description:
THAILAND DELUXE VACATION WITH BANGKOK AND KRABI

10-Nights, Deluxe 4-star hotels and air from LAX just $2,695

MEMBERS OF SUPERFABULICIOUS HIKING AND OUTDOOR RECEIVES $50 OFF THIS TRIP!!!

This will be our 5th trip to Thailand and is always a wonderful trip. Thailand is exotic, beautiful, and thrillingly different. We will repeat our 2014relaxing trip with just two stops - 3-nights in Bangkok and 7-nights in Krabi.

We are flying on Cathay Pacific on a red-eye arriving on May 1st at 12:30 am, arriving in Bangkok May 2nd. Our flight from LAX routes through Hong Kong so let us know if you wish to spend any time there on your own either before or after our trip. The next 2 days we will plan a a couple of optional half day tours - the Grand Palace and a Klong tour of the canals.

Our hotel, the 4-1/2 star Eastin Grand Hotel Sathorn was chosen for it's high ranking on Tripadvisor (9 out of 721 hotels in Bangkok!) and the tram system stops right at the hotel, not to mention the beautiful rooms and infinity pool at the top of the roof! Everyone will enjoy upgraded rooms to the Executive floor with not just amazing views but some incredible benefits including free open bar for 2 hours every night complete with an incredible spread of hors dourves, soups, salads and desserts! This hotel was a huge hit on our last Thailand trip. You will love it!

After our 3 nights in Bangkok we will depart for the amazing coastline with our visit to Krabi. You will love this town and it's easy access to the slands located just a short boat ride away. Krabi Town is majestically situated among impossibly angular limestone karsts jutting from the mangroves. The distinguishing feature of both Krabi and neighboring Phang Nga is the massive limestone karsts, rising vertiginously out of the flat rice paddies on land and as islands from the sea.

Krabi abounds with countless natural attractions that never fail to impress. Such attractions include white sandy beaches, crystal clear water, fascinating coral reefs, caves and waterfalls, as well as numerous islands. We'll organize optional tours into the interior jungle for river rafting ATVing, Caving, Ziplining, and even elephant riding and head to the ocean for snorkeling, island hoping and scuba diving. There is just so much to do including visiting spas, hot springs and other sight seeing and in Thailand our dollars goes a LONG WAY. Click here for the list of optional activities (these rates may change slightly as this is from our 2015 trip). Plus there are the gorgeous beaches and excellent scuba diving.

Our hotel is the 4-star Centara Anda Dhevi Resort & Spa Krabi which is convienently located in the heart of Krabi. It's another luxury resort that will certainly please. Read more below. Early signups will get poolside rooms.

Cost, for the international air, domestic air and 10-nights accommodations with daily breakfast at these two 4-star hotels is just $2,695 plus departure tax. Don't miss what we certainly be another wonderful trip to paradise.

DEPOSIT - $200 to sign up

SINGLE SUPPLEMENT (your own room) is $750

GO TO THE WEBSITE FOR THIS TRIP: http://www.singlesinparadise.com/singlesvacations_thailand%202018.htm

GO TO OUR WEBSITE FOR MORE INFORMATION ON OUR COMPANY: http://www.SinglesInParadise.com

name: BHUTAN, INDIA, AND MALDIVES
description:
DESCRIPTION:

Bhutan, India and Maldives

May 13th to 27th

Featuring Bhutan with the Tiger's Lair Monastery, the Golden Triangle with Delhi, Agra (Taj Mahal), Jaipur,

and 3-nights in the Maldives

$4,850 with 12 nights hotel, international and domestic air transfers,

departure taxes, all tours in India and Bhutan, all meals in Bhutan

OR: just India and Maldives - May 17th - 27th

$3,750 for 8-night trip with 5-nights in India and 3-nights in Maldives

MEMBERS OF SUPERFABULICIOUS HIKING AND OUTDOOR RECEIVES $50 OFF THIS TRIP.

Come join us on this amazing adventure and visit some of most interesting and sacred temples and palaces in the world as well as the most beautiful island chain. This amazing itinerary will have us moving about quite a bit but it will be well worth it when, at the end of the trip, you have experienced something truly unique and come away with these incredible memories. This is not the cheapest trip but it is an extremely interesting and diverse itinerary that you won't find anywhere else. I am quite confident that, although it is an expensive trip the price we are offering is an amazing rate.

We will have 2 options - either the entire trip including Bhutan or without Bhutan for just India and the Maldives. This will be my 2nd trip to India and I can say that it is fascinating. You see things you certainly won't see anywhere else. It's a very peaceful country and of course everyone should have the Taj Mahal on their bucket list. I am using the same tour operator that we used for our Nepal and Tibet trip and they did a very good job for us. They were encouraging me to include Bhutan at that time and it's been on my bucket list ever since.

We arrive in Delhi on May 14th. We spend one night then fly on to Bhutan. Then we have the relaxing part of this trip - the Maldives. Certainly a destination on many people's bucket list.

Nestled in the Eastern Himalayas between China and India, the small Buddhist Kingdom of Bhutan opened itself to the outside world only in 1960s. Hithertho, it had been largely mysterious even to its neighbours but abandoning its self-imposed policy of isolation had it grappling to find a precarious balance between modernization and the preservation of its culture and traditions. It manages to hold onto its unique identity that makes it unlike any other country in the world with a population of just over 0.7 million.

We spend 3-nights in Bhutan and enjoy a nice variety of tours. All meal are included in this leg of the trip and we will do the epic hike to Takshang (Tiger's Lair) monastery, Bhuitan's most famous sight.

We fly back to Delhi on the 18th. This is also the day that the second group arrives who were not signed up for Bhutan.

We now begin our India tour with all the amazing sites of the Golden Triangle including the Taj Mahal, the pink city of Jaipur, the Amber Fort, the Agra Fort and more. We will cover a lot over the next 5 days.

Finally on May 23rd we fly to the Maldives. Our stay is on the island of Kandoomaafushi at the 4-star Holiday Inn. It's a private island (see photo above) that offers beachfront and over water bungalows. At this point you've earned your 3-days of paradise and what a great way to cap off this epic trip! Enjoy the world's best snorkeling and diving.

Our website has much more information including hotel links and the complete itinerary for this trip.

Go to the website for this trip

INCLUDES:

12-night or 8-night accommodations grade A hotels in Bhutan (3-star), 4 and 5 stars in India

Three meals a day breakfast, lunch & dinner in Bhutan, Only breakfast in India

DOES NOT INCLUDE:

India e-Visa - $60

Bhutan Visa - $40

SINGLE SUPPLEMENT:

FULL TRIP WITH BHUTAN: $950

INDIA AND MALDIVES ONLY: $750

name: EASTER ISLAND AND SANTIAGO, CHILE
description:
Santiago, Chile and Easter Island

9 NIGHTS INCLUDING AIR AND DEPARTURE TAX FROM LAX - $3,650
June 19th to 30th

MEMBERS OF SUPERFABULICIOUS HIKING MEETUP MEMBERS RECEIVE $50 OFF THIS TRIP!!!

Here's another new trip for us! That is Easter Island is new and Santiago, Chille we have brought a group to in the past and looking forward to returning.

We start off with 4-nights in Santiago where we will enjoy a diverse choice of tours ranging from taking walks along the Paseo Ahumada, wine tasting, hiking the mountains of Patagonia to a natural mineral hot spring, bicycling and more. Click here to see the tours

The old town of Santiago offers stalls selling trinkets and surrounded by Colonial buildings and full of street painters and musicians who perform all sorts of concerts on the stage. Climbing up the exuberantly landscaped Santa Lucía hill - via a maze of swirling stairways, turrets and fountains - is an essential part of the Santiago experience. Your reward is sweeping views over the city. The narrow streets and village-like atmosphere of Bellavista, the capital’s arty, bohemian quarter, make for a great wander.

We’ll offer a wine tasting tour that was one of the highlights of our last trip with a beautiful setting. There are also many excellent beaches about an hour and a half’s bus ride away.

On the 24th we will fly to Easter Island, the mysterious island that has had researchers baffled for years.

We will set up a variety of day tours including visits to the key Moais around the island, volcanoes, caves, beaches and craters.

For a full day by day itinerary please go to the official web page for this trip. http://www.singlesinparadise.com/easter_island_singles_vacations_trips_travel.htm

After our 4-nights on Easter Island we fly back to Santiago and spend one more night. We felt it was best to break up our flights and not try to return home in one day. We will have another full day on the 29th before heading to the airport for our 9:25 pm flight that gets us back to LA early Sunday morning the 30th.

This will certainly be another epic trip that you will love. We're also very happy with the price we've been able to bring this in at which includes not just the air but also the departure tax!

INCLUDES:

Round trip international air from LAX (deduct $1,700 with your own air)
9-nights accommodations (double occ.)
All ground transportation
Guide service in Santiago
Daily Breakfast
Single supplement: $850

Deduct $1,700 with your own air

name: TAHITI DREAM VACATION
description:
TAHITI DREAM VACATION

July 9th to July 21st

5-nights at the Mai Tai Resort in Bora Bora
5-nights at the Manava Resort in Moorea
1-night on Papeete, Tahiti at the Manava Resort

Price - Just $3,879 with Air

MEMBERS OF SUPERFABULICIOUS HIKING RECEIVES $50 OFF THIS TRIP!!

OUR 13th TRIP TO TAHITI!

This trip will have it all - 11-nights of island hopping bliss. We'll start off with 5-nights on Bora Bora.

Bora Bora is an island that is completely magical. Undoubtedly the most celebrated island in the South Pacific - Bora Bora is French Polynesia's leading lady. From the day you arrive until the moment you part ways, you will be in awe of how her soaring mountain peaks, turquoise lagoon and luxuriant overwater bungalows somehow look even more spectacular than the pictures. Well have great tours planned here including a 4-wheel drive tour, a wave runner tour, snorkeling circle island tour where you can pet sting rays, scuba diving and more.

Next up - 5-nights on Moorea. This is a small island that is mostly unchanged over the last 50 years. It's quaint pensions and cute restaurants, palm trees that dip over the water and the dreamy, multi-hued water in the lagoons that the reef protects. We’ve been given an incredible group discount at the beautiful Manava Resort, a truly upscale, 4-star resort situated in a picturesque setting with an infinity pool, white sand beach and over-water bungalows. We've stayed here many times now and everyone always loves it.

There’s plenty of great sightseeing and tours to do in Moorea including scuba diving and their famous shark feeding,snorkeling with sting rays, dolphins and whales, visiting off-shore motu’s (small islands), 4-wheel jeep safari, motorscooter rentals where you can ride around the whole island or just relaxing by the pool. Once again, this resort is walking distance to several great restaurants that are not overly expensive. Restaurants will even send vans to pick people up.

We will be staying in both Garden Rooms but we also have Gardenpool Bungalows, beach bungalows and premium over-water bungalows reserved. See info below regarding upgrades. All have air conditioning, television and mini bar. The garden pool bungalows offer their own private plunge pool! If you’ve always fanasized about staying in an over-water bungalow, this is your best chance with our group discount. Our stay will also include the fabulous breakfast buffet.

Lastly, we fly back to the main island of Tahiti called Papeete where we'll spend the last night. This is another very nice hotel called Manava with a great view back on the island of Moorea. There's some local fresh seafood trucks walking distance from our hotel that we'll take you to.

We’ll be flying non-stop (just 8-1/2 hours) from LA to Tahiti on Tuesday night to spend a very full 11-days in paradise returning the evening of July 21st. We get terrific group rates from our hotels due to our frequent visits over many years so this really is a very good price for this luxury vacation. $200 deposit will sign you up.

EARLY SIGNUP PERK: The first 25 people to sign up will get ocean view rooms in Bora Bora (see photo with caption "view from our hotel"!

INCLUDES:
• Round trip international air from LAX
• 11-nights accommodations (double occ.)
• All ground transportation
• Daily Breakfast
• Special BBQ night in Moorea with entertainment (a $72 value)

DOES NOT INCLUDE:
• Departure taxes or any fuel surcharge (running $186.54 at the time of this posting. This is almost $250 less than our last Tahiti trip! Subject to change)

SINGLE SUPPLEMENT (if you prefer your own room): $1,175

name: Practice public speaking with Toasters Digest
description:
****Please RSVP to the event AND email [masked] for us to reserve you a seat.****

• What we'll do

Come see what a regular meeting is like! Meetings last an hour and follow a well-organized format. Prior to each meeting, members sign up for roles, which include the Toastmaster, Grammarian, Timer, Speakers, Joke Master, Speech Evaluators, Table Topics Master, and a General Evaluator. Each role is explained in more detail here (https://www.toastmasters.org/Membership/Club-Meeting-Roles).

The Toastmaster selects a topic as the theme for that week's meeting. Speakers are invited to center his/her speech around the theme or to deliver one on a topic of his/her choosing. Although the roles are only open to members, guests are encouraged to speak during Table Topics, which is a fun and engaging exercise for impromptu speaking.

• What to bring

Nothing! Bring yourself and an open mind.

• Learn more about the club!

http://www.toastersdigest.org/

name: Tuesday Night Grappling
description:
NO GI - Bring shorts, singlet, and shirt. Beginners Welcome.

This meetup requires returning members to become members of USAW, WWB, and GGWC - USA Wrestling, Wrestlers Without Borders, and Golden Gate Wrestling Club. These memberships cost about 100$ a year, and cover the insurances needed should you have an accident.

Note: no one in the 2 years that I have been teaching has had an accident. We ask that you go slow, use technique, tap early and tap often, listen to your partner?

name: Kundalini Yoga + Meditation
description:
We’d love for you to welcome one of our new teachers Devi Kiran Kaur. She is an incredible Kundalini Yoga Teacher with a healing presence and a true dedication to Kundalini Yoga. Come join her classes Saturday mornings at 10AM. Our kundalini classes are family friendly, open to beginners, and also for the seasoned yogi. As always, all classes are donation based.
Sat Nam!

name: Aromatherapy Yoga Flow
description: Danae is a passionate yoga teacher with a degree in Dance from Arizona State University. Sharing the practice of yoga both locally and Internationally for 13+ years, Danae draws inspiration from many sources to create her yoga classes, so please come prepared to sweat, smile, and shine. She radiates a playful spirit while still honoring the sacredness of yoga. Danae fosters a nurturing environment encouraging students to explore their vast potential in any given asana, to not hold back while in the pose and in life. What we learn on our mats automatically translates into the other areas of our lives resulting in transformational effects. She wants her students to know that yoga embraces you exactly where you are.

name: Yoga Nidra
description: Danae is a passionate yoga teacher with a degree in Dance from Arizona State University. Sharing the practice of yoga both locally and Internationally for 13+ years, Danae draws inspiration from many sources to create her yoga classes, so please come prepared to sweat, smile, and shine. She radiates a playful spirit while still honoring the sacredness of yoga. Danae fosters a nurturing environment encouraging students to explore their vast potential in any given asana, to not hold back while in the pose and in life. What we learn on our mats automatically translates into the other areas of our lives resulting in transformational effects. She wants her students to know that yoga embraces you exactly where you are.

name: Donation Based Bhakti Vinyasa Flow
description: Bhakti yoga, like any other form of yoga, is a path to self-realization, to having an experience of oneness with everything. Our Bhakti Vinyasa flow is a powerful all-levels practice that guides students through postures with love and devotion. This class will help you build a strong relationship with your body, mind, and spirit. You will find that the classes are infused with meditation, manta, chanting, and dharma. Jump in for a heart opening and fun practice (and a good sweat!).

name: Vinyasa Yoga
description: Amy teaches a rejuvenating and well-rounded Bhakti/Vinyasa flow that is accessible to all levels. Her hands-on classes focus on linking breath, movement, intention and mindfulness, which are woven together with carefully curated music. As a teacher, her goal is to have her students feel positive physically, mentally, and spiritually at the end of each class, and to carry that feeling of inner peace with them through the rest of the day.

name: Donation Based Family + Kids Acro Yoga
description: Bring the kiddos, the grandparents, sitters, cousins. This class is meant for all ages and families of all types to join!

name: Mindful Flow + Meditation
description: Or’s acquaintance with the world of yoga started over 15 years ago when he took an Iyengar class. Through those classes, he encountered the book Light On Yoga by BKS Iyengar. When he read the intro of that book, he realized that Yoga would play an essential role in the rest of his life. From there, he’s participated in numerous workshops in Israel, India, and the U.S. He received his 500-hour Yoga Instructor Certification from Prana School of Yoga in Tel-Aviv. His lessons combine elements of Hatha, Iyengar and Vinyasa yoga, emphasizing the harmony of body and breath, while engaging the core muscles and accuracy in the asanas.

name: Vinyasa Flow
description:
Kara comes to her mat because it is the daily nudge she needs to remind herself of the essential elements—love, compassion, playfulness, authenticity—she wants to manifest in life off the mat. With a background in dance, team sports and marathon finishes, Kara initially sought out yoga for its benefits to balance her physical body. It wasn’t long before her yoga practice brought to life the mind-body-soul connection she had always felt but hadn’t been able to articulate. She is grateful for the wisdom and kindness of her many teachers, both formal and informal, who planted the seeds for curiosity, courage and surrender to take root. Her classes reflect her love of movement while challenging the mind to be present and shift out of habits that no longer serve to reveal new expressions for the soul.
An HR professional by day, Kara lives in NoPa with her husband, their two small children, and their rescue dog from Muttville. She is honored to be teaching at HomeSweetOm to share yoga with the community.

name: Restorative Yoga + Reiki
description:
Christine started her yoga journey about 15 years ago practicing asana. With a stressful job in corporate marketing, she needed an outlet to deal with the anxiety. So she turned to yoga and it transformed her life. In 2016, she quit her corporate job and began to pursue yoga instruction and wellness coaching full time. She even started her own marketing consultancy firm and consults with organizations trying to create wellness programs. Christine graduated in 2015 with her 200 RYT training and is part of the Yoga Alliance.
She studied at Be the Change Yoga in Tustin, CA with Katie Allen and Allison Prince. Her studies are part of the Desikachara lineage, breath-centered asana. She continues her study of the Yoga Sutras and Yoga Wellness Coaching with Robert Birnberg in Silver Lake, CA. She is also in the process of becoming certified as an Ayurvedic Health Counselor with Eleni Tsikrikas at Belly Mind Institute in Silver Lake, CA.
She has always been a seeker of knowledge and lifelong student. As both a student and a teacher, she pulls from her own experiences to help empower others with a variety of tools including yoga, meditation, reiki and Faster EFT.

name: Yin and Yang Yoga + Breathwork
description:
Sol is a 500h yoga teacher specialized in breath work and Chakra balancing. She had the honor to study with a 50 years experienced yoga guru and practitioner that, as had been born in the west, gave a turn to his teachings creating “The Science of Yoga.” Sol learned and is now teaching how to heal your own body and mind through deep breath work, Yin Yoga, nutrition, meditation and art with the plus of patience, love and empowerment.
She was born in Buenos Aires, Argentina. After her first Vipassana meditation, she made the decision to travel solo leaving the city comfort behind. Her journey took her in a two and a half year adventure where she had the chance to develop a close connection with nature and yoga.

name: Mindfulness Meditation
description:
Kim Nicol teaches with love and kindness, bringing her gentle, calming energy to each class. In the yoga studio, Kim teaches InnerYoga (yin) and meditation. She loves to guide her students through exquisitely slow practices that develop self-awareness and self-compassion. Her approach is holistic, practical and accessible. She is also a Reiki practitioner.
Out in the world, she works in Learning & Development as an executive coach and trainer, helping people become better public speakers and more effective leaders. She teaches Essential Skills for New Managers at General Assembly, and is a coach with Own The Room.
Kim is a featured meditation teacher on Simple Habit (www.simplehabit.com), where you can listen to her series, Executive Coaching for New Leaders. She has authored 3 books on living life in a mindful way. You can find her books—Offering, Devotion, Everyday—on Amazon.

name: Cultivate Vitality and Inner Power with Qigong
description:
Release tension and stagnant energy and clear the way for fresh energy and renewal with whole body circular and spiral movements of Wild Goose Qigong.

Exploring foundational movements and sequences from the Wild Goose Qigong system we will cultivate our Qi or life force energy while gently stretching, realigning and strengthening the body. Using both standing and walking exercises, we will become more comfortable, integrated and fluid in our movements.

Practicing Qigong has been shown to have many benefits including:

Initiating the relaxation response • Boosting immune function • Increasing circulation • Reducing hypertension • Promoting balance • Strengthening muscle and bone • Relieving pain • Reducing stress • Helping manage chronic conditions

Relax, reduce stress and feel more ease in your body as you practice these beautiful movements which also increase balance, strength and flexibility naturally.

No prior experience is necessary; All ages and levels are welcome

Suggested Donation: $10-$20

*** LOCATION: Lafayette park (Pacific Heights) - Washington St. between Laguna and Gough ... at the top of the hill, facing the Bay.

name: Holotropic Breathwork Circle
description:
90 minute holotropic breathwork session facilitated by James Eyerman, MD (http://www.jameseyerman.com/p/about.html).

AS SPACE IS LIMITED: if you need to cancel, please, kindly update your RSVP ASAP (and not at the last minute) in case there is a waitlist. Please sign up for the wait list even if the meetup is full, as there are often cancellations a few days in advance. All waitlisted members are notified once cancellations occur (if you'd like to receive email notifications, please turn them on for this meetup).

Please bring:

• Yourself in a well rested condition, in loose comfortable clothing, and not having eaten solid food for a few hours.

• Blankets or sleeping bag, and pillow.

• Your favorite water bottle or drink. If you have dietary restrictions, special snack foods you might want for afterwards during the experience sharing period

• An open mind and an open heart

• Please let me know ahead of time if you have any special needs.

Suggested donation range $50 to $100

First time breathworkers: please listen to the interview below, and message James Eyerman with any questions or concerns.

Smart Drugs interview: Holotropic Breathwork, DIY Psychedelia with James Eyerman, MD

References:

Eyerman, James. A Clinical Report on Holotropic Breathwork in 11,000 Psychiatric Inpatients in a Community Hospital Setting, MAPS Bulletin Special Edition, 2013

Eyerman, James. Holotropic Breathwork: Models of Mechanism of Action, Journal of Transpersonal Research, 2014

name: Laura New Myers! Haute Couture Fashion & Editorial Photoshoot!
description:
Laura New is a gorgeously creative creature, a being of light, a breath of fresh air, and a pleasure to work with.
Dance with her- keep your camera ready & finger on your trigger & shoot!
She's a freelance published Model (flow&expressive artist), Makeup artist, hairstylist, wardrobe stylist, and costume designer for 10 years and running.
She travels across the world offering an all inclusive package to photographers of every caliber and genre.

https://www.modelmayhem.com/Lauranew
http://lauranewmua.wixsite.com/lauranewmyers
https://www.instagram.com/lauranewmyers/?hl=en
https://www.facebook.com/LauraNewMyers/

Bring your camera, pocket wizard if you have one ( we do have some in house you may borrow), a fully charged battery, an empty memory card and a model release for her to sign.

We will provide the model, fashion, strobes, c-stands, props, backdrops, and a truly unique experience.

Please arrive on time, you can show up late but you will miss all the fun.

name: Project Open Box! Last Fridays, Monthly Performance & Art Mixer!
description:
Little Boxes Theater & Project Open Box!

Join us for an "Open Box" fundraiser event full of live performances and local artists. 

This year Little Boxes Theater dived feet first into the realm of Fiscal Sponsorship. That means, 100% Tax deductible status will allow for donations to fund, what we are calling, Project: Open Box. 

Fiscal sponsorship and the worthwhile patronage of all you out there will allow for fee-less rehearsal's and creative development periods for devoted artists.
We will curate in-depth examinations of craft, offer material budget, and help support vision's that culminate in intimate showings.

Don't think you are the kind of artist that would benefit from this? Feel free to send an email: [masked] with a clear outline of your project and we will probably surprise you!

Would you like to make a 100% tax deductible donation to
Project: Open Box? 
Or know someone who would?
Please use the PayPal link below, or make checks Payable to Independent Arts and Media (our wonderful non-profit sponsor) with "Project:Open Box" in the subject line and make an artist's day!

Projects we would most like to support this year are:
community building works, work breaking down the social boundaries that test our humanity and work that develops from language occurring in the bay area, in relation to the shifting of time. But don't let thats stop you, if you just want to work out something rousting about in your imagination just waiting to explode! We are, after all, as Open Box as we can be :) Yup, I punned.

To date, dozens of performances have filled Little Boxes' House. Contemporary dance, live music, performance art, improv theater, sketch comedy, puppet salons, aerial artists, classical Kinbaku & Shibari demonstrations, and of course our own monthly Open Box', Free Art & Performance Mixer. 

We have hosted hundreds of Photographers & Film-Makers for fine art, dance, and indie shoots. Filling cameras with as much imagery off the beaten path that can fit inside a lens, dozens of workshops, collaborations and colorful events all in our first year.

At the end of the day, we are only a small studio theater (just the two of us) and we are very grateful to all the supporters from  vibrant communities of artists, dancers, musicians, photographers, film-makers, theater companies, kinksters, queers and left leaners that still populate the beautiful Bay Area and are very,very excited for what else this year has to offer!

Thank you so Much! 
We look forward to celebrating with you.

With Sincere Love & Gratitude,

Aaron & Kitty 
*Founders of Little Boxes Theater
1661 Tennessee St. Suite #2s,
San Francisco, CA 94107

Info and images of Little Boxes Theater:
http://bayareaspaces.org/spaces/8587
https://littleboxestheater.wordpress.com
https://www.facebook.com/littleboxestheaterAn Easy Link For Your (Much Appreciated) Tax Deductible Donations: https://www.paypal.com/cgi-bin/webscr?cmd=_s-xclick&hosted_button_id=XFAE47VEKSFZW

name: October Book Club - The Unbearable Lightness of Being
description:
This month we are reading The Unbearable Lightness of Being by Milan Kundera about two women, two men, a dog and their lives in the 1968 Prague Spring period of Czechoslovak history. From the cover - “Milan Kundera's magnificent novel of passion and politics, infidelity and ideas, encompasses the extremes of comedy and tragedy, illuminating all aspects of human existence.”

If you’d like to read ahead, we will be reading My Lady’s Choosing by Kitty Curran for November. This is a choose your own adventure book, should be fun!

Please only sign up if you are able to attend so that everyone who wants to join can. If you get put on the waitlist, please make sure you enable Meetup to send you notifications, in case you get moved up in the last minute.

See you guys soon!

-Mialy and Genevieve

name: BOOK CLUB EXTRA!!! The Brothers Karamazov - Parts III & IV
description:
This book club extra is for the second half of the Brothers Karamazov by Fyodor Dostoyevsky, parts III & IV. We’re almost done! If you didn’t attend the first book club extra but would like to join in the finishing of this epic novel we’d love to have you.

See you guys soon!

-Mialy and Genevieve

name: Paint the Goddess Hecate
description:
Join us for another afternoon of encountering the Divine and painting your own personal icon of her, even if you've never painted before!
This month we honor Hecate, goddess of the crossroads of life and death.
Read about her here:
http://www.goddessgift.com/goddess-myths/greek_goddess_Hecate.htm

Katie Ketchum, trained in Shiloh Sophia's Color of Woman method, will guide us from start to finish. Those who have never put brush to canvas before and experienced painters alike will be able to access this unique intentional creativity method.

All supplies are included in the class fee of $35, painting clothes, (smocks are available) a snack, favorite supplies, etc. You may wish to bring a journal as well. To pay on the day of, please have cash or check. To pay with PayPal, please pay in advance to [masked].

We meet in the Art Womb at herchurch, a big purple church across from Tower Market. There is plentiful, free parking.
Kindly avoid chemical fragrance.

description:
In this one hr fifteen min. of class ALONG WITH Various Breathing practices, movements

we will cultivate awareness and slowing down to enter subtler aspect of our body to cultivate Ecstasy with conscious breathing and guided visualization and relaxation!

8.15pm-9.30pm

donation $10-$20

This meet up will meet once a week and occasionally in weekend to practice, to awaken and evolve in our capacity to feel good in our body, mind and heart opening the energy channels and centers . This meet up is to explore power of breathing to open the potential of bliss and happiness we have when we know how to breathe properly. we will practice varieties of breathing technique that comes from Taoist and Tantric tradition, including Micro Cosmic Orbit Breathing (Meditation).

cost $10 -$20 (Nobody will turn away for lack of Fund)

Every, Tuesday and Thursday , At Yoga Room Downstair

we hope to meet you here.

name: Yoga of Deep Relaxation (Yoga Nidra) Part II
description:
Yoga of Deep Relaxation (Yoga Nidra)
with Mahendra Briksha
Cultivate Blissful Relaxation and Presence, releasing stress and stagnation!
Part II

Saturday, Nov. 3rd, 2018, 11 am- 12:30pm

Yoga Nidra is an ancient yogic practice that is almost like deep sleep but with awareness. Hence it is short of Meditation that can be define as Awakened rest.

General benefit of Y.N.

~Profound relaxation in all levels of being-Blissful relaxation

~ Eliminate stress, help to overcome insomnia

~Integrate trauma, reduce anxiety, fear and anger

~Program subconscious mind to make positive change and habits

Along with practice of systematic relaxation with deep relaxation and full Awareness This workshop will include some dialogue and discussion about

~What is stress and how it becomes chronic and cause of Dis-ease

~ How to release it, cultivating relaxation and rejuvenation in cellular level

~ Yoga Nidra and Brain

~How Yoga Nidra restores health and brings transformation

~Sleep dream and Yoga Nidra

~ 5 Koshas and Process of Pratyahara

Cost: $20 for each part individually and -$35 for both (No one will be turned away for lack of funds)

RSVP is required.

To RSVP go to

briksha2Briksha was born in the small village of Himalayas, is a yogi, a certified Rebirthing Breathwork practitioner, an Integral life coach and raw vegan chef. Mahendra Briksha combines Vedantic-Yogic practices, Buddhist wisdom and Integral insights in his teaching. He has been teaching and leading breathing sessions and meditation classes for 10 years.

He is a graduate of the yoga teacher training program at the Vivekananda Yoga Research Center in Bangalore, India and holds certificates in Integral Yoga from the California Institute of Integral Studies, and Yoga Therapy from Purusha Yoga, and has over 200 hours of yoga teacher training through Urban Flow with Rusty Wells. Briksha is a resident teacher and manager of the Yoga Society of San Francisco (yogasocietysanfrancisco.com). He co-teaches the 200hr YTT for Seaside Yoga Sanctuary and Yoga Society of San Francisco.
Briksha’s main mission to share his knowledge and experience is to help people awaken in their body, breath, and mind and learn to live a peaceful and evolutionary life in the midst of a busy world.

To Know more about Briksha go to http://rays-mandala.org/

name: Online Class: Breathwork & Meditation ( with Tantric/Taoist way of Breathing)
description:
Online Class: Foundational Breathwork (with Tantric/Taoist way of Breathing) and Meditation

8 weeks series, Drop in allowed.

Every Tuesday, 6.00pm—7. 15pm

Cost:

For a series; $50

Drop in: $10

Starting from Nov., 6th, 2018 Ends Jan . 1st, 2019

In this class, we will practice foundational breathing to improve improper breathing habits and open our Inner body (Nadis, chakras and breathing System) and awaken sleeping energy to move in higher centers. Opening body and breath this way and calming the restless energy and creating Coherence in body, heart and mind and energy field, we meditate and rest in our True Nature of Inner light and luminosity .

In this class we will practice

1. Yogic cleansing and lengthening exhalation breathings

2. Basic breathing and Full belly breathing

3. Alternate Nostril breathing

4. 3 centers Breathing and Spinal breathing

5. Warming the stove breathing

6. Microcosmic Orbit Breathing /Meditation

7. Resting on the light in the Heart and Open space meditation

We will to come together in virtual space of Breathing room, using

Zoom ( https://zoom.us/)

Title:
Mastery Under Pressure: How to Achieve an Unstoppable Mindset

Most business professionals spend years learning about their area of expertise and how to strategically bring that into the marketplace - but how much time have you spent time training your mind for success?

Join Tina Greenbaum, LCSW as she shares her 35 years of experience as well as specific strategies for becoming confident in any situation you want to excel.
By the end of this presentation you will:
Be able to identify your strengths and challenges with regards to peak performance
Learn how to be laser focused
Change negative self-talk into productive thinking
Learn how to change fear into your greatest teacher

name: Free Meditation Class in Oakland
description:
Free Meditation Class in Oakland

If you're interested in meditation and mindfulness come to one of the free meditation classes.

* What to expect?*
- During class we will learn an easy and simple meditation technique that you can practice by yourself or in a group.
- We will practice 15 mins meditations twice during every class.
- During the meditation class we will discuss practical and intellectual topics in an interactive way, spiced up with humor and chocolate.

* Main topics*
1. Meditation is stopping thought
2. Mindfulness: how your life becomes stronger and brighter
3. The philosophy explained behind Buddhism Mysticism
4. Refocusing and mindfulness practices for daily usage
5. The 3 Jewels of Buddhism: the Buddha, the Dharma, the Sangha
6. Dream Yoga: how to become aware you're dreaming and other practical techniques
7. How Chinese Tea Ceremony can be meditation?
8. The philosophy explained behind the significance of past life incarnations in Tibetan Buddhism

* Teacher*
Shen is practicing meditation and mindfulness disciplines daily for over 12 years.
He has been teaching meditation classes in the United States and in Europe since 2007.
He has excelled in carrier as a computer programmer at top companies in the Bay Area. His success is a direct result of his daily meditation and mindfulness practice.

* Who should come?*
- Beginner or advanced, everyone is welcome
- We practice the same meditation technique during every class
- It's easy to join any time

*When and Where?*
Mondays in Oakland
5:15-6:15pm
4341 Piedmont Ave Unit 202
Oakland, CA 94611
Energy Matters Acupuncture & Qigong Center

*For more info*
Email: [masked]
Website: https://www.sfawakenedmind.org

*Shen is also teaching classes in Berkeley and San Francisco*

University of California
Wheeler Hall, Room 24.
Berkeley, CA 94720

Classes on all locations follow the same structure and meditation technique.
Everyone is welcome to any and all classes.

name: Fun & easy way to play more tennis (please read event description for details)
description:
We’re still working to get more people into these Meetups, but our goal is to give members a few social tennis outings each week in addition to your Challenge League matches.

These Meetups are co-ed, super laid back, and all skill levels are welcome. Post your skill level and a suggested court in the comments section so we can round up as many players as we can for some tennis fun!

Also, if you’re looking to play more matches and you aren’t already in the PlayYourCourt Challenge League, you can go here to see what we’re all about and sign up:

https://www.playyourcourt.com/tennis-league/san-francisco-ca/?utm_source=meetup&utm_medium=group-home&utm_campaign=meetup-regional

If you love tennis, we’d love to have you! Be sure and watch the quick video that explains how everything works.

Happy hitting!

- Scott

name: Art Open Studio: AimaNoiOno
description:
ART OPEN STUDIO: AIMA NOI ONO

Exhibition days: 13-14 October 10am - 7 pm

"We are everything and everyone at the same time - we are connected." - Aima

It will be the first pop up exhibition in San Francisco of an artist AimaNoiOno with the "Fur & Bones" series. It's a contemporary sacred art. Where are connecting photography, 3D, ancient icons, the future and the past. Use the unique opportunity to meet an artist and look at the studio.

Visit the site to check the works: aimanoiono.tilda.ws

...The series "Fur and Bones" represents the world of duality.
Bones - an allegory of the Body, it's our human nature: individual, material, tangible.
Fur - reflects the Soul: light and soft, warming, delicate.
Just as light cannot exist without darkness, or height without depth, earth without sky - we can't know one without the other. Life is a dance of death and rebirth. It's conflict – inner and outer. As a species – we are both in conflict and conflicted. Nature only is.

The only way to find harmony is to see everything as a whole. We are everything and everyone at the same time - we are connected. The subtlest changes of vibration in us influence everything and everybody around us.

I chose photography as a means of searching for the purest art. In the past, I have learned how to draw religious icons, following all the scholastic rules. I have studied perfection in the craft, technique and formula of
how to draw the divine face until I finally came to feel an intangible truth:
that all people on Earth already are ideal. We already are what we are searching for.
So, I started making portraits because I wanted my viewer to see the ambrosia in the real people and not in the avatar images. This is imperfect perfection.

Aima is a whisper of your soul - created to illuminate beauty through art.

At the Exhibition:

Artworks for a special price
Drawing portraits for 10-15 minutes
Photoshoots
Art talks
CONTACTS:
aimanoiono.tilda.ws - [masked] -[masked].

description:
Here is the ED Day Investing Education Workshops
Eventbrite Online & credit card registration available at:
https://edday-2018.eventbrite.com

Here is a link to the full Ed Day flier at our Better Investing website page:
https://new.betterinvesting.org/getmedia/4284c842-eb3e-4736-b620-7d6a48e642f7/EdDay-Fall-18-AD4-Final.pdf

San Francisco Bay Area Chapter BetterInvesting
NON-PROFIT ∙ VOLUNTEER BASED ∙ MEMBER DRIVEN
www.betterinvesting.org/sanfran

Investing Educational Workshops
Saturday, November 3 - 8:30 am to 12:30 pm
Mills College, Lucie Stern Hall 107, 5000 MacArthur Boulevard, Oakland
Registration and Schedule

Early Registration: $30 must be received by October 21, 2018
Regular Registration: $35 registration begins October 22, 2018
Special Club Registration: $25 per person, 3 or more from same club

To qualify for the club discount, registrations must be submitted together and be received by October 21, 2018. use a separate form for each person or register online at Eventbrite.

Bring a friend! Register with a non-BI member at the same time only $20 each person. Save off the regular registration fee of $35. (Mail-in registration only)

Continental breakfast included

Schedule:
8:30 – 9:00 Registration & Continental Breakfast
9:00 – 9:50 Looking for Tomorrow’s Winners, Craig Braemer
Or The Stock Selection Guide: The Basics Part I, Joanne Willcox

10:00 – 10:50 Forecasting Growth, Harriet Chan
Or The Stock Selection Guide: The Basics Part II, Henry Gold

11:00 – 11:50 BetterInvesting Website, Joanne Willcox and Kweli Lewis
Or Stock to Study, Craig Braemer and Jim Willcox

12:00 – 12:30 Model Club Portfolio Review and Door Prizes
Registration: Eventbrite
https://edday-2018.eventbrite.com

Workshop Descriptions

Looking for Tomorrow’s Winners (Craig Braemer)
How to go about finding small and medium sized companies is one of the most frequent requests we get from members when we make club visits. During this class we will focus on two processes that will help you discover these companies; first we will use the BetterInvesting SSG online screening tool and then we will learn to a process that allows individual investors to regularly track professional trades.

The Stock Selection Guide: The Basics, Part I & II (Joanne Willcox and Henry Gold)
These workshops will help you gain understanding of what one looks for when evaluating a company for potential investment. Using the online SSG, the class will look at each section of the SSG as well as the key judgment areas; future high and low PE, selected low price, earnings per share growth, and how they all work together to help identify good companies at reasonable prices. The five sections of the SSG will be explained and we will discuss why each section is important.

Forecasting Growth (Harriet Chan)
The SSGPlus and the CoreSSG online analysis tools have 5 different research reports that provide estimates of long-term growth. Couple these with ValueLine reports and your brokerage firm resources. Harriet will guide you through the process for getting sales and earnings estimates from the SSG online analysis tools.

BetterInvesting Web Site (Joanne Wilcox and Kweli Lewis)
How do I get from here to there? When I get there, what is there? Come and join us for a deep dive into the BetterInvesting web site. Let us help you streamline your search for what you want to find. Missed a TickerTalk presentation? Let’s find it. Want to know what events are happening in your chapter?

Stock to Study (Jim Willcox and Craig Braemer)
With Jim and Craig, attendees will complete a Stock Selection Guide (SSG) and learn how to handle the various judgment sections of the SSG. This is an interactive workshop with lots of practical discussion.

Machine Learning Workshop ft. Kaggle Competition/CodeLabs
description:
Join GDG Cloud Silicon Valley for a hands-on workshop where you will solve machine learning problems from beginning-to-end using Logistic Regression.

Logistic regression is a statistical method for analyzing a dataset in which there are one or more independent variables that determine an outcome.

The outcome is measured with a dichotomous variable (in which there are only two possible outcomes). We would use Logistic Regression algorithms to determine if passengers on Titanic survived or died based on their attributes.

In this workshop you can expect to:

1) Get a quick overview of Machine Learning.
2) Get an environment set on your laptop to learn machine learning.
3) Walkthrough "Titanic" example from beginning to end.

• What to bring
Laptop with wifi capability and Chrome installed

name: Kizomba Classes SF Mondays
description:
𝗞𝗶𝘇𝗼𝗺𝗯𝗮 𝗛𝗮𝘀 𝗠𝗮𝗱𝗲 𝗜𝘁𝘀 𝗪𝗮𝘆 𝗧𝗼 𝗧𝗵𝗲 𝗗𝗼𝗴𝗣𝗮𝘁𝗰𝗵!

Kicking off 𝗠𝗼𝗻𝗱𝗮𝘆, 𝗝𝘂𝗹𝘆 𝟭𝟲𝘁𝗵 𝗮𝘁 𝟴:𝟯𝟬𝗣𝗠, for the first time at Dogpatch Dance & Yoga, learn to dance Kizomba!

Every Monday join 𝗖𝗵𝗿𝗶𝘀𝘁𝗶𝗻𝗮 & 𝗞𝗮𝗿𝗹 for one and half hours of fun and insightful Kizomba.

𝗟𝗲𝘀𝘀𝗼𝗻: 𝟴:𝟯𝟬-𝟵:𝟯𝟬 𝗣𝗠
𝗣𝗿𝗮𝗰𝘁𝗶𝗰𝗮/𝟭𝗼𝗻𝟭: 𝟵:𝟯𝟬-𝟭𝟬𝗣𝗠

All Are Welcome. No Partner Necessary.

𝗪𝗵𝗮𝘁 𝗶𝘀 𝗞𝗶𝘇𝗼𝗺𝗯𝗮?
Kizomba is a partner dance originating from Angola with influences from nearby countries and the caribbean. Since 2012, Kizomba’s popularity has been growing and is now danced all over the world. Today you will find many different styles of Kizomba have evolved with their own unique look and feel as inspired artists are excited to share the art.

𝗚𝗼𝗮𝗹𝘀 𝗼𝗳 𝘁𝗵𝗲 𝗰𝗹𝗮𝘀𝘀:
This class will teach Kizomba fundamentals and intermediate techniques that can easily be adapted to multiple related styles/dances under the Kizomba umbrella; including Urban Kiz, Semba, tarraxinha & tarraxo.
The class is designed to create well rounded dancers and give students the tools to enhance their experiences not only on local dance floors but at festivals around the globe.
Students will learn about the other music and dances that often played and danced at Kizomba parties and cultural events including afrohouse, kuduro, Kompa, dancehall, afrobeats, etc.

𝗪𝗵𝗮𝘁 𝘆𝗼𝘂 𝘄𝗶𝗹𝗹 𝗹𝗲𝗮𝗿𝗻:
✔ Globally recognized Kizomba basics, as well as Christina & Karl's own 𝗟𝘂𝗰𝗸𝘆 𝟳 foundations.
✔ Modification for basic and foundational steps and movements that vary from subtle to dramatic additions.
✔ Musicality concepts.
✔ Differentiating amongst Kizomba dance styles and music.
✔ Body movements.
✔ Follow/Lead techniques.
✔ Social Dance & Cultural Etiquette.
And more...

𝗛𝗼𝘄 𝘁𝗼 𝗿𝗲𝗴𝗶𝘀𝘁𝗲𝗿:
http://www.dogpatchdance.com/pricing
Drop in - $15
New Student special - 3 Classes for $30
5 Class pass - $65 (good for 3 months)

𝗬𝗼𝘂𝗿 𝗜𝗻𝘀𝘁𝗿𝘂𝗰𝘁𝗼𝗿𝘀: KC Karl & Christina

𝗔𝗯𝗼𝘂𝘁 𝗨𝘀:
We are longtime friends with a mutual respect for each other’s knowledge and skills as dancers and teachers. This respect is reflected in our classes which place equal value on both the lead AND the follow’s role. With a sense of fun and playfulness and attention to detail we aim to create a warm, relaxed learning environment that maximizes and honors our students learning.

When deciding to team up it was important to us that we didn't follow the common path of most Kizomba instruction but created balanced instruction that focuses on follows just as much as it focused on leads. Additionally, we are dedicated to addressing issues/topics that are often overlooked in classes.

We want our students to walk away from each classes feeling accomplished and knowing they have gained more knowledge, technique, skill as well as unlocking their own creativity and dance personality.This guiding philosophy will help students learn faster and be more confident because the class accommodates the students rather than the students having to accommodate to class.

name: Golden Gate Flyer monthly dinner meeting
description:
Thank you for your interest in Golden Gate Flyers.

Our monthly dinner meetings are on the second Wednesday of each month, and the venue alternates between The Sausage Factory and Hamburger Mary’s. Both restaurants are in the San Francisco Castro neighborhood, and street parking is usually available. Also, both are convenient to Muni if you're taking public transportation.

We usually meet around 7:00 pm in the back room bar for cocktails, then sit down for dinner around 7:30. The cost will vary, based on what you order to eat and drink.

Our LGBT members have a broad range of experience from the GA (general aviator), student pilot, airline pilot, flight attendants, air traffic control or pure admirers. We all share a common interest in developing future pilots and in fostering the growth and vitality of the aviation community.

name: What Does Your Website Say About You?
description:
What’s the impression your website is giving?

Is it clear, fresh, and engaging?

Or does it confuse and cost you clients?

People are drawn to clarity, and your website should be a clear representation of your message and offering. So why is it so hard to make your website reflect you? And how can you build a client-focused site that actually converts? Join us for this 90 minute workshop where you’ll walk away with clear and actionable steps to make your website work for you.

Takeaways:

● Learn the “Golden Rule” of websites that convert

● Learn how to simplify language so people “get it” immediately

● Learn how to structure your website with marketing in mind

About the instructor: Rebecca Williams helps clients align their messaging around a strategic story so they can connect with their customers and grow their business. She works with companies to help tell brand stories through a variety of brand activation campaigns.

Rebecca has been facilitating individual and group learning for over 20 years. She has a dynamic and interactive teaching style that keeps individuals engaged with experimental learning, peer coaching, and lots of humor.

Workshop Refund Policy: Refunds can be granted prior to workshop or if the workshop is cancelled. No refunds or access to class material after workshop is held. A credit can be given for a future workshop. Please call our office at[masked] for assistance or send us an email at [masked].

name: Guerrilla Marketing
description:
Frustrated that nobody knows about you and your product?

Frustrated that nobody cares about your products?

Don't have much money for advertising?

Did you think that when you built your company that people would immediately support you? That your initial product was great so you would be immediately successful? But reality is different.

In this workshop, you will learn that even great beer isn't enough to guarantee success. Pete will take you through a methodology for how to view the world of customers and give concrete examples of how to make some noise on a limited budget.

Yes! You can do things to improve your company's awareness and success.

Pete Slosberg has an undergraduate degree in space mechanics and propulsion as well as a masters in business administration, both from Columbia University. After many years working in anagement positions for corporations such as Xerox, IBM and Siemens, Pete left to turn his hobby of home-brewing beer into his own business. Pete's Brewing Company had 10 consecutive years of over 100% growth rates; made the Inc Magazine list of top 100 private companies in the US 3 years in a row; went public and then was acquired. Along the way, Pete wrote a best-selling book, "Beer for Pete's Sake". Then Pete turned his attention to another passion: chocolate. He started Cocoa Pete's Chocolate Adventures and sold it 7 years later. Pete is also a Certified Beer Judge and a
Certified BBQ judge.

description:
What is your Pricing Strategy!!

How do you set prices for your business or service?

Are they working? When should your change them?

This interactive workshop will address these topics as well as the role of Pricing in the overall marketing mix.

About the instructor: Marvin Brook worked for the United States Postal Service for 30 years, ultimately becoming the financial controller for Northern California. In that job, he managed 65 employees with 15 managers and professional staff. He had oversight for timekeeping, accounting, statistical testing, auditing, and a budget of over $800 million.A t USPS, he developed and presented a highly popular series of financial education seminars. His expertise in teaching as well as in financial analysis and planning should be helpful to business owners who need to align their business plan with their personal financial goals. description:

description:
Get Your Business On the Right Track..... Write an Effective Business Plan!

The journey of entrepreneurship begins with a single step, but the ones that follow often determine how successful your small business will be!

A business plan is a critical foundation when you are starting a new business or developing the potential of your existing company.

In this hands-on workshop, we will demystify the process using case studies and exercises. You will also develop a template for your own business that covers:

•Products/Services
•Organization
•Market Research

About the presenters:

Marvin Brook's expertise in teaching, as well as in financial analysis and planning, should be helpful to business owners who need to align their business plan with their personal financial goals. Marvin is a SCORE mentor and does email counseling.

These business covered many industries and ranged in size from international to one person in their living room. After improving over a thousand business plans, there is one thing that stands like stone: the better the planning, the more likely your chance of success. name: Make Portraits using Natural Light: A Hands-On Photography Workshop
description:
By popular demand, announcing the first weekend session of my well-reviewed Natural Light Portraiture class! I've lined up a wonderful model and we look forward to welcoming you to this class.

What you’ll be learning:
In this session you will learn everything you need to begin capturing beautiful portraits with a minimum of gear, fuss, and bother.
• Technique: I’ll share some best practices about what gear and camera settings to use.
• Hands-on practice photo shoot: A model will be provided for this hands-on workshop. We’ll stroll around a beautiful natural setting to practice the basics of how to pre-visualize, configure the camera settings, pose our model, and compose our portraits.
• Post-processing: I’ll demonstrate a professional yet simple workflow using Lightroom to develop the images we just shot. (If insufficient time remains for this module during the session, I will share notes covering this topic after the class.)

Take a peek at a recent class: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=sGT_l30vx_4

What’s included:
• Class size is limited to 8 people and is hands-on
• Get personal attention and ask any questions

Who can come: You should have a basic understanding of how your camera works, including knowing how to set ISO, aperture (f-stop), and shutter speed. Minors need to be accompanied by legal guardians at all times.

What you'll need to bring: A DSLR or mirrorless camera is recommended, along with a normal or moderate telephoto lens (either prime or zoom).

Minimum number of students: I require a minimum of 3 enrolled students. If fewer students enroll, we may need to reschedule or cancel the session.

Payment: I prefer payment in advance via PayPal (pay to [masked]). Please let me know if you prefer instead to pay by cash or check at the start of the class session.

A little about me: My name is Kyle Adler, and I’m a professional travel photographer based on the San Francisco Peninsula. I’m a recent winner of the prestigious international competition Travel Photographer of the Year and was shortlisted for the National Geographic Travel Photography Awards. My passion is helping photography enthusiasts learn to use their camera as a bridge to the local culture and land wherever we travel. When not traveling and teaching workshops around the world, I can be found capturing photos of the wonderful people and places around the SF Bay Area.

name: Travel Photography Workshop: SF's Mission District
description:
Note: You may RSVP to this Meetup event, but you must register and pay via the Airbnb Experiences page here: https://www.airbnb.com/experiences/227047

Join a professional travel photographer as we explore one of SF's last remaining true neighborhoods for a fun photo workshop filled with historic, architectural, artistic, and cultural attractions. The Mission District, named for the Spanish mission built there in 1776, is a vibrant Latino neighborhood that in recent years has undergone some gentrification, overlaying a hipster vibe on top of the still strong bedrock community. We approach our exploration as true travel photographers, not as tourists seeking "postcard shots". I'll share my award-winning tips and tricks to help you capture amazing images regardless of your experience level. The skills we practice today--covering many photographic genres including architectural, cityscapes, street, and portraiture--will give you a toolkit to draw from during your future travels. We seek a "sense of place" that roots our images to the place and the people we meet. In the middle of our walk, we rest our feet at a local cafe for an included coffee drink and the chance to review some of our photos. Our small group size allows for plenty of interaction and the chance to get your questions answered.

Guests should be prepared to walk about 3 miles, including some hills. Bring your gear (any kind of camera or phone) with a fully charged battery and memory card with room to spare for your photos.

We'll visit and photograph these Mission District locations:
- Misión San Francisco de Asís (Mission Dolores)
- Clarion Alley Murals
- The Women's Building
- Dolores Park
We stop along the way at a local cafe for an included coffee drink and photo review (and restrooms).

name: Backstage Myanmar Cultural Tour
description:
Dear Fellow Travel Photographers,

From January 3-11, I plan to join a special tour of Myanmar as the photographer for a not-for-profit organization working to preserve Burmese traditional performing arts that are rapidly vanishing. This tour includes unique experiences of meeting the master artists and their students behind-the-scenes. Having last traveled and photographed in Myanmar a few months ago, I share Arts Mandalay Foundation's urgent mission to preserve these ancient cultural traditions. I'm expecting that my images, which I am shooting pro-bono, will help the NGO in their mission to train the next generation of performers and save these cultural treasures from extinction.

There are still spaces available on the tour. While I'm not officially running this as a photography tour (and will not profit directly from it), enthusiasts who join the trip will be shooting alongside me and I will be offering some informal photography instruction in the field. I'm also working with the director to set up some extra photo shoots with the artists.

Please join us! Whether you're a photography enthusiast or not, this tour will be very special. More info here: http://www.artsmandalay.org/backstage-myanmar-cultural-tour.html Let me know if you have questions or are interested in booking.

Kyle

name: Total Solar Eclipse Photography Tour in Chile and Easter Island
description:
From Jun. 27 through Jul. 10, 2019, join our small group of photography enthusiasts and experience the thrill of shooting a total solar eclipse as well as capturing the full range of Chile’s spectacular beauty including a visit to fabled Easter Island. Chile is a dream destination for travel photographers, offering breathtaking scenery, unique wildlife, unparalleled astrophotography, and fascinating cultural encounters. We’ve planned this unique itinerary to provide ample opportunities to capture unforgettable images that you won’t find in travel brochures and on postcards.

Our extraordinary photographic journey will take us from the historic and vibrant capital city of Santiago and colorful Valparaiso, to La Serena and Isla Damas for in-depth workshops on eclipse photography in preparation for capturing extraordinary images of the total solar eclipse in this region, then on to the stark otherworldly beauty of the Atacama Desert with the darkest skies on Earth that are perfect for astrophotography, and finally to mystical Easter Island where we’ll have the opportunity to meet and photograph the native Rapa Nui people in exclusive photo shoots we have customized to capture a strong sense of the people and the place.

Award-winning professional travel photographer Kyle Adler will be shooting alongside tour participants and will provide personalized in-the-field instruction. During our optional informal workshops, we’ll review our recent images, plan our shot list for upcoming locations, and cover techniques to make the best images possible. Topics will be tailored to the group’s interests and may cover any aspects of travel photography from shot planning to capture technique, and on to post-processing and image sharing. Unlike most photography tours, we will place a special emphasis on learning to use the camera as a bridge to enhanced understanding of the land and people we visit. Photographers of any level will see their images improve, and non-photographer friends and family are also most welcome to join this tour. You can make memorable images using whatever camera gear you wish to bring; it is not necessary to invest in specialized gear.

Learn more and book your space here: https://aclassictour.com/tours/photography-total-solar-eclipse-tour-of-chile-with-kyle-adler/

name: Photography Tour: Mongolia and the Gobi Desert
description:
Wild and untamed, Mongolia is a deeply spiritual land of nomadic cultures and dreamy landscapes of snowcapped mountains, crystalline lakes, and great swathes of grassy plains and ancient desert. Even today, Mongolia evokes a time when Genghis Khan and his warrior horsemen thundered across the steppe to establish the largest land empire the world has ever known. Discover Mongolia’s diverse land and people, from the bustle of Ulaanbaatar and alpine beauty of Khovsgol Lake to the vast expanse of the Gobi Desert. Meet with nomadic herding families, learn about ancient shamanistic beliefs, ride a camel in the desert dunes, and discover why Mongolia is known as the "Land of Blue Sky" during stays in authentic ger tents—just as modern-day nomads and their ancestors have done for centuries. Travel to Mongolia, a pristine land that time forgot, for an adventure you’ll treasure forever.

Join our small group of photography enthusiasts and experience the thrill of capturing the full range of Mongolia's spectacular beauty. Mongolia is a dream destination for travel photographers, offering breathtaking scenery, unique wildlife, and fascinating cultural encounters. We’ve planned this itinerary to provide ample opportunities to capture unforgettable images that you won't find in travel brochures and on postcards. Award-winning professional travel photographer Kyle Adler will be shooting alongside tour participants and will provide personalized in-the-field instruction. During our optional informal workshops, we’ll review our recent images, plan our shot list for upcoming locations, and cover techniques to make the best images possible. Topics will be tailored to the group’s interests and may cover any aspects of travel photography from shot planning to capture technique, and on to post-processing and image sharing. Unlike most photography tours, we will place a special emphasis on learning to use the camera as a bridge to enhanced understanding of the land and people we visit. Photographers of any level will see their images improve, and non-photographer friends and family are also most welcome to join this tour. You can make memorable images using whatever camera gear you wish to bring; it is not necessary to invest in specialized gear.

Learn more and book your place here: https://www.oattravel.com/marketing/2018/kyle-adler-photography-tours-uln

description: Right, this is not a run. Please excuse me. But I'm an advocate for the Stewards. Please message if you are interested and I'll connect you with the folks who can tell you more about about species you might find for sale on Saturday!

name: Sunrise Mt. Sutro Run - 5 miles
description:
Starting time pulled up to 6:45AM.

Meet at Kezar (southeast gate).  The run goes uphill right away - Willard, the Farnsworth steps, Edgewood and into the Mt. Sutro Open Space Reserve.  The trails are beautiful and well-maintained (sutrostewards.org).  We link, via Tower Trail (under the iconic tower), to Twin Peaks.  Each morning at Twin Peaks is unique, and the city below is always incomparable.

Alternately, meet at the south (upper) end of Edgewood (about five minutes later), right where the trail enters the woods.  Though I don't advocate driving to a run, parking is just a bit easier there.

name: Sutro Stewards Trail and Habitat Maintenance
description:
Hi all,

The mission of the Sutro Stewards is to create urban recreational opportunities while practicing sustainable habitat conservation through stewardship.  

The Mount Sutro Open Space Reserve, located in the geographic center of San Francisco, was overlooked by surrounding communities for a century.  In the last decade, the true value of the open space was revealed through the Sutro Stewards’ creation of multi-use trails, allowing the public to explore this exceptional place.

Since 2006, the stewards have mobilized volunteers to build trails, remove invasive species, and grow and install native plants.

For active outdoors types, the reserve is a city treasure, with 5.1 miles of trails and the work continues, as we build an important connector and future segment of the Bay Area Ridge Trail (with a trailhead on Clarendon Ave.).  

Whether you prefer to work on trails or maintain habitat, come on out, join a great group of folks and let's get some work done.  After, there's beer/soft drinks and pizza and a wonderful chance to catch up with new and old friends.

Meet at 9:00AM at the Woods (parking) Lot, up behind UCSF, just off Medical Center Way, about half way up the hill toward the Aldea Housing.  Look for the shipping container in the parking lot.

In addition to signing up here, please go to sutrostewards.org and register on the website.

Thank you!!

Mike

PS.  We meet on 1st and 3rd Saturdays at 9:00.  But there is an amazing variety of other events, such as bird walks, flower walks, guest speakers, plant sales, etc. on the website!!

name: Capture the Essence of CA Oak Savanna!
description:
In the month of October the north coast branch of the nature journal club with Marley will be exploring the rolling hills and oak savanna of Helen Putnam Regional Park near Petaluma. We will practice several techniques for doing small watercolor landscapes to capture the essence and atmosphere of the place. We will also practice drawing three-dimensional trees with several tricks that will make your branches look like they're coming off the page.

We will be hiking short distances up and down hill on this trip with mostly even terrain. Bring all your normal nature journaling supplies and binoculars. Be prepared for sun and warm conditions. A small folding stool could be useful for the longer landscape drawing. This location has a bathroom and seven dollar parking unless you are a member of the Sonoma County Regional Parks. Bring a potluck item that is not too hard to carry onto the trail because we will not want to go back to the parking lot for lunch.

$20 recommended donation

In the unlikely chance of rain we will meet at the incredible backup location of California Carnivores in Sebastopol!!
2833 Old Gravenstein Hwy, Sebastopol, CA 95472

name: Coastal Ecology and Nature Journaling at Younger Lagoon in Santa Cruz
description:
This month's nature journaling field trip with Jack looks like it will be awesome! A great opportunity for people in the Santa Cruz and Monterey Bay area.

The Younger Lagoon Reserve is a part of the UC Natural Reserve System and is closed to the general public. We have permits to sketch and explore the land. This is a great place to learn about coastal processes and species. If rain is in the forecast we will still meet at the lagoon but may spend more of the day in the adjacent Seymore Marine Discovery Center.

Bring:

Your journaling supplies.
A lunch treat to share (it is a potluck). Your lunch treat does not need to be portable (it can stay in the car while we explore).
Bowl and spoon.
portable stool or chair (optional).
Weather appropriate clothing including layers, hat, and sunscreen.
Sense of humor
Your favorite poem printed on a piece of paper to share with someone.

Directions:

Meet by the Blue Whale Skeleton next to the Seymore Marine Discovery Center
From Santa Cruz

From downtown take Highway One (Mission Street) north approximately two miles. Turn left on Swift Street. Turn right on Delaware Avenue. Follow Delaware to the UC Santa Cruz Marine Science Campus entrance at the end of the road—this road becomes McAllister Way. The Seymour Marine Discovery Center is the final building located on the ocean bluff, next to the giant blue whale skeleton.
From San Jose

Take Highway 17 south from San Jose. Highway 17 ends at Highway One, as you reach the coast. As you approach the coast and the city of Santa Cruz, take Highway One north toward Half Moon Bay. (Highway One becomes Mission Street.) Turn left on Swift Street. Turn right on Delaware Avenue. Follow Delaware to the UC Santa Cruz Marine Science Campus entrance at the end of the road—this road becomes McAllister Way. The Seymour Marine Discovery Center is the final building located on the ocean bluff, next to the giant blue whale skeleton.

Public transportation is available to the Marine Science Campus entrance gate at the end of Delaware Avenue. Check the Santa Cruz Metro schedule––UCSC via Westside.

name: Startup Bike Tour Across the Golden Gate Bridge
description:
*** IMPORTANT: This event, originally scheduled on October 6 has been postponed to October 13.***

Join the Startup Basecamp community for a fun, leisurely day biking across the Golden Gate Bridge.

Join us for this chance to see the most iconic structure in San Francisco up close with other entrepreneurs! You'll have the chance to mingle with other entrepreneurs, share ideas, and network all while exploring the beautiful Sausalito.

It's free to join, but be sure to bring at least $30 for the bike rental and extra for lunch. You can get more information about what kind of bike you can rent + prices here. We'll be stopping for lunch at Bar Bocce, in Sausalito & then stopping by the boathouses in the area.

If you are interested in taking the ferry back to San Francisco, you can find the ferry schedule here. One way tickets cost around $12.

Out of courtesy, please let us know if your plans change!

11:00 am Meet at Startup Basecamp Co-working, 900 Franklin Street.

11:30 am: Alcatraz Bikes & Tours (2718 Hyde St)

12:00 pm: Depart San Francisco Bicycle Rentals towards Sausalito with stops for photos

12:30 - 1:30 pm: Bike over the Golden Gate Bridge to Sausalito! (Estimated time: 45 minutes)

1:30 - 3:00 pm: Lunch at Bar Bocce in Sausalito!

3:00 - 4:00 pm: Explore Sausalito & the boat houses (they are beautiful!)

4:00 - 5:00 pm: Head back towards San Francisco: choice of ferry or biking back

5 pm: Back to San Francisco Bicycle Rentals to return bikes

description:
This is a ongoing D&D 5 Adventure League group.

We have multiple games running every Thursday from 6:00pm-11pm and often on Saturdays daytime at private residences and Game Stores in Berkeley.

Each of our GMs is running a different season (storyline) and runs a game every two weeks on average.

Players are invited to play in a game every two weeks (often staying in the same storyline, but may play in multiple storylines if desired). We have events that tie the seasons together in various ways.

The group has been running for a year now, with players of all experience levels. Adventure League is set in the world of Forgotten Realms.

There is often room at games and you are welcome to contact the coordinator (Josiah) to be invited to future games. No experience is necessary (you're welcome to bring a existing Adventure League character from previous play as long as you have a full Adventure Log to share).

Campaign Website: Berkeley Adventure League (https://sites.google.com/site/berkeleyadventuresleague/)

Coordinator: Josiah Knight (Cell[masked]; Email [masked])

Note: Make sure to join and check the Facebook group to get invited to games, as this Meetup does not reflect whether the game is full or not.

Facebook Group:
https://www.facebook.com/groups/BayAreaAdventureLeague/

Calendar: https://www.facebook.com/groups/BayAreaAdventureLeague/events/?source=4&action_history=null&filter=calendar

name: Traveller STARWARS - Rise of the New Republic
description:
This is a Game that will be scheduled for every other Sunday.
Those that choose to be a part of this Game, please be aware that this is an on going game if you can not make the schedule please don't sign up and leave room for those that can. If you really want to play and can not make the games, message me I will help you find something.

People that are new to Gaming or have no other groups have priority.
