name: Wonders of the Galapagos
description:
Our friends at Photofly Travel Club ( https://www.photoflytravel.com/ ) have planned an exotic adventure to keep warm this winter & experience the best nature has to offer! We're all invited!

January 31st - February 6th 2019

Go here to sign up: https://www.photoflytravel.org/galapagos-group-tours/

E-mail us at [masked] for the daily itinerary!

We've built another extremely unique adventure! Anyone with a love for nature, science, wildlife, snorkeling, diving, hiking, photography, or just plain adventure, should have this iconic destination at the top of their bucket list. This Galapagos group tour offers a glorious blend of luxury, adventure, & up close and personal experiences! Our 2018 trip sold out in 2 days last year so get your deposits in ASAP and don’t miss this one in winter 2019!

The Galapagos is an “up-market” destination but fortunately we’ve again been able to create something special at an amazing value! Take a look at the details below and you will see that our small group trip is arguably the best deal out their when you factor everything we have been able to include!

* 7 days of Darwin’s Diversity

* 3 nights/4 days at the unique and waterfront Red Mangrove EcoLuxury Hotel

* 3 nights/4 days aboard our very own luxurious private yacht the Coral II!

* MOST Meals! (6 breakfasts, 6 lunches, 4 dinners)

* Round trip domestic flight Included (Guayaquil (GYE) –> Galapagos (GPS),[masked] USD value)

* All Snorkel Gear Included throughout

Part 1: Santa Cruz Island & Her Nearby Gems

Santa Cruz is the most important Island in the Galapagos archipelago with the only substantial port town of Puerto Ayora. The “bustling” town is home to the vast majority of all residents of the islands combined topping out at a staggering 12,000 people. This offers insight into the the amount of conservation and protected land on the island despite having the only major town in the whole volcanic island chain. From white sand beaches teeming with endemic marine iguana, lush highlands where some of the only giant tortoises in the world still roam, turtle coves, thriving reefs, ancient calderas, & of course, Darwin’s Finches all live in harmony with the small human population here (for once!).

* Highlands & Tortoise Reserve: Journeying across Santa Cruz into the highlands, we’ll be delighted by the variety of life and geology. Santa Cruz Island offers excellent opportunities for viewing wild giant tortoises, both roaming through pastures in the agricultural zone and in the El Chato Tortoise Reserve. Walk into the forest overgrown with lichens & ferns, and listen carefully for the sound of heavy footsteps and shrubs being slowly crushed as the tortoises make their way through the brush! The pond at El Chato is surrounded by forest where short-eared owls, Darwin’s finches, Vermilion Flycatchers, Yellow Warblers, Galapagos Rails, and Paint-billed Crakes can also be seen.

* Charles Darwin Research Station: An awesome and fascinating visit to give true perspective for the rest of the adventure! Founded in 1959, it has a Natural History Interpretation Centre and carries out educational projects in support of the Galapagos National Park Service. The Park has the following development programs: conservation of natural resources, management of flora and fauna, sustainable use of resources. Others are related to environmental education, marine resources, agricultural development, monitoring and vigilance. Their aim is to conserve this natural habitat and allow tourists to appreciate all these unique species.

Day Boat Excursions

*For our two full days staying on Santa Cruz, we’ll head off island on exciting day trips via boat and in search of biological wonders!

* Santa Fe Island, White Sands, Cactuses, & Giant Iguanas: White sand beaches surrounded by sea lion colonies lined with endemic cactus forests is just one appeal to this natural wonderland. It is also home to the Santa Fe land iguanas, the largest in the entire archipelago. Other species which reside here are the Galapagos hawk, Galapagos snakes, rice rats (one of the few endemic Galapagos rodents), a variety of finches, and one of the four mockingbird species on the islands.

* South Plaza Islet, Land of Red & Yellow: An impressive cactus forest where colorful yellow and red land iguanas live will be our introduction to this small landmass. Another peculiar thing to see in South Plaza is the unique, hybrid iguana (sea and land). During the time of year we’ll be here, the landscape should be gleaming with the vegetations glow of reds, greens, and yellows (Great landscape shots!)

* North Seymour Island: Formed by a series of underwater volcanic eruptions, this island is the home to large nesting colonies of blue-footed boobies (awesome to photograph!), great frigate birds, and swallow-tailed gulls. Land iguanas and Galapagos snakes can be encountered on a lucky day as well!

* The tours to all islands listed above are subject to availability and regulation guidelines. The park service sometimes changes regulations and rotates the islands which tourists are allowed to access with little or no prior notice. The above islands are the most likely places we will get to visit and may be substituted with other nearby sites/islands which have similar and/or different flora and fauna.

Part II: Private Luxury Yacht Island Hopping

Our next experience is very special. We’ll board our very own private cruising yacht and embark on a journey throughout the eastern Galapagos Islands. Aboard the Coral II, we’ll live in the perfect combination of classic beauty and exquisite style. Built in Holland, the ship surpasses all the standards you would expect from a high-class yacht, providing a slightly larger than average (and therefore more stable) cruising vessel while maintaining the friendly atmosphere of a small expedition yacht.

Every cabin features handsome wood decoration, along with air-conditioning, a private bathroom, safe deposit box, telephone, and your choice of background music. Additionally, the Coral has plenty of room to relax with three sundecks (some shaded), a jacuzzi, comfortable dining room, and lounge. Our very own naturalist guide, captain, and full board service staff will pamper us throughout!

*Since we are chartering this amazing boat just for our travel club, the rooms range from standard, standard plus, & jr. suite. The first guests to sign up will automatically be placed in the standard plus rooms. The Jr. Suites have a total supplement of[masked] USD per person (a ridiculous steal!) and first to submit deposit & request these rooms will get them. *More details on rooms within the daily itinerary- E-mail us! ([masked])

AND, Check out this amazing 3D tour of our yacht! (https://www.gogalapagos.com/Coral_I_II/vtour_coral_II/index.html)( https://www.gogalapagos.com/Coral_I_II/vtour_coral_II/index.html )

* Dragon Hill: Bright, pink flamingos thrive as we walk by a brackish lagoon to the trail which leads across typical dry zone vegetation. Dragon Hill is an important nesting ground for endemic land iguanas, not to mention incredible views & photograph opportunities of the anchored boats and neighboring islands at the top. The surrounding forest is home to mockingbirds, Darwin’s finches, yellow warblers, and Galapagos doves.

* Bartolome Island: Formed by different volcanic parasitic cones known as lava bombs, spatter, & cinder cones, the combination will feel as if we are walking on the moon. En-route to the summit, impressive views of the surrounding islands, including the eroded tuff cone Pinnacle Rock make for incredible & iconic panoramic photographs. We’ll alsoencounter & photograph marine iguanas, lava lizards, and blue-footed boobies along the way. Next, we’ll make our way down to the beach for snorkeling and a chance to see the famous Galapagos Penguins, sea turtles, and White-tipped Reef Sharks among a great variety of colorful fish.

* Rabida Island: Dark-red sand covers the unique beaches of Rabida, home to thriving sea lions colonies. This island is considered the epicenter of the Galapagos due to thediversity of its volcanic geology. Nine species of the famous Darwin’s finches can also be found here. We’ll take a dinghy ride along marine cliffs to observe nesting seabirds & then jump into the water for a snorkel off the coast where marine life is particularly active.

* Santiago Island; “Buccaneers Cove” & Espumilla Beach: This is an amazing location due to the remains of an eroded shoreline, home to seabirds, fur seals, and playful Galapagos Sea Lions. Photograph these beautiful creatures along with the cove’s unique shapes created by wave and wind erosion. The white, sandy Espumilla Beach nearby is in James Bay where mangroves and a small palo santo forest lead to salty-water lagoons home to wading birds like pink flamingos. We’ll visit and photograph a nesting site for sea turtles in the upper dunes of this area before another great snorkel to search for rays!

* Black Turtle Cove: Back on the north shore of Santa Cruz Island and accessible only by sea, four species of mangrove crowd and form an internal lagoon & turtle sanctuary where sea turtles visit the calm waters. Peaking their heads above the surface, fish & rays circle below and White-tipped reef sharks can be seen beneath the boat along with sea birds including pelicans, herons, and egrets.

* As always this entire trip will be amazing for photography and our tour leader will be on hand to help those who want to learn more about using their camera’s, taking better pictures, etc. (PhotoFly Travel Club adventures are laid back when it comes to photography. They are not workshop style based toursand you do not need to be an avid photographer to join. All are welcome!)

* Round trip domestic flight Included (Guayaquil (GYE) –> Galapagos (GPS),[masked] USD value)

* International airfare not included but we’re happy to help you find the best flights as always. (Flying into & out of GYE)

*Don’t forget to e-mail us for the day by day itinerary of these Galapagos small group tours ([masked])
_________________________________

Join Us!

*For our solo travelers I will pair you up with someone of the same sex unless single occupancy is requested.

Price: $[masked]
*Single Supplement: $[masked]

OR

Deposit: $600.00

Go here to sign up: https://www.photoflytravel.org/galapagos-group-tours/

name: The Ultimate Vietnam Adventure
description:
Details
Our friends at Photofly Travel Club ( https://www.photoflytravel.com/ ) have planned an amazing cultural and visually stunning adventure to the whole of Vietnam!

February 19th-27th 2019

Go here to sign up: https://www.photoflytravel.org/vietnam-group-tours/

***PLUS, don’t forget to check out our Best of Vietnam’s Tropical Paradise Optional Extension! Coming Soon…***

E-mail us at [masked] for the daily itinerary!

This time we’ll be exploring both the South & North, which in many ways are like two different countries (visually and culturally)! From the one-of-a-kind floating markets along the Southern Mekong River Delta, to the world famous natural wonders at Halong Bay in the North, to the countries best beaches and tropical waters, we’ll show you our favorite parts (on & off the path!) that this strikingly vertical country has to offer on our Vietnam small group tours.

-----------------------------------------

* 8 nights/9 days throughout this unimaginably diverse country:

– 3 nights/4 Days of unforgettable Southern Vietnam (Saigon & Mekong Delta)

– 5 nights/6 days of stunning Northern Vietnam (Halong Bay & Hanoi)

– 4 nights/5 days Optional Extension to Vietnam’s tropical central coast with the best beaches in the country! (Da Nang & Hoi An)

* Charming boutique hotels throughout

* Breakfast Everyday

* 8 Lunches & 4 Dinners Included

Southern Vietnam (4 Nights):

Covering the Mekong Delta, the extreme southern end of the river, and the area around Ho Chi Minh City (Saigon), Southern Vietnam is unique and stands out as one of the most important regions in all of Southeast Asia. Ho Chi Minh City (formerly known as Saigon) is a “compelling clash of commercial clout and colonial grandeur, showcasing soaring skyscrapers next to tree-lined boulevards, and a lingering aura of French finesse.” -Frommer’s

The whole region is a rich and lush area covered with rice fields thanks to the nutrient soil from the upper Mekong. It produces half of the total of Vietnam’s agricultural output (in fact the delta produces more rice than Korea and Japan altogether!). Timeless scenery of farmers planting or harvesting rice make for incredible photo’s here. The delta’s complex system creates a maze of small canals, rivers, and seasonal creeks interspersed with colorful villages and bustling floating markets. – Paraphrased from Wikitravel.org

* Tour of Ho Chi Minh City (Notre Dame, Hotel d’Ville, Ben Thanh Market, & Dong Khoi street)

* Cu Chi tunnels (Visit the vast underground network of tunnels built first as a defense against the French, and later expanded during the American war)

* Floating Markets of Cai Be & Cai Rang (Sampan ride through the floating markets colorfully congested with women and children jostling for space and vying to sell their wares)

* Khmer Pagoda in Can Tho City (The most beautiful Khmer pagoda in the Mekong Delta!)

Northern Vietnam (5 Nights):

6 days in Northern Vietnam will take us through the Old Quarter of Hanoi to an interesting and delicious street food tour. A 3 day exotic cruise in Halong Bay will complete this part of the journey in the best way possible! This breathtaking secluded harbour has 2,000 limestone islands rising from the emerald waters of the Bac Bo gulf. It is one of Vietnam’s most scenic regions and has been referred to as the eighth Wonder of the World.

* Hanoi highlight city tour (Ho Chi Minh Mausoleum, Presidential Palace, One Pillar Pagoda, Ho Chi Minh Museum, Temple of Literature (Awesome photographs of the grounds and architecture here!)

* Unique Street Food Experience (Lunch and privately guided tour of the hidden but true taste of Hanoi on a discovery walk-through of Vietnamese street cuisine and culture)

* Explore the Old Quarter- (Right outside our hotel, lots of great photos to be taken along the old streets, each well-known for a specialized industry. Silk clothing ready-made and tailored, embroidery, silver products, and so much more can be found at the different merchants.)

* Hill Tribes & Rice Paddies (A full day adventure to Hoa Binh province filled with bright green rice paddies and colorful lowland ethnic minority tribes, mostly of nomadic Thai origin. We’ll visit the “White Thai” Minority village of Mai Chau. Amazing cultural and landscape photos to be captured here!)

Cruise Halong Bay!

A great way to see spectacular Halong Bay is a slow cruise through the seemingly never-ending bay of islands. Lay in the sun, enjoy a selection of the freshest seafood, and take photograph after photograph. On our itinerary, the aim is to get off the beaten track while maintaining a leisurely pace. The size of the vessel allows passengers to get much closer to Halong Bay’s natural wonders, such as its pocket lagoons and small fishing communities.

* 2 night/3 Day all inclusive cruise of the best & off the path destinations in Halong Bay

* Deluxe cabins w/ ensuite bathrooms and air conditioning on traditional Vietnamese style “Junk Boat”

* Explore Bai Tu Long Bay (The largest part of the UNESCO World Heritage Site, most beautiful, off the path, and by far least crowded!)

* Explore, kayak, and swim among hidden beaches, lagoons, and magical sea caves!

* As always this entire trip will be amazing for photography and one photographer will be on hand to help those who want to learn more about using their camera’s, taking better pictures, etc. (PhotoFly Travel Club adventures are laid back when it comes to photography. They are notworkshop style based tours and you do not need to be an avid photographer to join. All are welcome!)

* All transfers & taxes Included

* Domestic Flight Included from Saigon to Hanoi (SGN–>HAN)

* International Airfare is not included. We are happy to help you find a good flight as always! (Flying into Saigon (SGN) onFebruary 19th 2019 and departing from Hanoi International Airport (HAN) on February 27th 2019)

name: Sumatra and Cambodia: From Orangutan Encounters to Temples ( 3 seats left)
description:
Feb 28th-March 13th, 2019

Give Back with our Compassionate adventure!

This year Destination Earth and team is bringing a life changing adventure to our groups.

Have 60 seconds? SEE VIDEO OF THIS ADVENTURE HERE:

https://youtu.be/jwPF4SZpBa0

We spent weeks on the ground on multiple scouting trips to create something truly exceptional. We discovered 4 star boutique properties not bookable online, Sourced the best restaurants in the countries, and enlisted engaging local guides that bring you into the heart of these entrancing regions with trekking itineraries guaranteed to put you face to face with Orangutans in a natural but safe environment. This custom curated intimate adventure has no more than 15 guests in order to blend in and build community.

Join our cause and treat yourself to a one of a kind luxury giving back experience that will change your life forever.

--In Cambodia, we will have an opportunity to deeply connect with the locals while making a true difference in the lives of these amazing people, staying in a village in the shadows of long forgotten temples.

--In Sumatra we will take part in a project to plant trees to save Orangutans and their habitat, while getting up close and personal with these incredible creatures.

Sign Up Here:
https://www.destination-earth.org/trips/sumatra-the-forgotten-continent/

Want more info first? Just email Jud about this adventure at [masked]

* 8 awe-inspiring days in each country
* Mostly inclusive: unlike other trips to these regions most of your meals are on us! We prefer you pull out your camera, not your wallet.
* 3 Complimentary Massages
* Boutique hand crafted resorts
* All in country transfers including air

Absorb the whole experience for $3,895 or join us for just Cambodia at $2,195, or adventure into Sumatra for as little as $2,395 depending on budget and time constraints.
_______________________________________________________________
CAMBODIA:

Cambodia offers the largest Buddhist temple monument in the world, incredible food, and Non profits where we can make a huge impact. Dive in and prepare to have all of your senses engaged.

Days 1 - 2 The temples and beyond

*Immerse in 900 year old temples
*Fly high over the temples in a hot air balloon (included)
*Get art made by these creative Orphans from ODA orphanage
*Eat at at award winning restaurants that are ran by street kids given a second chance!

Days 3-7 Forgotten Temples and the Circus

*Travel through the backroads of Cambodia to the original Angkor style temples of King Jayamaran the IV
* Stay for one night in a traditional Khmer village and Give back in a way you never have,: this 7 minute video will inspire you!

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=HFy5H5blzS8&feature=youtu.be

*Witness one of the best performances of your life! Join us for a touching story and unbelievable feats, as these formerly street kids out perform many Cirque Du Soleil acts.
* Travel by boat through floating villages
_______________________________________________________________
Days 8-15: SUMATRA From the Jungle to Calderas- 8 Day Sumatra mostly inclusive Extension:

Day 8-11 Orangutans and rivers
*Explore fabulous cuisine in Medan
* Treck face to face with the orange "forest Man"
* Make Tofu, see Palm Sugar made in front of you, and tour rubber plantations
* Plant trees (for 1.5 hours) that will save the lives of these endangered primates

Days 11-15 Volcanos, Islands and saving lives
* Eat the best street food of your life
* Hike live volcanos at sunrise
* Bask in private hotsprings
* Stay in 4 star villas on Island in largest volcanic lake in the world
* Visit rehabilitation center where we give back to cleft palate kids in need

Sign Up Here:
https://www.destination-earth.org/trips/sumatra-the-forgotten-continent/

Want more info first? Just email Jud about this adventure at [masked]

*For our solo travelers I will pair you up with someone of the same sex unless single occupancy is requested.

name: Monday Nights @ Revolution Cafe! -- Yup, it's weekly!:)
description:
Hi there all Classical Music Lovers,

*FYI: This event is for casual drop-in and informational. So it is NOT meant to be a real coordinated meetup headed by organizer UNLESS he/she announces so. Please look up RSVP list and see who's coming, and introduce each other if you happen to recognize from the list. Also, if members decide to meet, feel free (and we definitely encourage you!) to use our meetup communication tools (i.e. RSVP comment and/or Post a comment section below the posting) to coordinate such meetings. Thanks!

 

Come and be part of this live classical music experience @ Revolution Cafe every Monday night! Not sure what kind of stress you may have or anything rolled over from past month, don't you think you deserve just a few hours out of entire month at least relaxing and unwinding yourself from all that? I am[masked]...% positive about that. Okie, here's a juicy detail about what this weekly event is about.

Special thanks to Charith (leader of chamber group) & Brian (asst. organizer), who first introduced me to the event like this @ Socha Cafe past year & also inspired me in many ways… I am sure a number of you already heard about this before by now. Revolution Cafe is located in the Mission SF. This venue is hosting a live classical music jam by the Classical Revolution led by Charith Premawardhana every Monday evening from 8 until close to 11. Of course you are not obligated to stay until the end. Please try the link Classical Revolution, and find out who they are. I feel that my words aren’t adequate enough to describe this talented passionate classical musician group. Bottom line: I luuu…vit period!:) It’s free and donation’s suggested. The venue also offers great selection of food, goodies, and drinks, and they are decently priced too. Come around 8 to be seated within good proximity to the music. Unfortunately(?)There's no public program posting for this event ahead of time. You just come & find out what's on the menu for the evening! Generally I like the idea of being surprised… believe it or not it has been so haha!:)

Well, I’ve been enjoying a lot since the ambience intertwined with live classical music there is really something very unique and friendly to all listeners regardless. Plus it helps me decompress from work/study stress. Forget not to mention schmoozing with like-minded folks with live classical music playing in the background is definitely worth craving. Hope it will do more or less the same benefit to you if you are like me.

So, please feel free to join other classical music fellas for this weekly schmooze time @ Revolution Cafe. Please come early to sit inside near the bar since it tends to get a little too smoky out toward entrance & window.

name: You Are Invited to Our Monthly Concert/Party/Jam!:)
description:
*Note:

This event is completely FREE - there is NO event fee. So any member can sign up, BUT I will be checking attendance! Please be advised.

----------------------------------------------------------------

Hi there,

I'd like to welcome all of you (especially newbies to this meetup group!) to our monthly all-in-one event, and it's FREE of cost. Please come on out and meet us. It starts with a concert, followed by a potluck/jam session at our beloved friend's home in the East Bay. And yes, you are all invited to it as well. Read the details below while browsing through our event pics (from top down: concert; potluck; jam; jam++;)

*ABOUT THIS EVENT:
The concert will take place @ Redwood Gardens rain or shine while the potluck and jam will take place at a member's home near the concert venue. Please be on time. Come through the main entrance by pressing "#001" to call into the office to get in. Thanks. 

*WHERE:
Concert @4: Redwood Gardens (Address: 2951 Derby St, Berkeley).

Potluck dinner/musical jam (+ ping pong) after the concert: check you email as the date gets closer for the exact address & potluck assignment.

*WHEN: Every 4th Saturday @ 4p unless notified any change; followed by potluck/jam @6p

*PROGRAM:
The concert will begin @4 at Redwood Gardens. The program consists of mostly classical music featuring  various solo or ensemble vocal/instrumental performances (good mix of both pro & amateur musicians!). Concert generally goes 1-1.5 hours. Afterward, good time continues with potluck and jam session at our good old friend's home until we all get tired out, right?:)

ABOUT US (the performers):
East Bay Musical Chairs a.k.a EBMC is our name. You can find more information at our website http://east-bay-musical-chairs.blogspot.com/. Send us an email if you're interested in joining!

That's all for now. Hope to see you @ the concert/party & let's have a blast!!:)

------------------------------------------------------------

Voila, here's the driving direction to the venue: 

1) Get off on Claremont Ave exit off of Hwy24 twd Walnut Creek
2) Left at the exit
3) Drive all the way up until you see Claremont hotel right near you (crossing w/ Ashby Ave)
4) Right after you pass Ashby, veer to the left
5) Go until the dead end of the street. The bldg ahead of you at the dead end is the venue.
6) Park on street (2hr limit), and walk down on the street called Derby from that dead end. You will see a green roof with 2951 written. That's the entrance to the venue.
*We'll have the door to the community room open until 4. If you come late, dial #001 using intercom outside. Thanks! Hope this helps!:)

Here's the transit route:
1) Bart to Rockridge stn
2) Take AC Transit Bus 49B (*WARNING: Be sure to ask bus driver if it is heading Derby St immediately before you get on!) 
3) Voila, you're there right in front of Redwood Gardens - Look for green awnings w/ its street # 2951) It will take less than 10 min. of bus ride from bart stn. However, Bus 49B comes every 40 min: You should time yourself to catch either 2:59p or 3:39p departure. Hope it helped!:)

description:

name: Magical Mystery Tour
description:
We're embarking on a single-day adventure that is bound to be riddled with shenanigans! No itinerary and no trip details ahead of time. All you have to do is show up with a fun-loving attitude and an open mind. Oh, and trust us! We've got decades of exploring under our belts!

$39

Click here to sign up: https://greentortoise.com/reserve.online.form.php

name: Explore Death Valley!
description: Death Valley National Park is known for extreme conditions and extreme desert beauty, with vistas stretching from Mount Whitney’s towering crags to the lowest point in North America—the salty flats of Badwater Basin. This warm winter adventure explores wildly-colored canyons, the lunar landscape of a crater, playful sand dunes, natural hot springs, and a campout under a billion stars!

name: Spend your winter on the beach! Baja Beach Daze 14-Day
description: Our affordable backpacker bus tour of Baja, Mexico, has it all! Watch leaping dolphins and soaring manta rays from our private beach camp; snorkel through turquoise waters; stand in the shadows of towering cacti; and explore remote villages.

name: Bi-Weekly South Bay Meetup
description:
Join member host Kristine Stewart & Freya at the all-grass Lincoln Community Field every other Sunday afternoon--we're hoping for tired dogs come Monday mornings this Fall!

Lincoln Hound Society (LHS) is a non-profit community group that manages the community field (CF) at Lincoln High-School in San Jose where dogs get to play off-leash when school is not in session. The CF is about one acre of mostly grass, fully fenced, and located in the middle of Lincoln H-S’s athletic fields. Water is available from a nearby faucet and carried to the CF in plastic gallon containers supplied by LHS volunteers. There are garbage cans on the CF but you need to bring your own waste bags. There is only one bench so bring your own lawn chair if you know you're going to want to sit down during the meetup. NOTE: there's not a separate small dog area and no double-gate at the entrance (it's a regular door).

Address & Directions:

There's no actual street address for the CF so you can park anywhere on the streets surrounding the high school (Wabash, Dana, Hester, and Olive avenues) and walk onto the school grounds; the CF is located inbetween the football and baseball fields behind the tennis courts. However, we recommend you park in the school parking lot (allowed on weekends) located at the corner of Wabash Ave & Garden Dr. Driving in on Wabash, take a right turn into the school grounds at the corner with Garden Dr. Then follow the walking path outlined in blue on the attached map to walk from the parking lot to the CF; the door to enter the CF will be on your left side by a baseball batting cage opposite tennis courts. There is no signage so look for a regular tall metal door to enter. Please refer to the attached maps posted in one of the comments below for an overview.

NOTE: For safety reasons--please no treats, toys, food, or dogs in heat at this meetup! Young children should be seated in strollers or held by parents if they come along. Thanks for your cooperation!

name: Weekly Wednesday Lunch Meetup in San Mateo
description:
We've moved back to grassy Joinville Dog Park for the non-rainy season! Join us anytime on Wednesdays for our weekly meetup. We're a friendly group of 5-10 regulars and totally welcome newcomers if you happen to have free time.

This dog park is a small neighborhood place inside the greater Joinville Park, so no separate small dog section or double-gate entry, but there is water, poop bags & trash cans, and bench seating. Shade is limited but we put up a shade tent over the benches on hot days. We usually have the dog park almost to ourselves, and it's right by the lagoon with a nice relaxed atmosphere.

Directions:

The dog park is located within a regular park that has a children's area, baseball field, pool, etc., so it's necessary to walk deep into the park on the main path to get to the dog park.

From Kehoe Ave., turn left into the unmarked lane after the school's black fence and before the swim center (if you get to the stop sign at Roberta, you've gone too far). Drive as far in as possible to park right before the roundabout. Take the main path from the roundabout to the left of the baseball field, turn left at the fork to cross the bridge by the sewage plant, and then you'll see the dog park straight ahead (marked by a blue dot on the map in the comments).

If you're coming from SF/North, it's possible to access the park off 3rd Ave. East (J. Hart Clinton Dr.). Pass Seal Point Park on your left and turn right on Detroit Dr. This is an industrial/commercial neighborhood, but it's sometimes possible to find 1-2 open parking spots on the street by the dog park's northern entrance. You could also drive passed Detroit and make a right on the first street after the bridge over the lagoon, Anchor Rd. This is a residential area with street parking available so you can enter on the dog park's eastern end.

NOTE: For safety reasons--no treats, toys, food, dogs in heat, or small children at the meetup. Kindly keep an eye on your dog at all times. Thank you!

name: game night
description:
Hey everyone, we are meeting on Tuesday, at 6:30 p.m. to play some strategy board and card games. We will get some games going by 6:45, but if you can't arrive until later that's fine, too - you can start another game with other stragglers, or get in on a second or third round of games. If you have preferences for what you want to play, teach, or learn, just let everyone know in the comments section.

Some games we have been playing recently are Tikal, Inis, Photosynthesis, Scythe, A Study in Emerald, Twilight Struggle, Century: Spice Road, Grifters, Above & Below, Incan Gold, Avalon and a few others.

Bring whatever you like, though, especially if you are willing to teach it to others. We like learning new games, too!

Looking forward to meeting (and seeing again) other tabletop gamers, socializing and playing games!

Please keep your RSVP updated, and let us know if you need to cancel or will be more than 15 minutes late, so we can plan games according to player count. Thanks!

name: Halloween Bar Crawl!
description: It's that time of year again, Time for our annual Halloween Bar Crawl! This event is becoming not only a Meetup staple but a San Francisco must do event! You can see pictures of past events here (http://www.meetup.com/missiondivebars/photos/11470002/174137282/), here (http://www.meetup.com/missiondivebars/photos/753607/), here (http://www.meetup.com/missiondivebars/photos/1130647/), here (http://www.meetup.com/missiondivebars/photos/4164782/), here (http://www.meetup.com/missiondivebars/photos/18342042/) and here (http://www.meetup.com/missiondivebars/photos/25569242/) Like last year we will be sticking around the 16th St area to stay near BART Here's the tentative rout: Standard Deviant (http://www.standarddeviantbrewing.com/) Flying Pig (http://flyingpigbistropub.com/) Dalva (http://www.yelp.com/biz/dalva-san-francisco#hrid:eOkuz3Tq095a0cJDFE3DGA/src:self) Gestalt Haus (http://www.yelp.com/biz/gestalt-haus-san-francisco#hrid:NE7h2eCXPy36xpSTUUQkHg/src:self) The Sycamore (http://www.yelp.com/biz/the-sycamore-san-francisco) This rout is still in the works so check back later for changes I will be updating the Meetup App as we move to help you find us. If you only make it to one event this year this is the one This is a costume required event! You don't have to do much but you can't do nothing! Money: Bring some cash Transportation: This is an alcohol fueled event so please don't drive. There are plenty of public transportation choices. http://www.511.org (http://www.511.org/) Photographs: I take pictures at these events with the intention of posting them online for us to share and to use them to promote the group. If you don't want your image used this way feel free to come to our events but just don't pose for pictures. If you pose for a picture you are consenting to having your image used for the reasons I've mentioned above. If I get you by accident, in a candid shot or a group shot, let me know and I'll take the picture down and alter it so that you can't be seen.

name: Mission Dive Bars 20th Anniversary party! January 2029
description:
Since the Mayan apocalypse came and left without the sky burning and people bleeding out of their ears, so disappointing, we might as well start planning for the future.

 

January 2029 will be the 20th anniversary of this club and if we are still around we should definitely get together and mark the occasion with whatever revelry our old broken down bodies can stand!

 

Money: If we are using money then I bet most dive bars will still be cash only. They may have a space scrip dispenser but it’s generally best to bring for barter what you are going to need.

Transportation: This is an alcohol fueled event so please don't drive. There will be automated flying robots provided

Photographs: I will take holo-photo's at this event with the intention of posting them on the psychic network for us to share and to promote the group. If you don't want your image used feel free to come to the event but wear your cloaking gear so my sensors aren't triggered.

name: Afternoon Board Games in San Leandro (Bi-Weekly)
description:
*This Meetup repeats every two weeks*

• What we'll do
Join us for an afternoon of board games in San Leandro! Bring your favorite game to share with the group. We usually get through 2 or 3 sets of games so feel free to come late or leave early as needed.

• What to bring
Yourself and some games to share!

• Important to know
The "Host" for this event can not always make it. Substitute hosts may be solicited for weekends he can't be there. If at least two hosts can't be found we will cancel for that week. Host requirements - definitely show up (barring emergencies, of course), bring at least one game, and have something for others to find you (rainbow flag, sign, etc.)

If you RSVP, please show up. We've had a lot of issues with no-shows. It's a courtesy for your fellow attendees to please change your RSVP if you can't make the event.

name: LGBTQ Trip to Cuba!
description:
If you're interested in traveling to Cuba, there are some amazing trips coming up this year. Groups will be mostly solo travelers and small, usually between 7-10 people and truly local, as we will be staying in local bed and breakfast style accommodations. Email [masked] if interested or if you have questions.

All of the non-LGBT trips are open to everyone. Usually about a quarter to half of everyone on each trip are LGBTQ travelers.

TRIP DATES :

- December 26, 2018 - January 3, 2019 (LGBTQ Trip)
*6 SPOTS LEFT! 1 solo lesbian traveler & 1 solo male looking for roommates.

- November 17 - 25, 2018
*6 SPOTS LEFT! 1 solo female and male looking for roommates.*

Trip details can be seen on the website : globe-drifters.com/tour/cuba

PRICE (excluding flights) :

Regular Season - $2,400 (February - November)

Peak Season - $2,600 (December - January)

Single Supplement is $550

REVIEWS :

See past travelers' Yelp reviews by clicking here : https://www.yelp.com/biz/globe-drifters-san-francisco-2

ITINERARY :

Days 1-3 : HAVANA

• Classic car convertible ride to Fusterlandia (famous artist neighborhood) and Revolution Square.
• Drinks in Old Havana and live music at El Floridita, Buena Vista Social Club and other hot spots!

Days 3-5 : VINALES

• Organic farm visit and dinner at local farmer's home.
• Local tobacco farm tour and cigar rolling demonstration.
• Your choice of optional activities : cooking class & local market visit, horseback riding, or caving at one of the many caves in the area (at your own expense).

Days 5-6 : PLAYA LARGA

• Swimming or snorkeling at Bay of Pigs & Bay of Pigs historical museum visit.
• Sunset dinner & drinks at Playa Larga.

Days 6-8 : TRINIDAD

• Hike to and swim at waterfall w/ a stop at a local farmer's house for tea.
• Beach time at Playa Ancon.

Days 8-9 : HAVANA

• Say adios to Cuba with one last dinner at a local paladar!

For more information, please visit : http://globe-drifters.com/tour/cuba/ or email : [masked]

name: How SmartGurlz got featured "Shark Tank" and accepted an offer from Daymond John
description:
RSVP HERE: https://www.lifograph.com/events/51254824560

Join us for Chinese food dinner and come listen to the incredible story of Sharmi Albrechtsen, Cofounder and CEO of SmartGurlz, a Silicon Valley company that last year beat 40,000 other applicants and got featured on the famous ABC TV show “Shark Tank”.

SmartGurlz showed its amazing coding robots on national TV to Richard Branson, Marc Cuban, Robert Herjavic, and other sharks, then accepted a $200,000 offer from celebrity shark Daymond John.

SmartGurlz also raised $700,000+ through crowdfunding and from several angel investors.

If you want to learn how to get featured on Shark Tank and raise money from investors, don’t miss an opportunity to meet Sharmi and ask her questions.

SmartGurlz is an EdTech platform that manufactures friendly self-balancing robots and action dolls that teaches girls how to code. Connected via smartphone or tablet, SmartGurlz allows girls 6 and up to immerse themselves in Science, Technology, Engineering and Math (STEM).

SmartGurlz was launched in 2016 and raised over $1M in funding to date. It also has made over $1.5M in revenue and entered into a partnership with Pitsco, one of the largest education products distributor in the world.

You can buy SmartGurlz toys on Amazon but also at big box retailers like Walmart and others.

SmartGurlz is also working with organizations such as Black Girls Code and Girl Scouts of America.

The Chief Creative Officer of SmartGurlz is Kari Byron, TV personality known for her participation on the top- rated TV show “Mythbusters”.

Besides Shark Tank, SmartGurlz has been featured in many TV shows and publications, including The Huffington Post, Financial Times, Forbes, BBC, CNet, CNN, NBC, Home Business, TechCrunch, CBS, TheNextWeb, Washington Business Journal, Fox Business, etc.

RSVP HERE: https://www.lifograph.com/events/51254824560

______________________
SPEAKER
______________________

Sharmi Albrechtsen has over 20 years of experience in STEM focused co-creation and learning platforms.

Prior to launching SmartGurlz, Sharmi was the Associate Director of Ida Institute, an organization co-creating consumer education materials for children and adults with hearing loss.

She was also head of communications at major pharmaceutical companies - Ferring Pharmaceuticals, ALK Abello and Sonion - where again, she and her team created consumer education materials for children and adults who suffered from nocturia, infertility, allergy and asthma.

name: “Financial projections and funding strategies” with Stanford GSB Lecturer
description:
RSVP HERE: https://www.lifograph.com/events/50880575170

Financial projections are critical when raising money. Investors are expecting founders to include the financial projections in their deck and be able to tell their startup story with numbers. Investors will ask you to back up your assumptions and explain your numbers and ratios. Are you prepared?

Join us for a great hands-on workshop on how to build your financial projections and do financial modeling with Efrat Kasznik, Lecturer at the Stanford Graduate School of Business.

She is a contributor to many publications, including VentureBeat, Business Journals, etc. She is also a Mentor at the Stanford Venture Studio Incubator, as well as a mentor at several other incubators, accelerators, angel groups and venture capital firms.

Efrat will share with us advice on how to build a robust business and financial model based upon realistic expectations and sound assumptions and successfully communicate your financial vision and expectations to investors.

Drinks and Chinese food dinner will be provided.

RSVP HERE: https://www.lifograph.com/events/50880575170

_________________________
TOPICS:
_________________________

Based on her experiences as a valuation expert, Stanford Lecturer, Silicon-Valley entrepreneur and startup and investor advisor, Efrat will provide hands-on advice on:

• How to build a robust business and financial model, based upon realistic expectations and sound assumptions

• How to analyze and select the appropriate revenue models and cost structures for your startup

• How to understand the user metrics and key performance indicators (KPI) benchmarks in your industry, and how they impact your funding and valuation

• How to determine your valuation trajectory throughout the funding cycle, from seed funding to an exit

• How to successfully communicate your financial vision and expectations to investors

And much more!

RSVP HERE: https://www.lifograph.com/events/50880575170

_________________________
SPEAKER
_________________________

EFRAT KASZNIK

Efrat Kasznik is a startup valuation, fundraising and financial modeling expert, as well as a Lecturer at the Stanford Graduate School of Business.

Efrat is the Founder and President of Foresight Valuation Group, an intellectual property and startup advisory firm, where she has assisted clients that range in size from Fortune 100 companies to startups, angel investor groups, venture capitalists, law firms, universities, research institutions, inventors, IP brokers and patent funds.

Throughout her career, Efrat has served as a cofounder, executive and advisor to several startups, including serving as CFO at a telecom startup.

She is a Mentor at the Stanford Venture Studio Incubator, as well as a mentor at several other incubators, accelerators and investor groups in the US, Europe and Israel.

Efrat is a frequent conference speaker, author and blogger, and regularly writes for leading publications such as the Business Journals, VentureBeat, IAM Magazine and IPWatchdog.

She has been listed on the prestigious IAM 300 list of Leading World IP Strategists for 4 years in a row.

Temple of Thelema presents: Tarot in the New Aeon
description:
Do what thou wilt shall be the whole of the Law.

Join us every month for a Tarot and Qabalah workshop. In this series we will be focussing on the 22 Major Arcana of the Tarot and it's application to the New Aeon. Topics will include but are not limited to Hermetic Qabalah, Magick, Astrology, and Thelema. Each month we will delve into a comparative analysis of each of the Keys of the Tarot, beginning in April with The Universe and taking the Path of Return to The Fool.

This event is open to the public. A $10 donation is requested.

PLEASE NOTE:

Doors open at 7:30, and discussion starts at 8:00pm.

*There is a callbox located outside the front door. Dial #206 to be buzzed in.*

Love is the law, love under will.

name: Temple of Thelema Presents: The Rite of the Mother
description:
Do what thou wilt shall be the whole of the Law.

Join us for a very special celebration of the Rite of the Mother. This is the first in the cycle of this annual triad of healing rites celebrating the Mother, Father & Child Archetypes. This beautiful public ritual is performed in the style of the Western Mysteries, giving you an opportunity to take a closer look at the Temple of Thelema, a modern Mystery School for the New Aeon.

There will be light refreshments following the ceremony where you may meet members of Temple of Thelema, and discuss the ritual and initiation in this modern mystery school.

This is a public ritual and all are welcome! A $10 donation is requested. Doors open at 2:00 and the ceremony will begin at 3:00. Sorry, no latecomers will be admitted after the ceremony has started.

The space is located on the 6th floor of the I.O.O.F. (International Order of Odd Fellows) building, 26 7th St, San Francisco, CA 94103

Love is the law, love under will.

name: Exploring the Planets in Sidereal Astrology
description:
Do what thou wilt shall be the whole of the Law.

Please join us for this month's Astrology Lab. In addition to our usual plotting of charts for newcomers, this month we will begin our program on Planets, including their myths, properties, and lessons. All levels of knowledge and experience are welcome. For those who've attended in the past, we can also investigate further in the particulars of your chart, including planetary aspects, transits, and Lunar and Solar returns. As this is a "lab" style setting people are welcome to come and go as they please within the time frame of the event.

As above, so below.
From Macrocosmos to Microcosmos, Astrology provides a symbol set that the aspirant can utilize to understand the relationships between the Universe within and outside of themselves. It's also useful in the context of the Tarot, Hermetic Qabalah and the patterns and paths on the Tree Of Life.

"Astrology is the science that describes the influence of the heavenly bodies upon mundane affairs and upon human character and life. It is the oldest science in existence; it is not only prehistoric, but pre-traditional; it is the science of the effects of the Solar Currents on the living things of our earth, especially on human life."
-Aleister Crowley

$10 donation suggested.

PLEASE NOTE:
*There is a callbox located outside the front door. Dial #206 to be buzzed in.*

Love is the law, love under will.

name: Brownie Mary Democratic Club Monthly Meeting
description:
You are cordially invited to attend the next meeting of the San Francisco Chapter of the Brownie Mary Democratic Club. We will meet on Wednesday at 6:15 pm at 847 Howard Street (between 4th and 5th Streets) in downtown San Francisco. Anyone 18 or older is welcome to attend.

All current members who did not renew their annual membership at the July meeting will need to renew in August. New members are welcome to join. Annual dues are $20.

name: Join us for an introduction to meditation and a start to a better life :)
description: Get an introduction to meditation and learn about interesting subjects like career success, scuba diving, martial arts and much more. Come hear how you can integrate all of this into making your life more vibrant, bright and fun!

name: Outsourcing Technical Documentation Projects: Documentation Managers Meetup
description:
On November 8, join Barry Saiff, Founder and CEO of Saiff Solutions, a Philippines-based technical writing outsourcing firm, and me, Scott Abel, the Content Wrangler, for a spirited discussion about outsourcing content development. This documentation manager’s meetup aims to demystify technical communication outsourcing and answer questions and concerns about the approach.

Barry is the author of the book, "Technical Writing Outsourcing: From Fear to Mastery," forthcoming in October, 2018. The book will be published by XML Press as part of the Content Wrangler Content Strategy Series. Barry has experience on "both sides" of the outsourcing equation, over many years. If you are interested in the challenges of outsourcing, take this opportunity to learn from your colleagues, and contribute to our discussion. We look forward to seeing you.

Light refreshments will be served. Free parking on site.

name: Understanding Industry 4.0: A Disruptive Opportunity for Information Developers
description:
Whether you call it Industry 4.0 or the Industrial Internet, the combination of technologies that integrate autonomous connected devices, remote sensing, augmented and virtual realities, driven by artificial intelligence and powered by big data is going to upset your professional and personal apple-cart.

• What does this mean for all of us, and what is the role of information?
• How will our work lives change, and how can we prepare for it?
• What are the opportunities?

Information 4.0 is an informational response. We're working to make sense of it all. And, we're coming together to ensure that the information and knowledge we need to live well in a hybrid human-machine environment is built into the design of these products and devices.

Join me, Scott Abel, The Content Wrangler, for a lunch-n-learn presentation from Ray Gallon, president of the Information 4.0 Consortium and co-founder of The Transformation Society, to explore where we are today, and how you can play a role in where we’re heading.

HOW TO BUY A TICKET & SECURITY CLEARANCE

1) In the upper right-hand corner of this page (where it says "ARE YOU GOING?") click YES to purchase your ticket (which includes a box lunch; you'll order your meal in the next step).

2) AFTER you purchase your ticket, visit this URL — https://goo.gl/forms/390kgx8q1x76tR3l2 — to provide security clearance information and to make your boxed lunch selection.

See you at the Meetup!

Scott Abel, The Content Wrangler
[masked]

name: Mastermind Session
description:
Mastermind
-----------------

Paul will lead the Mastermind session. He will give a short explanation if there are any newcomers. Then, he will poll the room for participants to sit in the "seat." After he has a list of participants, he will divide the time evenly by the participants.

Each person will get an opportunity for feedback.

Agenda
-----------
6:00pm - 6:15pm Meet and Greet / Networking
6:15pm - 7:15pm Mastermind Round #1
7:15pm - 7:30pm Break
7:30pm - 8:30pm Mastermind Round #2
8:30pm - 9:00pm Networking / WrapUp*

Housekeeping
--------------------
There are restrooms and drinks available. However, we do not provide food. Please either eat in advance or bring snacks (the meetings can often go long).

* This discussion has *always* gone over. One session didn't finish until 10pm as we were so engrossed and lost track of time. We wish to respect your time. Please feel free to excuse yourself to leave early.

If you're wanting to join to get a workout we'll have a fast pacer there to run with you.

Travel Symposium for the Blind and Visually Impaired
description:
RSPVP on EVENTBRITE: https://www.eventbrite.com/e/travel-symposium-tickets-49565251000?aff=ebdssbdestsearch

Hosted by: LightHouse for the Blind and Visually Impaired
"Students of all ages that are blind and low vision, their families and professionals are invited to join Guide Dogs for the Blind and LightHouse for the Blind and Visually Impaired for our first day long Travel Symposium consisting of presentations, activities and social gathering focused on connecting people that are blind or have low vision with resources, equipment, mentorship for all sorts of important topics related to travel.

The Symposium will start with a light breakfast and keynote address before our morning breakout sessions. These morning breakout sessions will have two tracks, one dedicated to travel tips and tricks and the other about the innovative Guide Dog Immersion program hosted by LightHouse for the Blind and Visually Impaired and Guide Dogs for the Blind. After lunch guest will get the chance to explore a travel resource fair that will include some of the following topics; Canes Canes and more Canes, Guide Dog Lifestyle, GPS and other applications that can assist with travel, T-Map Project and tactile images with Mad Lab and some much more. Through the day students will get the chance to meet other peers and mentors that can share advice and their experiences traveling around the bay, around the country and around the world. The afternoon programming will conclude with a social celebrating White Cane Day and a drawing for some really awesome door prizes.

Who: student that are blind or have low vision as well as their families, teacher and other professionals that work with those that are blind or have low vision

What: day long workshop dedicated to learning about travel

When: 9:00 am to 5:00 pm Saturday, October 13th

Where: LightHouse Headquarters – 10th floor of 1155 Market St. San Francisco, CA 94103

RSVP: Please register of the event by Wednesday, October 10th by completing the form on the below link or contacting Jamey Gump. https://www.eventbrite.com/e/travel-symposium-tickets-49565251000.

Should you have any questions about this event or need assistance with the registration please contact, Jamey Gump, Youth Services Coordinator at [masked] or by phone at (415)[masked]."

name: Nature Escape Croatia
description:
From Zagreb to Zadar, Split to Dubrovnik we’ll traverse Croatia’s diverse & stunning natural landscapes while enjoying fantastic local cuisine, ancient historic sites, and sunsets on the Adriatic sea on this 8-day venture.

$200 off early bird special through 4/30!

• Daily breakfasts and multiple group lunches and dinners

For complete information and booking instructions please visit: https://traversejourneys.com/croatia/

This trip is designed & lead by your Meetup co-host, Ashley Blake. We’d love to have you along!

name: The Art of Cuba
description:
An 8-day cultural journey into the beauty that is Havana, Trinidad and Viñales, Cuba. We’ll peek behind the curtain on this eye-opening, beautiful exploration of the magical culture of the long-since prohibited island. We will be spending our time between the bustling capital of Havana, the well-preserved colorful colonial town of Trinidad and the lush tobacco and farm region of Viñales. Come see what's in this time capsule filled with beautiful art, food, culture and music.
A carefully curated itinerary for an immersive, culturally rich experience in Cuba.

October 23-30, 2018
November 16-23
January 8-15, 2019

Trip includes:
7 nights in our charming Cuban homestays in Havana and Trinidad.
Daily breakfast
Welcome and farewell lunch/dinner
Locally guided architecture tours
Havana and Trinidad city tours
Tobacco farm tour and cigar rolling lesson
Organic farm visit
Personal translator and driver
An authentic look into the lives and culture of Cuba
Travel Visas (required to visit the country)
Local guide + Traverse representative 24/7
Small group experience, max 14 people

For complete trip details and registration information see here: https://traversejourneys.com/cuba/

name: No Man's Land Film Festival
description:
RSVP on EVENTBRITE: https://www.eventbrite.com/e/no-mans-land-film-festival-tickets-49997239088?aff=ebdssbdestsearch

Hosted by BAY AREA CLIMBERS COALITION:
"Join us for our annual screening of No Man's Land Film Festival!

No Man's Land Film Festival is an all-woman adventure film festival based out of the Rocky Mountains of Colorado that meets a need and desire to highlight and connect individuals who identify as women in pursuit of the radical. We are a collaboration and celebration of humans who are deeply engaged in enhancing the female presence in the adventure arena. The goal of this festival is to connect like-minded individuals who are action-oriented, wish to support a shared vision of gender equality, have a desire to experience their passions and environments through a uniquely female lens, and above all, love adventure. Along with cultivating a deep interest in exploring the vastness of our planet from a female point of view, No Man's Land strives to create a history of motivating audiences to implement and inspire change. Our mission transcends the films presented; this festival acts as a platform for progressive thought and movement in the outdoor industry. At No Man's Land, we aim to un-define feminine in adventure and sport through film."

About your host:
"The Bay Area Climbers Coalition is a volunteer run 501(c)(3) non-profit organization focused on preserving access to our local outdoor areas by actively fostering positive relationships with land managers, hosting stewardship events, and providing educational programming for the climbing community."

name: A New Zealand Fantasy
description:
A New Zealand Fantasy: Nov.19-26 (or 30th), 2018
$250 OFF 'EARLY BIRD SPECIAL' FOR SIGNUPS THROUGH 6/15!!!

For more info and to secure your spot: https://traversejourneys.com/new-zealand/

Our 8-day route takes in New Zealand's stunning North & South Islands, with an optional add-on to create a 12-day trip. Starting from Auckland, together we will explore the land of the long white cloud, with good company and a comprehensive exploration of not only the landscapes and unique formations that make up this modern-day Middle-Earth, but of the cultures and values that are part of what makes New Zealand the breathtaking destination you’ve been hearing all about.

With options for travelers of all thrill, skill and activity levels, you can choose to simply relax and soak up the sights with a range of standard and luxury options, or customize your trip to access the high of your natural adrenaline. See stunning Milford Sound, swim with dolphins or zip-line through magical underground glow-worm caves, as you travel with a local guide as well as your host throughout the country. With all your travel planning taken care of, and plenty of time for side trips and adventures with our knowledgeable team, you can truly discover both islands at a relaxed but steady pace. Drive times are kept to a minimum with your comfort in mind, and in order to maximize your own enjoyment your tour is fully customizable to suit your desires.

Hear from the people of the land, the songs, the stories. Take a bath in a pool of world-renowned thermal muds, or a hot pool under the stars on a sparkling beach. Our trip will take you to the base of the highest peaks and the deepest fjords, and will reconnect you with Papatuanuku (the earth mother) herself as you soak up the natural wonders of the end of the earth with our own brand of personalized care and comfort.

STARTING AT $3245 PER PERSON -- or $2995 for early bird signups!

Included:
-- All accommodations in clean & comfortable 3-4 star hotels
-- Daily breakfast and multiple group dinners
-- Transportation from Auckland airport on arrival and to Queenstown airport on departure
-- Ground transport between each destination in comfortable, privately rented vehicles
-- Welcome drinks in Auckland on arrival day
-- Ferry to Coromandel town
-- Domestic flight from Rotorua to Christchurch
-- Tickets on Driving Creek Railway Eyeful Tower Rail Tour
-- Entry to TeWaiaroa Buried village, Hells Gate Geothermal Park, Okains Bay Museum, & Tekapo Hot Springs
-- Scenic drives with freedom to stop for photos and bask in the stunning views
-- Visit to our local community partner
-- Traverse representative 24/7 as well as a dedicated New Zealand-native guide
-- Small group experience, max 12 people

Secure your spot today: https://traversejourneys.com/new-zealand/

name: Women's Yoga & Surf Retreat: Costa Rica
description:
LADIES -- join this 6-day Retreat to indulge and rejuvenate!!

NOV 20-26, 2018 (and more options throughout 2019)

Enjoy the adventure of surfing with the relaxation of yoga, all in a serene setting on an idyllic beach with perfect summer temperatures. It's an invigorating experience that will leave you happy, grateful and full!​

Whether you wish to learn to surf, deepen your yoga practice or simply explore a new place and meet new friends on a fun adventure, this retreat is the perfect experience. Relax in a stunning, private boutique hotel -- the perfect accommodations situated a moment’s walk from a four-mile stretch of white sand beach... with perfect waves. The hotel is even complete with a gourmet restaurant attached, providing daily meals packed with fresh, local goodness.

FOR MORE INFO:
https://traversejourneys.com/costa-rica-retreat/

This trip is partnered with Sister Surf & Yoga Retreat to bring you a wonderfully planned experience, ideal for any women looking for a 'ready-to-go', adventure-filled vacation. No previous surfing or yoga experience necessary! With expert skills and patient guidance, your instructors are able to further anyone's yoga or surf journey, even if you're starting at 'zero'. You'll be surprised and amazed at what you can achieve in a few days with their confidence-boosting instruction and tips. Together, the three women (who are also sisters) leading your experience will bring their expertise, passion and energy to inspire you with their love of surfing and yoga... and their true zest for life!

INCLUDED:
6 nights + 5 days at La Marejada Hotel
3 gourmet meals daily + drinks (not including alcohol)
Daily yoga on the beach
Professional surf lessons
Daily surfing
Daily video coaching sessions
Surf + yoga equipment always available to use
Experienced instructors
Airport transfer to + from Libiera
Hiking + beach walks to secret tide pools
Professional surf photo session
Afternoon of beach arts + crafts

FOR MORE INFO, and to book your spot:
https://traversejourneys.com/costa-rica-retreat/

name: Cycle Vietnam & Cambodia
description:
Get on a bicycle, off the beaten track and explore Cambodia and Vietnam with us! We'll cover 300+ miles across the two countries and cycle the beautiful green canals of the Mekong Delta, explore pepper farms, fresh crab markets and ancient history. Dig deeper and scratch the surface of the Khmer ‘fast fashion’ industry while visiting local non-profits, social entrepreneurs and impact organizations.

Get educated, get fit and get inspired. Chose from 2 different date sets:

Nov 21-Dec 2
Dec 27-Jan 7

The adventure includes:

• 11 nights boutique hotel accommodation, with A/C & private bath

• Full bicycle hire, including helmets

• 2 dedicated guides

• 8 breakfasts & 6 dinners in social enterprise-based training restaurants + 1 cooking class

• 3+ visits to our community and village NGO partners + your $200 AUD donation to the partner of your choice

• Cultural education to get the best local experience in Cambodia & Vietnam

• Entry to the Genocide Museum in Phnom Penh

• Mekong Delta floating market tour

• Airport transfers

• Small group experience, max 10

This trip is offered in partnership between Traverse Journeys & Social Cycles to bring you the best local intel and professional cycling know-how.

Find full registration information, pictures and detailed itinerary here (https://traversejourneys.com/cambodia-to-vietnam). We hope to see you on this incredible trip!

name: Costa Rica Immersion
description:
Want to experience the natural beauty and unique culture of Costa Rica away from the tourist crowds and over-inundated destinations? Interested in community engagement, home stays, and/or language immersion when you travel? Do you enjoy learning about culture, history, and local life abroad? How about a few nights at a boutique hotel on a pristine white sand beach, surrounded by a friendly locals, with lux activities included like a catamaran sailing tour?

If all that sounds pretty much perfect, then check out this 7-night trip, crafted to bring you a truly unique experience in the happiest country in the world!*

Find out more: https://traversejourneys.com/costa-rica-immersion

Community engagement with Costa Rican Humanitarian Foundation** for 3 days offers an in-depth and fulfilling experience on your travels, combined with excursions throughout the Central Valley. You'll also enjoy 3 nights of relaxation and adventure on a stunning & pristine beach named among the most beautiful beaches on earth! All of this is yours and MORE on our 'Costa Rica Immersion' trip this March (OR custom dates -- just let us know when you want to go and we'll make it happen)!

Family package pricing and add-on nights available. Custom date options. Unguided pricing option for custom dates. Truly something for everyone! Pricing starts at $1495 and includes:

Accommodations:
4 nights staying with local families
3 nights in a boutique hotel on the beach

Transportation:
All transportation -- to/from included excursions & activities, and your shuttle to Playa Grande

Activities:

Visit to indigenous reserve with indigenous guide

name: Discover Nepal
description:
Join us for a 12-day venture through the mountains & jungles of the Land of the Himalayas, complete with temples, trekking, yoga, and art in Kathmandu, Lumbini, Pokhara & the Annapurna circuit.

A carefully curated itinerary for an immersive, active experience in Nepal. With two date sets for 2019:

April 8-19, 2019
September 17-28, 2019

Trip includes:
11 nights’ accommodations: 6 nights local 3-star hotel in Kathmandu & Pokhara with 4-star boutique hotel upgrade option; 1 night Lumbini boutique hotel; 2 nights mountain retreat cabin; 2 nights trekking guest house
Daily breakfast, Welcome & Farewell dinners + multiple additional meals throughout
Guided tour & entrance fees of Kathmandu valley to see Hindu & Buddhist cultural & UNESCO heritage sites including Durbar Square, Buddha Stupa, Pashupatinath Temple & more
Guided bicycle tour through Lumbini, the birthplace of Buddha
Tea time with a monastery monk to learn more about Buddhism
Guided tour options in Pokhara Valley to see Devi’s Falls, Fewa Lake, Gupteshore Cave, Bindabashini Temple & more.
3 days, 2 nights trekking through terraced fields and local villages in the Annapurna mountain range (4-7 hours hiking daily) with all meals, assistant guide and porters

description:

April 20-27, 2019
$3090

name: Ireland's Wild Atlantic Way
description:
Join us for an 8-day or 12-day route along Ireland's ruggedly beautiful West coast. Starting from Cork city, we'll take in County Cork's scenic coastline, Kerry's rugged beauty, Clare's unique heritage, and Galway's bustling streets before finishing up in historical Dublin City.

MORE INFO HERE: https://traversejourneys.com/ireland/

This trip will be led by guides intimately familiar with Ireland (one guide from Ireland), ensuring that you are provided an authentic and immersive experience throughout the journey... well beyond the tourist trail and cookie-cutter sights/routes. Come immerse yourself in the luring magic of this wee country's Western shores!

INCLUDED:
All accommodations in clean, comfortable and locally-run B&Bs
Daily breakfast and multiple group dinners (3 total dinners on 8-day trip, 5 total dinners on 12-day trip)
Transportation from Dublin or Cork airport on arrival and to Dublin, or Shannon airport on departure
Ground transport between each destination in comfortable, privately rented vehicles
Guided walking tour of Cork City
Visit to our local community partner -- Irish Seed Savers
Entry to Blarney Castle, Killarney National Park, Gleninchaquin Park, Ross Castle, and the Cliffs of Moher on 8-day trip
Entry to Dunguaire Castle, and select Dublin sights on 12-day trip
Roundtrip ferry crossing to Inis Mor on 12-day trip
Guided walking tour of Galway City and Dublin City on 12-day trip
Dedicated Irish-native guide and 2nd Traverse guide for groups of 6+
Traverse representative assisting you from booking to departure
Small group experience, max 12 people

If you've ever fantasized about being in a fairy tale, then this is the country for you to explore. Ireland's rugged West Coast is especially alive with rich traditions and folklore, not to mention picture perfect vistas.

For further info: https://traversejourneys.com/ireland/

name: Classic Machu Picchu & Cusco
description:
Have you always wanted to visit Machu Picchu? Join us May or August 2019 for a trip of a lifetime! Experience the majesty of Machu Picchu, learn about the ancient city of Cusco, and soak in local culture through the Inca trail hike or a no-hike option with excursions in the Sacred Valley.

2019 Dates are:
May 25-June 2
August 31- September 8

Join our community & culture focused journey to one of the most iconic sites in South America. We'll start off by adjusting to the elevation while learning about Andean culture, local foods, and the Quechua language. Then, the hikers in our group will embark on on the 4-day classic Inca trail hike with our local guide Edwin. The rest will explore the Sacred Valley, visiting the ancient sites of Pisaq, Salineras salt mines, Moray and more as well as enjoy a farm lunch and cookout. On Friday of the itinerary, the hikers and non-hikers will meet at Machu Picchu for a guided tour of the city to learn about Incan culture. It will be a trip to remember!

What's included?

All Itineraries:

Accommodations:

-8 nights’ accommodations in boutique, centrally located hotels

Transportation:

-All transportation between Cusco, Ollantaytambo, and group excursions

-Transfers to/from Cusco airport

-Train to/from Aguas Calientes + bus to/from Machu Picchu

Activities:

-Walking city tour of Cusco to learn about Incan society & culture

-Entry fee to Machu Picchu + guided tour of the archeological ruins

-Traditional Andean pachamanca farm lunch

Meals:

-Daily breakfast + multiple dinners & lunches

-Healthy, nourishing meals using traditional ingredients and local sourcing

Additional

-Visit to our community partner to learn about the education & preservation of Quechua language and culture + contribution to their organization

-Dedicated Traverse representative 24/7 + local guides

-Small group experience, max 16 people

Non-hiking option additional activities:

-Continued stay in Ollantaytambo

-Excursions & entry fees to the Moray ruins, Salineras salt mines, and Pisaq artisanal market

-Optional visits to Rainbow Mountain, Chinchero or Intipunka

Hiking option:

-4 days/3 nights hiking the classic Inca trail to Machu Picchu

-Healthy, nourishing meals prepared by our on-site cook, starting with breakfast on departure day to breakfast on last day of the hike

-Clean, potable water throughout the hike

-A team of local porters to carry provided tents, chairs, food, medical emergency kit and other equipment

-Sleeping mat provided (you will carry)

-Entry fee to the Inca Trail and Machu Picchu

-Option for a full or half porter to carry some or all of your supplies

-Local hiking guide 24/7

See the full itinerary and inclusions here: https://traversejourneys.com/machu-picchu-peru/

name: The Heart of Colombia
description:
Is Colombia on your list? Join us to explore one of Latin America’s most exciting, creative and innovative cities - Medellín - along with picturesque villages in Colombia’s mountainous interious. We’ll soak up nature’s splendor on a working coffee farm, hike the cloud forest and sub-alpine moorlands, and be immersed in the vibrant, diverse culture of Colombia. This is a small-group trip with a maximum of 12 spots. We’d love to have you along!

Go to https://traversejourneys.com/colombia/ for more information on the itinerary, costs, and what's included.

Includes:
• 8 nights’ accommodations in boutique, centrally located hotels and farmhouse eco-cottages
• Healthy, nourishing meals using traditional ingredients and local sourcing
• Medellín walking tour to learn about the history of social activism and revitalization in the city
• Cocora Valley day hike through cloud forests and alpine zones to the subalpine paramo
• Entry to the Acaime Hummingbird Reserve and opportunity for bird viewing
• Learn about Colombia’s unique Wax Palm and its importance in the ecosystem
• Organic coffee farm tour with tastings and an overnight farmhouse stay
• Entry to El Peñol monolith in Guatapé
• Willey’s Jeep ride in through the Salento Valley
• Community partner engagement + donation to their program
• Daily breakfast + multiple dinners & lunches
• Roundtrip domestic flight between Medellín and Pereira
• Transfers to/from Medellín airport
• All ground transportation between Medellín and Guatape, Pereira and Salento/Cocora Valley, and group excursions
• Small group experience, max 16 people
• Traverse representative 24/7 + local guides

To secure your spot, go to https://traversejourneys.com/colombia/ for details on the itinerary, costs, and what's included. To book, download the registration form and send to the e-mail address indicated.

name: Iconic Italy
description:
September 14th - 22nd (or 26th), 2019

For more info and to secure your spot: https://traversejourneys.com/italy/

Join us for an 8 or 12 day exploration of Italy's iconic Ligurian and Tuscan regions. From stunning seaside villages to breathtaking art, and picture-perfect countryside vistas to restaurant feasts fit for a king, our Italian adventure has everything you're looking for. Starting in Milan, we'll explore the Ligurian coast of Cinque Terre, the incomparable Tuscan countryside, Florence's unending sights, as well as the picturesque towns of Lucca, Siena, Parma and more!

This trip has been put together and will be led by an Italian native and you will traverse the stomping grounds of her home region. She will be there every step of the way, to lead you through regions and experiences in Italy that most tourists would not know to explore. This truly is THE trip to Italy, that all other trips hope to be!

TRIP INCLUDES:
Accommodations
8 or 12 nights in clean, comfortable and central 3- or 4-star hotels

Transportation
Transfer to/from Linate airport on arrival and departure day
Private ground transport between Milan hotel and Monterosso hotel
All train tickets in Cinque Terre, from Monterosso to Lucca, & Lucca to Florence
Private rental vehicle from Florence onwards until the end of trip

Activities
3-hour guided walking tour around Florence
All costs for Florence Duomo complex, Academia in Florence, & Siena Duomo in 9-day trip
All costs for Bagno Vignoni hot springs, Parma Ham farm tour, Parma cheese farm tour, San Gimignano, and Parma city sights in 13-day trip

Meals
Daily breakfasts at our accommodations
Multiple group dinners (4 dinners on 9-day trip, 6 dinners on 13-day trip)

Additional
Visit to our local community partner to learn about sustainable agriculture in Italy + donation to their organization
Dedicated Italian-native guide and 2nd Traverse guide for groups of 6+
Traverse representative assisting you from booking to departure
Small group experience, max 10 people

For more info and to secure your spot: https://traversejourneys.com/italy/

Breathwork and other deep dive practices for self-learning and spirituality
description:

Our special host Tatiana Ginzburg, PhD in transpersonal psychology, will share her over 20 years of experience in western breathwork practices (rebirthing, holotropic breathwork, vivation and others).

Tatiana is an author of integration technic in breathwork practices, that includes mind, not just an energy. It helps to get insights and find the meaning of what comes to you in your process.

Tatiana also has a great experience in numerous practices that she brilliantly combines during her special retreats. Non-stop practice method and using special environment for spiritual development is our other topic we might discuss.

Welcome to participate and hopefully you can find the right practice for yourself !

(Our next meet-up will be more philosophical)

name: Lunch with the Meaning. Let's discuss how to find our way to happiness
description:
Search for the Meaning in a rapidly changing environment. What can be Meaning oriented lifestyle? Those are the topics for our Meetup on Tuesday, October 23rd.

So many people around me are disappointed in their lifestyle of going to work, making money in order to spend money for consumption. And even adding regular yoga and meditation classes and charity to this picture brings little satisfaction.
Life split between "work" and "rest" creates just an activity, but non something we could name a Real Life.

Three years ago, from that type of emptiness, I changed my well-paid job for an experiment in self-development and community myself. What do others do? Is their a new paradigm solution for living and being at all?

Let's meet and discuss and find solutions.

Polina

name: Aikido Training - Beginners Welcome (Free)
description:
Beginner Aikido Class

Join us for a FREE trial class. Aikido focuses on neutralizing aggression by blending with the attackers energy, and guiding it away. Aikido is non-combative, non-agressive, with a goal of doing no harm. Come join us to learn some basics. Limited to 3 new students per session, so sign up to attend. Please see For Beginners: Getting Started (http://heartaikido.com/begin.html). See the "About us" link in the upper left column.

This class taught by Chief Instructor Penny Sablove - 4th Dan

Penny Sablove, chief instructor and founder of Heart of San Francisco Aikido, began her training in 1980, captivated by the splendor of the physical movement.

"I couldn't believe my eyes - there were bodies flying through the air in fluid, clean lines, forming spiral shapes with each other. After attending that first trial Aikido class, I was so moved by the beauty of the movement and how good my body felt doing it, that I signed up right away for classes."

Penny has been training ever since, including several trips to Japan. She opened Heart of SF Aikido dojo in 1995. Her teaching emphasizes the ways that the principles of Aikido - such as harmony and nonresistance - are reflected in the movements of the art. Penny has also taught many seminars in Germany, Finland and the U.S.

A physical therapist by profession, Penny brings her knowledge of biomechanics to adapt the practice to a wide variety of individual needs.
