name: The Future of Immersive Retail
description:
The Future of Immersive Retail / RSVP via Eventbrite @ https://bit.ly/2Mk6LO4 (No Refunds)

How Immersive Technology (VR/AR) Can Influence Consumer Behavior. Companies are constantly required to adapt to ever-evolving consumer preferences. Consumer behaviour is easily influenced by targeting individuals’ perception and experiences. For years, psychological researchers have studied consumer buying behavior in brick-and-mortar stores. Consumer behaviour involves studying how individuals acquire, use, experience, and make decisions about goods/services. Technological advancements with products such as VR/AR now enable companies to greatly influence consumer behaviour in a positive manner.

The confluence of technologies such as augmented reality and virtual reality (AR/VR), artificial intelligence are able to turn a traditionally passive shopping experience into one in which the consumer is directly engaging with brands and personalizing their retail journeys. These technologies are going to have the capacity to further blend online and physical retail, making retail experiences adaptive to consumers as their product offerings and even environment change in real-time rather than remaining stagnant.

name: How AI, Big Data, and Blockchain Can Improve the Retail Industry
description:
San Francisco Fashion Week ® 2018 : Retail Tech - A.I. + Big Data + Blockchain | RSVP @ https://bit.ly/2NSW4Ca | NO REFUNDs Policy

How AI, Big Data, and Blockchain Can Improve the Retail Industry? The retail industry is doing well, bringing in about $5.73 trillion in sales in 2017. At the same time, behind the scenes, retailers struggle with significant issues that include logistics, in-store experience, digital competitors, and technology aligned to customer needs.

However, the previous year was an eventful one for retail technology, particularly when it came to the growing use of data analytics, artificial intelligence, blockchain and the Internet of Things capabilities.

In partnership with:

General Assembly is a pioneer in education and career transformation, specializing in today’s most in-demand skills. The leading source for training, staffing, and career transitions, we foster a flourishing community of professionals pursuing careers they love.

Focusing on the most relevant and in-demand skills across data, design, business, and technology, GA confronts the global skills gap through award-winning, best-in-class instruction, and innovative opportunities across diverse communities. name: Brisbane Stars Skilled European Football(Soccer) Pick-Up
description:
Hello we have a core group of European players who have all played at a high level. We are looking to expand our group for our weekly Sunday 5v5 to 8v8 meetup @ 10:15am with a 10:30 start time. We play rain or shine unless we have less than 8 people in which case I will text everyone. We play on REAL grass and on awesome solid indoor goals, new nets, cones, pennies, and match balls. In other words we have the perfect conditions for a high quality game. We are looking for consistent guys who can be counted on to show up most weekends. This game is for players who are skilled and have played at a competitive level (pro/college) or are at a comparable level. If you are worried about how you will stop the ball or shoot it this game is not for you. Ability to move the ball is a must. This way we all have fun

We do not tolerate any politics and just want to have a game we all look forward to every week. We can also start earlier in the day if better for the group.

We BBQ after the game on the field almost every time in case there are any 3rd half professionals :)

name: Alcatraz Swim with the Centurions 2018 race
description:
• What we'll do
—16TH ANNUAL EVENT
—Register here: https://waterworldswim.com/events/alcatraz-swim-with-the-centurions-2018/
—Two hundred and fifty (250) swimmers will start the race at Alcatraz and finish at Aquatic Park
—A 1.25 mile swim from Alcatraz to Aquatic Park with the Centurions - elite swimmers who have made the crossing more than 100 times. You do not have to be a Centurion to participate. Team registration available!
—Curious about this race? Read more about it here! https://waterworldswim.com/swims-events/alcatraz-swim-with-the-centurions/

Registered swimmers will receive an email 1-2 weeks prior to race day confirming conditions, temperatures, times, locations, parking options, etc. Passenger space, if available, will be made available for registration and announced in that email as well.

On June 11, 1962, Frank Morris and John and Clarence Anglin chipped through their cement cell walls, squeezed through a ventilation shaft to get to the roof, climbed down a drain pipe, scaled a 15-foot fence, and entered the frigid waters of San Francisco Bay. They disappeared into the night, wearing only the meager life preservers they made from stolen rain coats, and were never found, seen, or heard from again.

39 years later, on June 11, 2001, Pedro Ordenes and Gary Emich became the first swimmers to successfully “Escape from Alcatraz” 100 times! Since then, becoming a member of the elite “Alcatraz 100 Club” has become THE ambition for many open water swimmers. On September 30th, you’ll have the chance to reach your own goals and share the waters with the experts of the Bay, the Centurions.

You don't need to be a Centurion yourself - in fact, this is a great race opportunity for first-time Alcatraz swimmers with adequate training! This swim is not for novices. This event is for experienced open-water swimmers only. You should be able to swim one mile comfortably in a pool in under 40 minutes. If you need advice, support, and coaching for this swim, Water World Swim can help.

Your registration is non-refundable. Please review our refund and rollover policies before registering.

• What to bring

• Important to know

We meet at the bleachers at Aquatic Park. There are two sets of amphitheater-style bleachers; we'll be at one of them at beach level. Look for crazy people taking their clothes off and zipping up wetsuits 🙂

SAVE/AUTOFILL YOUR REGISTRATION INFORMATION
Make a free account! You may already have one if you're a member, or have made an account before, so you can log in. With an account, fill out your registration info once and it will remember your answers each time you sign up. Easy!

PLEASE NOTE WE DO NOT ACCEPT CASH
If you cannot pay online, please bring a check made out to Water World Swim or pay via credit card online.

SAVE 10% BY PAYING ONLINE
Non-members will be charged $20 onsite, instead of $18 online.

USMS MEMBERS GET A DISCOUNT!
Fill out your waiver, mark that you’re a USMS member, and you’ll get a 10% off coupon good towards all swims – including weekly ones!

JOINING US FOR THE FIRST TIME?
All levels of swimmers are welcome to join us – whether it’s your first open water swim, or you're training for an Ironman! If you can swim a mile in the pool, you are ready to transition to open water. The open water can be much more tiring which is why we recommend having a base of good swimming fitness before joining us. If you have strong fitness in other sports like running and cycling but not swimming and wish to try the bay anyway, you will be tired and that’s okay! It’ll be working new muscles and will get easier with more practice. Being able to swim a mile in the pool will just help you have a more successful first time out there.

WE HAVE THREE DIFFERENT SWIM ROUTES: BEGINNER, INTERMEDIATE, AND ADVANCED
Because all levels swim with us, we want to make sure you swim according to your skill and comfort levels, so we’ll brief you before we get in the water on what those are. Don’t be bummed out if the beginner lane is the best place for you – it’s only up from there! Talk with a coach if you’re not sure where to start.

YOU’LL BE SAFE & GUIDED IN THE WATER
Coaches will lead the swim in the water and swim with you in your group, and you’ll be led and flanked by experienced kayakers looking out for you. We'll also have coaches on shore, so you'll always be able to ask questions.

WHAT TO BRING
Bring earplugs (we recommend Mack’s and will have some on hand as well), a thermal swim cap, goggles, towels, a thermos of something hot to drink and a snack, and a good attitude 🙂 You can swim wetsuit or skin and will have time to change during and before the briefing.

BATHROOMS AND YOUR STUFF
There are no private bathrooms or showers at Aquatic Park or Crissy Field. Near Aquatic Park, there is a Starbucks and the Argonaut hotel if you need a restroom, and both Aquatic Park and Crissy Field have public showers to rinse off it at the beach. Everyone roughs it, has a laugh, and it’s always good to have a fellow swimmer help zip up that wetsuit! Staff will safely guard your things. Swimmers with us proudly have no incidents of theft.

LOCATION CHANGES ARE RARE BUT WHEN THEY HAPPEN, REGISTERED SWIMMERS ARE NOTIFIED BY EMAIL AND WE ANNOUNCE THE CHANGE ON OUR WEBSITE AND FACEBOOK PAGE.

Your registration is non-refundable. Please review our refund and rollover policies before registering.

name: One more  chance to experience beautiful hidden Audubon Canyon.
Hidden Waterfall & Creek hike, Historic Sawmill , underground winery & more !
Secrets of Erickson Metaphors
description:
In this meetup, Ericksonian hypnotherapist, Greg Turner, will talk about how to do Erickson Metaphors. Dr. Milton Erickson, M.D. is, perhaps, the most famous name in the use of therapeutic hypnosis in 20th Century. His ability to help people change problems into solutions was legendary. One of the techniques he used was telling stories and metaphors to his clients.

Greg will explain a few simple techniques that you can use straight away to craft and deliver metaphors to your clients to help them resolve problems.

Erickson was able to deliver metaphors to a small group of training hypnotherapists and all of them would end up getting something out of it, some healing and change. And without ever discussing with Erickson what they wanted to change!! Learn how this is possible and how you might be able to do that, too. You can wonder if Greg might do this for this meetup group - guide you into trance and tell a metaphor that will have deep and profound meaning for you and whatever personal issues you may be working on.

You will learn a profound, almost secret technique, that you can use to assure that your hypnotic trances and metaphors for your clients will be deep and life changing, almost all the time.

As always, in these meetups, plenty of time will be given to pairing up and practicing these techniques with each other. So, bring a notebook.

Greg is an Ericksonian hypnotherapist with a private practice in Novato and loves to share about and talk about Milton Erickson, M.D.

name: H-Plus with Power Words and A Hypnotic Blitz

name: The only "Sensory Overload" Art, Wine, Nature & Photography event of the year.!
description:
DiRosa

5200 Carneros hwy (121/12) · Napa, CA

How to find us

Take 121/12 West from Hwy 29. Go past 2 stoplights & cross Duhig Rd. Blue gate is just past on the right.

Aloha Wahines & Kanes. That's ladies & gentlemen in Hawaiian.

It's been over a year since we have experienced this, as the massive wild fires put a crimp on this unique event.
***We will meet in the parking lot of DiRosa. Or at the front door up the gravel path.
Itinerary:
1. Di Rosa is a large but well hidden property between Napa & Sonoma. It has several museums & galleries that hold the largest bay area artist 's collections. Much art, structures, moving pieces, & many unique exhibits to think about & view. The main gallery is nestled on the far end of Winery lake. The gatehouse gallery is where we will meet. It is also on the beautiful Winery lake. We will be toured by knowledgeable Docents.
From the Gatehouse gallery we will take a Tram up to the Rene Di Rosa home & other galleries. This is an indoor & outdoor tour. ***Please wear good walking shoes.

2. Our next stop will be to another seldom seen or known location in Glen Ellen. This is where the Quarry Hill Asian gardens are located. After our wine picnic in the vineyards, we will tour this exotic piece of paradise. It contains lakes, ponds, a quarry, creeks, exotic & endangered species of plants & trees from all over Asia.

3. Our 3rd stop brings us to the Sunset/Cornerstone gardens. It is an ever growing place with cafes, unique shops, wine tasting areas & eclectic indoor & outdoor gardens with unique art structures & more.

4. If you still have some energy left, our final stop takes us to a special & very interesting winery. It is a destination all by itself. If you are tired of wine; just check out the amazing grounds . See the Mud Sharks, The Adobe House(made of clay & mud only) . The gardens, The museum, the exotic birds, The Romanesque Fountain ponds, The huge Eucalyptus trees & the hidden train for your special event.

If you wimp out before the day is over; that's ok. Our after event dinner option is still available.
NOTE: Bring a lunch. I will have personal wine varietals for our picnic lunch & other drinks & snacks to keep you going.

All entry fees, touring, wine, etc are included. We will caravan from Di Rosa & I'll have maps for driving to the locations. I can accommodate
three people in my car.
donation/cost: a mere $ $65. Use paypal (Friends & family option only) or Chase.com/zelle or $ or chk. upon arrival.
I must have an accurate head count for this event. So if you RSVP; you are expected to show up.
**This is the only time for this unique event till next march or April of 2019. Or if I'm still living. Or have not retired; or moved back to Hawaii.

One last note; Please use a desktop comp. when you RSVP & print up the page for ref. with your phone app. (Or you may miss important info)
Aloha.
Indie Tom

name: Hidden waterfall & Creek hike, Historic Sawmill, Underground winery & more !
description:
Usually we meet at the Wildflour Bread co. But time is an issue. So we will meet in the parking lot of the old Union hotel in downtown Occidental. It is at the corner of Bohemian Hwy & Coleman Valley Rd. Can't miss it.
(3731 Main St. Occidental)
NOTE: If you wish to stop at the Wildflour Bread co. first (140 Bohemian hwy in Freestone) ; Grab some amazing breads & meet us at the Union hotel in Occidental. It takes about 7 minutes to get there from Wildflour Bread co.

Please read all info. * Always bring a jacket; good hiking shoes, backpack or fanny pack. An extra pair of shoes for after is also a good idea.

* Always give me your em & phone # & meetup group name for carpooling help when contacting me. Email me directly for questions:
* All my events are unique and planning, creating , & conducting them takes 40-45 hours a week. Over 40 different events a year.
* Do not RSVP if not serious about attending.
* Some events have pre-pay requirements. Please heed them.
* You will most always have a super great time & meet fun people of all ages. I conduct no "Ho Hum" events !

Our first location takes us to a hidden ecological preserve . The waterfalls are very low now. But the creek trail is so cool to trek & climb it. A very unique area to explore. (Must have good hiking shoes) .

From here we head to the historic Sturgeon saw mill. This place is a working 1890's saw mill. You will love the tour & all the demos how things worked using belts & only steam power. A very unique experience is waiting for you here.
We will have our wine picnic lunch here in an outdoor cafe under the redwood trees. NOTE: This is the last time until next May that the sawmill will be operating.***
Onward from here to an Historic Brandy & sparkling winery for an underground tour & tastings. An interesting movie is also in the tour.
Another unique experience to enjoy & remember.

Our next to the last stop (If you have the energy) will be at the Russian river Sea cliffs. Where the Russian river meets the sea. Lots of wildlife to view here.
Our last *option is a visit to the soon to be famous RUSSIAN HOUSE #1. A unique restaurant that sits over the Russian river near the river mouth. So relaxing & the views are fantastic ! The delicious food is home style Russian. Buffet style. Cash is best here . ***But you won't get a bill. They accept a love offering only. How great is that ?!
Whew; all fun things must end temporarily. Just another crappy day in paradise !!

Also included will be: water, juices, teas, lattes, protein & energy drinks, , gourmet fruit & nut packs, Zillions of trail bars, Wine Country Sodas(non alcoholic), other snacks, car pooling & shuttles, parking fees, wine tasting & tour & a super interesting & fun experience !
donation $30. Chk or $. preferred or use p.pal. (friends & family option only). Or use chase.com/zelle
Indie Tom:[masked] [masked]
NOTE: Please use a desktop computer to rsvp & print up the info for reference with your mobile app. (Or you may miss important info).

This is one long & fun experience ! Hope to see you .

name: Commercial Astronaut Training Program - Divers Needed
description:
Dr. Ed Diaz with AdvancingX is looking for volunteers for his commercial astronaut training program that he's developing to help enhance the safety and practicality of space travel. Dr. Diaz has reached out to us again, this time in search of 8 divers to pilot his astronaut training program. One major difference for this event, however, is that pre-registration is required. Participants will need to provide their e-mail address and take a 20 minute online assessment prior to participation in the diving portion.

Volunteer divers will help him collect the final data set that he needs to refine, insure, and market the opportunity to future space travelers. Each volunteer, however, will get credit for having completed the first two segments of the commercial astronaut training program for their participation.

This segment of the training is a four part team assessment that includes a series of activities and tasks teams will be asked to complete while wearing full scuba gear (minus fins) in a submerged Space Vehicle Mockup (SVM). The two segments of the assessment divers will participate in are intended to mimic what one would experience in a planetary low gravity environment (i.e. on the moon or Mars) and in a zero gravity environment (i.e. in a space station).

Volunteers are asked to show up with full SCUBA gear including tanks and weights. Full face masks with communication units will be fitted to their equipment prior to participation. Participation will include a brief full face mask introduction in shallow water along with a neutral buoyancy check. Divers will then proceed to the near shore submerged SVM and proceed as teams of 2-4 with the assessment (after having removed and secured their fins). I as well as several others will be serving as in-water safety support should there be some nervousness about not having fins while in the water. Dr. Diaz will be observing and recording the interactions of the team members as they complete a series of activities per the assessment.

This is truly an exciting opportunity for divers in the area to have a unique experience while diving and get in at an early level on the prospect of traveling to space. Since I've been initially contacted, I've been amazed at how fast commercial space travel is approaching us. The first 12 commercial space travelers were featured on the national news in August of this year to launch with SpaceX and Boeing. Elon Musk's SpaceX, Jeff Bezos's Blue Origin, Richard Branson's Virgin Galactic, and Robert Bigelow's Bigelow Aerospace are all preparing for launching commercial space travelers into space as early as 2019!

Particulars:
1. Divers must be certified divers and be able to provide proof of certification upon arrival as a prerequisite to participation.
2. Participation is limited to adult divers only (18+)
3. Participation will be limited to no more than 8 volunteers
4. In order to receive credit, an online assessment is required. The assessment must be completed before the event and participants must receive an email confirming the dive team they will be assigned to join.
5. Participants will need to provide all of their own gear. They should be prepared to dive with all gear. One tank will be sufficient to complete both segments. During the activity they will be fitted with a full face mask and com unit and asked to remove their fins. But still come with mask and fins.
6. Divers should be prepared to dive in cold water at altitude. Lake Tahoe is approximately 55F currently and at an altitude of 6300 ft above sea level. An altitude diver certification is not required, but is highly recommended. Divers are expected to know the altitude function on their computers.
7. Volunteers, being certified divers, will assume responsibility for their own dive profiles, altitude compensation, and bottom times.
8. There is no cost or fee to participate or receive credit for the two activities or online assessment.

Can't wait to see you there!

name: Dive Belize and the Great Blue Hole
description:
We’re headed back to where it all began!

This year we’re headed back to Ramon’s Village in San Pedro, Belize. The resort has been renovated since our last trip back in 1998 and includes rooms available seaside or jungle-side. The resort borders the same Mesoamerican reef we dove in Roatan and diving and water temps are very similar. The trip will also include a day excursion to the famous BLUE HOLE DIVE site, made famous by the pioneer of our sport, Jacques Cousteau.

The Blue Hole is the remnants of an ancient cave that filled with ocean water as sea level rose after the last ice age. Years later the ceiling fell in leaving the eerie hole in the ocean you see in the image above. The hole spans approximately 400 ft in diameter and descends to nearly 600 ft deep. It is also surrounded by a magnificent reef laying in approximately 35 ft of water, great for snorkels and divers alike.

We'll be staying at the world class diving resort known as Ramon's Village for 7-nights. Our package includes:
- Lodging in Belizean Princess, Jungle or Seaside Rooms all with AC
- 4-days of 2 single-tank boat dives
- a 5th day diving excursion at the world famous Blue Hole
- Island hopper round-trip flight from the mainland Belize to Ambergris Caye aboard Air Tropic
- Breakfast daily
- and airport transfers on Ambergris Caye

Double Occupancy Rates (per person):
Belizean Princess Room - Diver - $1465
Jungle Std Room - Diver - $1645
Seaside Std Room - Diver - $1725

Single Occupancy Rates:
Belizean Princess Room - Diver - $1945
Jungle Std Room - Diver - $2295
Seaside Std Room - Diver - $2455

Non-Diver Rates (per person):
Belizean Princess Room - Diver / Double Occupancy - $835
Jungle Std Room - Diver / Double Occupancy - $985
Seaside Std Room - Diver / Double Occupancy - $1065
Blue Hole Snorkel Add-on: +$270

*Taxes and fees are included. Airfare is NOT included. Trip insurance is highly recommended.

To hold your spot, we need deposits of $250 per person. 120-days from the date of departure (July 13) we'll need to collect 50% of the reservation balance. Full payments are due 75-days before departure (Aug 27).

Ramon’s offers three single tank boat departures daily: 9 AM, 11 AM, and 2 PM. The boats return to the resort between dives ~ guests may choose which two departures they prefer, giving the dive shop 24-hour advance notice.

The nightlife is truly so much fun in the nearby village with karaoke, a chicken drop gambling event, local dancing, and plenty of fun and adventure on the island.

I hope you can put this one on the radar to join us. We can’t wait to do this one with you for 2018.

Please contact Anne Norris Durrin or Joshua Durrin for booking and/or questions or assistance with handling any travel particulars.

Thanks so much and we look forward to diving with each and every one of you again in Belize if not sooner.

http://www.theaquanutz.com/belize-2018

See you underwater,
Josh and Anne

name: PROPHETIC KABBALAH: Power of Divine Names - 4th Saturday Mystical Seekers Series
description:
-Free Admission - Refreshments - Open to the public -

PROPHETIC KABBALAH: The Power of Divine Names by Lloyd Abrams, FRC

“These are the secrets that are uttered in a whisper, and they are known by the intellect of an abundant consciousness, but they are hidden and concealed from the masses.”- Abraham Abulafia (1280)
“The Kabbalistic path of the prophet has been veiled and concealed for a long time. The Kabbalists have been waiting for the time when it would be correct to reveal them again. . . The time has come for us to again dream dreams and to see visions.” - Rabbi Ariel Bar Tzadok (1994)

Unlike other forms of Kabbalah, Prophetic Kabbalah (also called Ecstatic Kabbalah), does not focus on the Sefirot and the Tree of Life system. Instead, it uses special meditation techniques with Divine Names in order to induce an elevated state of consciousness (mystical ecstasy) that provides direct contact with the Divine Mind (Active Intellect/Nous). The goal of this practice is to receive a prophetic revelation in the form of a voice, vision, or special mystical insight.

The main exponent of Prophetic Kabbalah was the thirteenth century Kabbalist, Abraham Abulafia, who revealed the details of Secret Divine Names and their special meditation techniques in his writings. Abulafia’s books were shared in manuscript form among elite groups of Kabbalists for many centuries. In recent years, Abulafia’s writings have been made more generally available, and some have now been translated into English.

This presentation is an introduction to Prophetic/Ecstatic Kabbalah, its specialized meditation techniques, and the types of mystical experiences to be obtained.

Featured Speaker:
Lloyd Abrams has presented many programs and workshops on Kabbalah. He has served as an instructor for Rose Croix University International and has written articles for the Rosicrucian Digest and for Pantacle, the magazine of the Traditional Martinist Order.

We hold a monthly public presentation on mystical or metaphysical topics as a public service. The topics and speakers vary and no previous knowledge or experience is required. Just bring an open mind and heart.

The Golden Gate Atrium Group doesn't charge for admission. We operate under the law of AMRA. You may give as your heart and mind direct you.

The Golden Gate Atrium Group of the Rosicrucian Order, AMORC is a 501c3 Educational Nonprofit.

Schedule:
1: PM - Doors Open
1:30PM - Public Presentation
• Celestial Sanctum Guided Meditation
• Followed by a Special Guest Speaker Presentation on a Mystical or metaphysical topic. Topic and Speaker are listed above.

12 Noon- Atrium Convocation (members only)
We welcome all AMORC members to meet with us for GGAs Atrium Convocation at 12:00 noon. We are delighted to have you join us in ritual and discussion for Rosicrucians. The Pronaos Convocation is open to all Current Credentialed Members of the Rosicrucian Order, AMORC.

Discourse Topic to Be Announced.

• What to bring - Your AMORC Credentials and Dues Reciept.

• Important to know- Doors close and Convocation begins promptly at 12 Noon. Doors open for members entrance by 11:30 AM.

Following convocation, at 1:00PM the doors are opened for a public presentation and social time from 1pm to 3pm.

The Golden Gate Atrium Group doesn't charge for admission. We operate under the law of AMRA. You may give as your heart and mind direct you.

The Golden Gate Atrium Group of the Rosicrucian Order, AMORC is a 501c3 Educational Nonprofit.

Schedule:
1: PM - Doors Open
1:30PM - Public Presentation
• Celestial Sanctum Guided Meditation
• Followed by a Special Guest Speaker Presentation on a Mystical or metaphysical topic. Topic and Speaker are listed above.

12 Noon- Atrium Convocation (members only)
We welcome all AMORC members to meet with us for GGAs Atrium Convocation at 12:00 noon. We are delighted to have you join us in ritual and discussion for Rosicrucians. The Pronaos Convocation is open to all Current Credentialed Members of the Rosicrucian Order, AMORC.

Discourse Topic to Be Announced.

• What to bring - Your AMORC Credentials and Dues Reciept.

• Important to know- Doors close and Convocation begins promptly at 12 Noon. Doors open for members entrance by 11:30 AM.

Following convocation, at 1:00PM the doors are opened for a public presentation and social time from 1pm to 3pm.

name: Chocolate & Wine Cruise on SF Bay: Eight Edition
description:
Join us for the final Chocolate & Wine CRUISE on San Francisco Bay of this year on October 13th!

The day's adventure takes place onboard a luxury yacht, where you will taste wines from a local winemaker, along with samples from a curated selection of local chocolate, toffee, and wine.

Walk among the various artisans and experience their latest creations. Explore and luxuriate on the yacht, and enjoy it all during the 2-hour cruise on the San Francisco Bay.

Then take home some of that great food and wine you've discovered and purchased onboard for continued enjoyment.

The Cruise is Limited to a lucky 130 attendees.

$55/person. 1:00-3:00pm (yacht sets off at 1pm SHARP).

Must be over 21 years of age. TICKETS ARE LIMITED.

GET TICKETS HERE (https://www.eventbrite.com/e/chocolate-wine-cruise-on-san-francisco-bay-tickets-48962046800?aff=chocomeetup)

READ THIS INFORMATION ABOUT HOW TO USE YOUR ADVANCE TICKET

1. Purchase Advance Tickets
2. Your purchased ticket or tickets are reserved for you. Please bring your ticket confirmation sheet with you to Will Call for the event, with a Photo ID.

3. If you purchase more than one ticket, all attendees must be present in order to receive the tickets, which are under your name only.

4. Each ticket purchased is good for the day of the event only.
5. Due to the limited capacity for this event, No refunds available within 72 hours of the event (or after Advance Ticket sales are completed, if sold out earlier)
6. For faster check in, bring your confirmation printout (with scanner bar code on it)

RSVP and RESERVE TICKETS on EVENTBRITE (https://www.eventbrite.com/e/chocolate-wine-cruise-on-san-francisco-bay-tickets-42821390933?aff=chocomeetup)

name: The Meetup Cookbook
description:
Food and friends go very well together! TasteTV and TCB Cafe Publishing and Media are publishing a new book, "THE MEETUP COOKBOOK: Fun and Tasty Recipes for Get Togethers, Gatherings, Meetups, and More."

We invite meetup members to contribute to it with their best or favorite recipes for when they get together with others. The deadline to submit a contribution is here. To submit a contribution, go to: http://www.tastetv.com/book-contributor-template-meetup-cookbook/

name: Fall Holiday Chocolate Salon 2018
description:
SAN FRANCISCO COUNTY FAIR BUILDING AUDITORIUM

The premier chocolate show on the West Coast brings the Annual San Francisco Fall and Holiday CHOCOLATE SALON. Chocolate aficionados, fanatics, buyers and journalists can experience the finest in artisan, gourmet & premium chocolate in one of the world's great culinary metropolitan areas.

name: Two Left Feet @ Sundance Saloon (November #1 of 3)
description:
Extra-patient ultra-beginning two-step and waltz lesson specially designed for folks with two left feet. We'll start with some social time when the club opens at 5:00 pm. The lessons will begin promptly at 5:30 pm upstairs in the "Red Room." (Note that these are separate lessons from the regular beginning lessons that also start at 5:30, downstairs in the main ballroom.) No partner necessary. Wear comfortable casual clothing. Smooth-soled leather shoes or boots recommended but not required. No open-toed footwear please. Admission is $5, and you must be 21 or over.

We're holding Two Left Feet lessons for three consecutive Sundays in November. Come to one or all or them!

description: We'll begin with a short meditation, followed by Qigong stretches and warm up. All students will then practice Tai Chi walking, forward and backward. New students will learn the first move: Peng. Returning students will continue with new material as they are ready.

description:
Gather in sacred space to join with the voice of the sacred drums. These are women-only gatherings. (Open drum circles, to which men are welcome, take place during the 1st, 3rd and 5th Sundays as a part of the worship experience at herchurch. Please see herchurch.org for details.)

name: TAPPING WORKSHOP: Releasing Procrastination + Fear Of Shining
description:
Are you procrastinating and hiding out?

Are you witholding your gifts from the world because you think you are not good enough or you worry about people think?

Let go of stress + resistance and get back in the zone in your biz and life.
Let go of the past and tap into your vision.
Find out how tapping can help you change your life, shine and follow your dreams.

Tapping provides relief from chronic pain, emotional problems, disorders, addictions, phobias, post-traumatic stress disorder, and physical diseases. While Tapping is newly set to revolutionize the field of health and wellness, the healing concepts that it’s based upon have been in practice in Eastern medicine for over 5,000 years. Like acupuncture and acupressure, Tapping is a set of techniques which utilize the body’s energy meridian points. You can stimulate these meridian points by tapping on them with your fingertips – literally tapping into your body’s own energy and healing power.

Your body is more powerful than you can imagine… filled with life, energy, and a compelling ability for self-healing. With Tapping, you can take control of that power.

Release what is not working and move in the direction of your dreams.

We will spend the evening tapping away blocks to new beginnings, setting intentions and visualizing. This will be a powerful way to get focused, release blocks and tap into magic in your biz and life.

In the workshop you will:

1. Set your intentions

2. Tap away resistance, fear, limiting beliefs and more + create a new beginning.

3. Do a visualization and get back in the zone.

4. Pick an angel card

Come and tap it all away!
Presale $25 / Doors $30

Tap into Magic Workshop Testimonials

Here is what some previous workshop participants have written

” I feel lighter than I have in years.”

“If you are looking to create abundance in your life….this is an amazing workshop. I did it last year and my income went up 4 times…and so much has shifted. I am amazed at how much I had created from it!! Go!! you will love it”.

Kate H.

“I have done 10 years of personal growth with dedication and commitment, it covered a lot of ground but the synthesis of EFT and the group environment was one of the most impactful experiences I have had in terms of uncovering old beliefs and patterns. I feel healed from all the tapping we did. Thank you, Kate, your Goddess energy was elegant and radiant today and it was a joy to watch you in your essence and doing your part of healing wounds of so many people. You are a blessing and a gift”.

Laura

Space is limited, register here ....

https://www.eventbrite.com/e/tapping-workshop-releasing-procrastination-fear-of-shining-with-kate-winch-tickets-50292352781?aff=efbeventtix

The theme for our evening will be centered around ABUNDANCE. I will lead us through a powerful EFT Tapping session to remove blocks to abundance, and then the amazing Sarah Bryanne will lead Qoya. name: Ways To Tell Your Life Story
description:
*What We'll Do: Members of the writing workshop will do some writing in class in response to prompts and suggestions. Students will also have the opportunity to read from their works in progress and receive feedback from classmates and the Instructor. We will also read some published pieces to get ideas for our own work.

*What To Bring: Bring a notebook and pen. Feel free to bring a water bottle and a snack.

name: The San Francisco Photography Meetup Group Monthly Meetup
description:
Let's meet our old friends at the Crossroads Cafe for a nibble and sip after work!
We'll talk about our Photographic New Adventures while looking at each other's work.

As this venue is a bit loud, don't expect a "talk" or "speech" or "shoot"; but rather to chat, mingle, review one another work and discuss our photo opportunities.

Please Note:
This is a Public Meetup - Images brought and shared should be of a public nature!

IE: publishable on a Billboard in the US.  Nothing beyond an R Rating should be presented at our group meetings, please.  If you would like to share stronger images, please vet your viewer and do so outside of the SF Photography Meetup Group.
Thanks.

Our Meetup is NOT intended to be a place for Marketing or Business Promotion, but rather a gathering of like minds to discuss the Art and Technology of photography. Folks are welcome to leave literature or fliers regarding upcoming events or services offered on the sign-up table and answer questions only. Presentations or other sales/marketing should be set up at least one week in advance though the meeting host. This will encourage continued comradery and discourage aggressive marketing at future meetups, ensuring a collaborative environment for all. Thanks.

Please bring your book(s), your portfolio, pictures or new toy/gadget to share with the group.

Bring an image that inspires you...
An image that you really want to make...
Maybe you don't know how, or need someone to go with you to hold a reflector or light.
If you want to know how someone made their awesome photo now's your chance to find out.

Don't have a book yet? Bring a Print!
Come be inspired to build a portfolio, see what others have done and learn how you can build your own!

Don't have a Print?
Bring and image (magazine or book, printed off the web?) that inspires you - one that you'd want to make!

digitalShe's directions to Crossroads Cafe, here:
Cafe in a bookstore at the End of Delancy Street, note, there is generally parking - though now you're gonna pay for it all evening.
Delancy is crossed by Brannan and just off the Embarcadero.

From S Bay: Exit 280 at 6th St, follow 6th two blocks and turn right on Brannan St. Keep driving, it's a long ways... Delancy is the last street on the Right from the Embarcadero.

From E Bay: Exit @ 5th St and turn LEFT onto 5th. Follow for two bocks and turn Left at Brannan St, follow to Delancy Street and turn Right.

Muni: Take the N-Juda or the T/K link.
Exit @ The Embarcadero & Brannan St‎ Station, walk south toward the AT&T Park and look for a Cafe called "Towns End" in neon... Crossroads is the little grassy gated area directly across from this cafe... look for the small bookstore at the end of the block in the cul-de-sac, that's the cafe!

BTW - Be sure to say "Hey, Thanks!" to the staff that let us hang out!
Plan to grab a bite here! Crossroads has light snacks, dinners and deserts along with assorted beverages.  A nice place to relax and mull over this photo stuff with other chill folks...

name: Forest/Sound Bathing
description:
More info + reserve your spot here: http://consciouscityguide.com/forestsoundbathing

NEXT LEVEL MULTI-SENSORIAL IMMERSIVE SELF-CARE

ALLOW THE CACAO TO OPEN YOUR HEART, THE FOREST TO GIVE YOU A CELLULAR UPGRADE, THE SOUNDS TO CALM AND BALANCE YOUR WHOLE SYSTEM, AND THE COMPANY TO REAFFIRM YOUR TRUST IN HUMANITY.

Lucia and Julia want you to feel amazing!! So we are teaming up to offer our favorite healing practices during a potent time on this planet. Maybe you're feeling drained and disconnected and desiring a dose of magic. Let us serve you how we know best — by being your guides on a journey of nature connection and sacred music. We're gathering during the height of autumn to share insights about this time of year and how it reflects where we are on our individual and collective journey. Allow nature to be the mirror into your soul and the sound to wash over you during a journey that is guaranteed to be full of magic.

Some benefits of forest bathing:

Intentionally immersing in nature is proven to lower stress and cortisol levels, increase natural killer (NK) cell activity, increase creativity, sense of awe, and comfort within one's self and surroundings. Forest bathing boosts gratitude and provides heightened perspective.

Some benefits of sound bathing:

Sound waves can reduce anxiety and stress, lower blood pressure and depression, induce deep relaxation, increase creativity, and over-all well-being. Increases mental and emotional clarity, and promotes stillness and happiness.

We've designed a flow for the afternoon and also left plenty of space for what wants to emerge. We will meet at a private home along the hills of Sausalito, less than 10 minutes and a world away from the hustle bustle of San Francisco to share intentions and cacao. We will then walk up to the forest and soak in breathtaking views as we share invitations that allow you to connect deeply – to yourself, others, and the world around you. We'll return for a sound bath and finish the evening with a healthy, high-vibe meal.

name: Forest Bathing + Yoga at a Private Hot Springs
description:
*** http://consciouscityguide.com/ojaiforestbathingyoga

SUNDAY, NOVEMBER 11, 2018 @ ECOTOPIA

3:30 pm - 8:00 pm

21 + up!

Imagine soaking in private hot springs, frolicking through the forest, and enjoying the most soulful yoga class of your life. Now let's make that dream happen. Sojourn to magical Ojai and rejuvenate from the inside out and the outside in.

We've reserved Ecotopia for this experience that will start with some treats (cannabis optional). You will then be guided through a transformational forest bath and juicy yoga class and set free to watch the sun set and the stars come out while bathing in a private hot springs. Our intention is to create a safe, fun, and playful container for the power of nature to heal you in the way only nature can.

What's forest bathing?

Forest bathing is an evidence-based practice of connecting to nature as a way to destress and heal. It comes from the Japanese practice of shinrin-yoku and the version practiced by the Forest Bathing Club brings in nature connection elements from shamanic practices around the world. Forest bathing is meant to be accessible to everyone — it's not about going on a long hike, but rather about slowing down and connecting deeper to the world around you. According to the Japanese prescription for nature healing, it's always beneficial to finish a forest bath with a hot springs soak!

Why cannabis?

Nature heals us from the inside out and the outside in. Cannabis is medicine from the Earth that helps us get out of our own way and be out in the world. We'll be offering a microdose that does not take over the experience but just heightens it. Of course this part is totally optional and you're more than welcome to enjoy the experience without the microdose.

And yoga?

The word yoga means to "yoke" or unite. Just as immersing in nature unites us to our true selves, practicing yoga unites it all — the mind, body, and soul – in the present moment. In this practice, we will explore how yoga also unites us to nature – our inner nature and outer nature.

More info and reserve your spot here:
http://consciouscityguide.com/ojaiforestbathingyoga

name: Remove your hidden blocks to love and Intimacy with NLP
description:
Change your negative patterns so you can finally have a healthy relationship

***Whether you are single, married, or in a relationship, this workshop is for you if:

• Do you find your self doing the same things over and over in dating and relationships?

• Are you tired of sabotaging your chances at healthy love?

• Want to know how to stop your brain from getting in the way of your love life?

We all have deep seated patterns of belief and behavior that causes us to get what we want in love or sabotage ourselves over and over.

It’s not your fault!

Many of the things that get us stuck or triggered are just your brain’s bad habits.

Wouldn’t it be great to permanently change what seems to be an impossible thing to shift?

There is a way!

In this workshop we will be using powerful brain changing NLP techniques to begin to change the way your brain is wired for love and connection.

If you find yourself:

*Picking the wrong partners over and over

*Putting up walls against love

*Feeling like you don’t deserve love an attention

*Sexually shut down

*Felling like you need to be what someone wants you to be in order to be loved

*Getting triggered and reacting the same way every time in relationship

*Or just can’t seem to find anyone to share your life with

Then this workshop is for YOU!

Imagine what it would be like when you can finally pick a good partner for yourself and create an open loving relationship that is easy and joyful..Since you are reading this I am assuming that you are ready to have this now.

**We will be doing hands on re-patterning exercises that night that will start shifting things for you right away!

Don’t waste any more precious time. Join us for this life changing event.

Seats are limited.

Cost: $15 , hurry seats are limited.

Hope to see you there!

Cinthia

About Cinthia Dennis:

Cinthia Dennis is a Master NLP Practitioner/Dating and relationship Expert of 11 years. She has had the pleasure of helping her clients move through their personal blocks so they can have amazing love and healthy relationships in their life.

name: NLP For removing the blocks to your best life and  best self
description:
NLP tools for removing the blocks to living your best life and being your best self.

I invite you to look deep inside and ask yourself, “What is it that I truly desire in my life that I don’t have yet?”

*Optimal health?

*An amazing love life?

*Money and abundance?

*A career that you love?

*Tapping into your creative self?

*Living your true purpose?

Whatever it is that you want for yourself it is possible!

If you haven’t achieved your ultimate life yet, there might be some hidden blocks getting in your way.

If you are ready to finally step into your highest self, we invite you to come join us for this 2 hour experiential NLP workshop where you will:

*learn the #1 secret to achieving your goals quickly and effortlessly, using NLP techniques (neuro re-patterning).

*Discover techniques you can use right away to make your goals stick.

*Uncover the biggest block you might have to becoming successful in achieving your dreams.

* Re-new your motivation and get back on track.

Are you ready for a life worth living?

Let’s get this life party started!!!

Don’t waste any more precious time. Come join us on May 7th for this hands on workshop designed to ramp up the juicy life that is waiting for you.

Please arrive by 11:30 AM to get settled in. Doors close right at 11:45 AM

About the facilitator:

Cinthia Dennis is a Master NLP (Neuro Re-pattenring Practitioner)
She has had the pleasure of helping her clients achieve their goals and create juicy lives for over 13 years.
NLP is a powerful modality focused on how patterns in the brain can get people stuck. It is designed to unwire and rewire the neurology and belief systems so people can have lives they want.

name: Sunday Morning Meditation
description:
Meditation, meditation instruction, discussion, and community.

This Sunday morning meditation session is open to the public and welcomes newcomers, beginners and people who have an established sitting meditation practice.

Whether your motivation is to simply relax or to explore this profound path, sitting meditation cultivates sanity and fundamental well-being. We practice and teach mindfulness-awareness meditation as it has been passed from teacher to student for 2,500 years.

Meditation instruction is given at 10:00 AM.
Please arrive 5-10 minutes before.

Meditation practice begins at 10:00 AM in the meditation hall. Please arrive at least 5 minutes early. This hour is a combination of silent sitting and walking meditation practice.

The first 3 Sundays of the month we have discussion facilitated by a senior student. It begins at 11 AM and runs for approximately 45 minutes. If you do not wish to meditate prior to this you may arrive at 11 to join the discussion.

The 4th and 5th Sunday are longer sitting periods—two full hours of silent sitting and walking practice without discussion.

We look forward to seeing you.

Schedule
10:00 AM Meditation Instruction
10:00 AM Meditation
11:00 AM Talk/Discussion

Price
There is no cost to attend this event. Suggested donations are appreciated.

name: Tuesday Lunchtime Meditation
description:
Lunchtime is an opportunity to come to a quiet, peaceful place, slow down, sit down and relax. Enjoy your sandwich and a cup of tea in our cozy community room.

Meditation instruction is available. Feel free to use your own meditation method, or take a break from methods altogether!

Bring Your Sandwich! Bring Your Stress! Bring a Friend!

Time
Tuesdays & Thursdays, 12-1: 30 PM.

Sit as long as you’d like!

Price

There is no cost to attend this meditation session, however donations are always gratefully accepted.

name: Thursday Lunchtime Meditation
description:
Take a break for your busy work week and join Lunchtime Meditation for an opportunity to come to a quiet, peaceful place. Slow down, sit down, and relax your mind.

Please feel free to use any meditation method you like.

And, if you like, enjoy your bagged lunch, a cup of tea or water, and perhaps some conversation in our cozy community room before or after your sit.

Time
Tuesdays
From 12 noon to 1:30 PM.
Sit as long as you’d like!

For details, check our monthly calendar.

Price
There is no cost to attend this meditation session. And, donations are always welcome.

name: Creating Your Personal Religion Online Sunday School
description:
Creating a Personal Religion Sunday School Led by Addam From Adam goes over a framework in which you can build and create with confidence your own personal religion to help you maximize your personal spiritual experiencee .

Addam studied Positive Psychology at LIFE University in Marietta Ga, and received his Masters of Arts in Theological Studies from Mercer University. He has spent the last 7 years working as an Intuitive Psychic Counselor and the primary facilitator of the Raise Your Vibration Meetup Movement in Atlanta Ga, and Las Vegas. He serves as the Chairperson of the Enlightened Collective Inc.

Addam has become convinced that Personal Religion is the most effective tool for advancing one's spiritual and personal progress.

To Join the Sunday School Register here:
https://zoom.us/meeting/register/cc26c839e2b3cff8cde7dc3c8da9331e

After registering, you will receive a confirmation email containing information about joining the meeting.

name: Kidpower Child Protection Workshop for Adults
description:
OFC is excited to partner with Kidpower on this workshop for LGBTQ+ parents and caregivers on child protection and cybersafety. The workshop will prepare adults to assist their children in developing healthy relationships and making safe choices with people including strangers, siblings, peers, and other people they know, in the real world and online.

RSVP HERE: https://ourfamily.z2systems.com/np/clients/ourfamily/eventRegistration.jsp?event=72760&;

Our office is within walking distance of Civic Center BART station and Van Ness Muni station. Free parking is available in Our Family Coalition's gated lot at the corner of 10th and Mission after 5:00pm; please call[masked] for access when you arrive. To enter the first floor lobby at 1385 Mission St, press #340 on the intercom to be buzzed inside, then proceed to Suite 340 on the third floor, accessible by elevator and stairs.

Child care is provided FREE with advance registration at least 24 hours in advance. Please register all family members who plan to attend, including ages of children, so staff can make arrangements. For more information, please contact SF Programs Coordinator, Jeannette Page at [masked] or[masked] x309.

name: QTPOC Parent Support Group Cycle 2
description:
Navigating the world as a queer or trans parent of color can be complex, and finding a safe space to connect and build community with each other can be a challenge. Join OFC for another cycle of our 8-week support group for queer and trans parents of color in San Francisco where you can be your whole self and talk about what matters to you. Facilitated by Dr. Stacy N. Knight, psychologist and early childhood mental health consultant.

Group will meet on Tuesdays from 6:00-8:00pm on the following evenings at Our Family Coalition (1385 Mission St, Suite 340, San Francisco):
Oct 2, 9, 16, 30
Nov 6, 20
Dec 4, 11*

*Group may meet on Nov 27th instead of Dec 11th

First-time participants will need to complete a brief intake upon arrival. Space is limited, so please commit to attending all sessions in the series if possible.

Dinner and child care are provided FREE with advance registration at least 24 hours in advance at ourfamily.org. Please register all family members who plan to attend, including any dietary restrictions as well as ages of children, so staff can make arrangements.

Our office is within walking distance of Civic Center BART station and Van Ness Muni station. Free parking is available in Our Family Coalition's gated lot at the corner of 10th and Mission after 5:00pm; please call[masked] for access when you arrive. To enter the first floor lobby at 1385 Mission St, press #340 on the intercom to be buzzed inside, then proceed to Suite 340 on the third floor, accessible by elevator and stairs.

For more information, please contact SF Programs Coordinator, Jeannette Page at [masked] or[masked] x309

name: Toddle With Me: Music & Movement Class
description:
This music and movement class for LGBTQ+ parents/caregivers with toddlers promotes children's overall development. Using creative physical expression, these classes promote gross and fine motor skill development, coordination and balance, as well as early literacy, pre-math, and social-emotional skills. Toddle with Me class meets weekly on Fridays from 9:30-11:00am at Community Well (78 Ocean Ave, San Francisco).

RSVP HERE: https://ourfamily.z2systems.com/np/clients/ourfamily/eventRegistration.jsp?event=68825

First-time participants will need to complete a brief intake upon arrival. Group does not meet every week in the months of June, July, November and December so please be sure to confirm dates on our calendar at ourfamily.org. For more information, please contact SF Programs Coordinator, Jeannette Page at [masked] or[masked] x309.

name: Baby & Me: Infant Class [0-12 months]
description:
Want more quality time with your little one? OFC is hosting an 8-week infant class for LGBTQ+ parents and caregivers. This parent-child interactive group helps support parent-child bonding, infant health, and increases know-how about your infant's cognitive, physical and language development! Guest presenters will attend on certain sessions to discuss infant-related topics, such as lactation, child care or babywearing, and to share resources with participants.

RSVP HERE: https://ourfamily.z2systems.com/np/clients/ourfamily/eventRegistration.jsp?event=70080

Baby & Me will meet weekly on Fridays from 11:30am-1:00pm starting September 7 through October 26, 2018 at Community Well (78 Ocean Ave, San Francisco). Space is limited, so we encourage you to register in advance for sessions, but drop-ins are also welcome. First-time participants will need to complete a brief intake upon arrival. For more information, please contact SF Programs Coordinator, Jeannette Page at [masked] or[masked] x309.

name: Kid's & Family Area at OurTownSF Nonprofit Expo
description:
OurTownSF's 3rd annual expo of well over 100 arts, community, fundraiser, health, legal, political, recovery, service, & spiritual groups serving the LGBTQ+ community. New this year, join OFC in the Kids & Family area located at the playground for snacks and fun activities!

FREE entrance, over $1,000 in door prizes, food from over a dozen local eateries, live entertainment, and much more. Don't miss it!

RSVP via the Facebook event: https://www.facebook.com/events/1988951171146000/

name: Trans Family Fall Harvest
description:
Come explore the changing seasons with friends at the Trans Family Fall Harvest. Transgender, gender non-conforming and non-binary parents and kids, along with their families, will gather at the College Hill Learning Garden (336 Elsie St, San Francisco) for a fun nature scavenger hunt that leads to a TRANSformation Pumpkin Station. Festive fall treats will be served along with our "Gender Around the World" display, and much more! Don't forget to bring a scarf and a hat to stay warm!

RSVP Here: https://ourfamily.z2systems.com/np/clients/ourfamily/eventRegistration.jsp?event=74075&;

Please let us know in advance of any dietary restrictions or accessibility needs so our staff can make arrangements. For further questions or information, contact SF Programs Coordinator, Jeannette Page at [masked] or[masked] X309.

name: Drop-In Support for LGBTQ Parents
description:
Enjoy a meal with your kids and other LGBTQ2SIA families, then parents and caregivers break off for facilitated discussions about family and child-rearing issues with their peers. This monthly group is held the 4th Tuesday from 6:00-8:00pm at Children's Day School (333 Dolores St, SF - behind Notre Dame Plaza Senior Housing). Dinner begins at 6:00pm and the parent group will start at 6:30pm to allow ample time for discussion and peer support. First-time participants will need to complete a brief intake upon arrival. Group does not meet in June or December.

Dinner and child care are provided FREE with advance registration at least 24 hours in advance. Please register all family members who plan to attend, including any dietary restrictions as well as ages of children, so staff can make arrangements. For more information, please contact SF Programs Coordinator, Jeannette Page at [masked] or[masked] x309.

RSVP HERE: https://ourfamily.z2systems.com/np/clients/ourfamily/eventRegistration.jsp?event=67920

name: Monster Mash Halloween Bash
description:
It's almost Halloween! Join OFC and other LGBTQ+ families for some swampy swimming, spooky dancing, creepy crafts and tasty treats. There will be fun activities for little monsters of all ages. Don't forget your costume, and join us for this year's Halloween Bash!

There will be festive, family-friendly activities on three floors of the Y’s wheelchair-accessible facility. Jump in the pool for some swampy swimming, or try out one of the Y's group exercise classes such as Zumba or Family Boot Camp. Little ones will enjoy Arts & Crafts and (Not So) Scary Storytime, while teens can escape to a youth-only Kidpower safety workshop. There's something for everyone at the Monster Mash.

RSVP HERE: https://ourfamily.z2systems.com/np/clients/ourfamily/eventRegistration.jsp?event=73372&;

A few reminders for those venturing into the pool for swampy swimming:
- Guests must shower before entering the pool (all-gender restrooms, changing rooms and showers are available)
- Kids under 5 years will be expected to have an adult in the water with them
- Infants and toddlers who aren’t potty-trained will need to wear a swim diaper
Please be sure to read the Embarcadero Y’s Family Swim Guidelines if your family plans to swim. https://www.z2systems.com/neon/resource/ourfamily/files/EMBARCADERO%20Y%20FAMILY%20SWIM%20EVENT%20GUIDELINES.pdf

Some final important pieces of information for the Halloween Bash:
- The YMCA requires children under 13 to be accompanied by an adult at all times.
- This is an alcohol and smoke/tobacco-free event.
- Street parking is extremely limited, so we encourage taking public transit to the YMCA.
- Save time during check-in by registering all members of your party in advance.

See you Saturday, October 27th for a scary good time!

name: Camping in Yosemite National Park
description:
This page is purely informational. For more details and to secure your spot on this adventure, click here: https://goo.gl/Pq1r3S.
___

Trail Mavens is dedicated to drop-kicking the primary barriers to entry keeping women from adventuring outdoors.

No gear? We got you.

Not sure how to set up a tent/read a map/start a fire? You'll learn.

No posse of badass ladies to adventure with? That's where we come in!

Appropriate for all levels, from outdoor ninjas to outdoor newbies.
___

TRIP HIGHLIGHTS:

- HIKE in America's first (and greatest) national park, alpine lakes, stunning views, and moments of inspiration included.

- ZERO STRESS around literally any planning. We handle everything from permits to bug spray, so all you have to do is soak it in.

- THE MAVEN FACTOR, a.k.a what happens when you mix dynamic, thoughtful, open-hearted women for a weekend outside.

- HANDS-ON TRAINING so you can show off your skills next time you pitch a tent (we'll make sure you look like you've been doing it since you were a kid).

- SPACE TO DISCONNECT from the day-to-day urban living, and stop, breathe, and focus on what's happening NOW.

- Enough SELF-CARE to get you through any hurdle. Eat gourmet camp meals, work your glutes on-trail, and enjoy the brilliance of Mama Nature.
__

WHAT'S INCLUDED

... all Yosemite National Park backcountry permit fees

... delicious meals from Friday afternoon through Sunday afternoon, trail snacks, chocolate, and wine & whiskey to sip in the moonlight

... guided, hands-on outdoor skills instruction and facilitation from a Wilderness First Responder-certified guide, plus access to the collective brilliance of your group

... all the gear you need, just in case you don't have any; just bring clothes and a toothbrush

... a donation back to Yosemite National Park, to preserve and protect it for future generations

Trip fee is exclusive of transportation costs to/from Yosemite and park entrance fees.

__

This page is purely informational. For more details and to secure your spot on this adventure, click here: https://goo.gl/Pq1r3S.

- INSANE OCEAN VIEWS (and the chance to swim in Bass Lake!) as you backpack to Pt. Reyes' most coveted backcountry campsite.

- ZERO STRESS around literally any planning. We handle everything from permits to bug spray, so all you have to do is soak it in.

- THE MAVEN FACTOR, a.k.a what happens when you mix dynamic, thoughtful, open-hearted women for a weekend outside.

- HANDS-ON TRAINING so you can show off your skills next time you pitch a tent (we'll make sure you look like you've been doing it since you were a kid).

- SPACE TO DISCONNECT from the day-to-day urban living, and stop, breathe, and focus on what's happening NOW.

- Enough SELF-CARE to get you through any hurdle. Eat gourmet camp meals, work your glutes on-trail, and enjoy the brilliance of Mama Nature.

__

WHAT'S INCLUDED

... all Point Reyes National Seashore admission/campsite fees

... guided, hands-on outdoor skills instruction and facilitation from a Wilderness First Responder-certified guide, plus access to the collective brilliance of your group

... delicious meals from Saturday afternoon to Sunday afternoon, trail snacks, chocolate galore, and wine & whiskey to sip in the moonlight

... all the gear you need, just in case you don't have any; just bring your clothes and a toothbrush

... a donation back to Point Reyes National Seashore, to preserve and protect it for future generations

___

This post is purely informational. To secure your spot, click here: http://bit.ly/2L0YJEs.

No gear? We got you.

Appropriate for all levels, from outdoor ninjas to outdoor newbies.

name: Free Usui Reiki Level 1 Attunement
description:
A distant mass Usui Reiki Level 1 attunement is given every 1st day of the month for free :) You receive this attunement from your home!

The attunement will open and cleanse your crown chakra, heart chakra, and palm chakras, as well as your energy channels. You will be able to channel reiki energy to yourself and to others. But most importantly it will help to open your heart more :)

Please note that this free attunement is not a Reiki Tummo attunement, but an Usui Reiki Level 1 attunement (for those who have already taken the Reiki Tummo Workshops and received attunement this will be a Reiki Tummo attunement). The Usui Reiki attunements open only the upper half of your main energy channel/sushumna (from the crown chakra to heart chakra) while Reiki Tummo attunements open the whole sushumna from crown chakra up to base chakra. However, this free Usui Reiki Level 1 attunement is given remotely by means of Reiki Tummo attunement technique, so the result is better than traditional Usui Reiki attunement results. Irmansyah Effendi, the Founder of Reiki Tummo, gives this attunement.

WHAT TO DO TO RECEIVE THE ATTUNEMENT

- No need to register to receive it, just prepare yourself and intend to receive distant attunement Usui Reiki Level 1 from Padmacahaya

- The attunement is given every 1st day of the month at 6:30 PM, for 15 mins.

- Do simple and light exercises / stretching before to help the energy flow better in your body.

- Sit down with your spine straight. You may sit with your legs crossed or with with your feet on the ground. Place your hands on your laps with palms facing up.

- Relax and smile :) No need to concentrate nor practice any breathing techniques. Just enjoy :)

- After the attunement please do self healing directly

Note:
1) Suggested hand positions for channeling Reiki energy during Self Healing are (3 minutes per position sequentially):

Positions:
FRONT OF THE BODY: Forehead/face, Cheeks, Throat, Upper chest, Lower chest, Stomach, Thighs, Knees, and Ankles
BACK OF THE BODY: Back of the head, Nape of the neck, Upper back, Lower back/waist, Buttocks, Back of thighs, Calves and Soles of the feet
2) More detail and complete techniques about doing healing and other Reiki techniques will be taught in Reiki Tummo workshops.

Reiki Tummo is a gentle, effective form of energy healing based on the heart. Our spiritual heart is the key to our connection to the Divine, the Source of Love and Light. In Reiki Tummo we rely on our heart connection to channel Reiki, Divine Energy, to ourselves and others. With thousands of practitioners worldwide, Reiki Tummo has safely and successfully helped countless people all over the world. It is great for relieving stress, clearing stuck emotions and energetic blockages, as well as helping to bring balance and healing to your whole being

With Love and Light :)

name: Chakra Meditation for Business Professionals & Startup Teams
description: We'll meditate using an ancient Vajrayana practice designed for Western professionals. The chakra meditation technique combined with music helps you increase personal power, compassion and intuition. All meditation practices ultimately share one common goal: stopping thought. When your thoughts stop, you can connect to worlds of light, power, wisdom, and pure consciousness. You will find that each meditation session brings a more clarity and power into your life.

name: PoC Meditation for Turbulent Times
description:
One of our members, Malcolm, hosts a weekly meditation and is opening it up to GAPP members. This will be $15 suggested donation and location will be shared closer to the date. Here's what Malcolm has to say about meditation and its benefits for PoCs:

Our media culture bombards us with an unending stream of human suffering. We are assaulted by a barrage of heartbreaking images of violence, misery and injustice. When the world is seen as threatening, our feelings of insecurity cause us to worry about all the things that undermine our wellbeing and stability.
Fortunately, mediation offers time honored ways to restore an inner sense of harmony. In this ongoing class we explore new ways to work with the body, breath, thought and emotion to maintain balance in turbulent times. When we reorient our attention in specific ways, our inner resources become activated to face our difficulties artfully. Rather than destroying us or robing us of hope, turbulent times can teach us about living a world of unprecedented flux and disorientation.

name: PoC Happy Hour! 🥂

Please join me at The Assembly in the Mission for drinks and conversation. This will be our monthly happy hour spot on the last Monday of each month. We'll be joined by PoCs who are also members there, so come hang out, mix and mingle with other PoCs in SF.

Wine will be provided. Non-alcoholic drinks are available as well.

Can't wait to see you there!
Myisha

name: Substance & Supply: Meditation & Sunday Service
description:
"Your presence here makes a difference. Your consciousness makes a difference" - Reverend Muata Rasuli.

The San Francisco Center for Spiritual Living is a joyful celebration of Spirit. We are a spiritual community grounded in Divine Love and dedicated to recognizing the Unity of Spirit in all life. Our purpose is to recognize Love as Truth and to be in service to our community and the world. All are welcome here as we celebrate the Presence of God in all life kind. We are affectionately known as the lovingest place on earth and we have more than enough love for you.

Come and join us on Sunday between 10:30am and 12:15pm for a transcendent experience that guarantees to warm your heart, inspire your imagination and give wings to your dreams.

The week's topic is: Substance & Supply

Sunday Meditation: 10.30am - 10.50am
Sunday Service: 11.00am - 12.15pm

We appreciate the light you are and look forward to the gifts you bring.

name: The Seven Sins Series: Envy
description:
The Seven Sins "Envy" workshop is coming up soon!

Thursday October 18th, 6.30pm - 9.00pm

Here comes the next workshop in the 7 Deadly Sins series! Each one stands alone, so no worries if you missed a previous week's session. Please join us on Thursday October 18th for "ENVY"! 6:30pm at San Francisco Center for Spiritual Living, 280 Claremont, San Francisco. Reach out to me for more info!

Do you wish that you had Jessie’s girl? Money for nothin’? Although you may not covet your neighbor’s servant or donkey, chances are at some point you desired something for yourself that belonged to another. Maybe it was something intangible---like intellect, a cheery outlook, or good luck. We’ve all been there. Who said it isn’t easy being green? Come turn your green envy into the green for life. Ready? Set? Go!

The group meets every other Thursday night from 6:30 p.m.- 8:30 p.m. during the fall season. Attend 1 session... or add all 7 to your calendar! Suggested donation of $40/session; a $150 donation reserves your spot at all 7 sessions. Sign up at the center or by emailing [masked]

description:
Come laugh with the sinners!

Feed your creativity in this workshop series as we study the 7 lively sins: greed, pride, envy, lust, wrath, sloth, and gluttony. Each Workshop will focus on a different sin and include conversation, music, solo and group activities, and a meditation session.

The group meets every other Thursday night from 6:30 p.m.- 9:00 p.m. during the fall season.

Attend one session...or add all 7 to your calendar! Suggested donation of $40/session; a $150 donation reserves your spot at all 7 sessions. Reserve your spot by emailing [masked]

Just steps away from the West Portal MUNI depot - free street parking
Co-facilitated by Fran Cesarone and Jasmine Jia Erazmus

Series #1 Greed
Date & Time: September 20, 2018, 6:30 p.m. - 9:00 p.m.

Does money make the world go ‘round? Or is it the root of all evil? Is greed good? Are you more of a Warren Buffett or a St. Francis of Assisi? And what are the advantages and drawbacks of being one over the other? Come join us as we look at this emotionally charged subject from a variety of angles. You might just experience what it feels like to be a millionaire.

name: Early Morning Practice - Ashtanga Yoga
description:
You are welcome to join our early morning yoga sessions! You can start the practice and leave at any time within 2 hour time slot.

Mysore-style Ashtanga is the only type of yoga where practitioners can go through the sequence of postures at their own pace and receive personal adjustments from the teacher, while joining the energy flow of a group practice. Special attention is given to breath, gazing point and bandas. This dynamic practice equally develops strength and flexibility, brings stability to the body and focus to the mind.

Beginners and experienced practitioners are more than welcome! Complete beginners might need only 1 hour of practice.

Book your class at www.divineyogastudiosf.com
We are very close to AT&T Park and 4th St Caltrain station. Address: 255 King St (enter through Dental Spa lobby)

description:
WE ARE LOOKING FOR INDIVIDUALS THAT WANT TO LEARN TO DANCE BACHATA plus kizomba and salsa. Nightclub lessons and Studio dance lessons aren't enough. You have to challenge yourself to not only learn but to train with Dance Experts and to train with other individuals that has the same goals as YOU - to be awesome in the skills of social dancing.

No judgements. No need to bring partners.

Just show up at our 11am sessions and try it out for one hour - beginners or intermediate only.

THE TEAM EMPHASIZES
- Social dancing skills
- Performance Principles and Concepts
Performing is an option (but not required) for the dance members.

We have training programs & choreographies this year designed to improve your social dancing + core steps & leading and following concepts and principles

Rehearsals will be twice a week for 2 hours -Tuesdays (8pm to 10pm) & Saturdays (11am to 1pm)

WHAT TO BRING TO THE AUDITION
- Comfortable clothing
- Flat Shoes

Team Rodchata is the first bachata dance team in the Bay Area. Rodchata, the director founded this dance group since 2004.
The team have performed in Reno, Hawaii, Los Angeles, Las Vegas, United Kingdom, Australia, Canada and all over California.
- We teach all styles; tradicional, moderna & sensual + basic salsa and kizomba structure for all-around social dancer.

Director

name: Church 1.0 Community Spiritual Dialogue
description:
Come, have coffee and sit with us for relaxing moments of singing, praying and mindful group conversation.
Some of the themes of our discussions are internal peace, empowerment, relationship with the divine, relationship with each other, love, grace, deconstruction of a harmful religious past, acceptance, loss, pain, compassion.
We use the Bible and several different authors as source of content for our meetings. Some of the recent authors we read are Karen Armstrong, Richard Rohr, David Benner, Anne Lamott, Harold Kushner, Chris Glaser, Jack Kornfield, Henry Nowen and many others.
We rent the stunning chapel of the Unitarian Universalist Center on the corner of Geary and Franklin Streets.

description:
Hey awesome podcasters! This event is our monthly group event where we get to:

- Help you overcome roadblocks you're facing in your podcasting journey
- Answer ALL the questions you have about anything podcast-related
- Brainstorm and problem-solve different challenges you're facing- whether it's technical, mental, emotional, or otherwise!
- Get inspired and motivated by other super cool female podcasters
- Build a community of like-minded badass women who support each other and lift each other up!

We are thrilled to meet you awesome ladies!! Together we will kickstart and accelerate your podcasting journey. Hope to see you there!

name: December MeetUp!! (Women Who Podcast)
description:
Hey awesome podcasters! This event is our monthly group event where we get to:

- Help you overcome roadblocks you're facing in your podcasting journey
- Answer ALL the questions you have about anything podcast-related
- Brainstorm and problem-solve different challenges you're facing- whether it's technical, mental, emotional, or otherwise!
- Get inspired and motivated by other super cool female podcasters
- Build a community of like-minded badass women who support each other and lift each other up!

We are thrilled to meet you awesome ladies!! Together we will kickstart and accelerate your podcasting journey. Hope to see you there!

*If you have any ideas about what you want to talk about during the meetup specifically, feel free to send us a message! :)
**No-shows/ last-minute cancellations may result in being barred from attending certain Meetups in the future. This just ensures that we have full and vibrant Meetups each time, and everyone who is interested in coming has the opportunity.

name: Free Morning Satsang (Group Meditation and Spiritual Gathering).
description:
Satsang is the heart of the Yoga practice. It consists of 30 minutes of silent meditation, 30 minutes of chanting of mantras and kirtan and an easy-to-follow lecture on Yoga philosophy or psychology. The steady, joyful practice of satsang tangibly builds an uplifting energy at the Yoga Center.

Satsang means ‘“association with the wise.” Meditating together in a group creates a strong spiritual atmosphere which allows a deeper experience of meditation. In satsang, people of different levels practise together – from newcomers to experienced Yoga teachers.

Satsang is held every morning at 6:00am for about 90 mins. Friday mornings we perform a beautiful puja ceremony to celebrate the Divine Mother. There are evening satsangs on Wednesdays at 7:15pm and Sundays at 6:00pm.

name: All Level Hatha Yoga Saturday Morning Class (9:00 AM)
description:
Tuition: $15.00 / First Class Free.
The basic Sivananda All Levels class tones and stretches the entire body. It is non-competitive. We begin class with two breathing exercises to calm and balance the body and mind. We warm up with Sun Salutations. Then begins a series of 12 classical postures, with active relaxation in between. Gain strength, flexibility and focus. Train to become resilient, calm and relaxed with a healthy body, mind and spirit. All experience levels are welcome.

90 minutes
Modest attire
$15 / First Class Free
Multi-class passes available
No reservations required

All instructors teaching yoga asana classes at this Center have a minimum 200-hour Yoga Alliance-approved certification from the International Sivananda Yoga Vedanta Centres.

description:

name: Gentle Yoga Evening Class (7:15 PM, 1 hour)
description:
Yoga for relaxation and for people with limited flexibility

The emphasis is on focus and breath, as we move the energy of the body through a sequence of poses, modifying according to the capacity of those in attendance. The benefits are multiple, including improved mobility of the joints, increased awareness, deeper relaxation and sense of well being.

Gentle Yoga can also be helpful if you have injuries, post surgery, if you are in disease recovery or are overweight. Chair Yoga will be included when appropriate.

This is a 1 hour class. Gentle classes are also offered two mornings a week, Wednesdays and Fridays. No reservation necessary.

name: Gentle Yoga Morning Class (9:00 AM, 1 hour)
description:
Tuition: $12.00 / First Class Free.

The emphasis is on focus and breath, as we move the energy of the body through a sequence of poses, modifying according to the capacity of those in attendance. The benefits are multiple, including improved mobility of the joints, increased awareness, deeper relaxation and sense of well being.
