This is a 1 hour class. No reservation necessary.

name: Yoga for Pregnancy
description:
Tuition: $15.00 / First Class Free.
The months of pregnancy are precious. Yoga helps right from the beginning to create a positive environment for the mother and the child she is carrying. Yoga can help prevent problems like excess weight and back pain.

Even those who have never practised yoga will soon realize that even the simplest exercises enhance well-being and health. Relaxation, breathing exercises and meditation are a great relief during pregnancy, delivery, and the time afterwards. Yoga lets you tap your inner source of strength and helps you deal better with phases of stress and fatigue.

Yoga practice during pregnancy is based on the 12 basic postures. Over the course of the pregnancy, many postures are adjusted or replaced with specific variations. In addition, students learn special poses to prepare them for childbirth.

Deep breathing exercises, stretching and relaxation gives an all-round workout to the body and mind, helping not only in a healthy pregnancy, but also a safe delivery.

The mother-to-be should ask her doctor before practising yoga. It is advisable to attend pregnancy yoga classes in addition to practising at home.

name: Restorative Yoga Class
description:
Tuition: $15.00 / First Class Free
Restorative Yoga benefits those with physical limitations, or who are recovering from injuries and illnesses. It is rejuvenating for those who experience stress, insomnia or fatigue, or are energetically-drained.

Be guided into restorative poses for therapeutic effects—to re-align, re-balance and restore the root of any imbalances. Props will be suggested for support and comfort.

Empower yourself to release agitation and experience relaxation and healing on a deep level. Commit to a once-per-week practice.

name: Classical Sitar Concert
description:
Tuition : $20.00
The true Guru-disciple relationship is one that most westerners are unfamiliar with, but for sitar master Peter Van Gelder it is a life-long commitment that he entered into 35 years ago when he became the disciple of India’s greatest sarod master Ustad Ali Akbar Khan. Says Van Gelder, “There’s something indescribable about where that energy comes from that makes the raga really come to life.”

Peter Van Gelder will be accompanied on tabla by Tim Witter.

The Sivananda Yoga Vedanta Center is devoted to offering intimate concerts of classical Indian music once a month.

Great acoustics. Open seating. Floor cushions and chairs available.

Please book your tickets in advance:
- By phone:[masked]
- In person at the Center

Sitar master Peter van Gelder is one of the first and foremost Western disciples of the renowned Maestro Ali Akbar Khan, one of the greatest musicians and teachers of our time. He began to study Indian music with Maestro Khan who had come to teach a summer session in Berkeley. Peter found himself drawn to India, and spent two years studying under the guidance of Maestro Khan and his family in Calcutta.

Meanwhile, back in California, other young American students equally inspired by Ali Akbar Khan worked with benefactor Alan Watts to charter the Ali Akbar College of Music. Khansahib, as he is called by all his students and friends, agreed to become the artist in residence. A generous donation from Don McCoy (who also funded the Grateful Dead) got them up and running with a faculty of several of India’s top musicians. The college was run entirely by the students who worked for not much more than free lessons.

Peter returned to California and continued learning from Khansahib. He soon joined the college staff as a junior sitar. The college provided a setting for students to immerse themselves in the demanding music, and Peter had the opportunity to perform with musicians like Zakir Hussain, Shankar Ghosh, Ashish Khan, Lalgudi Krishnan and others.

In 1989 he was awarded the prestigious A.I.I.S. Professional Development Fellowship from University of Chicago to continue his career with a performance-study sabbatical in India during which he played in more than 20 public and private programs. Devoted full-time to the music of India, he now travels and performs widely and teaches sitar again at Ali Akbar College of Music in San Rafael, California.

http://petervangelder.com/index2.html

name: Mystery of Breathing (3 days self-exploration retreat)
description:
At “The Mystery of Breathing” workshop we will totally immerse ourselves in breathing practices and self-exploration.

Western (Rebirthing, Holotropic breathing, Vivation, Primal therapy) and

Eastern (Pranayama, Vipassana, Anapana) practices will help us to reach Wholeness.

And of course, we will also try the newest Russian techniques, like Free Breathing, DA-breathing, and A-ha breathing.

Workshop facilitator – Tatiana Ginzburg,

PhD in transpersonal psychology, 20 years of experience in various breathwork, founder of European Breathwork School (Saint-Petersburg, Russia), ex-national Russian coordinator at International Breathwork Foundation, author of «Methodology of Integration in Breathwork»
She has her special touch of facilitation that
does not let you to escape from your real
challenges !

The purpose of this workshop is deep dive into oneself.

- Trance-like states,
- altered states of consciousness,
- existential experience
as the tools that we will be actively using during our workshop.

You can touch the secrets of breath reaching the true self inside.
Are you in?

Workshop price (420$) includes

- a set of non-stopbreathwork and other self-exploration practices,
- lodging is in a comfortable tents under the redwood trees or shared rooms
- hikes, hot tubs, woods create a special environment.
- healthy vegan and vegetarian food

Tickets
https://www.eventbrite.com/e/mystery-of-breathing-3-days-self-exploration-retreat-tickets-48178184246

name: SF Shamanic Drumming and Journey Circle
description:
Come join us for a journey where darkness allows vision, and where vision illuminates consciousness. Open the gateway to your hidden mind and tap into the spirit knowledge of our ancestors. 

For thousands of years drumming has been used as a way of tapping into the subconscious, and going to other places and times in order to heal one's self and others. Join us for a very personal and possibly life changing experience.

This month we are going to journey on Spring. With Winter fading, and new buds starting to form, how should we nourish the parts of us that are just waiting to bloom? What are the optimal conditions for us to thrive and succeed with abundance and love? 

Personal drums/rattles are welcome but not required. Please bring pen and paper to record your journey, layered clothing or a wrap because the temperature may change, something to cover your eyes. Also, if you would like to lay down, a pillow and a blanket might be useful. 

No experience necessary and everyone is welcome!! 

Suggested donation is $10-$20; no one is turned away for lack of funds. 

For more information about shamanism and the leaders of this group, please visit: 
Will's website: http://www.willthejourneyer.com, or 

DeeDee's website: http://interioralchemy.weebly.com

name: Monthly Privacy Hackathon: Cypherpunk Saturdays @ Noisebridge!
description:
Fellow privacy hackers,

Join us on Saturday at Noisebridge where we'll be hacking on privacy-enhancing software the world desperately needs! Here is your chat invite: https://bit.ly/cwc-mminvite . (Or join #cpunkswritecode on Freenode, which is bridged to the main Mattermost room.)

Come help the Tor Project, the EFF, activists, and journalists by continuing the important work we began at our more formal hackthathon last month! Or hack on other privacy projects, including our new projects:

1. miniShare (instant in-browser encrypted sharing of files and text)

2. LeapChat (self-destructing/ephemeral in-browser encrypted chat -- announced at 5MoF on May 18th!), and

3. Encrypted AV Recording (record + encrypt + safely upload audio/video from your mobile device).

4. OpenOversight (hold police accountable be crowd-sourcing their names and badge numbers so complains against them are no longer rejected, beginning with the Chicago police and expanding to other departments soon; created and headed by Jen Helsby of the Freedom of the Press Foundation)

5. Pursuance (end-to-end encrypted task management to help large groups of people band together to change the world; this is part of the Pursuance Project (https://pursuanceproject.org/ )).

Developers, designers, activists, journalists, and concerned citizens are all welcome. We need software to be built, to be easy to use, and to solve real problems for real people; everyone has a role to play.

Projects we've hacked on during our previous formal and informal hackathons: https://github.com/cpunkswritecode/hackathons#hackathon-projects

Other projects you might want to contribute to (feel free to add to this to spread the word about some important project): https://github.com/cpunkswritecode/projects/wiki/Projects

See you there!

name: Tuesday Turnout
description:
The purpose of the San Francisco Gay Men Couples Meetup is to provide a place for couples to find other couples with whom they can form lasting friendships.

Tuesday Turnout meets for two hours on the first Tuesday of every month. The time is unstructured, so couples can initiate and foster the connections that best suit them. Forming lasting relationships doesn't happen quickly, as you know, so if you're willing, and we hope you are, this is truly playing "the long game." As the saying goes, eighty percent of success is just showing up.

Please eat beforehand, as food won't be served. There is a bar downstairs in the lobby, so you can bring a cocktail up if you'd like.

If you're driving, the closest garage is Fifth & Mission/Yerba Buena Parking Garage.

If you're taking public transportation, disembark at either Powell Street Station or Montgomery Station, walk to 4th Street and turn one block south.

We look forward to seeing you. 

Tom and Dan

name: Sunday Surf at Pacifica
description:
Weekly session at Linda Mar, Pacifica for the folks who want a regular local weekend event. This is a mellow spot, so it's a great session for the newer surfers. You can rent gear at Nor-Cal Surf Shop right next to where we park. Also a fantastic sunset spot, so it's worth coming even if you're late.
There's a back section to the parking lot that has a walk in entrance to the south side of the beach. It's a great place to park, and is right next to Soul Grind Cafe, which is a nice place to have a lil' somethin' before (or after) paddling out.
There's also some other good eats in the same shopping center, along with a really nice high-end "surf shop" called Traveler that has some awesomely tasteful things. If you like the Liz Clark/Patagonia ethos, you'd like their stuff.
If you have any ideas about how to make this session better, please post them, or message me.
Hope to see you there!

name: Wednesday Ocean Beach Dawn Patrol
description: Every Wednesday we're going to cater to the SF working crew with a local Ocean Beach session that folks can hit before office hours. It's a rolling start, just show up and get in whenever you make it. The super early risers might meet at Java Beach on Sloat for coffee at 6:30AM (or earlier? it opens at 5:30), and then head wherever it looks best. The rest of us will park at either Sloat lot, Noriega intersection, or up at Kelly's. If you come, tie a sock to your roof rails, or stick it on your windshield wipers, and hopefully we'll find each other. After-surf BS session at Java Beach, sometime between 8 and 10.

name: Free Intro to Lawn Bowling GG Park
description:
FREE Intro to the Great Game of Lawn Bowling in Golden Gate Park!

For newbies or people who have bowled before. Come on out and get your bowls on.

Join the FUN at the historic SF Lawn Bowling Club (founded 1901) on our beautiful greens on Bowling Green Drive, west of Robin Williams (formerly Sharon) Meadow/Children’s Playground. Discover the blissful, easy-to-learn/nuanced-to-master sport of bowls. Gentle exercise and great camaraderie for men and women ages 12 to 112.Just come to the clubhouse wearing flat-soled shoes (no heels) and casual attire. As it is summer in SF bring layers, it can get cold.

We'll provide the bowls, coaching and an hour or two of fun! You may get hooked! More info and directions: http://www.sflbc.org/

Please rsvp below or drop a note to [masked]

name: Preparing for Post: Making sure your film Doesn't Die in post production.
description:
While Noone will be turned away for lack of funds, THIS IS NOT A FREE EVENT! PLEASE RSVP ON EVENTBRITE!
https://preparingforpost.eventbrite.com/?aff=Meetup

Most filmmakers know that if you don't prepare for post-production, you can run out of funds and your film might just never be completed. But so many filmmakers focus solely on getting the film in the can, they miss many of the most important steps in finishing the film. That's why we've put together a panel of experts to help you better prepare for post-production so that you can move right through it and focus on marketing and distribution.

Together, our panelists have edited films for limited theatrical release, worked with the likes of Vice News and MSNBC, and more.

As with all of our events, tickets are priced with progressive increases, so get your ticket soon or you'll have to pay more for your seat.

Check out our presenters.

Herb Ferrette

He’s a seven time Regional Emmy winner and five time nominee. He has received National Emmy nominations in the categories of Individual Achievement in a Craft: News and Documentary/Editing and National Business & Financial Reporting. His work has been recognized at many prestigious film festivals. “Stable Life” a full-length project won Best Feature Documentary at the San Jose Cinequest Festival the Grand Jury Prize at San Antonio Cinefest and was nominated for a Regional Emmy and most recently granted a National Broadcast airing on “America ReFramed.” He also has been honored at Sundance for “The Fight in the Fields: Cesar Chavez and the Farmworker Movement.” He has won a Gold Medal at the New York Film Festival with a project for the Discovery Channel and in the 2006 San Diego International Latino Film Festival, “Race is the Place” won Best Feature Documentary and premiered that same year as the season opener for Independent Lens.

Geoffrey Orthwein

geoffreyo_headshot-1600.jpgAs independent filmmaker, editor, and colorist, Geoffrey’s work has been shown in theaters and film festivals across the US and Europe, museums, and broadcast television.

He got his start in post-production on independent films and documentaries including Ocean Voyagers, with Meryl Streep. He went on to supervise the post-production on the film Ocean Odyssey, a permanent installation at the Smithsonian Institution in Washington DC. He moved on to live production, where he toured the world doing live shows for companies including Google, Salesforce, Disney, and Virgin.

Alexander Nazarian Nigro

Alex is an audio engineer for both production and post-production sound. He's a resident engineer at FirstGen Audio Studio and is an active member of IATSE Local 16. His credits include "Hal" which won the student Oscar for best documentary in 2017, he also did foley for "For Here or to Go?" which screened before Congress and had a very successful Limited Theatrical Run, and has worked in a high-level audio production capacity on more than 5 feature films. Further, he has produced 2 audiobooks and is currently working on the post audio for a third.

While Noone will be turned away for lack of funds, THIS IS NOT A FREE EVENT! PLEASE RSVP ON EVENTBRITE!
https://preparingforpost.eventbrite.com/?aff=Meetup

ABOUT THE MODERATOR:

Ben founded, in 2014, an independent film producer's representation company Guerrilla Rep Media. Ben Yennie has 12 feature film Producer Credits since 2014 he earned by working with filmmakers to Sales Agents and distributors. These films have appeared on many platforms, and DVDs are set to be widely available for one in September. This year, Ben is set to coordinate two theatrical runs for independent feature films.

Ben has helped secure letters of intent, build business plans, and helped to raise funds for 3 early stage films in 2018.

name: Mastering Movie Marketing
description:
THIS IS NOT A FREE EVENT! PLEASE BUY YOUR TICKET ON EVENTBRITE IF YOU WISH TO ATTEND. PRICES GO UP THE CLOSER WE GET TO THE EVENT.
https://www.eventbrite.com/e/mastering-movie-marketing-tickets-50612849395?aff=Meetup

If you ask an average filmmaker, they’re probably not going to put marketing down as something they’re good at. They may not even think they need to be good at it. However, in the turmoil that film distribution is currently going through, a filmmakers marketing skill is probably going to be one of the most important things that sets them apart from the massive number of other filmmakers currently trying to start their own independent production company.

That’s why Guerrilla Rep Media is bringing you this 5 hour intensive about marketing for the independent film. It covers everything from developing your personal brand to finding your target market to getting publicity and proper social media strategy. Proper use of these tactics can help you grow your filmmaking revenue by more than 300%!

--Overview
----Why do you need to market?
----What’s the competition like?
------How many filmmakers are there?
------How many films are made in a year?
--Discerning your Target Market

----Finding Early Adopters
----Developing a Community around your work
--Branding
----Defining your Brand
----Defining your look
----Using Content to expand your brand
----Personal Brand Vs Company Brand
----Developing Brand Zealots
--Social Media/digital marketing
----A simple guide to SEO.
----5 Dos and Don’t for selling content online
----Developing relationships with your end consumer
----How much to Give away before you ask them to buy
--Publicity
----How and When to use publicity stunts
----Rules for drafting a press release
----Using Automated distribution services for press releases
----How to get reviews about your movie
----A strategy to appear on podcasts
----How to approach press
Using Festivals to market your film
----Getting into the major festivals
----What to do when you don’t get into Sundance
----How to Use Festivals to develop a community and a fan base.

name: Cell-based Meat Technology Workshop
description:
Please register for this free workshop here:
https://www.eventbrite.com/e/cell-based-meat-technology-workshop-cms18-tickets-50996964293

Cell-based Meat Technology Workshop

Join us on the night of Halloween for a workshop session at the IndieBio Biotechnology accelerator. This event is intended for anyone interested in cell-based meat technologies, the biotechnology IP landscape as it relates to cellular agriculture, and starting a biotechnology business in Silicon Valley.

Agenda
6:00 Doors Open
6:30 Introduction to IndieBio
6:40 Robert Yaman
7:00 Adam Yee
7:20 Speaker 3
7:40 Speaker 4
8:15 Closing

Speakers & Abstracts

Learning from the cell-based meat patent landscape
Robert Yaman

A cell-based meat company’s patent portfolio is one of its most important assets. Each company must have a plan for protecting its technology. New companies should also be aware of the current landscape, so they know where they should focus their efforts. In this talk, I’ll discuss what we can learn from looking at the current landscape for cell-based meat, then give an overview of all the major public patents.

Please register for. this workshop here:
https://www.eventbrite.com/e/cell-based-meat-technology-workshop-cms18-tickets-50996964293

name: Cultured Meat Symposium 2018 - November 1st
description:

name: Starfinder: Return to Sender
description:
-------------------------------------
SFS 1-23: Return to Sender
-------------------------------------

Character levels 5-8

While the Starfinder Society debates how to handle a newly emerged threat, faction leaders Historia-7 and Radaszam enact a dangerous mission to prove the Society is not an organization to trifle with. Taking a stolen enemy starship into the heart of a hostile alien empire, the PCs must pave the way for a decisive strike against the jinsul menace.

Content in Return to Sender directly follows-up on the events of Starfinder Society #1-99: The Scoured Stars Invasion, though playing the previous scenario is not required.

----------------------------------------------------------------------
As always, please reserve your seat on on Warhorn (you will need to sign up first).

Hope to see you at Laughing Monk!!

name: Pathfinder: Mysteries Under Moonlight, Part 1: Testament of Souls
description:
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
PFS 10-05: Mysteries Under Moonlight, Part 1: Testament of Souls
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

For Pathfinder character levels 3-7

Something ominous is afoot around Magnimar's famous monuments. The mayor hired an official investigator to get to the bottom of the situation, but the latter's methods have overlooked key evidence. Unable to secure the investigator's cooperation, a local governing body called the Varisian Council has turned to the Pathfinder Society for aid. The Pathfinder Society's efforts to cleanse the monuments and discover the source of their corruption are certain to stir up trouble as the PCs draw closer to a confrontation with a lurking evil force.

Testament of Souls is the first scenario in the two-part Mysteries Under Moonlight campaign arc. It is followed by Pathfinder Society Scenario #10-07: The Howling Dance. Both chapters are intended to be played in order (you can play other adventures in between, though).

Part 2 will be played on November 3 at Laughing monk.

----------------------------------------------------------------------
As always, please reserve your seat on on Warhorn (you will need to sign up first).

The event is listed here: https://warhorn.net/events/gamescape-sf-pfs/schedule/sessions/a806595e-0a67-4c8f-b752-ff16363d593f

Hope to see you at Laughing Monk!

name: Pathfinder: Mysteries Under Moonlight, Part 2: The Howling Dance
description:
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
PFS 10–07: Mysteries Under Moonlight, Part 2: The Howling Dance
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

For Pathfinder character levels 3-7

With the unique blessing of a celestial ambassador, the PCs depart Magnimar and rush into the swamp, chasing after the mastermind behind the corruption of several of Magnimar's iconic monuments. This mastermind isn't the only one who wants to see the PCs perish in the swamp, however. If the PCs are to find the mastermind and undo these schemes, they'll need to keep their wits sharp and make the most of their newfound powers.

"The Howling Dance" is the first scenario in the two-part "Mysteries Under Moonlight" campaign arc. It is preceded by Pathfinder Society Scenario #10-05: Testament of Souls. Both chapters are intended to be played in order.

Part 1 will be played on October 27.

----------------------------------------------------------------------
As always, please reserve your seat on on Warhorn (you will need to sign up first).

The event is listed here: https://warhorn.net/events/gamescape-sf-pfs/schedule/sessions/84f6bc55-9c56-4386-b002-3abd387faf62

Hope to see you at Laughing Monk!

name: Pathfinder Module: Gallows of Madness, Part 2: What Lurks in the Woods)
description:
---------------------------------
The Gallows of Madness
---------------------------------

For pathfinder Society characters level 1-3

Something wicked—and monstrous—stirs around the rugged Isgeri town of Saringallow, where the hated legacy of noble Chelish diabolists runs deep. With the recent disappearance of several apprentices, the nearby menace of particularly grotesque goblins, and the unsettling rumors about the old Sarini Estate, Mayor Sandra Trinelli knows that she needs help, and she needs it fast! The heroes must confront one of these crises, or all three, if they hope to stem the tide of darkness that looms. Before too long, the heroes discover that villains with ties to the Abyss have set their sights on Saringallow, and won't rest until the settlement and all its innocent inhabitants fall victim to their madness-inducing predations!

A NOTE ON PATHFINDER MODULES
-------------------------------------------------
Please note that we will be running this module in 3 parts. You will get a separate chronicle sheet worth 3 XP for each of the three parts, meaning you don't have to play them all.

If you do play them all, you will get a bonus sheet chronicle worth another 3XP. All told, if you play all three parts and take all the XP at full speed, you will finish at level 5.

As always, please reserve your seat on on Warhorn!
-----------------------------------------------------------------------
The table is listed here (you will have to register on Warhorn to view the event): https://warhorn.net/events/gamescape-sf-pfs/schedule/sessions/4ceed84a-254b-4832-8c83-8a50fef1b7df

name: Pathfinder: Treason’s Chains
description:
---------------------------------------
PFS 10–06: Treason’s Chains
---------------------------------------

For Pathfinder Society Characters level 1-5.

Venture-Captain Roderus has long been one of the most reliable and steadfast allies of the Pathfinder Society in the nation of Katapesh, but the aging human has decided that it is time to retire from his long-held position. Roderus's retirement party draws in Pathfinders from across Golarion, but there are some who see his retirement as an opportunity to advance personal goals that go against the Pathfinder Society's interests. Amid the turmoil of a party turned crime scene, the PCs must uncover the true threat to the Society's stability in Katapesh—and perhaps make an unexpected new ally along the way.

Contents in "Treason's Chains" also contribute directly to the ongoing storyline of the Liberty's Edge faction.

----------------------------------------------------------------------
As always, please reserve your seat on on Warhorn (you will need to sign up first).

The event is listed here: https://warhorn.net/events/gamescape-sf-pfs/schedule/sessions/8728fc68-d4ed-4761-8f3a-1e16107f566e

Hope to see you at Russian Hill!

name: Starfinder: King Xeros of Star Azlant
description:
-----------------------------------------------
SFS 1-27: King Xeros of Star Azlant
-----------------------------------------------

A Starfinder Society Scenario designed for levels 5-8.

When a relic dating back to the times of Old Golarion docks in a remote space station, the Azlanti Star Empire takes notice and quickly seizes it. The Starfinder Society dispatches the PCs to stop the Azlanti and reclaim the relic: the ether ship known as the King Xeros. With little time to hamper the Azlanti's upgrades on the strange magical vessel, the PCs must overcome the now functional starship. Only by claiming the King Xeros can the Starfinder Society learn more about its predecessor organization's past.

King Xeros of Star Azlant is a spiritual successor to the Pathfinder Society Roleplaying Guild scenario, Pathfinder Society #20: King Xeros of Old Azlant. It also works as further content for players who've played, or are in the process of playing through the Against the Aeon Throne adventure path.

Written by Christopher Wasko

----------------------------------------------------------------------
As always, please reserve your seat on on Warhorn (you will need to sign up first).

The event is listed here: https://warhorn.net/events/gamescape-sf-pfs/schedule/sessions/c41e08f7-ebc7-426f-bea8-c7f6d1650e12

name: Meet and Greet - Fellow hybrid Parents
Blockchain Open Development Lab
description:
| Interactive Open Development Lab
Come hack and learn with your peers at The DEN for yet another Blockchain Open Lab!

You make the agenda each Saturday - focus on the topics that interest you and your peers. Our community likes to:

- Learn more about Solidity and it's unique syntax

- Practice writing smart contracts and audit each other's work

- Collaborate on Full-Stack projects from contract to front-end

- Discuss interesting whitepapers from up-and-coming companies

- Create your own cryptocurrency and trade it amongst the group

- Dive into new protocols like EOS, Dispatch Labs, Hyperledger and Corda and understand how they differ from Ethereum and other popular Blockchains

- Network and more

You will also get the chance to work with experienced mentors and Alumni from our various courses & bootcamps, take on interactive challenges, and whiteboard out your solutions.

No experience is necessary - developers of all skill levels are welcome! Exposure to Solidity and knowledge of Ethereum will allow you to get the most out of the Open Lab.

If you've got a project you're working on or something you'd like to further your understanding of with others, please bring it!

We're all here to make the most of this new technology, and look forward to supporting you on your your journey!

| What Should I Bring?
Please bring your laptop or tablet to the workshop for maximum productivity.

We're building a top notch peer-to-peer learning community around developers & entrepreneurs who want to learn about Distributed Ledger tech and hack on projects in the blockchain space.

Learn more about our community at CageChain.io !

Connect with us on Twitter: @CageChainMedia !

You may inquire directly: [masked]

name: The Role of Ethics in Politics
description:
The Role of Ethics in Politics: Navigating Communication and PR in an Era of Mistrust

From fake news to false narratives, there is no doubt a growing sense of skepticism among audiences today. According to the 2018 Edeman Trust Barometer, trust in government and media have declined as dishonesty, bias and lack of rational discourse are threatening the public's overall sense of trust.

Join PRSA-SF and our moderator Jacob Warwick, brand and marketing strategist/founder of ThinkWarwick, for a lively discussion to explore what is behind the mistrust and how to communicate morally and effectively in this politically-charged climate.

Panelists:
-- Eva Rijser, Executive Vice President of Corporate Affairs at Edelman San Francisco
-- Melissa Caen, Politics Reporter at KPIX-TV
--Walter Adkins, Ret. San Jose Police Chief and Political Science Teacher at Evergreen Valley College

Agenda:
6:30 - 7:00 p.m.: Registration, Networking and Appetizers Reception
7:00 - 8:00 p.m.: Panel and Q&A
8:00 - 8:30 p.m.: Post-panel mingling

General/Non-PRSA-SF Members: $40
PRSA-SF Members: $25
Students (with ID): $10
(Note: Prices above do not include processing fees.)

To register, go to http://bit.ly/102518PRSASFEvent

Money collected at registration or at the door will go towards supporting future PRSA San Francisco events as well as to the Chapter's Scholarship Fund.

name: Jingle, Mix & Mingle with PRSA-SF and AMA SF Holiday Party
description:
Jingle, Mix & Mingle with PRSA-SF and AMA SF Holiday Party

Public Relations Society of America San Francisco Bay Area (PRSA-SF) and American Marketing Association San Francisco Bay Area (AMA SF) team up to celebrate the holiday season, co-hosting this year’s Jingle, Mix & Mingle!

Get in the holiday spirit with your friends at PRSA-SF and AMA SF at a special holiday party to benefit our friends in the Tenderloin! Mingle in one of San Francisco’s hottest lounges with marketing, PR and communications professionals from across the Bay. Learn about open positions and scout new talent for your organization.

Indulge in holiday cheer with light fare, complimentary drinks (depending on ticket purchased), dancing and photo booth fun. Participate in a silent auction to benefit the Tenderloin After-School Program, from which proceeds will go directly to the nonprofit group whose mission is to provide a safe drop-in space for the children of the Tenderloin District. Items up for grabs include restaurant packages, sports memorabilia and much more!

We will also collect toys for the San Francisco Firefighters Toy Program. Kindly bring an unwrapped toy for ages infant through 12 — gifts for tweens (bath/body products, jewelry, comic books and SF sports team clothing and accessories) — are in highest demand.

Pre-registration is required as space is limited — so reserve your spot today!

To register, go to http://bit.ly/2018PRSASFHoliday

name: Weekly Goal-Setting

We turn off our phones at 6:15, so make sure you're in the building by then!

name: Mechanism Design Working Group
description:
The Mechanism Design Working Group ( t.me/mechanismdesigners ) is for collaborative learning about strategic design, game theory and dynamic systems in blockchain, decentralized networks and beyond.

Our iterative, peer-to-peer co-learning format cycles through 6 week units*, structuring qualitative and quantitative exploration answering "what/who, why, how, when/where" about mechanism design topics.

We decided to focus on Work Token Models for the duration of Unit 01:
bit.ly/mechanism-design_unit01

* We're covering 2 units in Fall 2018 -->
- Unit 01 (Cryptoeconomics): 8/21, 9/18, 9/25, 10/2, 10/9, 10/16, 10/23
- Unit 02 (Tokenomics): 10/30, 11/6, 11/13, 11/27, 12/3, 12/10, 12/17

• Follow along with reading materials on -->
- Are.na: bit.ly/mechanism-design_arena
- Google Drive: bit.ly/mechanism-design_drive

• Up-to-date info & materials on Telegram: t.me/mechanismdesigners
^^ including the remote meeting link for that week via Google Hangouts

The Mechanism Design Working Group meets weekly on Tuesdays (6:30 – 8:30 pm) in the Starfish Network Workshop Room (1535 Mission St., San Francisco).

name: Get Paid More as a Professional Accountant
description:
Join speaker, best-selling author and TBD as s/he shares his best tips for making money as an accounting professional including:

*The tips for connecting with meeting planners
*Finding organizations that book speakers on a regular basis
*How to craft a one sheet that gets you booked
*How to turn speaking into revenue
*Sales conversion tips
*How to use speaking to get more clients faster and with less effort
*What meeting planners look for when booking speakers

About our Workshop Leader

RSVP Now! At this point, you have all the information you need... ... However, if you want even MORE information, feel free to keep reading.

Why & Who should attend this event?
Professionals who certainly don't have to be a QuickBooks ProAdvisor or an accountant, but want to learn, create opportunities to socialize. Entrepreneurs, business owners, attorneys, bankers, real estate developers, physicians, design professionals, product managers, technology gurus, sales and marketing experts, and others will greatly benefit from attending this event.

Are you looking to improve your tax prep or accounting business in some way?
Are you a business owner seeking to create a smoother tax preparation program in your business? Are you looking to improve your financial aptitude for anticipated growth in your business, or are you going in a new direction? Come join us at our event and discover how we could help grow your company.

Thinking of migrating, updating, cleaning up the data, or changing accounting systems or other processes for your business? Come check-out our events to see relevant, leading examples of business process and accounting practices.

Are you looking to benchmark certain aspects of your business, to optimize the financial aspects of a new online platform, product offering, or reach an ambitious business objective? Come join us at our event and discover how we can help you restructure and migrate your accounting situation.

How many people show up?
Our events usually see anywhere from 15 to 45 people depending on the topic and speaker. We make sure the presenters have a depth of knowledge to share that is relevant to accounting professionals. Regardless of how many people show up, you will be able to meet and talk to anyone.

What to Bring:
Bring your business cards (or it's digital equivalent.) Laptop's optional. Try to bring at least one card for the event organizer, because sometimes we have a raffle for a valuable surprise.

How to Dress:
This is an after work meetup gathering, so even if you did not work . . . it's a good idea to dress like you did! We all look good when we dress well. Occasionally, someone may take pictures at our events, so you want to look your best!

We look forward to seeing you. Thank you!

8:30pm - Bachata Progression with footwork and partnering foundation by Rodchata

Pay at the door: $15 per class

Rodney Rodchata Aquino, an international instructor, has 19 yrs of dance experience, including world competition judge and promoter. He has taught Bachata Dancing in 46 countries totalling 265cities in the world including the Dominican Republic. He is ranked the 2nd most influential bachatero in the world by Dance Planet Daily. (Ref: http://danceplanetdaily.com/most-influential-in-bachata/) You can also read his intimate interview here @ http://bit.ly/2c7ekWi

Henry Velasquez is a dance teacher under the tutelage of Rodchata

name: Spiritual LGBTQs and Beyond!
description:
Queer spirituality is often pushed aside by religion but thrives in the context of universal spiritual truths. You are a holy, divine and worthy of God's love and the love of others when we learn to be aware to the blocks to love's existence. Fear, Anger, Hate and Anxiety keep us from the truth of who we are and removing them is the miracle that heals our perceptions of ourselves, our relationships and the world.

Through sharing our experiences and the universal spiritual truths from A Course in Miracles we see our brother as ourselves and heal the separation to allow love, companionship and growth into our lives.

“When you meet anyone, remember it is a holy encounter. As you see him you will see yourself. As you treat him you will treat yourself. As you think of him you will think of yourself. Never forget this, for in him you will find yourself or lose yourself."

name: November 7,  2018 Meetup: Network, build community and learn from each other
Gathering December 6, 2018 in San Francisco
Saturday Morning Miracles Meeting
description:
• What we'll do
"Do you want to make this world a better place? Do you want to strut your stuff and align the molecules to project something beautiful? Do you want to hear the intuitive voice of guidance? This class will have an emphasis on getting things done in a way that will be truly helpful to you and everyone else! Come join me in this one of a kind expedition. Let's hit the miracle out of the ballpark! Think it and it will come!

"The Course is a master's degree in economics, music, and cosmology all at once. It is the architectural plans, materials, and the builder of your new life. Live to create, and create to live!" - Rev. Rudy Colombini

This group will be starting on January 6, 2018 reading, discussing and applying A Course in Miracles together! The location is a BEAUTIFUl high-rise condo with amazing views of the city of San Francisco, COIT Tower, Alcatraz, Angel Island, the Bay Bridge and the Golden Gate Bridge! ***There is ample parking on Saturday mornings on Hyde Street.***

The group is by donation. Any amount, great or small, is greatly appreciated. Your presence is the real gift!

After earning a business degree from the University of San Francisco, Rev. Rudy Colombini went into real estate, started his own business, and went into music with his own band, Rudy Colombini and the Unauthorized Rolling Stones. In 1988 he began studying A Course In Miracles and in 1995 became the 15th minister ordained by the Community Miracles Center.

• What to bring
If you have a copy of A Course in Miracles by the Foundation for Inner Peace, feel free to bring it! Along with anything you would like to take notes with.

• Important to know
Parking is ample on Saturdays on Hyde Street. The front desk person at the building will be able to give directions to the specific unit.

name: Spiritual Playdate - The Playdate with a Purpose!
description:
Spiritual Playdate at Unity San Francisco is an affirming, interfaith approach to sharing, learning, and exploring spirituality with children. It is a lightly structured, regularly committed space that allows families to talk about God, traditions, faith, spirituality, and Unity's principles. These Spiritual Playdates foster engaging, age-appropriate discussions with children, and encourage them to recognize their innate wisdom.

We provide a nurturing, safe environment for our children to start their spiritual journey and develop friendships throughout. During our time together, our youth is encouraged to experience God, learn about the world around them, and discover the sacred in everyday life. We use discussions, stories, music, meditation, movement, art, and other activities to engage our youth and explore Truth principles. The lessons are fun and age-appropriate, and provide lively, creative experiences directly related to the discussion of Unity concepts to help anchor their learning.

The Five Unity Principles underlie all of our activities in Spiritual Playdate:
1. God is all good and active in everything, everywhere.
2. I am naturally good because God's divinity is in me and in everyone.
3. I create my experiences by what I choose to think, what I feel, and what I believe.
4. Through affirmative prayer and meditation, I connect with God and bring out the good in my life.
5. I do and give my best by living the truth I know. I make a difference, and I matter.

If you and your family are interested in becoming involved, we invite you to join us for one of our fun-filled Spiritual Playdates. You are also welcome to reach out to our Youth and Family team with any questions, or to give us a call during our weekly office hours. We look forward to seeing you!

name: Meditation and Healing Circle with Rev. Eleesabeth
description:
Meditation and Healing Circle with Rev. Eleesabeth Hager
Third Wednesday of Each Month
7:00 - 9:00 PM

In our Meditation and Healing Circle, we will explore and practice meditation together. Through sounds, silence, words, and blessings, we will access together the power of our Principles in action and how to embody them for the highest and best life we came here to live.

The answer is to practice, and to practice together. As Myrtle Fillmore said in her Healing Letters, "We have access to the realm of rich ideas; we enrich our consciousness by incorporating these rich ideas. A rich consciousness always demonstrates prosperity."

When we practice "rich ideas" and the receiving of them, we embody them in health and manifest them in our lives. We do this better when we do it together, because it is easier to do it for someone else than for ourselves.

"The Lord is more willing to give than we are to receive...." --Myrtle Fillmore, Healing Letters

Join our Meditation and Healing Circle to experience these intentions for yourself!

name: Spiritual Salon with Rev. Ken Daigle
description:
Spiritual Salon with Rev. Ken Daigle
Fourth Wednesday of Each Month
7:00 - 9:00 PM

Rev. Ken's Spiritual Salon is a holistic spiritual service built upon community dialogue. In this emerging and innovative service, we will engage our spiritual questions with music and meditation, and then let Spirit lead during a time of personal sharing around a specific topic or quote. If you long for a place to ask questions, share your experience, and listen deeply to the essential spiritual issues of our time, then this service is what you are looking for.

Join us each fourth Wednesday of the month as we come together to expand our spiritual understanding and consciousness.

name: The Ohm Hour with Rev. DeeAnn
description:
The Ohm Hour with Rev. DeeAnn Weir Morency
First Wednesday of Each Month
7:00 - 9:00 PM

There is a call from within to quiet and be still. How do we quiet the "monkey mind" and allow that stillness? Join Rev. DeeAnn on the first Wednesday of each month for an experiential journey of the heart.

Using powerful spiritual practices from a variety of traditions, we will consciously quiet the mind and align our body. Each month, we will come together and accesss stillness through chanting, silence, poetry, contemplation, mudras, and simple movements. This gentle service is the perfect way to start off the month. Drop in, anchor, and renew!

name: Collective Wisdom with Rev. DeeAnn
description:
Collective Wisdom with Rev. DeeAnn Weir Morency
Second Wednesday of Each Month
7:00 - 9:00 PM

Our collective wisdom is waiting to be unleashed! Join Rev. DeeAnn on the second Wednesday of each month as we gather together in sacred space to listen and share from the heart. In our busy lives, it is easy to get disconnected from the wisdom within. How do we speak and engage with others from a deeply connected space? What happens when you allow yourself to speak the sacred language of the heart?

Each month, we will start with a poem, question, story, or inspirational quote. We will alternate moments of silence as we listen deeply with moments of inspired inshgts that we are called to share with each other. We will continually invite ourselves to return to the silence, to the wisdom within, and practice speaking from that consciousness.

name: Last chance to experience the beautiful & hidden "Audubon Canyon ". !
description:
What we'll do
The Foundation has reduced access to this area quite a bit. I guess they are trying to leave less of a human footprint, etc? This location sits high above Bolinas Lagoon North of the Stinson beach area. The wildlife viewing from here is great !

There are spotting scopes strategically placed high overlooking the nesting trees. Our hike will take us far & higher above this area. A very beautiful sanctuary. we will encounter the Giant's swing, , redwoods, creek crossings, the hidden bird observation house, breath taking ocean & lagoon & Tidal views, hidden wildlife cameras will take photos of wild animals in the natural state. *** Like the Mom Bobcat with her 2 young ones as she is bringing home a huge snake for dinner. Plus much more to see. The photo book area is hidden on an off main trail location.

There are many hidden cameras mounted at strategic locations where the wildlife frequents. I have seen their videos of Bears, Mountain Lions, Bobcats, a badger, & many more . It's amazing .

Many unusual trees & giant & unique mushroom growths & more. Few know of this hidden gem.

We must leave the area by 4:00 pm as they will close. Our usual dinner option will follow nearby.

**NOTE> I have added a new trail which will increase the hike distance to about 5 miles. We will do both sides of the canyons. This hike is rated as moderate with some gradual uphill at the start. ** This will be our last chance to visit here until May 2019.

The usual goodies I will have for all: water, juice, tea, lattes, energy & protein drinks, snacks, gourmet fruit & Nut packs, 20 varieties of trail bars, Vino, hiking poles, car shuttles, parking fees paid, donations, Special Fun, bad jokes, & other stuff to share. *BRING A LUNCH *** New this year are the delicious (Non Alcoholic) Wine Country Sodas from grapes.

Donation : $ or chk. $22.00 & A 25 % plus; Donation will also be given to the Foundation. (I'll explain this in better detail later.) I also send semi annual donations. NOTE: If you use Paypal (You must use the friends & family option only) . Or an additional charge will apply. UGH!!!

**We meet at Starbucks & will shuttle from there be fore 9:45 am am. I will have maps for shuttle drivers. Or for those who wish to meet us there & not meet at Starbucks, you may contact me.

** This is one beautiful place to experience !!!

Also it;s better to RSVP on a desktop computer & print up the info for reference along with your mobile phone app.(If not, you may miss important info.)
Contact: Indie Tom: [masked][masked]

name: The only "Sensory Overload" Art, Wine, & Nature  event of the year !
description:
DiRosa

5200 Carneros hwy (121/12) · Napa, CA

How to find us

Take 121/12 West from Hwy 29. Go past 2 stoplights & cross Duhig Rd. Blue gate is just past on the right.

Aloha Wahines & Kanes. That's ladies & gentlemen in Hawaiian.

It's been over a year since we have experienced this, as the massive wild fires put a crimp on this unique event.
***We will meet in the parking lot of DiRosa. Or at the front door up the gravel path.
Itinerary:
1. Di Rosa is a large but well hidden property between Napa & Sonoma. It has several museums & galleries that hold the largest bay area artist 's collections. Much art, structures, moving pieces, & many unique exhibits to think about & view. The main gallery is nestled on the far end of Winery lake. The gatehouse gallery is where we will meet. It is also on the beautiful Winery lake. We will be toured by knowledgeable Docents.
From the Gatehouse gallery we will take a Tram up to the Rene Di Rosa home & other galleries. This is an indoor & outdoor tour. ***Please wear good walking shoes.

2. Our next stop will be to another seldom seen or known location in Glen Ellen. This is where the Quarry Hill Asian gardens are located. After our wine picnic in the vineyards, we will tour this exotic piece of paradise. It contains lakes, ponds, a quarry, creeks, exotic & endangered species of plants & trees from all over Asia.

3. Our 3rd stop brings us to the Sunset/Cornerstone gardens. It is an ever growing place with cafes, unique shops, wine tasting areas & eclectic indoor & outdoor gardens with unique art structures & more.

4. If you still have some energy left, our final stop takes us to a special & very interesting winery. It is a destination all by itself. If you are tired of wine; just check out the amazing grounds . See the Mud Sharks, The Adobe House(made of clay & mud only) . The gardens, The museum, the exotic birds, The Romanesque Fountain ponds, The huge Eucalyptus trees & the hidden train for your special event.

If you wimp out before the day is over; that's ok. Our after event dinner option is still available.
NOTE: Bring a lunch. I will have personal wine varietals for our picnic lunch & other drinks & snacks to keep you going.

All entry fees, touring, wine, etc are included. We will caravan from Di Rosa & I'll have maps for driving to the locations. I can accommodate
three people in my car.
donation/cost: a mere $ $65. Use paypal (Friends & family option only) or Chase.com/zelle or $ or chk. upon arrival.
I must have an accurate head count for this event. So if you RSVP; you are expected to show up.
**This is the only time for this unique event till next march or April of 2019. Or if I'm still living. Or have not retired; or moved back to Hawaii.

One last note; Please use a desktop comp. when you RSVP & print up the page for ref. with your phone app. (Or you may miss important info)
Aloha.
Indie Tom

name: Hidden waterfall & creek hike, Historic sawmill, Underground winery & more !
description:
Usually we meet at the Wildflour Bread co. But time is an issue. So we will meet in the parking lot of the old Union hotel in downtown Occidental. It is at the corner of Bohemian Hwy & Coleman Valley Rd. Can't miss it.
(3731 Main St. Occidental)
NOTE: If you wish to stop at the Wildflour Bread co. first (140 Bohemian hwy in Freestone) ; Grab some amazing breads & meet us at the Union hotel in Occidental. It takes about 7 minutes to get there from Wildflour Bread co.

Please read all info. * Always bring a jacket; good hiking shoes, backpack or fanny pack. An extra pair of shoes for after is also a good idea.

* Always give me your em & phone # & meetup group name for carpooling help when contacting me. Email me directly for questions:
* All my events are unique and planning, creating , & conducting them takes 40-45 hours a week. Over 40 different events a year.
* Do not RSVP if not serious about attending.
* Some events have pre-pay requirements. Please heed them.
* You will most always have a super great time & meet fun people of all ages. I conduct no "Ho Hum" events !

Our first location takes us to a hidden ecological preserve . The waterfalls are very low now. But the creek trail is so cool to trek & climb it. A very unique area to explore. (Must have good hiking shoes) .

From here we head to the historic Sturgeon saw mill. This place is a working 1890's saw mill. You will love the tour & all the demos how things worked using belts & only steam power. A very unique experience is waiting for you here.
We will have our wine picnic lunch here in an outdoor cafe under the redwood trees. NOTE: This is the last time until next May that the sawmill will be operating.***
Onward from here to an Historic Brandy & sparkling winery for an underground tour & tastings. An interesting movie is also in the tour.
Another unique experience to enjoy & remember.

Our next to the last stop (If you have the energy) will be at the Russian river Sea cliffs. Where the Russian river meets the sea. Lots of wildlife to view here.
Our last *option is a visit to the soon to be famous RUSSIAN HOUSE #1. A unique restaurant that sits over the Russian river near the river mouth. So relaxing & the views are fantastic ! The delicious food is home style Russian. Buffet style. Cash is best here . ***But you won't get a bill. They accept a love offering only. How great is that ?!
Whew; all fun things must end temporarily. Just another crappy day in paradise !!

Also included will be: water, juices, teas, lattes, protein & energy drinks, , gourmet fruit & nut packs, Zillions of trail bars, Wine Country Sodas(non alcoholic), other snacks, car pooling & shuttles, parking fees, wine tasting & tour & a super interesting & fun experience !
donation $30. Chk or $. preferred or use p.pal. (friends & family option only). Or use chase.com/zelle
Indie Tom:[masked] [masked]
NOTE: Please use a desktop computer to rsvp & print up the info for reference with your mobile app. (Or you may miss important info).

This is one long & fun experience ! Hope to see you .

name: Awesome Big Island Hawaii Cultural & adventure Experience !
description:
Steve is not doing this trip this year.

This super fun trip is 8 days & 7 nights of all or most of the listed Itinerary.

Things to know about this island: It has 11 different climates. It is twice the size of all the other 7 islands combined. It is still growing. It has the most variety . (take a helicopter tour & really be blown away) From snow to rivers of lava. This is one Awesome Island !

Included: Pickup & drop off at Kona airport. All tours. Great Snorkeling . Lava Tube exploring. Volcano & lava viewing. Whale & Dolphin watching. Breathtaking Volcano Caldera Treks. Waterfall hikes. Warm thermal steam vents & pools. Black , Green, real White Sand beaches. Jungle & river treks. Manta Ray dives & observations. Water safari to Island lagoon & swim with fish & giant Green Sea Turtles.

Sunset fish & sea Turtle lagoon walk. (On day of arrival) Queen's bath & underground lava tube swim. Amazing sunset photo trip to the top of Mauna Kea volcano. (Worlds' tallest Mtn. from its base) . Snowball fight on top anyone ? This other worldly excursion will leave you breathless. (physically & emotionally) NOTE: On our last trip we left Mauna Kea sunset & on the way back in the pitch dark we were treated to the most amazing Stars & meteor shower of a Lifetime !!
Cultural locations. Botanical gardens, Volcano Winery, Zip Lining & Hawaiian history & Festivals.
Awesome hike down into the "Valley of The Kings" & explore the Black sand beaches, waterfalls, scenic jungle river & maybe find some of the Wild Horses that roam free there. I'll show you sea caves, Sea Arches, The unique lava Elevator pools, & the 4000 ft. Cloud Forest Coffee farm & tour. Cool old farmer's markets, old Hawaiian Art towns, & shopping Historical sights & so much more.
Note: This is not a sit on the beach with a Mai Tai tour. But we will be on great beaches. If you get tired; you may stay back & chill out at the pool or beach.
Our private(Hawaiian Style) Villa/home is private & gated with ocean view at about 1300 ft. No AC needed. There will be room sharing with several different bedrooms. The best part are the 4 unique Jungle outdoor showers attached to the corner units of the home.
**Also Hoping to have one of our great private chefs with us again.
**This trip is all inclusive except for maybe one evening out for dinner & airfare purchase. Snorkel gear is also included.
**Indie Tom
More info & what to bring later.
Cost: $[masked] Deposit[masked] .
Checks to: T. Bold 2471 Solano ave. # 112 Napa, CA 94558
[masked]
Pay pal/venmo (Friends & family option only) or Chase.com/zelle

name: Lunch and Networking
description:
Are you interested in increasing your business this year? BNI Dynamic Connections is an active Daly City chapter of BNI, the world's largest business referral organization. We are a group of local business owners who meet weekly to help one another promote and grow our businesses through word-of-mouth advertising and bonafide business referrals. 

If referrals are an important part of your business, then this is the group for you. One advantage BNI has over other networking groups is that we only allow ONE representative from each profession to join, so that we are not in direct competition with one another. We meet every Thursday for lunch. We are looking to grow our group so visitors are always welcome to check us out. Be sure to bring plenty of business cards! Make sure to RSVP here so we know you are coming and can make sure the restaurant can accommodate everyone. 

We are currently recruiting new members but these positions have already been filled: 

Acupunturist; Attorney - Employment Law; Attorney - Estate Planning; Attorney - Personal Injury; Auto Body Repair;  Banker - Business/ Personal; Business Copiers; Bookkeeper (Accounting); Chiropractor; Computer services; Construction; Dentist; Enrolled Agent; Financial Advisor; Individual & Relationship Coach; Insurance - Property & Casualty; Insurance - Health; Insurance - Life/ Pension; Loan Officer - Residential Mortgages; Loan Officer - Reverse Mortgages; Massage Therapist; Nutritional Products; Painter; Personal Trainer; Realtor - Residential; Security - Document/ Data Destruction Services

name: 2-Day Bootcamp for Software Testing – QA Bootcamp
description:
Boot camp for software testing – Foundation Level Class

This 2-day “how-to” workshop is designed for individuals that want to learn how to test software systems. The material is presented in a step-by-step format from building a test plans through the final test report. In this course you will learn test planning, test cases creation, test execution, defect reporting and test summary reporting.

Each step of the testing process includes test templates and checklists. The course begins with having attendees develop a testing strategy and concludes with having the attendees run test cases and filing bugs.

This is a beginner level course for an individual who has some IT experience and is interested in learning testing techniques and test methodology.

Workshop Benefits
The workshop attendees will learn software testing techniques, methodology and best practices.

Workshop Content
Section 1: Define effective software testing fundamentals.
Section 2: Test Plan.
Section 3: Test Cases.
Section 4: Test Execution and Tracking qa progress. Record and analyze test results
Section 5: Bugs, and Bug life cycle and bug tracking tools
Section 6: Define and build an effective test report.

Who Should Attend
Software Test Managers
Software Testers
Software Developers
Business Analysts
Project Leaders
Customers/Users

Schedule
Every 2nd weekend of the month. Saturday and Sunday from 9AM to 6PM

Cost
$325

Agenda
9:00am-9:30am   Breakfast Social
9:30am-12:00pm  Class Time
12:00pm-1:00pm  Lunch Break (Bring or Buy your own)
1:00pm-6pm  Hands On Testing

name: Learn Java, JUnit, TestNg and Selenium WebDriver – 6 Weeks of In-Class Bootcamp
description:
During this course, you’ll learn Java, WebDriver, Selenium IDE, Frameworks, Linux, SQL, TDD and more! We provide 123 hours of classroom instruction and hands-on project training.  Courses start on January 18th, 2016, and approximately every 8 weeks thereafter. For more information and to enroll, please visit our website.

Learn to automate web testing and white box testing. We’ve created a project-based course to teach you to become a competent tester as quickly as possible.

As a member of our community, you will receive lots of support and guidance. We all work together in an intense, but fun learning environment. You’ll be motivated and stay on track to learn exactly what you need to know to become a valued member of a software testing team.

WE EVEN ASSIST YOU IN YOUR JOB SEARCH! Most testers need help to break into the tech industry. We do more than just train you for a good job. We help you get one! We will assist you with creating your portfolio. Then we’ll provide you with practice interviews, and assist with the job application process.

Meet Our Instructors:

Fuad Mak is a Test Architect and QA Manager at SQA Solution. He has over 16 years of experience in Quality Assurance, and 9 years of experience in QA Management. Fuad is a successful Quality Assurance leader with a diverse background in multiple industries.

Fuad Mak has a thorough understanding of QA methodologies, automated testing, and the iterative software development processes. His background includes responsibility for eCommerce sites, Life science and Pharma validation, Client Relationship Management (CRM) strategy and systems, SAP, Mobile, and Retail solutions. His expertise covers a myriad of testing tools and processes in the software testing industry. Here are just a few: Test Director, QA Partner/Silk Test, Silk Performer, MS Test, Visual Test, Win Runner, Bounce Checker, Star Team, Track Record, BugZilla, Web Defect Manager, PVCS, Web Load, PVCS Tracker, Net Mechanic, Compuware, Scrum, Selenium, and many more.

Lesya Turanscaya is a Software Professional with 14 years of core expertise in Automation, Manual, Database, and Web-Service Testing. Lesya has experience Planning, Designing, Building, and maintaining complex Test Automation Frameworks (Data-Driven, Keyword, and Hybrid). She is an Expert in Selenium, WebDriver, and SilkTest Automation. She is also proficient with Java, has a deep knowledge of JUnit and TestNG unit testing Frameworks, and has real-world experience with many other testing tools and technologies. 

Jean Francois Nepton is an expert in planning, designing, building, and maintaining complex Test Automation Frameworks (Data-Driven, Keyword, and Hybrid). His expertise covers Selenium, WebDriver, and SilkTest Automation. He is also proficient in Java, has a deep knowledge of JUnit and TestNG Unit Testing Frameworks, and real-world experience with many other testing tools and technologies.

Our Philosophy: Anyone who is motivated can learn!

Yes, you can learn Java and Selenium WebDriver, and Become a Qualified Tester in 6 Weeks! We have structured this course to be streamlined and project oriented. In addition, we provide lots of guidance in a supportive environment. This helps keep you motivated, and helps you learn exactly what you need to know to get a good job, and to excel at it.

Hands-on training is the best way to learn!

At SQA Solution, we teach you how to think outside the box so that you can quickly discover bugs. We also provide you with problem solving techniques so that your input can assist in providing resolutions. After taking this course, you will enter the workplace eager to discover new challenges, knowing that you’ll have the tools to effectively handle them.

OUR PROGRAM

Our Objective: You’ll want to come to class eager to learn and prepared to work. At the end of six weeks, you’ll walk out of class as a new person. You are now qualified for your first QA or Tester position, and you’ll have a Certificate and Portfolio to prove it!

Our Curriculum: The processes and expectations for Test Automation and White Box Testing have undergone significant transformation. Our course is based on the new standards for web testing: robust, scalable, and trackable. You’ll build test scripts using Java, Flash, UI, DataDriven, and more. You’ll learn the same testing practices and tools that you’ll use on the job, like Ant and Maven. 

Detailed Schedule: SQA Solution classes run from 6pm to 10pm, 3 evenings a week, and 9am to 6pm on Saturdays. Classes vary between structured intros to exercises or projects and full day Testathons. During a Testathon, you may finish the previous day’s projects, or test and code a new project or exercise. Following is how a structured day will look:

• Saturday only, 9am: Breakfast. We’ll discuss technology and testing over breakfast in the classroom.

• Saturday 9:30am or Weekday at 6pm: Coding with our Instructors. We’ll introduce your next project or exercise. We’ll explain the concepts of how to perform the work, and then we’ll discuss how to work out the stuff you don’t already know. We want you to participate by asking questions—that’s how you’ll learn best.

• Saturday at 10am or Weekday at 6:30pm: Hack and Test. You’ll be working either in pairs or small teams on real-life projects. If you have questions, just ask an instructor and they’ll be happy to help get you resolve them by offering different approaches for resolution.

• Saturday only, 12pm: Lunch. Free pizza provided! Also, there are many great places for lunch within walking distance.

• Saturday at 1pm or Weekday at 7:30pm: Learn, Code, Test. Again, we’ll introduce you to new concepts by starting a brand new exercise or project together, and then allowing you to continue working on it within your team.

• Tuesday only, 6:30pm: Special Events. We hold different types of events. You can ask our guest instructors about their job experiences, go to meetups, practice interviewing, or just work on projects. The program ends at 8 p.m. However, you may want to continue working much later.

Weekly Overview:

•  Weeks 1 – 2 include teaching the basics of Test Automation and programming.

• Weeks 3 – 6 focus on project-oriented learning, both in groups and individually. This covers working on new projects from scratch and working on existing codebases. During this time, you’ll be creating your portfolio.

• During the course, we’ll be guiding you through practice interviews so that you’ll feel prepared and confident about what you’ve learned and what you can offer a new employer.

Financing: SQA Solution School is not participating in any federal, state, or other government financial aid program. However, we understand that motivated students might have different financial backgrounds. Students are encouraged to borrow money for tuition using a 3rd party crowd funding platform WeFinance: wefinance.co/sqa

Note: SQA Solution is not affiliated with WeFinance; the loan you receive from WeFinance becomes your own full responsibility.

Housing: If you don’t already live in the San Francisco area, we may be able to help you with arranging housing. We know of some student housing, and we’ve contacted a nearby hotels that has agreed to house our students at a reduced rate. (You will be responsible for the costs of your own housing)

☛ Should you have any questions, give us a call at [masked], ext. 6 during normal business hours, and one of our team members will be happy to chat with you!

We hope to see you soon in our class and share our knowledge with you!

name: Mobile Application Testing Boot Camp: 2 days of hands-on in-class training
description:
Mobile Application Testing Boot Camp in the Bay Area

</a>

<a href="http://renttesters.com/mobile-application-testing-bootcamp/">

Rapid growth of mobile will continue to transform the software industry in 2016 and beyond. Nearly 70% of startups building mobile apps or plan to enter the space in the near future. Ensuring quality is the greatest challenge (and key to success) in mobile industry. As a result, organizations are prioritizing testing and implementing many key quality processes and tools across the application lifecycle. Producing quality products is the #1 greatest challenge for succeeding in the mobile space.

Nearly 80% of consumers would delete a mobile app if they encountered a single bug.


In our Mobile Application Testing Boot Camp you will:

• Understand what makes mobile application testing different from standard software testing

• Learn some of the underlying technologies behind mobile devices and how those technologies affect testing

• Discover how mobile applications work and different techniques for testing  them

• Explore the different types of mobile applications and how to test for each

You will learn how to identify common issues in mobile applications and how to test the unique aspects of a mobile application testing. In this course you will learn how to test  usability across multiple platforms and resolutions, network and security testing, creating application unit tests, mobile UI automation, and performance testing for various devices over various networks and carriers.


Course Outline:

• Introduction to mobile testing

• What is mobile testing?

• Why is mobile testing important?

• What do you need to know to be a good mobile tester?

• Emerging trends in the mobile marketplace

• Types of mobile applications

• Mobile application SDLC

• Mobile testing platforms

• Mobile specific testing

• Network testing

• Data storage testing

• Security testing

• Understanding how the operating system affects testing

• Testing special device capabilities

• Usability testing for mobile devices

• Testing mobile web applications

• Application testing strategies

• Testing native applications

• Tools for testing native applications

• Testing hybrid applications

• Tools for testing hybrid applications


Hands-On Mobile App Testing

In this Boot Camp you will learn about mobile application testing through hands-on activities, exercises, discussions, and demos. You will explore mobile testing techniques on your mobile device, so a mobile device, smartphone, or tablet is required (BYOD).

Who Should Attend

This course is appropriate for both novice and experienced software testers who are new to mobile application testing. Technical support, business analysts, and test managers may also find this course helpful. A background of basic software testing principles is required.


Agenda:

9:00am-9:30am.....Breakfast Social (continental breakfast provided)
9:30am-12:00pm.....Class Time 
12:00pm-1:00pm.....Lunch Break (bring your own lunch) 
1:00pm-6:00pm.....Hands-On Testing

Please visit our website to register: http://renttesters.com/mobile-application-testing-bootcamp/

Cost: $350

We hope to see you soon in our Mobile Application Testing Boot Camp and share our knowledge with you!

name: The San Francisco Men's Group Weekly Meetup
description:
We are going to be addressing a variety of issues that Men typically face in their lives. Common issues in the group are loneliness, anger, grief, depression, anxiety, sexuality and relationship and career challenges. You can anticipate learning how to more effectively communicate with others and deepen your capacity to understand yourself as well as your relationships. Not only will we be supporting each other in the lives we lead, we will also be learning from each other as we embark on the important task of staying connected. Too many men in our world don't have a space to connect deeply with others.

"It is terribly important for a man to have some way to continue throughout his life working and playing with male companions who earnestly try to develop personal as well as collective soul.  Without some sense of genuine group, too easily the individual man falls asleep or gives up.  The history of men, of animals, and of learning has to do with groups, with common effort.  A man can risk more exploration of his potentials and of his grandiosity--he can risk more encounters with grandeur--when connected to other men who can reduce him when necessary and encourage him when needed."

-Michael Meade

There are three separate groups being held now, two on Monday evening and another on Tuesday.

description:
Please go to website for most current information and to make sure schedule has not been changed.

SHABBAT SCHEDULE

10:30 Worship service / Liturgy

~11:30 Message / Children's classes

Thank you for saving your questions & comments until the end of the message. Children from ages one to pre-bar/bat mitzvah are dismissed mid-way through the service to the upstairs room. They are separated into Nursery, Pre-school - Kindergarten/1, grades K/1 – grades 3/4, grades 3/4 – grades 5/6, and grades 6/7 to pre-bar/bat mitzvah levels. Youth are dismissed after the Torah reading to the room inside the fenced playground along Oka Rd. Children's classes end about 15 minutes after the message. Please remain quiet if you enter the upper room before Kiddush begins.

~1:00 Kiddush & Oneg Shabbat (potluck) upstairs

We welcome everyone to join us in our upper room above the sanctuary for food and fellowship after the service which can be accessed via staircase or ramp. Lunch is provided by the donation of many generous hearts and hands. Please bring only kosher dishes  or fruits, vegetables, and or drinks. Everyone is expected to clear off their own tables and their neighbors if needed. Oneg is not a catered event! Also, if you or a child spills food or drink on the rug, please clean it up, or ask for assistance if you are not capable.

(Location: Upstairs)

name: Celebrate Shabbat Liturgy - Livermore
description:
http://www.britahavah.net/ 

Brit Ahavah is a small peripatetic (wandering) congregation in the Tri-Valley for the past 17 years.  We have rented  in Livermore, Dublin, Pleasanton, and now back in Livermore.   We rent space Saturday morning at 193 Contractors Ave, Livermore.

Our weekly service uses the common Jewish liturgical framework but adjust the components as needed to reflect Y'Shua, especially during the High Holy Days.   We speak/sing the Hebrew and then repeat the component in English.

We follow the service with Oneg (potluck lunch using koshered foods).

We pray that, in celebrating the L-rd’s appointed times, you will experience how each shabbat and festival reflects an aspect of the fulfillment of G-d’s plan of redemption. We hope this will bring you into a deeper relationship with G-d and a greater understanding of his written word and promises.  There is so much to revel in learning about the L-rd.

name: Fellowship Meeting (Sat.) Santa Rosa, CA
description:
Hallel Fellowship meets weekly on Saturdays starting at 8:30 a.m. in Santa Rosa, Calif.

“Hallel” means “praise” in Hebrew. Join us for singing and dancing in praise — “hallel” in Hebrew — to our Father in Heaven, Creator of the earth and the universe. After the dancing, we talk with Him in prayer before listening to Him through His message to us, the Bible. Hallel Fellowship searches for God’s instructions for us today in the Torah (Hebrew for “teaching” and synonymous with the Bible books of Genesis–Deuteronomy), the writings of historians and prophets (i.e., Joshua–Malachi) and the writings of the followers of Yeshua (Matthew–Revelation).

8:30–11:30 a.m. Spanish-language worship and study
12 p.m. Dance & worship
12:45 p.m. Break
1 p.m. Announcements and prayer
1:45 p.m. Torah study by Richard Agee
2:45 p.m. Break
3 p.m. Prophets & writings study by Daniel Agee or Apostolic Writings study by Jeff Quackenbush (alternating weeks)
4 p.m. Final dance & prayer
4:15 p.m. Kiddush (a symbolic “meal” of bread and wine)
4:30 p.m. Dinner
5:30 p.m. Cleanup

Getting to the meeting

Rincon Valley Grange, 5055 Rincon Ave., Santa Rosa, Calif. (Google map)

name: Let's get together for Shabbat! fellowship, prayer, bible study, testimony
description: The fourth commandment requires us to rest on the seventh day of the week. On Shabbat we get together to observe this day the same way it was done in the past and continues to be for those who walk in obedience to God's Word. It is a feast day, so let's celebrate! A day in which we rejoice before the presence of God, fellowship, worship, prayer, testimony, and study of the Word. Learning from each other and sharing what God has been doing in our lives. We meet until sunset, but of course you can come and go at any time. We will have drinks and food to share through out the day. Please get in touch with me if you have any questions or would like to join us in observance of the Sabbath.

name: Beit Abba Shabbat Service (Napa)
Talk about the New Yorker over cocktails.
description:
All, please join us for our next New Yorker Magazine Meet Up. Conversations are not limited to the New Yorker Magazine at all, but rather it is a gathering of like-minded people who enjoy the New Yorker Magazine to enjoy cocktails and socialize. We will talk about life, world events and anything else worthy of conversation over happy hour drinks.

We try to pick a few articles each month for people to read. Here are this month's articles: 

Moving to Mars

http://www.newyorker.com/magazine/2015/04/20/moving-to-mars

Tears of the Sun

http://www.newyorker.com/magazine/2015/04/20/tears-of-the-sun

Escape or Die

http://www.newyorker.com/magazine/2015/04/20/escape-or-die

<a href="http://www.newyorker.com/reporting/2013/11/25/131125fa_fact_keefe"></a>

By popular demand, here is a FAQ for this Meet Up.

Q: Is reading of the articles mandatory. 

A: No, No, and No. Please come even if you haven't. 

Q: I only look at the cartoons and never really read the articles. May I still attend?

A: Yes.

Q: I used to read the New Yorker but I haven't recently. May I still attend?

A: Yes. We are about like-minded people getting together and socializing. There will be no test on recent issues.

briksha2Briksha was born in the small village of Himalayas, is a yogi, a certified Rebirthing Breathwork practitioner, an Integral life coach and raw vegan chef. Mahendra Briksha combines Vedantic-Yogic practices, Buddhist wisdom and Integral insights in his teaching. He has been teaching and leading breathing sessions and meditation classes for 10 years.
He is a graduate of the yoga teacher training program at the Vivekananda Yoga Research Center in Bangalore, India and holds certificates in Integral Yoga from the California Institute of Integral Studies, and Yoga Therapy from Purusha Yoga, and has over 200 hours of yoga teacher training through Urban Flow with Rusty Wells. Briksha is a resident teacher and manager of the Yoga Society of San Francisco (yogasocietysanfrancisco.com). He co-teaches the 200hr YTT for Seaside Yoga Sanctuary and Yoga Society of San Francisco.
Briksha’s main mission to share his knowledge and experience is to help people awaken in their body, breath, and mind and learn to live a peaceful and evolutionary life in the midst of a busy world.
To Know more about Rebirthing Breathwork go to http://hamsaintegralbreathwork.com
