name: 7 Week Bollywood Choreography Workshop in San Francisco
Bollywood Cardio Workout for 13 weeks! Class Starts today!
How Biomimicry is Inspiring AI
description:
• What we'll do
This Meetup will be a discussion on how biomimetic design can inspire what we teach artificially intelligent machines. The talk will begin with an overview of the key differences between the features of modern machine learning architectures and those of the human mind. We will briefly look at the history of the field of AI as well as other branches of science through the lens of biomimicry and will explore how this lens can be used to generate further advances. Finally, we will discuss the implications of this novel approach to scientific discovery in general.

Tanya Grinberg will be speaking, she is the head of AI development at Symbiokinetics. She is working on reverse engineering the human learning algorithm to build AI-aided human-hardware interfaces aimed at high-performance learning. Her research interests include symbol grounding/ontology identification problem, value learning, signal processing and reinforcement learning. Symbiokinetics is a human-centric AI and robotics company with the goal of optimizing human learning. We believe that the human mind is a vastly untapped resource which can outperform AI in any dynamic problem-solving scenario if used to its full capacity. Symbiokinetics technology is addressing AI risk and automation-driven job displacement by driving human performance to its true potential via AI-assisted adaptive learning.

This Meetup is brought to you by IBM and Metis. IBM Index will be taking place from FEB 20–22, 2018 at Moscone West. This is an open developer community conference. Attend and learn the latest software development practices and techniques to advance your skills and develop your career. This event will be provided free of charge to all students. Metis accelerates the careers of data scientists by providing full-time immersive bootcamps, evening part-time professional development courses, online resources, and corporate programs.

name: Tour de Pink West Coast
BAYS Monthly Support Group
Hack with purpose!
description:
Participate in local projects to create lasting change.

Hacktivations start with needs that are identified from nonprofits and those directly in need of help. The community is filled with developers, designers, marketers, business professionals, social workers, writers, community organizers and many more skilled volunteers.

We meet twice a month and spend a few hours connecting and working on projects to make an impact in San Francisco and beyond. Join us if you want to get involved, give back and get to work to make an impact.

If you have an idea for a project please submit it to http://hacktivation.org/submit-a-project. We welcome new projects all the time and would love to have you present your idea to the group.

name: Take an improv class in a creative community!
description:
Welcome to the fun!!! Here are all the details:

Step 1.) You must register and pay $15 on Eventbrite (http://mondayimprovclass.eventbrite.com/) to secure your place in the class (not just on this Meetup). Online registration ends at 6:30pm every Monday for that week. $15 discounted online registration for the class is located here: http://mondayimprovclass.eventbrite.com/

You can just show up and pay $20 (cash only) at the door. However class size is limited and it often sells out. So I'd recommend signing up online if you want a guaranteed place in the class (it's cheaper too) - you must do this on Eventbrite (http://mondayimprovclass.eventbrite.com/) (not just on this Meetup).

Step 2.) Everyone meets inside the SF Chronicle building lobby, checks-in, and takes the elevator upstairs to the third floor classroom. Following the class there's usually an after party at the Chieftain Irish Pub & Restaurant around the corner (5th and Howard). It's a great time, hope to see you there!

This Meetup is for people who currently improvise or are interested in trying out improv. We get together and attend Leela's weekly Monday night drop-in improv class: The Art of Improvisation (see below).

"Come play, bring a friend, and meet new people in Leela's weekly drop-in improv class. This fun-filled improv class is a valuable opportunity for experienced actors/improvisors to sharpen their skills, and newbies to get introduced to the wonderful world of improvisation. Connect, play, grow..."

Visit http://www.leela-sf.com for more information about Leela.

description: On the 3rd Friday of each month, at 8am at Robin’s Café (17th/Shotwell) we'll meet to discuss the various themes of being a #responsiveorg. Feel free to bring friends, colleagues and other interested people to join the conversation. This event does not have a regular facilitator. We encourage those wanting to practice their facilitation skills to step up at the start of each meeting.  See you there!

name: User Testing Night (UX Speed Dating)
description:
Schedule

6:15pm -- Food/Drinks & Station Setup

6:45pm -- Announcements, etc.

7:00pm -- User Testing Begins (Promptly)

It's formatted like a speed dating event! Test, rotate, test again.

8:30pm -- End of Event

Cost:

- $10 for each visit

- Payment on the event Meetup site before attending (cash on arrival also possible)

Who:

- UX designers / project managers / start-up founders

- Anyone who wants to have some software/device/concept tested.

--- Please do bring along a user to keep the balance of users and testers.

What:

UX Speed Dating is a monthly event (third Wednesdays!) where tech professionals get to present a prototype/game/product/website/etc. to three willing testers.

It's formatted like a speed dating event with a twist; product owners sit at a station while the users rotate to test a new product every 15 minutes.

name: HOSTING/ORGANIZING AN EVENT
description:
If you would like to host/organize an awesome event, simple suggest it.  Please make sure to answer all of the following questions to help members decide if they would like to RSVP:

1) What is the name of the event?

2) What is it about?

3) What's the date(s) of the event?

4) What time do you wan to start and end the event?

5) Where is the event happening?

6) Where exactly do you want everyone to meet?

7)How much does it cost?

8) If it cost a certain amount, do we pay ahead of time/pre-order?  If so where and to whom?

9) Would you be hosting the event?  If you host the event would you need help to prepare for the event?

10) Please provide a weblink if available for more information

If you have any questions or would like to see a specific type of event, or if you would like to host events on a regular basis, please ask.

name: Awareness Through Movement Class @ Feldenkrais Center
description:
Most movements are done lying on the floor. Please wear comfortable street clothes that do not restrict movement and arrive at least 10 minutes before class.

Cost: $20

Awareness Through Movement is a practice that uses mindful movement exploration to improve the way we function in daily activities and high performance endeavors, such as athletics and performance arts. Some lessons resemble a blend of meditation and gentle yoga; some lessons are like neurological puzzles for the brain; and some lessons focus on developmental movements and how to acquire specific advanced skills.

These lessons were developed by Dr. Moshé Feldenkrais, an lsraeli scientist and one of the first Judo black belts in Europe. In accordance with the latest scientific research on brain neuroplasticity, the Feldenkrais Method uses our proprioception, sensory feedback and movements to change our neurological patterns. The practice can help to manage chronic pain, improve function in a variety of activities and elevate mood.

"To make the impossible possible, the possible easy, and the easy elegant." - Dr. Moshé Feldenkrais

The Feldenkrais Center is conveniently located in the Glen Park area near several Muni lines: J Church, 14, 24 and 49.

name: Exploring the Unknown Reality
description: We will discuss a chapter from "The Unknown Reality Vol. 1" and practice exercises related to our dreams and exploring the multi-dimensional aspects of the self, probables, counterparts, etc.. in our waking and sleeping realities. We ask those interested in participating to have an understanding of the ideas and concepts in Seth's first two books Seth Speaks and The Nature of Personal Reality .

name: The Power of Now Book Club
JKD in the Park
description:
RSVP does not reflect actual attendance. The meetup map pin shows the wrong location, but a google maps search will pin the actual location. The 11:30 am start time is for first-timers to meet and greet, and a basic orientation. The actual start time is 11:00, but I like to have things going a bit, so I can focus on the new folks.

The meetup is listed elsewhere and due to a price change in Meetup, I keep this group to below 50 members. I belong to whole bunch of meetup groups that I never go to and chances you are just as human as me. The way I cull the herd is when reach 49 members, I remove the 5 at the bottom of the last visited list.

My cell if you get lost -
[masked]

This is a Sunday on-going JKD/FMA/Martial Arts/Personal Defense workout Safety first is my primary rule.

What this means to you is, More people actually attend the meetup than the RSVP indicates. I appreciate it is somewhat off-putting to have only one or two RSVPs, as it appears to make the group smaller than it actually is.

Rain days are at the Chinese Pavilion (the gazebo on the Stowe Lake island just past the waterfall). It is a bit less muni friendly, but car parking should be available on the lake for those who travel that way.

In it's favor, the location has nearby bathrooms, it feels more martial artsy, it can handle eight, is covered, so no rained out. But more importantly, great acoustics. It's bothered me practicing Sonny's stuff without music, this place solves that.

I am going to start allowing folks to spar/play - a major gear-shift from the self-defense/combatives scenario approach I have used since I started organizing this group. It is strictly optional. I am going to require three classes before I let you play.

The distinction I am making here is spar = without weapons, play = with trainer-weapons - rattan is basically banned.

As always, no fight club, no dog brothers.

(Several of you have taken exception to my no dog brothers rule, implying, "we're not all idiots." After all, a guy trained by subject of a dog brother documentary, Sonny Umpad, and fracking punk-rock anarchist icon, Frank Discussion, should delight in training you to take out guys wearing riot gear. Sadly, this is not the case.

The problem isn't the TFM or the dog-brothers, per say, the problem is its devotees tend to develop an attitude that becomes a problem. The dog brother attitude/approach makes it difficult for some rare individuals within their ranks and on their periphery to know why they are training. Of the three people I've kicked to the curb/banned from this group, two fell into that category. The third was a mentally disturbed registered sex offender.

Highly recommend watching the original Japanese "Shall we dance," movie if you are still a bit confused about what I will and will not accept behavioral-wise.

People of all levels and different Martial Arts systems are welcome to attend. I emphasize, safety first, movement, flow, with broken rhythm, basic techniques and JKD terminology/language.

For those of you who don't know, www.nextbus.com is a useful resource for getting around on Muni, but kinda sucks unless you already know what bus routes you need.

Gavin

Join us in a private room at this popup from Diane, Michael Mina's wife.

Some great reviews

"Great as Brunch spot!! Amazing bartenders Amberrae and Diane! Get the Dirty Diane Bloody with a burger! Phenomenal lunch brunch spot!"

"WOW! This place is one of the best spots in San Francisco, all around. Unbelievable bloodys, one of the greatest french toasts I've ever had, and the breakfast sandwich was #1. The egg dishes and avo toast the others had at the table also were perfect."

About Tanya
Excited to discover new great places to eat and drink

About Mina Test Kitchen
It is in her home in West Marin that Diane quickly discovered a love for the garden, which she now calls “Bella Mina Gardens.” There, she experimented with forgotten herbs like lovage and created her one-of-a kind “Tomato Vineyard” with Heirlooms selected just for her Bloody Mary.

Through 25 years of making Bloody Mary drinks, Diane designed her own special mix—a unique blend of hand-milled heirloom tomatoes, lovage, and a few secrets spices that evoke the comforting childhood memories of backyard barbeques at Pop-Pop’s house.

Now widely recognized as a Bloody Mary connoisseur, Diane continues her bloody obsession by testing out new mixes and bringing wellness to the Mixology industry.

Come, relax, Meet Diane with the rest of the gang and start your day off right!

name: Beef Wellington Wednesday at Maybeck’s!
description:
Join Sharon Hajek for Beef Wellington Wednesday at Maybeck’s!!

Reserve your seat on Nommery! RSVP here: https://nom.ms/YLKd6jphkQ

Please join me for Wellington Wednesdays where at 7 p.m. the Chef invites diners back to the kitchen for a brief, yet comprehensive, lecture on the history of the dish. (He says it was first mentioned in the Los Angeles Times in 1907 and did not reappear until a New York Times article in the 1930s.) Like risotto, Wellington waits for no one; it must be sliced and served before it goes soggy. With everyone watching, the Ceremonial cut reveals a tenderloin cooked to a perfect medium rare, with the duxelle evenly ringing the tenderloin.

About Sharon
Born in NM but really Native Californian since age 4. Majority of my time in Bay Area with a stint in the Central Valley. I'm back in the City now enjoying life looking forward to unique dining experiences, great cycling and new friends!
Professionally, I'm in the aviation industry,

About Maybeck's
Maybeck's is an American classic restaurant in an iconic San Francisco neighborhood. They use the best ingredients and provide a great atmosphere. They are also well known for their amazing homemade pasta dishes!

• Elegant reception and four-course tasting menu by Chef Philip Tessier - View Menu: https://meritagecollection.com/application/files/2515/3910/0180/VC_FutureOfCooking_Dinner_Menu_2018V3_ADA.pdf
• Wine pairings by Hestan Vineyards, a family-owned estate on the eastern slopes of the Napa Valley
• Demonstrations of Hestan Cue, an app-guided cooking system that is changing the way we cook
• Stunning setting at Vista Collina Resort, Napa’s newest food and wine destination

$145 per person with promo code "MeetUpSF." Tickets must be reserved in advance at https://nightout.com/events/the-future-of-cooking-dinner/tickets

name: Friendsgiving Benefit for ESF
description:
Don't miss this Opus 415 event, an intimate friendsgiving gathering at an iconic North Beach gallery in support of Ensemble San Francisco. Nosh, mingle, and enjoy a performance by the Ensemble San Francisco piano quartet.

20 spots are reserved for SF Foodies at this event. Drinks and appetizers will be provided by the host but we invite SF Foodies to take part in the inaugural ESF cook-off! Details are as follows:

Show off your favorite savory or sweet bites/side dish. Prepare a plate for about 15-20. Because of an allergy, please do not use peanuts. The ESF quartet will be the tasting judges and the winner of the evening will receive an invitation to the dress rehearsal and a front row ticket to ESF's season finale at Herbst Theatre on Tuesday April 16, 2019! Please email [masked] with your intent to compete by Friday November 9th.

For an additional donation of $50 and above, we invite you to bring your instrument and play in a side by side reading with ESF. Please choose one movement from the following list and send your request and what instrument you play to [masked] by November 9th:

Dvorak Piano Quintet
Schumann Piano Quintet
Mozart Piano Quartet in G Minor
Mozart Piano Quartet in E Flat Major
Haydn String Quartets
For special requests not included in this list, send an email by November 2nd.

General Admission: $25
Drinks and appetizers will be served

Space is limited so act fast. Tickets can be purchased here:
https://www.eventbrite.com/e/friendsgiving-benefit-for-esf-a-chamber-music-gathering-tickets-51059914579

Opus 415 is the social club of ESF that fosters friendships with our audience.

ESF is a 501c(3) not for profit. For more information visit www.ensemblesf.com

name: Dinner at Angler
description:
Join Frank Huang for Dinner at Angler!

Reserve your seat on Nommery! RSVP here: https://nom.ms/sTAngOgjHQ

Joshua Skenes' Angler is popping! Come find out the magic that he works with top-quality local produce on a lively Friday night!

From the restaurant: "Please note we are unable to fully omit traces of gluten, mushrooms, soy and fin fish from our menu."

About Frank
Student in Bay Area. Love food and travel!

About Angler
Angler is a sea-life focused restaurant with views of the expansive wood burning hearth as well of the San Francisco Bay from Chef Joshua Skenes and Saison Hospitality located on the Embarcadero waterfront.

The menu is a collection of local bounty. Each day’s inspiration is drawn from the products themselves and is an articulation of their natural flavors, served at their peak taste. Our cooking is slow and deliberate, pausing to pay attention to all the little details that make good food great. We work with a small group of fishermen, hunters, gatherers, ranchers, and farmers to find and follow microclimates that produce the highest quality products in local existence. All of the cooking revolves around open wood fire and a fireplace designed for Chef Skenes's unique methodology, techniques, and tools for extracting the best tastes in our products.

Like Nommery on Facebook
Follow us on Twitter

Click HERE to reserve your seat on Nommery! Nommery is your social dining platform. It is free to join and browse our events.

$5 nonrefundable RSVP to reserve your seat. No shows and cancellations made within 48 hours of the event will be recorded as a demerit by our group. Individuals with demerits may be moved from lists of attendees to waiting lists for future events. If 2 or fewer members sign up, this event will be canceled and all attendees will be refunded. Please RSVP and pay on Nommery and we will add you to the Meetup. RSVP on Meetup alone does not guarantee you a seat at this event

name: FEATURED TRIP: AUSTRALIA
description:
Location: Australia- Sydney, Melbourne, Cairns, Brisbane, Australian Outback.

THIS POST IS JUST TO FEATURE THE TRIP. THE ACTUAL DATES ARE MARCH 9-24, 2019

CLICK HERE TO LEARN MORE: https://www.1000treks.com/trips/australia--the-adventure-down-under

In this two-week trip we will:

- Visit some of Australia’s major cities such as Sydney, Melbourne and Brisbane.

- Visit a tropical rainforest.

- Get introduced to the Aboriginal culture, the oldest living culture in the world, dating back 40,000 years!

- Snorkel on the Great Barrier Reef, the largest reef in the world.

- Scuba dive on the Great Barrier Reef! This is a must for any scuba diver, but you will be able to do it even if you have never scuba dived before!

- Visit the breathtaking Whitsunday Islands: https://tinyurl.com/whitsunday-1000treks

- Sail on a racing yacht.

- Visit the beautiful Fraser Island and go on a two-day 4x4 adventure where you can drive your own 4x4 through the sandy beaches of the biggest sand island in the world.

- Kayak with dolphins.

- Drive the Great Ocean Road where we will see Loch Ard Gorge, Apollo Bay, The twelve apostles and Port Campbell.

- Visit the Australian Outback where we will see the famous Uluru (Ayers Rock) and do a full hike around it. In case you have been living under a rock (no pun intended) and don't know what Uluru is, this is Uluru: https://tinyurl.com/uluru-1000treks

- Take a helicopter flight over Uluru (optional), one of the most amazing experiences you will ever have!

- Have the chance to skydive over Uluru! That’s right: do a safe tandem jump- attached to a professional skydiver- over Uluru!

And more! Those were just some of the highlights.

CLICK HERE TO LEARN MORE: https://www.1000treks.com/trips/australia--the-adventure-down-unde

name: LEARN HOW TO SCUBA IN THE PHILIPPINES ON THANKSGIVING
description:
If you are already certified CLICK HERE: https://www.meetup.com/Adventure-us-SF/events/250953946/

It's OK to RSVP without a deposit. A deposit guarantees your spot.

Click here for more info and to make a deposit: https://www.1000treks.com/trips/learn-how-to-scuba-dive-in-the-philippines-on-thanksgving

This year’s Thanksgiving is going to be a little more adventurous and a little more fun than your previous ones. Pick up your phone, call your family, and tell them that this year you will have to skip Thanksgiving with them because you are going to the warm-water, tropical, beautiful Philippines to learn how to scuba dive!

The Philippines is one the most beautiful countries in the world and one of the best places in the world to scuba dive. The only bad thing about learning how to scuba dive in the Philippines is that you will be so spoiled, it’ll be hard to match your first diving experience!

And since the area has so many activities besides diving and so many beautiful places to see, we will plan on taking two days in which we can choose to go diving only in the morning and then arrange with the hotel to take us to do some of the activities and see some of the other places in Puerto Galera. All the activities besides diving will be optional and carry an extra cost, although things in the Philippines are so cheap, those costs will be very small.

Here is our planned itinerary:

SATURDAY, NOVEMBER 17:

Arrive at any time. Our rooms will be available after 1 PM, but if some of us arrive before that (I’m probably going to), I can see if the hotel can have our rooms available earlier. Either way, we’ll have a secure place to leave our luggage and enjoy the day at the resort.

SUNDAY, NOVEMBER 18

Two dives as part of your certification in the morning and free day in the afternoon.

MONDAY. NOVEMBER 19

Two dives as part of your certification in the morning and free day in the afternoon. At the end of those two dives you will be an Open Water Certified Scuba Diver!

TUESDAY, NOVEMBER 20

We’ll go out in the morning on a boat to do your first two guided dives as a certified diver! Again, this will be the perfect set up for a newly certified diver, since you will have a guide (who is also an instructor) with you the entire time.

In the afternoon we will have an optional (extra cost) beach hopping outing in which an El Galleon’s boat will take us to different beaches in Puerto Galera to snorkel, lay out at the beach, etc. Or if you prefer, you can stay and do two more dives in the afternoon at no cost.

At night we will arrange transport to take us to town for dinner and a drink. As it turns out, the Philippines have some unique drinks that they say every tourist should try! Check this out: https://alcoline.ph/blog/filipino-alcoholic-drinks-try/

WEDNESDAY, NOVEMBER 21

Full day of guided boat diving with optional night dive (12.00 extra for the night dive)

THURSDAY, NOVEMBER 22

We’ll do two dives in the morning. In the afternoon we will do an optional (extra) outing to Extreme Sports Philippines where we can ride ATV’s, go-karts, zipline and do a bunch of fun stuff! http://www.extremesportsphilippines.com﻿.

Or if you prefer, you can stay and do two more dives in the afternoon at no cost.

FRIDAY, NOVEMBER 23

Full day of guided boat diving and optional night dive (12.00 extra for the night dive).

SATURDAY, NOVEMBER 24

Full day of guided boat diving. At night we will arrange transportation to go to the village of Sabang where we can have dinner and go bar hopping for our last night in the Philippines.

SUNDAY, NOVEMBER 25

It’s our last day, but because we will be crossing the timeline on the way back, we can leave late in the day. We will see how we feel, but it would be fun to once again arrange transportation with the hotel to take us to beaches in the area where we can go snorkeling lay out, and just enjoy our last day in the Philippines.

PRICE and PAYMENT TERMS

-1,395.00. I know, crazy cheap, right??? For seven days of unlimited diving with breakfast included! The Philippines is pretty inexpensive. Now, we got 4 rooms for this price. Once those rooms are taken, the price will go up to 1,595.00.

- A deposit of[masked] (non-refundable) secures your reservation. Then you have until August 17, 2018 to finish making your payment. Once we receive your deposit, we will send you an invoice for the remaining amount. When you make your payment, you will be asked for your email. MAKE SURE YOU LIST AN EMAIL YOU CHECK DAILY WHEN YOU MAKE YOUR PAYMENT. THAT'S WHERE YOU'LL RECEIVE YOUR INVOICE, QUESTIONNAIRE AND ALL THE EMAILS IN REGARDS TO THE TRIP.

CLICK HERE TO MAKE YOUR DEPOSIT: https://www.1000treks.com/trips/learn-how-to-scuba-dive-in-the-philippines-on-thanksgving

- Full payment is only due on August 17, 2018, three months before the trip. So you have a lot of time to pay. You can make payments in any way you prefer so long as you are fully paid by the due date.

- If you make payments or pay in full before the due date, your payments (minus the deposit) are refundable before the due date (August 17, 2018). After that, all payments are entirely non-refundable. We STRONGLY suggest that you get travel insurance to cover you in case you need to cancel your trip for any reason.

INCLUDED

- All the hotel stays at double occupancy (please see ABOUT OCCUPANCY below).

- Four certification dives on November 18 and 19 (two dives per day).

- Five days of unlimited guided boat dives (up to four per day) from Tuesday, November 20 through Saturday, November 24.

- Tanks and weights.

- Transportation to and from Manila airport to the hotel if you arrive within the guidelines on FLIGHT GUIDELINES below. If arrive or leave at a different time, you’ll have to arrange your own transportation or pay extra for El Galleon to come pick you up.

- Breakfast at El Galleon from Sunday, November 18 through Sunday, November 25.

NOT INCLUDED

- Flights (see FLIGHT below).

- Optional activities including the ones listed on the itinerary.

- Meals unless specifically stated in the itinerary.

- Travel insurance (highly recommended). We do offer Travel Guard travel insurance and will send you a link to purchase it once you pay your deposit. You can also get insurance with any company you would like.

- Tips to guides, drivers, staff, etc.

- Rentals besides tanks and weights. Equipment rental is 16.00 per day without computer, 21.00 with computer and can be arranged at El Galleon.

- Souvenirs or anything extra you would like to get.

- Anything not described in the itinerary.

ABOUT OCCUPANCY

- Double occupancy: you will be paired up with someone of the same gender as a roommate. Unless you have someone that you are already coming with, of course.

- Single supplement (if you want a room for yourself):[masked]

- The last people to RSVP and pay the deposit MAY have to be put in triple occupancy rooms (if we end up with an odd number of men or women).

RSVP DEADLINE

- We’re not setting a deadline but we’re limiting the number of people to 20, including experienced divers and new divers for this trip. We STRONGLY recommend that you put your deposit down ASAP. This way we can reserve your place. For every trip we do there are people who come in too late because they kept thinking about it too much. Life does not wait for you if you hesitate. You know this trip was in your bucket list, so jump in right now!!!! :-)

FLIGHTS

Flights are NOT included. Flights are very easy to book nowadays on your own and some people want to do side trips, so it gets really unpractical to include flight. Besides many of you can use miles or other ways of making your flight free or saving money if you book it by yourself. So instead of including air, we will give you guidelines so you can go to Kayak.com, Cheapoaire.com, Expedia.com, Orbitz.com, or any booking website and book your own. The best time to book a flight is usually 2-3 months before (the best day is Tuesday and the best time is between 12:00 and 3:00 PM). We will book ours at that point and e mail the group telling you what we got. If you do book the flight, we’ll meet at LAX. If not, we’ll just meet you there.

I did a quick search and already found flights as low as[masked] round trip! I found a direct flight for[masked] round trip and will probably buy that one about 60 days before.

FLIGHT GUIDELINES

- Arrives in MNL at any time on Saturday, November 17 up until 7:00 PM. We will have to be shuttled to Puerto Galera from Manila, which is a 3 hour drive, so we can’t arrive too late.

- Leaves MNL on Sunday, November 25 at any time after 4:00 PM.

SOME OTHER IMPORTANT THINGS TO KNOW

- PADI’s Open Water Certification consists of a classroom or online session, five pool dives (done usually over two days) and four ocean dives (done usually over two days). The itinerary and package we put together has you taking the classroom or online course and doing your pool modules beforehand, so you don’t have to waste your time during our vacation doing those things. You can contact any PADI dive shop and arrange those, and I can help you with that. If you prefer to do it all in the Philippines, that is possible too, but I strongly recommend against it because you want to spend your time in your vacation diving; not sitting in a classroom or diving in a pool. You can email me if you have any questions and we can discuss this.

- All the optional activities will be arranged and paid for at El Galleon.

- Because of the adventurous nature of our trips, our itinerary and some locations are subject to change due of weather, tides, road conditions, logistics and other unforeseen circumstances. It’s not likely, but it could happen. Whenever we make a change in the itinerary, we will do our best to keep the integrity of the trip.

- Passport is required, of course, as in all international travel. Your passport must be valid for 6 months after our return date of November 25, therefore it must be valid until at least May 25, 2019. If you don't have a valid passport or if you passport expires before May 25, 2019, make sure to get started on a new one ASAP. Here's the link for the Department of State Passport section: http://travel.state.gov//content/travel/en.html

- As of the time of this posting American Citizens don’t need a visa for the Philippines. If you have a foreign passport, you may need a visa. Here's the Philippines Embassy page so you can look into that: http://www.philippineembassy-usa.org

If you need to take care of any those issues, make sure to get on them ASAP so you don't get held up because of some unexpected delay. We've had people missing trips and losing their money because they waited too long, had unexpected issues come up, and couldn't take care of them before the trip started.

LEGAL DISCLAIMER AND RELEASE OF LIABILITY STATEMENT

1000 Leagues Travel, 1000 Treks, Adventure Us, SoCal Scuba and their event/assistant organizers, representatives, agents, employees, and/or any affiliated person, company or entity are not responsible for your safety. Outdoor activities are inherently dangerous. By participating in any event, you're taking responsibility for your own safety and well-being and agree to release 1000 Leagues Travel, 1000 Treks, Adventure-us, SoCal Scuba and their event/assistant organizers, representatives, agents, employees, and/or any affiliated person, company or entity from ANY responsibility, liability or claim in law or in equity.

You acknowledge and understand fully that there are risks and dangers of serious bodily injury or death that could result from your participation in this event. You have voluntarily elected to participate and FULLY ACCEPT AND ASSUME ALL RISKS AND ALL RESPONSIBILITY FOR ANY INJURY, LOSSES AND DAMAGES TO PERSON OR PROPERTY THAT INCUR AS A RESULT OF YOUR PARTICIPATION.

You represent that you are qualified, in good health and in proper physical condition to participate in this event.

You agree not to sue and to release, discharge, waive, hold harmless and to indemnify 1000 leagues travel, 1000 treks, Adventure-us, SoCal Scuba and their event/assistant organizers, representatives, agents, employees, and/or any affiliated person, company or entity from and against all liabilities, claims, demands, losses, damages, suits and proceedings, regardless of the cause, including but not limited to, the negligence of any releasee, arising or resulting from your participation in these events.

You understand that the 1000 Leagues Travel, 1000 Treks, Adventure-us and SoCal Scuba may, from time to time, take photographic, digital or video images of event participants for advertising purposes. You hereby agree to allow 1000 Leagues Travel, 1000 Treks, Adventure-us and SoCal Scuba to use those images for that purpose without expectation of privacy or remuneration.

name: Thanksgiving Scuba Diving in the Philippines
description:
Keeping up with our tradition of awesome scuba trips to great, warm-water, tropical places for Thanksgiving, this year we are going to the beautiful Philippines.

Our location will be Puerto Galera on Mindoro Island, one of the most beautiful locations in the Philippines with some of the greatest dive sites in the world. Puerto Galera is also listed as one of the most beautiful bays in the world!

Click here for more info and to RSVP: https://www.1000treks.com/trips/thanksgiving-scuba-diving-in-the-philippines

Puerto Galera is actually a great resort area for both divers and non-divers. Because there is so much to do besides diving, this will be a great trip to bring our non-diving friends, family, boyfriend, girlfriend, etc. There are beautiful beaches to lay out and snorkel, as well as tons of other activities including hikes to water falls, 4x4 adventures, ziplining and even an adventure park.

As always, we are taking advantage of the weekend and arriving on Saturday before Thanksgiving to make this a 9-day vacation, but only have to take 3 days off work. Actually we’ll have to take the Friday off too, since the flight crosses the timeline, so 4 days off work for a 9-day vacation; still awesome. Now, because we cross the timeline, we can leave late on Sunday and enjoy one extra full day in the Philippines and arrive back in the U.S. Sunday earlier, so we truly have full days. I love traveling back from Asia because on the way back you arrive before you left! :-D :-D

We are staying at El Galleon dive resort, one of the best dive resorts in Puerto Galera, and we got a package of unlimited guided boat dives for 7 days. We are going to dive our asses off!

I also scheduled one trip to Verde Island, the passage between Mindoro Island and Luzon, which experts call the “center of the center” of the world’s marine biodiversity, with more than 300 species of corals and underwater rock canyons that host nearly 60 percent of the world’s known shorefish species.

And since the area has so many activities besides diving and so many beautiful places to see, we will plan on taking two days in which we can choose to go diving only in the morning and then arrange with the hotel to take us to do some of the activities and see some of the other places in Puerto Galera. Or if you prefer, you can stay and do two more dives in the afternoon at no cost.

FRIDAY, NOVEMBER 23

Full day of guided boat diving. At night we will arrange transportation to go to the village of Sabang where we can have dinner and go bar hopping for our last night in the Philippines.

SUNDAY, NOVEMBER 25

It’s our last day, but because we will be crossing the timeline on the way back, we can leave late in the day. name: AUSTRALIA: THE ADVENTURE DOWN UNDER
description:
Location: Australia- Sydney, Melbourne, Cairns, Brisbane, Australian Outback.

Dates: March 9-24, 2019

It's OK to RSVP without a deposit. A deposit guarantees your spot.

CLICK HERE TO LEARN MORE: https://www.1000treks.com/trips/australia--the-adventure-down-under

People have been asking for this one for a long time. Let’s go on an one-of-a-kind adventure to one of the most beautiful and exciting countries in the world: the land down under, Australia.

As always we have gone out of our way to create a fast-paced amazing itinerary in which we will do tons of exciting activities and visit tons of amazing and exciting places. We will do the regular touristy things that everyone has to do when they go to Australia, but as always, we’ll take things to another level by doing some amazing adventurous and unique stuff.

In this two-week trip we will:

- Visit some of Australia’s major cities such as Sydney, Melbourne and Brisbane.

- Visit a tropical rainforest.

- Get introduced to the Aboriginal culture, the oldest living culture in the world, dating back 40,000 years!

- Snorkel on the Great Barrier Reef, the largest reef in the world.

- Scuba dive on the Great Barrier Reef! This is a must for any scuba diver, but you will be able to do it even if you have never scuba dived before!

- Visit the breathtaking Whitsunday Islands: https://tinyurl.com/whitsunday-1000treks

- Sail on a racing yacht.

- Visit the beautiful Fraser Island and go on a two-day 4x4 adventure where you can drive your own 4x4 through the sandy beaches of the biggest sand island in the world.

- Kayak with dolphins.

- Drive the Great Ocean Road where we will see Loch Ard Gorge, Apollo Bay, The twelve apostles and Port Campbell.

- Visit the Australian Outback where we will see the famous Uluru (Ayers Rock) and do a full hike around it. In case you have been living under a rock (no pun intended) and don't know what Uluru is, this is Uluru: https://tinyurl.com/uluru-1000treks

- Take a helicopter flight over Uluru (optional), one of the most amazing experiences you will ever have!

- Have the chance to skydive over Uluru! That’s right: do a safe tandem jump- attached to a professional skydiver- over Uluru!

And more! Those were just some of the highlights.

CLICK HERE TO LEARN MORE: https://www.1000treks.com/trips/australia--the-adventure-down-under

name: Walk With A Doc - McLaren Park
description:
According to the American Heart Association, walking has the lowest dropout rate of any physical activity. Think it doesn’t do any good? Think again. Walking is low impact; easier on the joints than running. It is safe – with a doctor’s okay – for people with orthopedic ailments, heart conditions, and those who are more than 20% overweight. In addition, research has shown that you could gain two hours of life for each hour of regular exercise! That quick stroll around the block seems a little more worthwhile now, doesn’t it?

Walk with a Doc is a walking program for everyone interested in taking steps for a healthier lifestyle. What better way to start your weekend than on your feet making strides to help your heart and improving your general health to live longer! While you walk at your own pace, you’ll have the opportunity to have questions answered by local physicians.

This program was started in Columbus, OH in April of 2005 by Dr. David Sabgir and has now expanded throughout the country. You don’t need any special gear and there are no special rules. Just put on a pair of comfortable shoes and walk alone, with friends, a partner or family or with a group. It’s a personal preference.

In partnership with: Healthy Parks, Healthy People and Heal, Inc.

Lead Physician:
Andrew Oliver, D.O.

Contact Information:
[masked]

name: Last "Sensory Overload"  Wine, Art, Nature & photo event for the year.
description:
Aloha Wahines & Kanes. That's ladies & gentlemen in Hawaiian.

It's been over a year since we have experienced this, as the massive wild fires put a crimp on this unique event.
We will meet in the parking lot of DiRosa. Or at the front door up the gravel path.
Itinerary:
1. Di Rosa is a large but well hidden property between Napa & Sonoma. It has several museums & galleries that hold the largest bay area artist 's collections. Much art, structures, moving pieces, & many unique exhibits to think about & view. The main gallery is nestled on the far end of Winery lake. The gatehouse gallery is where we will meet. It is also on the beautiful Winery lake. We will be toured by knowledgeable Docents.
From the Gatehouse gallery we will take a Tram up to the Rene Di Rosa home & other galleries. This is an indoor & outdoor tour. ***Please wear good walking shoes.

2. Our next stop will be to another seldom seen or known location in Glen Ellen. This is where the Quarry Hill Asian gardens are located. After our wine picnic in the vineyards, we will tour this exotic piece of paradise. It contains lakes, ponds, a quarry, creeks, exotic & endangered species of plants & trees from all over Asia.

3. Our 3rd stop brings us to the Sunset/Cornerstone gardens. It is an ever growing place with cafes, unique shops, wine tasting areas & eclectic indoor & outdoor gardens with unique art structures & more.

4. If you still have some energy left, our final stop takes us to a special & very interesting winery. It is a destination all by itself. If you are tired of wine; just check out the amazing grounds . See the Mud Sharks, The Adobe House(made of clay & mud only) . The gardens, The museum, the exotic birds, The Romanesque Fountain ponds, The huge Eucalyptus trees & the hidden train for your special event.

If you wimp out before the day is over; that's ok. Our after event dinner option is still available.
NOTE: Bring a lunch. I will have personal wine varietals for our picnic lunch & other drinks & snacks to keep you going.

All entry fees, touring, wine, etc are included. We will caravan from Di Rosa & I'll have maps for driving to the locations. I can accommodate
three people in my car.
donation/cost: a mere $ $65. Use paypal (Friends & family option only) or Chase.com/zelle or $ or chk. upon arrival.
I must have an accurate head count for this event. So if you RSVP; you are expected to show up.
**This is the only time for this unique event till next march or April of 2019. Or if I'm still living. Or have not retired; or moved back to Hawaii.

Please use a desktop comp. when you RSVP & print up the page for ref. with your phone app.(Or you may miss important info)

Aloha.
Indie Tom

name: Awesome Big Island Adventure Trip !
description:
This super fun trip is 8 days & 7 nights of all or most of the listed Itinerary.

Things to know about this island: It has 11 different climates. It is twice the size of all the other 7 islands combined. It is still growing. It has the most variety . (take a helicopter tour & really be blown away) From snow to rivers of lava. This is one Awesome Island !

Included: Pickup & drop off at Kona airport. All tours. Great Snorkeling . Lava Tube exploring. Volcano & lava viewing. Whale & Dolphin watching. Breathtaking Volcano Caldera Treks. Waterfall hikes. Warm thermal steam vents & pools. Black , Green, real White Sand beaches. Jungle & river treks. Manta Ray dives & observations. Water safari to Island lagoon & swim with fish & giant Green Sea Turtles.

Sunset fish & sea Turtle lagoon walk. (On day of arrival) Queen's bath & underground lava tube swim. Amazing sunset photo trip to the top of Mauna Kea volcano. (Worlds' tallest Mtn. from its base) . Snowball fight on top anyone ? This other worldly excursion will leave you breathless. (physically & emotionally) NOTE: On our last trip we left Mauna Kea sunset & on the way back in the pitch dark we were treated to the most amazing Stars & meteor shower of a Lifetime !!
Cultural locations. Botanical gardens, Volcano Winery, Zip Lining & Hawaiian history & Festivals.
Awesome hike down into the "Valley of The Kings" & explore the Black sand beaches, waterfalls, scenic jungle river & maybe find some of the Wild Horses that roam free there. I'll show you sea caves, Sea Arches, The unique lava Elevator pools, & the 4000 ft. Cloud Forest Coffee farm & tour. Cool old farmer's markets, old Hawaiian Art towns, & shopping Historical sights & so much more.
Note: This is not a sit on the beach with a Mai Tai tour. But we will be on great beaches. If you get tired; you may stay back & chill out at the pool or beach.
Our private(Hawaiian Style) Villa/home is private & gated with ocean view at about 1300 ft. No AC needed. There will be room sharing with several different bedrooms. The best part are the 4 unique Jungle outdoor showers attached to the corner units of the home.
**Also Hoping to have one of our great private chefs with us again.
**This trip is all inclusive except for maybe one evening out for dinner & airfare purchase. Snorkel gear is also included.

More info & what to bring later.

Hocking Hills Rock Challenge
description:
Join Explorer Chick for an Exclusive, Women-Only Rock Challenge Adventure in Hocking Hills!

You’ll experience first hand a variety of challenges including narrow rock halls, tight squeezes, bouldering style climbs and much more!

You’ll be greeted at beautiful High Rock House by your Explorer Chick Ambassador. Then your guide will run through a safety briefing and tour instructions. After gearing up, we’ll head out!

On your way to the Rock Challenge, your guide will share interesting tidbits about native plants, trees and the geology that makes Hocking Hills so stunning! 🍂🌲

You will be guided through each crawl, under and between these giant rocks!

You will be doing many mini climbs and rappels without the need of a harness!

No experience?! No worries!! This is a perfect event to get your toes wet and wanting more! The Rock
Challenge is less physically demanding than rock climbing, nothing else in Hocking Hills like it!

• Get the rock climbing experience with a little less physical demands than the Rock Climbing 101
• You’ll experience all the excitement, just closer to the ground!
• Narrow rock halls and tight squeezes
• Bouldering style challenges
• Tight crawls under and between giant rocks
• Ascents and Descents
• Mini climbs and rappels without the need of a harness!
• Learn about the native plants and geology of Hocking Hills
• Exclusive and Private Explorer Chick, small group, women only tour. Embark on your adventure with an encouraging and supportive group of Badass women!

10 UNIQUE CHALLENGES:
• Conquer several challenges utilizing stationary ropes and webbing for on-ground climbs (bouldering and scrambling) between mammoth rock outcroppings.
• You will have to squeeze through tight rock narrows. There will be at least two crawls through small tunnels in and between giant sandstone boulders and rocks.
• Enjoy shared knowledge of the local plants and trees as you are hiking through the trails.
• You will also cross the Sky Bridges between towering cliffs.
• Challenge yourself and ascend to the top of High Rock for a panoramic view of the Hocking River Valley!
• EQUIPMENT PROVIDED: A helmet is provided for this tour.
• INSTRUCTION: No experience necessary, there will be a safety briefing and two guides will lead you through each challenge, offering tips throughout to make your adventure the best it can be!

• Weight limit for climbing and rappels is 275lbs. Applies for safety.
• Check-in Time: 30 minutes prior to departure
• Duration: 3 Hours
• Women-Only, 21+

*Explorer Chick and its partners reserve the option to modify trip itineraries at the discretion of your tour director as necessary due to weather, conditions, illness, injury, group dynamics, or other unforeseen incidents.

*Tipping your Guides is optional and not included in the price of your adventure. Gratuities may be given to one leader—the team divides tips among themselves after the trip. We recommend 10-20%.

Why aren’t Guide gratuities included in the trip price? Allowing Guides to accept tips is customary in the tour industry and for good reason. Explorer Chicks enjoy the opportunity to recognize their Guides personally for their hard work and keeping them safe

See website for full details and to book.

name: Hocking Hills Rappelling 101
description:
Join Explorer Chick for an Exclusive, Women-Only Rappelling 101 Mini Adventure in Hocking Hills!

You’ll experience 3 rappels ranging from 35 up to 100 feet in a variety of formations including flatwall, canyon, and an overhang!

You’ll be greeted at beautiful High Rock House by your Explorer Chick Ambassador. Then your rappelling guide will run through a safety briefing and tour instructions. After gearing up, we’ll head out!

On your way to the rappelling areas, your guide will share interesting tidbits about native plants, trees and the geology that make the Hocking Hills so stunning.

At each rappel, your guides will instruct you as you lower yourself down the rock face!
With rappels beginning at 35 ft and up to nearly 100 ft, this tour is a great blend of nature and adrenaline!

No experience?! No worries!! This is a perfect event to get your toes wet and wanting more! Rappelling is less physically demanding than rock climbing, but doesn’t sacrifice any excitement!

• Get a taste of outdoor rappelling surrounded by the natural beauty of Hocking Hills
• You’ll experience three different types of rappels: flat wall, canyon and a large overhang.
• Average of 3 rappels of 35 to 100 feet
• Learn about the native plants and geology of Hocking Hills
• Exclusive and Private Explorer Chick, small group, women only tour. Embark on your adventure with an encouraging and supportive group of Badass women!
• Rappelling for all skill levels – on average 3 rappels of 35 to 90+ feet
• All equipment is provided including a harness, helmet, climbing devices
• Instruction – No experience necessary, two expert Guides: one top side and one below will walk you through your rappell and offer tips throughout to make your adventure the best it can be!

• Weight limit for climbing and rappels is 275lbs. applies for safety

name: Georgia Aquarium Under the Sea Slumber Party
description:
Explorer Chick has partnered with the Georgia Aquarium for a Women-Only Exclusive Under the Sea Slumber Party!

That's right! You will spend an entire evening surrounded by the magical wonders under the ocean. Your evening starts with a Happy Hour that includes a $20 voucher to spend on food, beverages or cocktails. The social hour is the perfect time to get to know other Explorer Chicks.🍷

Afterwards, we'll turn it over to the Aquarium staff who will preview what's in store and all the exciting highlights. Then it's on to a privately guided, behind the scenes tour of the aquarium. You'll get an intimate look at life at the aquarium and the inner workings of the caretakers.
You'll see many of the aquarium's treasures including the biggest fish in the sea - whale sharks!

As the evening comes to an end, you'll fall asleep in front of a magnificent aquarium gallery. The next morning will begin with a continental breakfast and then you are invited to enjoy the Aquarium on your own.

You can also opt to add on an Animal Encounter! It's an opportunity to get up close with some of the Aquarium's most lovable creatures! (You'll have the option to add on at the time of booking!)

• Escape to an Under Water Wonderland as soon as you walk through the doors!
• Tour behind the scenes of the aquarium.
• Enjoy the quiet and tranquility of the aquarium after hours
• Meet other Explorer Chicks during social hour with drinks and food
• Customized encounters throughout the aquarium with our private Explorer Chick group
• Continental breakfast with free admission to the aquarium the following day
• Fall asleep in front of one of the aquarium's many sea life galleries
• Optional to add on an Animal Encounter with Penguins, Otters, Seals, Dolphins, or Beluga Whales
• Exclusive and Private Explorer Chick, small group, women only tour. Embark on your adventure with an encouraging and supportive group of Badass women!

What’ Included:
• Georgia Aquarium admission with a prompt 6:30 pm entry time
• $20 food/drink voucher for the Cafe'
• Next-day entry into the 4D FUNBelievable Theater
• Next-day entry into SunTrust Pier 225: Under the Boardwalk, featuring our California sea lions*
• Next-day entry into AT&T Dolphin Celebration in the AT&T Dolphin Tales Theater*
• Guided Activities
• Gallery and Backstage Tours
• Evening Snacks and Hot Breakfast
• Sleeping mat
• Optional Add on's for the day of departure for the Animal Encounters at Member's Only Prices!
Waiver(s)
• Your order Confirmation will include a link to the Explorer Chick Smart Waiver. Please take a minute to sign online.
• Print and bring your Georgia Aquarium Waiver with you please!
The secret is to pack light.
You'll be provided a sleeping mat, but you might want to consider bringing:
• Sleeping bags
• Blankets
• Pillows
• Sweater or hoodie
• PJ’s
• Toothbrush and other small toiletries
• Ear plugs/eye mask
• Battery powered phone charger

*These presentations do not take place during your scheduled sleepover adventure, rather afterward. Presentation times may vary. All seating is first come, first serve and may be limited
*All specific animal encounters are not guaranteed. Please keep in mind they are wild animals, some may be on exhibit while some are resting indoors.

name: Northern Lights Winter Iceland Adventure
description:
See the Northern Lights in Iceland while embarking on incredible multisport adventures on our Women Only, Small Group Tour in Iceland. The cold winter days won’t keep us indoors! Instead, you’ll go to the world of Fire and Ice to venture out on experiences unique to Iceland’s cold winter temperatures.

Four of your nights will be spent in remote guest houses away from big city lights to increase your chances of catching the dancing green beams. We even planned your trip around the New Moon phase so the Icelandic sky will be at its darkest. Every night your eyes will be cast to the skies to spot Aurora Borealis.

We’ll make the most of every ounce of daylight. You’ll wander inside an enchanting ice cave with it’s vibrant blue hues. You’ll strap on crampons and grab an ice axe to traverse a glacier and ice climb. You’ll search for seals as you kayak along the sea coast. You’ll soak in a hot springs wearing your favorite beanie at the end of a 45 minute winter hike. You’ll tour the famous sites of the Golden Circle. You’ll re-energize in the soothing waters of the Blue Lagoon. You’ll see the iconic sights of Iceland’s south coast including icy waterfalls, black sand beaches, mountains, and glaciers!

Adventure Highlights:

• Chase the Northern Lights in Iceland staying in remote accommodations and traveling during the dark skies of the New Moon phase.
• Explore an enchanting glacial Ice Cave that can only be accessed during the cold winter months.
• Walk and Ice Climb on Sólheimajökull Glacier with all technical gear provided.
• Hike 45 minutes into the wintery wilderness to relax in a natural hot spring.
• Kayak along the scenic coast of Stokkseyri searching for seals.
• Soak in the geothermal waters of the Blue Lagoon and soften your skin with a silica face mask.
• Tour the three destinations that comprise the famous Golden Circle – Þingvellir National Park, Geysir, and Gullfoss.
• Enjoy the iconic sights of Iceland’s southern coast including Skógarfoss Waterfall, Dyrhólaey, Glacier Lagoon, and Seljalandsfoss with private transportation.
• Embark on your adventure with an encouraging and supportive group of Bad Ass women! – Private Explorer Chick, small group, women only tour.

See website for full details and to book.

name: Michigan's UP Frozen Adventure
description:
Discover the thrill of dogsledding, ice climbing, snowshoeing to towering frozen waterfalls, and visiting sparkling ice caves on our Women Only, Small Group Winter Adventure to Michigan's Upper Peninsula.
Your first 3 days will be spent experiencing winter like never before. You'll learn to ice climb in Pictured Rocks National Lakeshore, snowshoe to unforgettable frozen waterfalls, and explore mysterious ice caves. You'll experience the best outdoor adventures of Michigan's Upper Peninsula while unwinding each day at a warm and cozy lakeside lodge.
On our final 2 days you'll pack an overnight bag and meet your own team of sled dogs. After learning about your dogsled team and how to mush, you and your sled dog team will mush 20 miles to an exclusive backcountry yurt and cabin where you'll spend the night. Your sled dogs are depending on you to feed them, cuddle them, and help them get settled into bed. On our final morning, we'll mush back to the kennel and say goodbye to our new furry friends and before bidding farewell to our new found friends.

Adventure Highlights:
• Mush your own dogsled team to an Explorer Chick Exclusive backcountry cabin and yurt
• Ice Climb and explore Pictured Rocks National Lakeshore as you learn to climb frozen waterfalls and ice columns
• Navigate by snowshoe to frozen waterfalls and through ice caves
• Experience the best of Michigan's Upper Peninsula while spending your days exploring winter phenomena unique to extreme climates
• Enjoy a private Explorer Chick backcountry cabin and yurt complete with a sauna, backcountry meals and a warm bed
• Private Explorer Chick, small group, women only tour. Embark on your adventure with an encouraging and supportive group of Bad Ass women!

Early Bird Discount: $300

name: West Virginia Winter Adventure
description:
Immerse yourself in West Virginia’s Canaan Valley white wonderland while discovering the allure of cross country skiing to mountain vistas and snowshoeing to frozen waterfalls on our Women Only, Small Group Winter Trip.
Each day of our mountainous adventure in West Virginia will be spent exploring the winter wonderland Canaan Valley is known for. We’ll strap on snowshoes to navigate through snow-laden trees and along frozen rivers in Blackwater Falls State Park while discovering frozen ice columns and waterfalls. We’ll spend a day learning how to cross-country ski through frozen landscapes and to white landscaped mountain vistas. Every day of our adventure will be filled with outdoor actives where we’ll embrace the winter weather and won’t want to stay indoors!
Our winter adventure in Canaan Valley is based out of a comfortable State Park Lodge where we’ll wind down each evening relishing in the day’s adventures.

Adventure Highlights:
• Enjoy West Virginia’s mountainous Canaan Valley while experiencing the best winter sports in the East!
• Navigate through snowy landscapes by snowshoe to frozen waterfalls, ice curtains, and rivers in Blackwater Falls State Park
• Learn to cross-country ski enjoying a variety of terrain and elevation with over 1,200 feet of vertical rise and over 60 km of cross-country ski trails
• Slow down with relaxing evenings in the colorful towns of Thomas and Davis, WV as we enjoy local eateries, live music, and microbreweries.
• Spend each night in a comfortable, State Park lodge with views of Blackwater Gorge
• Private Explorer Chick, small group, women only tour. Embark on your adventure with an encouraging and supportive group of Bad Ass women!

name: Banff Winter Wanderland Adventure
description:
Explore the Winter Wanderland of the Canadian Rockies, Banff National Park, and Jasper National Park with our Small Group, Women-only Trip to Canada.

You’ll escape to a snowy wonderland enjoying the best of two of Canada’s National Parks: Banff and Jasper. Depending on trail and avalanche conditions, you’ll experience some of Canada’s other outdoor gems!

You’ll drive a Dog Sled with the snowy back drop of the Canadian Rockies! You’ll have a hands-on experience assisting the guides in harnessing the dogs and setting up your team. Each sled is shared with equal opportunities to drive the sleds. You’ll enjoy a backcountry lunch warming up next to a campfire while learning more about the role of dog sleds in the Bow Valley.

You’ll ride a Snowcat up Fortress Mountain for some serious backcountry Snowshoeing. You’ll be trekking at treeline with wide open views of the surrounding mountains. Some of those landscapes you might recognize from The Reverent (We’ll skip the Grizzly scene!), Inception, and The Bourne Legacy. It’ll be a full, long day of playing in the snow, but we’ll recharge with a hot backcountry lunch, hot cocoa, and cookies!

You’ll strap on ice cleats and hike one of Banff National Park’s most popular trails into the frozen Johnson Canyon.You’ll trek along trail and catwalks peering into the gorge below. After a short hike, you’ll reach the steep walls of frozen waterfalls. Chances are you’ll see ice climbers picking their way up – a preview of your adventure in Jasper National Park.

You’ll experience Canada’s favorite past time: Curling! We’ll have a private lesson learning about curling and experiencing the excitement of sweeping our brooms to control the speed and direction of our stone across the sheet into the house. Adult beverages will be available at the cash bar for purchase.

You’ll traverse the snowy Canadian Rocky landscapes on Cross Country Skis. We’ll start our full day adventure with a lesson learning how to maneuver ourselves with long planks attached to our feet. Once we have the hang of it, we’ll venture out into the wilderness to enjoy the solitude of the trail.

You’ll tour one of the world’s most scenic drives: The Icefields Parkway. We’ll travel the 145 mile stretch of double-lane highway winding along the Continental Divide from Lake Louise up to Jasper. We’ll make frequent stops to enjoy the many highlights including frozen waterfalls, glaciers, and soaring rocky mountain peaks.

You’ll ice climb frozen waterfalls in Jasper National Park. It’s a matter of finding your rhythm and trusting the spikes on your crampons to top out each problem. You’ll have an immersive lesson and experience with our guides in ice climbing. We’ll have multiple ropes set up, so everyone will learn to belay and try out different routes.

Phew! We’ve also worked in some free time for you to explore the town of Banff, enjoy the solitude of your Jasper Lodge, or relax in the Upper Banff Hot Springs.

ADVENTURE HIGHLIGHTS
• Experience two of Canada’s most popular National Parks in the winter: Banff and Jasper.
• Drive a dog sled surrounded by snowy rock mountain peaks.
• Ride a snowcat deep into the backcountry for a full day of Snowshoeing on Fortress Mountain.
• Explore the frozen and famous Johnson Canyon of Banff National Park.
• Learn how and play Canada’s favorite pastime: Curling!
• Traverse the trails enjoying the quiet serenity of a snowy landscape on Cross Country Skis.
• Tour and explore the incredibly scenic Icefields Parkway.
• Ice Climb frozen waterfalls in Jasper National Park.

name: Baja Out to Sea Adventure
description:
Experience Baja, Mexico like no one else aboard a privately chartered boat! Spend your days playing at sea with Whale Sharks and sea lions and your evenings fast asleep in your bunk anchored in the Sea of Cortez on this women only, small group active Baja Mexico Adventure!

Your time in Baja will be jam packed with only the best in adventure! You’ll swim with playful sea lions. You’ll come face to face with the largest known fish, the whale shark! You’ll learn to breathe under water with a Discover Scuba Diving day. Already a certified Scuba Diver? Fantastic! There will be equipment available for you to borrow.

Yes, there’s more! You’ll learn how to surf off the shores of Todos Santos. You’ll leave behind the equipment learning the technique to dive naturally and become a Level 1 Certified Free Diver. You’ll take to land to hike and explore the natural pools in the Sierra de Laguna. Phew.

You’ll spend 6 days/5 nights aboard our privately chartered boat exploring Isla Espíritu Santo National Park and it’s neighboring islands in the Sea of Cortez. Each night, you’ll fall asleep to the silence and tranquility anchored in a bay under a star filled sky. You’ll spend your final night camping at Huertas Los Mangos in Santiago fully equipped with all of your basic camping needs including a lively happy hour around the campfire.

Adventure Highlights:
• A surf lesson off the shores of the adorable, bohemian town of Todos Santos.
• Search for and snorkel with Whale Sharks in the bay of La Paz.
• Give Scuba Diving a try without the full commitment with a Discover Scuba Diving Day.
• Ditch the equipment and earn your AIDA 1 in Freedviving.
• Snorkel with the fun and playful sea lions of Los Islotes.
• Explore the sea caves and beaches of Baja California.
• Hike the Sierra de Laguna discovering natural swimming holes.
• Enjoy the tranquility and solace of the sea.
• Free range use of on-board water equipment aboard our private vessel including kayaks and snorkel gear.
• Live a life at sea aboard a privately chartered boat with a small group of women-only Explorer Chicks.
• Enjoy an evening of camping under the stars around a bonfire with a happy hour and authentic Mexican dinner.
• Meals – All of your meals are included from Lunch on Day 1 through Lunch on Day 7.

name: Dominican Republic Tropical Adventure
description:
Discover the “Real” Dominican Republic on our multi-sport,Women Only, Small Group Adventure Tour to Cabarete. Explore the lush jungles, the sandy beaches, the dramatic mountains, the friendly culture, and the farm-to-table fresh authentic food during your 8 day trip to this tropical paradise along the north shore of Hispaniola island.

You’ll soon find that the Dominican Republic is more than All-inclusive resorts, but a mecca for adventure! You’ll travel to the countryside before hiking down into a river canyon to trek and leap from waterfalls. You’ll play in the ocean learning how to surf at Encuentro Beach. You’ll fly like an acrobat swinging from a trapeze set against a beautiful sunset. You’ll enjoy the unexpected mountain air when you whitewater raft. You’ll tour the organic farm where your included meals are sourced before hopping in a tube for a relaxing float down the river.

Every day you’ll find your body being built into a better, stronger, version of itself through playing in the outdoors. But, you’ll also have access to evening Functional Fitness classes in a tiki hut (our gym in paradise!). To balance out your epic adventures, you’ll be able to treat your body to yoga practices in a loft overlooking the ocean. No music is necessary as the the crashing waves will be the perfect back drop. Of course, you always have the option of winding down your evening with Happy Hour Mojitos watching the sunset from the beachfront bar!

ADVENTURE HIGHLIGHTS
• Beach to Ocean Surf Lesson at Encuentro Beach
• Ciguapa Falls canyoning, river trekking, and waterfall jumping
• Flying on a Trapeze
• White Water Rafting in the mountains of Jarabacoa
• Organic farm tour including a picnic lunch sourced directly from the farm
• Relaxing River float with an ice cold, Presidente in hand
• Functional fitness classes in a tiki hut
• Yoga practices in a loft overlooking the ocean
• Accommodations in a beachfront Eco-Hotel with wi-fi, a pool, and a restaurant/bar.
• Meals ~ All dinners and breakfasts included from time of arrival to departure and lunches where indicated above.

name: Vegas Vacation
description:
Discover Las Vegas, Nevada and the surrounding desert landscape in a whole new way with our women-only, small group adventure!
It's Vegas Explorer Chick style, baby! You'll spend a full day rock climbing in Red Rock Canyon, experience the glamour of Las Vegas in a 4 star Downtown Hotel, spend 2 days on an overnight kayak adventure through Black Canyon and soak your muscles in natural hot springs before bed on this women-only, small group adventure!
Your Vegas Vacation will begin at a 4 star Downtown Las Vegas Hotel and Casino. We'll enjoy the glamour of Freemont Street for 2 nights. But, we'll venture away from the crowds to spend a full day rock climbing and exploring the vertical sandstone walls of Red Rock Canyon National Conservation Area.
On day 3, you'll leave behind the city streets for the backcountry. Exchange the Vegas Neons for the Starry Skies. With our overnight belongings packed into a dry bag, we'll launch kayaks near the Hoover Dam to begin a 12 mile paddling journey through the Black Canyon on the Lower Colorado River. We'll be kayaking along "moving flat water" that is perfect for a relaxing trip. Along the way, we'll make frequent stops to areas only accessible by watercraft - natural hot springs, slot canyons, a natural sauna, Emerald Cave with gorgeous green water, historical sites, and ruins. We'll camp on the shore trading our luxurious hotel bed for a comfortable tent and cozy sleeping bag.
This adventure is for Explorer Chicks who love to experience multiple adventures, don’t mind trading their bed for a warm sleeping bag, and enjoy the best of both worlds - city life and outdoor adventure!

Adventure Highlights:
● Experience the shine and sparkle of Las Vegas while exploring the best outdoor activities in the surrounding areas!
● Explore the Lower Colorado River by spending 2 days kayaking through Black Canyon stopping at natural hot springs, a natural sauna, Emerald Cave, historical ruins, slot canyons and more
● Spend a full day learning to rock climb in Red Rock Canyon with the intensity level as high or low as you'd like.
● Enjoy the glamor of a 4 Star Hotel in Downtown Las Vegas including a variety of restaurants, luxurious pools, casinos, attractions, and more within a convenient walking distance.
● Spend one night backcountry camping in a beautiful location deep in the heart of Black Canyon
● Private Explorer Chick, small group, women only tour. Embark on your adventure with an encouraging and supportive group of Bad Ass women!

name: Havasu Falls Backpacking Adventure
description:
Discover the turquoise waters of the iconic Havasupai Waterfalls in the Grand Canyon while camping along Havasu Creek on our 5 day, Women-only Backpacking Adventure.
Escape the hustle and bustle of daily life and reconnect. To reach the oasis in the desert you’ll pack 4 days of gear into your backpack and hike 10 miles to our basecamp. Along the way, you’ll hike through the dusty desert canyons and washes of the Grand Canyon. You’ll trek thought the Supai village, the most remote village in the United States.
Your next few days will be spent exploring the spectacular waterfalls including Mooney Falls, Beaver Falls, Rock Falls, and Navajo Falls from our convenient basecamp. Water temperatures at Havasu Falls remain at a fairly constant 70 degrees – perfect for a post hike dip. Every night, you’ll wind down with a home cooked backcountry meal from our guides and recount the day’s adventure before falling fast asleep in your shared tent.
This adventure is for Explorer Chicks who love a good challenge, don’t mind trading their bed for a cozy sleeping bag, and basking in the beauty of turquoise waterfalls you won’t find anywhere else.

Adventure Highlights:
● Spend 4 days/3 nights exploring Havasu Falls including Mooney Falls, Beaver Falls, Rock Falls, and Navajo Falls from our convenient basecamp in the Grand Canyon.
● Hike through and visit the village of Supai, the most remote village in the USA!
● Enjoy a rugged experience reaching the oasis by foot and carrying all of your gear for the next few days.
● Disconnect to reconnect! Leave behind the constant contact and use your phone solely for capturing moments.
● Simply show up to a fully-planned backpacking trip. We’ll take care of the rest including snagging the nearly impossible to obtain permits.
● Private Explorer Chick, small group, women only tour. Embark on your adventure with an encouraging and supportive group of Bad Ass women!

name: Adventure to Machu Picchu with Rainbow Mountain Trek
description:
Adventure to Machu Picchu and trek to Rainbow Mountain with our Women Only, Small Group Adventure Tour in Peru. You’ll spend 4 days on a Multi-Sport journey to Machu Picchu including Hiking, Mountain Biking, White Water Rafting, and Zip-lining. Prior to your journey, you’ll spend 2 days acclimatizing in Cusco and the Sacred Valley. You will also embark on a single day hiking tour to Rainbow Mountain.

During the first part of your adventure you’ll explore the ancient ruins, landmarks, and museums of Cusco and the Sacred Valley with Explorer Chick on private tours while acclimatizing. Sites to see include Cusco Cathedral, Qoricancha, and Sacsayhuaman.

On Day 3, it’s an epic and challenging day of hiking to Rainbow Mountain. You’ll go deep into the spectacular painted hills, also known as Vinicunca. Rainbow Mountain is an unexplored land filled with snow-covered glaciated peaks, wildly desert landscapes, herds of alpaca, and immaculate beauty.

You’ll start your Multi-Sport journey to Machu Picchu on Day 4 with a string of exciting adventures. To reach the sacred site, you’ll first hike the scenic Salkantay Trail surrounded by snowcapped mountains. You’ll then mountain bike to a coffee farm to learn from local farmers. Next is an exciting white water rafting trip down the Urubamba river. You’ll sooth sore muscles and relax in crystal clear hot springs. You’ll zip between mountains and over canyons. Finally, you’ll hike the Inca trail to Aguas Calientes, before a full day of exploring Machu Picchu and climbing Machu Picchu Mountain.

Adventure Highlights:

• Journey to Machu Picchu over 4 days by multi sport adventures with exclusive and private Explorer Chick tours with local Peruvian guides.
• Hike the scenic Salkantay Trail. Mountain Bike to a Peruvian coffee farm. White Water Raft the Urubamba River. Soak in natural hot springs. Zipline in the mountains across canyons.
• Embark on the challenging trek to see the vibrant colors of Rainbow Mountain.
• Immerse yourself in two days of Peruvian culture while acclimatizing to the higher altitudes. Enjoy the sites and sounds of Cusco and the Sacred Valley. Learn Peruvian and Incan history with several private tours to the must see sites including Cusco Cathedral, Qoricancha, and Sacsayhuaman.
• Exclusive and Private Explorer Chick, small group, women only tour. Embark on your adventure with an encouraging and supportive group of Badass women!

See website for full details and to book.

name: Iconic Inca Trail Trek
description:
Hike the iconic Inca Trail to Machu Picchu with our Women Only, Small Group Adventure Tour in Peru. You’ll spend 4 days and 3 nights trekking the classic route to reach Machu Picchu via the Sun Gate. Prior to your trek, you’ll spend 3 days acclimatizing in Cusco and the Sacred Valley.

During the first part of your adventure you’ll explore the ancient ruins, landmarks, and museums of Cusco and the Sacred Valley with Explorer Chick on private tours. Sites to see include Cusco Cathedral, Qoricancha, and Sacsayhuaman. You’ll visit the famous Maras Salt Pans and Moray Inca site learning about the experimental agricultural techniques. You’ll be immersed in ancient Incan culture with a visit to a village learning about weaving techniques, sharing a meal, and touring homes.

You’ll start your iconic journey on the Inca Trail on Day 4 following in the footsteps of the Inca and their holy pilgrimage to Machu Picchu. The next 4 days and three nights will be spent trekking up and over mountain passes, through breath taking valleys, and enjoying the stunning scenery. The historical significance and beauty of the route make it the most popular. However, we hike a bit further on our first trekking day to create space between ourselves and the majority of groups.

You’ll enjoy Deluxe camping on the trail sleeping 2 per 4 person tent, eating in dining tents, and enjoying private toilets and showers. Porters and professional chefs will aid our group along the trail assisting with gear and set up allowing you to exhale, free your mind, and take in the challenging and sacred journey.

Peru strictly limits the number of travelers on the Inca Trail per departure day. PERMITS WILL SELL OUT for your date.

Book your spot ASAP.

You must have your Passport to book. If you do not have your passport, please send us an email ([masked]). We can temporarily secure your permit with your license.

Explorer Chick will secure your Inca Trail Permits as soon as our Trip Minimum is met.

After the minimum is met, we secure permits as soon as we receive a new booking and deposit. We will do this until the permits are sold out.

Permits cannot be transferred to a different date or person.

ADVENTURE HIGHLIGHTS
• Trek the Famous Inca Trail over 4 days on an exclusive and private Explorer Chick tour with local Peruvian guides.
• Climb three mountain passes including Dead Woman’s Pass and descend into valleys with a panoramic view of snow capped mountains before entering the Sun Gate to reach Machu Picchu.
• Enjoy deluxe camping, a professional chef, porters, private group dining tent, chairs, toilets, and hot shower on the Inca Trail. You’ll have a lightened load carrying only your day’s needs in a day pack.
• Three days of acclimatizing while enjoying the sites and sounds of Cusco and the Sacred Valley. Learn Peruvian and Incan history with several private tours to the must see sites including Cusco Cathedral, Qoricancha, and Sacsayhuaman.
• Set your sights on and learn agricultural techniques at the famous Maras Salt Pans and Moray Inca site.
• Immerse yourself in Incan culture learning about ancient weaving techniques and purchasing tapestries from locals to take home.
• Exclusive and Private Explorer Chick, small group, women only tour. Embark on your adventure with an encouraging and supportive group of Badass women!
• Optional Extension: Embark on the challenging trek to see the vibrant colors of Rainbow Mountain.
