name: Patagonia Trekking Adventure
description:
Discover the massive glaciers and towering mountains of Patagonia in Torres del Paine National Park on this Women-Only, 10 Day Trekking Adventure.
Patagonia. The place, not the retail company. Simply looking at photos of this magnificent landscape makes one's heart flutter like seeing an 8th grade crush catch your eye at the school dance. The Patagonian landscape is unlike anything else in the world. Nestled near the southern tip of South America, we'll explore the incredible Torres del Paine National Park on this 10 day trekking adventure experiencing the best glaciers, mountains, cirques, alpine lakes and valleys Patagonia has to offer.
After meeting your crew of fellow Explorer Chicks in Punta Arenas, we'll travel 5 hours to Torres del Paine National Park where the real adventure begins. You'll spend 6 days and 5 nights hiking the entire Paine Massif Round trek on a fully portaged trip (all camping gear will be carried for you)! We'll spend our days hiking to remote alpine lakes, kayaking among massive icebergs and near the towering Grey Glacier, waking up to views of the Southern Patagonian Ice Field, going to sleep with turquoise lakes a few hundred steps away and basking in the shadows of the jagged mountains that Patagonia is known for.
On the final two nights of our adventure, we'll reward ourselves by lodging in the world's first Geodesic Dome Hotel as we feast on gourmet Chilean cuisine and hike to the infamous "Base of the Towers".
This adventure is for Explorer Chicks who love a good challenge, don’t mind trading their bed for a cozy sleeping bag, and crave the beauty that is unique only to Patagonia.

Intro paragraph

• Adventure Highlights:
• Spend 6 days trekking through Torres del Paine National Park experiencing parts of the backcountry that is only accessible by your own two feet with your private Explorer Chick group and local Chilean Guide(s).
• Trek the infamous "Towers Hike" to view jagged peaks and turquoise alpine lakes.
• Marvel at Grey Glacier as you get up close and personal by kayaking across Grey Lake while navigating floating icebergs.
• Complete the entire Paine Massif Round Trek - You'll hike up and down John Gardner Pass as you view Grey Glacier from a birds eye view, experience Dickson Glacier in a serene, backcountry setting, and fall asleep every night to views you won't find anywhere else in the world.
• Enjoy 3 nights in the World's first Geodesic Dome Hotel in Torres del Paine National Park.
• Exclusive and Private Explorer Chick, small group, women only tour. Embark on your adventure with an encouraging and supportive group of Badass women!

name: SUPREME COURT TO RULE ON GERRYMANDERING; Act Now
description:
SUPREME COURT TO RULE ON GERRYMANDERING: Join the campaign against rigged elections to control Congress. AwareCitizens.org/gerrymandering.html
In the first days of July 2017, the U. S. Supreme Court threw out North Carolina’s congressional district maps because the State legislature had packed two districts with an overwhelming majority of Afro-Americans to dilute minority influence in other districts. The gimmick contributed to guarantee control of one party over most districts. The Court ruled that: "A state may not use race as the predominant factor in drawing district lines, unless it has a compelling reason."
Now the Court must address the issue of political gerrymandering, the manipulation of boundaries with the purpose of guaranteeing control not based on race but on partisanship.
Judges do not live in a vacuum. Prevailing social convictions and tendencies do influence their decisions. Having ruled against racial gerrymandering as near as the first week of July, there is a real opportunity that the despicable practice of gerrymandering be dealt with once and for all.
At the same time, we must campaign for legislation against gerrymandering. Reagan and Obama both came out against it.
Let your voice be heard against gerrymandering, wherever it may come from. Sign the petition at AwareCitizens.org/gerrymandering.html
NOTE: Do not RSVP this activity as it will not count as an endorsement of the petition. You must visit AwareCitizens.org/gerrymandering.html

name: Women's March Huddle hosted by SF Resist and Rise
description:
SF Resist and Rise, formerly Momentum, is a group of about 47, based in North Beach. We have a Facebook page and a website listing weekly actions to take and an events calendar that are available to people after they have attended one meeting. During meetings we drink wine and eat goodies. We sign petitions, write letters and postcards, make phone calls, register voters, march and rally together. We will be fundraising and travelling to swing counties and states nearer the 2018 elections. We offer companionship and support as well as guidance on just what to do during these trying times.

Not all members are Meet-up members so the attendance numbers listed on Meet-up are never correct.

VISIT sfresistandrise.org

"Huddles are part of the 10 Actions for the First 100 Days campaign, which launched at the Women’s March, and will mobilize millions to win back the country and world we want.

We’ll visualize what a more equitable, democratic, safe and free world could look like four years from now -- and we’ll work backwards to figure out what we need to do, starting today, to get there. Huddles are meant to be inclusive, action-oriented, productive, and grounded in the tradition of nonviolent resistance."

description:
Documentary filmmaking 101 will take you through the nuts and bolts of digital documentary filmmaking. From conceiving of your idea to producing your story. This workshop is optimal for those who have always wanted to make a short documentary-style film but lack formal training. In this class, you will learn how to find a story you are passionate about and use film as a way of exploring it in further depth. You will learn the basics of composition, lighting, and sound as it applies to any camera including your iPhone. At the end of this 5 session course, you will have enough material to produce a 3-5 minute film.

name: Register today for PH201, More Magic in the Darkroom : Black and White Level 2
description:
Register here: www.ccsf.edu/contined

Class Fee: $250
Dates: 11/14/18-12/19/18
Day: Wednesdays
Time: 6:00pm-9:00pm
Number of meetings: 6
Location: Fort Mason, Bldg B
Rm: 106

Instructor Barry Umstead

This Saturday workshop is designed for people with basic darkroom skills who are looking to hone those skills and learn new darkroom techniques that can improve the quality of their printed photographs.

Much of what separates traditional, wet darkroom B&W photography and digital B&W work can be found in the quality of the actual prints. Digital B&W prints don’t yet approach the downright scrumptiousness of a great print by a master such as Ansel Adams, Ruth Bernhard, or Edwin Weston. While you may not get to that level by the end of a six-week class, the goal is to get you closer to it.

The emphasis of the workshop will be on each student creating a new body of work comprised of images that are related in a meaningful way. We will be in the darkroom printing each session and new techniques such as split-filter printing, bleaching, or flashing will be introduced. Come help the silver tradition not just survive, but thrive in the age of pixels!

Students will be able to print 35mm, 645, or 6x6 negatives

PRE-REQ: Recent darkroom experience. At the minimum, students should be able to process film and make a print in a darkroom on their own.

BRING TO FIRST CLASS: B&W negatives and Fiber photo paper

name: Wednesday Night Drop-in Improv Class
description:
Register for your seat here: http://momentimprov.com/dropins/

Just so ya know... Every drop-in class has at least 7-10 participants no matter what the meetup says. If you are coming, please let others know by marking yourself as attending on the Meetup group also. Remember to grab your seat by registering on Eventbrite as soon as possible to ensure you will get in on the fun. You MUST register for this event on Eventbrite. Only people with valid registration will be allowed to attend.

Class Description:
Imagine if you could have more control over your life, be more confident and have greater peace when you don’t? What if you could learn how to do this in a supportive community that has your back? What if you could learn these skills through laughter, joy, and play?

You can have all of this and more, through the practice of improv.

At Moment Improv we believe in creating a community of supportive artists. We believe that anyone can improvise, because you already do it every day. We believe humans have the capacity to be more present, more empathetic, closer, have more fun, and can live their lives to the fullest when they believe in themselves. We believe that people can believe in themselves and their choices with confidence and live their lives with greatness while positively effecting those around them.

We teach improv to humans so they can feel more comfortable in their own skin.
We teach improv to actors so they can feel confident in their choices.
We teach Improv to improvisers because improv is not a crap shoot and you can have consistently good shows.

Join us for this fun 2 hour drop-in improv session. During each class students will be met where they are at and instruction will be led by a passionate teacher that will keep the fun flowing. It is a great way to break up the monotony of the work week and to meet new people. We cater to all walks of life in this fun, inclusive, and community driven drop-in.

See what others say about Moment Improv Theatre: https://www.yelp.com/biz/moment-improv-theatre-san-francisco

Only 16 slots available per class so take the leap and drop into the moment!

***Please Note:

VERY IMPORTANT: Show up on time if not early. Each drop-in is packed with awesome and each exercise builds upon the previous. It can be difficult to jump into the middle of an exercise or class. If you do come early, it just gives you that much more time to meet new friends.

name: SF renter? - Act Now - Prevent rent hike because of interest rate pass through
description:
~~~~~~~~~~~
Following is the text from a very important email.
If you are renting in San Francisco then this is potentially one of the most important emails you will read in 2018 thus far.
~~~~~~~~~~~
As residents of San Francisco, if we do not act right now then we will all be paying fees on top of our rent before the summer.
~~~~~~~~~~~
The time to act is now.
~~~~~~~~~~~
Volunteer:
http://hrcsf.org/volunteer/
~~~~~~~~~~~
Become a member:
http://hrcsf.org/become-a-member-today/
~~~~~~~~~~~
Get counseling:
http://hrcsf.org/counseling/
~~~~~~~~~~~
~~~~~~~~~~~
Some of the text from the email sent out by http://hrcsf.org/
~~~~~~~~~~~
Last Tuesday, almost 50 Veritas tenants, tenant advocates, Supervisor Fewer, and even a candidate for supervisor in District 6 showed up at Pine and Powell Streets for a press conference to announce new legislation that would stop landlords from passing on their mortgage and property tax to tenants.

After the press conference, tenants marched and chant to the Greentree office at 724 Pine, where we entered the lobby and 634 Powell tenants read a letter requesting a meeting to negotiate all pending operating & maintenance passthroughs across the city not covered by the legislation.

I want to acknowledge all the tenants who came out and everyone who helped out for the event, including Jeanne, Tish, and Nikki who helped with the press release, Ray who made a bunch of amazing signs (see attached photos!), Fe who led us in chants, Amina who MCed, Lenea who took photos, Charles who passed out flyers and stickers, Sandi, Engin, Theo, and Ferminita who shared their stories, and many others!

I want to highlight an important thing from the event. Right before we were set to start, Veritas contacted Supervisor Peskin's office and said that if he did not attend the event, then Veritas would sit down and negotiate all pending O&M passthroughs across the city. I spoke with Sup. Peskin's office about this decision, and Sup. Peskin decided to not attend to keep that option on the table while ensuring the press conference would still continue.

That was a VICTORY for us, as it gave us new leverage to negotiate pending passthroughs for buildings that won't benefit from the legislation!

Then, the Veritas lobbyist called Supervisor Fewer and begged us to call off the march to Greentree's office. Because of organizing this action, we suddenly gained leverage. I brought the issue to the tenants who were there, and tenants voted to continue with the press conference and march.

As a result of this action, we got leverage to negotiate other buildings' pending passthroughs AND we saw what weakens Veritas: organized tenants, public action, and media exposure!

For the legislation, it was introduced that day, April 3. We are now in a 30-day waiting period before it goes to committee for a public hearing. During this time, we need to talk with our supervisors. I'm going to send a separate email tomorrow with more info on this strategy and how to get involved, but for now, if you don't know your supervisor, please click HERE to type in your address and find your district number and supervisor. That's the first step.
~~~~~~~~~~~
Link to property map: http://propertymap.sfplanning.org/
~~~~~~~~~~~

name: Wolves in The Throne Room, Behemoth, At the Gates
All About Thieves!
description:
A fun fact about Thieves: Young Living's Thieves essential oil blend was inspired by the legend of four 15th-century French thieves who formulated a special aromatic combination composed of clove, rosemary, and other botanicals they used while robbing the dead and dying.
Amazing, right?!?

Thieves blend is one of Young Living's most popular & versatile oils, so it's fantastic that they include it as part of the Premium Starter Kit! It's also the foundation of their housecleaning products, as well as personal care lines. The Thieves household cleaner, dish soap, laundry detergent, toothpaste, foaming hand soap & bar soap only scratch the surface of natural products offered!

Join me for this insightful class learning "All About Thieves". I'll share how you can easily incorporate into your daily life to the ability to use naturally to clean your home.

For those in attendance, you'll be entered to win a 1 oz. Thieves waterless hand purifier! It's definitely one of my favorites! Not only does it use powerful essential oils (HELLO, Thieves blend & Peppermint!) to help clean & purify hands naturally, but also aloe vera to help moisturize!!

Please make sure to answer the question below and provide your full name as it's required for WeWork Security. Upon arrival, please have your photo ID ready, and use the guest registration tablet at the front desk, registering as a guest of me (Kelly Tessmer).

As this location is located at the corner of California and Kearny Streets, please plan accordingly with travel time & parking (especially for those driving).

Muni: Please check the best routes at https://www.sfmta.com/.

BART: Take any BART train coming into SF. The closest station is Montgomery, which is a 10 min. walk.

Parking: There is a parking garage at the location (600 California - aceparking.com). Other options: Impark Parking (505 Montgomery St., 6 min walk), Ace Parking (17 Washington St., 6 min walk), California Parking (555 Jackson St., californiaparking.com, 6 min walk).

name: Making the Switch...Naturally!
description:
If you're curious and/or interested in making a switch to more natural products, you won't want to miss this class! This is a very eye-opening & informative class on natural living with plant-based products. I'll walk you through affordable ways to ditch the chemicals in your house and switch to nature. I'm currently going through this process in my household, and loving all of the chemical-free Young Living natural products. I can't wait for you to learn about this as well!

Make sure to go to the Environmental Working Group site (www.ewg.org) and check out the ratings of your current brand(s), along with the reason for the rating. Below I've provided a link specifically to the site's healthy cleaning guide. It really is quite shocking to learn about the brand(s) you may have been thinking were safe for you and the environment! For example, my previous brand's all-purpose cleaner is rated F, and dish soap, D!

https://www.ewg.org/guides/cleaners#.WyyTPFVKjIV

I'll also hold a giveaway for a 1 oz. sample of the beloved Thieves Household Cleaner for those in attendance! This all-purpose cleaner can be used on any surface in your home for dusting, spot cleaning, scrubbing, or any other cleaning need. Wherever you use it, you’ll feel good knowing it’s safe to use around everyone in your family, including pets.

Looking forward to sharing this knowledge with you!

description:
FLASH SALE OFFER – JUST $2,999 for an African Safari!!

-- October 20 - 27, 2018

Join members from all over on this locally guided Mid-Range Serengeti Safari & Cultural Group Tour to the Serengeti in Tanzania! (http://www.gectravel.com/details.php?record=1157)

This 8-day group safari tour will travel to the world famous Serengeti and Ngorongoro Crater National Parks where you'll see incredible amounts of zebra, wildebeest, water buffalo, gazelles, lions, cheetahs, leopards, hippos, rhinos, etc... not to mention visiting the Masai Mara Village and Bushman tribe.

Considered by many to be one of life’s great adventures, an African safari through the world famous national parks of Tanzania is a trip that simply can’t be missed. On this exciting group adventure, you will join other like-minded adventure travelers and together experience plenty of opportunities for big game viewing and to take in the vast and incredible natural attractions of Tanzania, including the world-famous Serengeti National Park and the breathtaking Ngorongoro Crater... all in the comfort of mid-range hotels, lodges and luxury tent camps.

name: CUBA:  Best of Cuba Group Tour
description:
CUBA: Group Tour Licensed and Approved for US Citizen Travel

CLICK HERE (http://www.gectravel.com/details.php?record=1228) to book your spot.

TWO DEPARTURE DATES:
-- December 1 - 9, 2018
-- February 2 - 10, 2019

We are FULLY LICENSED and Authorized by the US Government (OFAC) for US Citizen Group Travel (please note that recent govt. rule changes forbid US citizens to travel on their own or with non-US based and US Government approved companies - ONLY travel with a licensed US based company and on an approved group tour is allowed)!

Join the group as we explore the wonders of Cuba before the masses of US citizens discover its beauty on this 9-day Best of Cuba group trip. Starting and ending in Miami, we’ll explore the island in an effort to engage with the everyday person and support the people and small private businesses in Cuba. We’ll take a ride in a privately owned classic Cuban car, meet local artists and everyday Cubans, take a salsa dance lesson, learn about Cuban cuisine at a family owned restaurant, witness the beauty of Cuba’s colonial architecture and stunning landscapes, see the Bay of Pigs, visit locally run cigar and rum businesses, and so much more!

CLICK HERE (http://www.gectravel.com/details.php?record=1228) for more details and to book your spot. This trip will sell out!

name: CHAMONIX: Group Skiing Trip to the European Alps
description:
CHAMONIX: Group Skiing Trip to the European Alps

CLICK HERE (http://www.gectravel.com/details.php?record=1235) to book your spot.

The group will travel
-- January 20 - 25, 2019 (with an optional early PRE-NIGHT in Geneva Jan 19th)

Join us on an exciting ski (or snowboard) trip to the spectacularly beautiful ski town of Chamonix, France. Nestled in a steep valley with stunning views of snowcapped Mt. Blanc (Europe’s highest mountain) Chamonix is not only home to some of Europe’s best skiing, but also some of the best après-ski.

With 4 full days in Chamonix, this trip includes a 2 consecutive day pass for not only virtually all the ski areas in Chamonix, but also for the mountain train to one of Mt. Blanc’s glaciers, the tram to the top of Mt. Blanc for incredible views, and a host of other fun activities. Or take advantage of skiing the 2 days and take the other two days for sightseeing or even more skiing!

name: Bay Area Agile Coaching Circles Meeting
Free San Francisco! Town Hall Caucus Event
description:
Great news – We have a new home!

SF Liberty Coalition's monthly Town Hall Caucuses will be happening the 4th Wednesday of each month at 580 Howard Street, from 6-9pm, starting Wednesday September 26, 2018.

A big thank-you to our hosts Clickup! And thanks for your patience to everyone who's stuck around here. We look forward to seeing you in person at our premiere event. Now that we're getting going, we hope you will please help spread the word. This is for anyone you know who is working for more freedom in San Francisco on some issue, or wants to!

Like to see scooters allowed? Prostitution decriminalized? Taxes cut? Immigrant rights protected? Zoning laws repealed? Legal open hours extended? Self defense permitted? The nudity ban repealed? Tiny houses legalized? Permit fees reduced? Beach bonfires allowed? More school choice? Police abuse stopped? 6-figure City Hall salaries cut? Civil liberties of homeless people respected? More government transparency? More individual privacy?

Whatever freedom you believe in and want to fight for, we'll help you get started, provide support, and connect you with other people interested in your cause.

More details about the events and September's special feature to come...

name: Small Business Program for Aspiring Entrepreneurs - Applications open in Feb
description:
Ready to run with your small business or startup idea?

Golden Gate University’s Small Business / Entrepreneurship Program
Is a year-long program that begins with a 10-week workshop tailored to help aspiring entrepreneurs and small business owners get their plans off the ground.

The workshops will be led by experienced faculty and alumni that have their own small businesses and will include pairing with a mentor to help you realize your entrepreneurship goals.

Those admitted to the program will participate at no cost, made possible by generous support from Chevron. An application form and ability to commit to the entire program is required.

ABOUT THE PROGRAM
This year-long program includes the following:

10-Week Workshop
Covers the fundamentals of starting a practice or small business and will result in a business plan to guide your launch. The workshops will be led by experienced faculty and alumni that have their own practices / businesses, giving valuable insight and tips to start your own business.

Mentoring
Upon completion of the 10-week workshop, you will be paired with an experienced practitioner to help guide business growth, answer questions and offer advice throughout the year. Please note: mentors will only be assigned to students that have attended the entire 10-week workshop.

A Foundation for Success
The goal is for you to have launched your company by the end of the program. In addition, through other cohort members, mentors and alumni, you will have built a powerful network of support as you continue to grow your business.

Participants of the program will be expected to:
• Attend all classes, workshops and events
• Start a practice / business by the end of the year-long program (September 2019)
• Support fellow classmates
• Be a mentor in the future

TO APPLY: Application process will go live in Feb for the summer program

Class start date: Saturday, April 20, 9 am

What to bring: Yourselves and your ambition!

Meeting time: Time: 9 am – 12 pm

Where: Golden Gate University, 536 Mission Street, SF, CA 94105

Hosted by: Edward S. Ageno School of Business and Chevron

name: Divorce: Healing and Moving On- ONLINE
description:
My online group, Divorce: Healing and Moving On, focuses on envisioning what members want their lives to be like so they can move forward and create the life and relationships they want. This group will become a safe place for you to share these feelings without fear of judgment, as most group members are in a phase of trying to recreate their lives.

It can take 2-3 years to recover from divorce. You need to create a new identity, discover who you are as a single person, find a sense of belonging within your social circle and your community, and sometimes adjust to single parenthood. Change takes many forms: moving on, living separately from their partners, going through a legal process, starting to date, re-establishing a social life, or getting used to being alone.

In this online support group, you will gain strategies, learn to cope and begin to heal by relating to others in similar situations. Facilitated discussion and sharing of experiences within the group will help you gain insight, acceptance and self-awareness. The group focuses on examining all relationships. Members observe when they take similar roles in their relationships, choose the same types of people, and recreate similar situations. One of the stages of healing is working on the harm that was done in the relationship as well as being accountable for one’s part in the dynamic. Once the trauma of the separation has been worked through, the deeper work begins. The focus is placed on the individual and their relationship with themselves.

Remember- the disorientation of divorce can last a long time, and the process of finding your footing is not linear. There are days when you feel grounded and secure. Then a trigger can lead to a fresh wave of grief, anger and confusion.

If you have kids, you have to re-learn how to deal with your ex, shift communication styles, and become more formal and distant. It may be hard to create new boundaries with your ex. The fighting may continue, or one of you may need more distance while the other does not.
While the emotional upheaval is at its worst, you may be dealing with lawyers and court appearances. This just adds to feelings of frustration, fear and vulnerability. Having group support makes a huge difference because it helps you transform those negative feelings into strength.

Divorce is the starting point and our goal for the group is to transform who members will become. You will meet people who want the right kind of support so you can get through this part of your separation together.

Group Details:
Co-ed membership
ONLINE Group: 12 pm - 1:15 pm PST Wednesdays
Intake therapy session required to join

*Group starts on July 11*

name: Recreating Yourself- ONLINE Group
description:
My online group, Recreating Yourself, is focused on developing a vision of what you want your new life to be, and identifying the next steps for recreating your life so you can move forward. Divorce is the starting point - transformation is the work we do in the group. Once the trauma of the separation has been worked through, the deeper work begins. The focus of this group is placed on the individual and the relationship with oneself. You will meet people who are working on moving beyond their divorces to have healthier relationships, develop more self knowledge, and create deeper connections with yourself and others.

This online group is for those that have already finished the divorce process, or are in the ending stages, and are ready to being their new lives. Most group members are in a phase of trying to recreate their lives. Change takes many forms: moving on, living separately from their partners, final stages of legal process, starting to date, re-establishing a social life, or getting used to being alone.

My online group, Recreating Yourself, focuses on examining all of these changes and stages. Members observe how they may go through similar patterns. They get feedback on how to break out of this based on others’ experiences. Ultimately, members learn how to create their ideal “present”, so they can move forward and cultivate healthy relationships.

Together we will explore:

Who you are now
What you have learned about yourself
What you want, who you want to be
Having boundaries and practicing them
How to have happier, better relationships with family and friends

We will also look at the parts of yourself that you'd like to heal that had nothing to do with your marriage, and look at ways you may have been sabotaging yourself - such as not living up to your potential, not having the career that you want, not managing your money well, or using unhealthy coping mechanisms and addictions.

Looking at your family of origin, we can help identify the reasons you are holding on to certain unhelpful habits.

Additional group topics:

Healing the damage that happened to your past long-term relationship
Moving on to new relationships
Moving toward your future
How to get used to and be comfortable alone
What your greatest fears are for your next relationship

Group details:
Time: Tuesdays, 11:45 AM - 1 PM PST
ONLINE group
Ongoing Group with a 12 week initial commitment
Co-ed membership
Intake therapy session required to join
$65 per session

*Group starts on July 10*

name: Skeptics in the Pub
description:
Science and Reason with Skeptics in the Pub West Bay, Fiddlers Green, Millbrae sponsored by Bay Area Skeptics. (http://www.baskeptics.org/)

If ye value critical thinking, and if ye scorn the film-flam man, and if ye drink, drink with us, your friends. If ye shun the brewer's art, at least help us lay waste to bangers & mash!

Skeptics in the Pub is a monthly meeting for discussion of topics of science, reason, and skepticism. Sometimes there will be a planned talk sometimes it is a group of like minded people informally discussing the latest in science or pseudoscience.

Fiddlers Green is a 10 minute stroll from the Millbrae BART & Caltrain station.

333 El Camino Real, Millbrae CA 94030

name: Independent Investigation Group - San Francisco Bay Area
description:
The Independent Investigation Group was founded by Jim Underdown in Los Angeles about 10 years ago.  We have formed an affiliate in the Bay area<a href="http://iigsfba.org"></a>.  The group administers a $100,000 challenge similar to Randi's million dollar challenge and backed by the Committee  for Skeptical Inquiry.

It meets regularly in the afternoon of the 4th Sunday of every month.  There is a google group for internal discussion where details of time an place are announce.  If you would like to join the google group your can go to https://groups.google.com/forum/#!forum/iig-sf and apply for membership or send email to jerry at acm.org

You are urged to check out the websites linked to above before attending a meeting.

This is your chance to become a skeptical activist.

name: East Bay Skeptics Dinner
description:
The East Bay Skeptics meet for dinner and discussion on the fourth Sunday of every month. Sometimes there is a topic and someone makes a short presentation about it before an open discussion,  and sometimes there is just open discussion of whatever is on people's mind.

Ordering dinner starts at 6pm, discussion starts after eating is finished which is usually a little after 7pm.

Note that there is a email list specifically for this group. To join go to https://groups.google.com/forum/?fromgroups#!forum/eb-skeptics

Even if there are no RSVPs here there are typically between 10 and 20 "regulars" so don't hesitate to come just because you don't see RSVPs here.

We look forward to seeing you ! please RSVP if you are new.

name: Cafe Inquiry
description: Our regular monthy get together to talk about whatever interests us.

name: San Francisco Divorce: Healing and Moving On
description:
My group, Divorce: Healing and Moving On, focuses on envisioning what members want their lives to be like so they can move forward and create the life and relationships they want. This group will become a safe place for you to share these feelings without fear of judgment, as most group members are in a phase of trying to recreate their lives.

It can take 2-3 years to recover from divorce. You need to create a new identity, discover who you are as a single person, find a sense of belonging within your social circle and your community, and sometimes adjust to single parenthood. Change takes many forms: moving on, living separately from their partners, going through a legal process, starting to date, re-establishing a social life, or getting used to being alone.

In this support group, you will gain strategies, learn to cope and begin to heal by relating to others in similar situations. Facilitated discussion and sharing of experiences within the group will help you gain insight, acceptance and self-awareness. The group focuses on examining all relationships. Members observe when they take similar roles in their relationships, choose the same types of people, and recreate similar situations. One of the stages of healing is working on the harm that was done in the relationship as well as being accountable for one’s part in the dynamic. Once the trauma of the separation has been worked through, the deeper work begins. The focus is placed on the individual and their relationship with themselves.

Remember- the disorientation of divorce can last a long time, and the process of finding your footing is not linear. There are days when you feel grounded and secure. Then a trigger can lead to a fresh wave of grief, anger and confusion.

If you have kids, you have to re-learn how to deal with your ex, shift communication styles, and become more formal and distant. It may be hard to create new boundaries with your ex. The fighting may continue, or one of you may need more distance while the other does not.
While the emotional upheaval is at its worst, you may be dealing with lawyers and court appearances. This just adds to feelings of frustration, fear and vulnerability. Having group support makes a huge difference because it helps you transform those negative feelings into strength.

Divorce is the starting point and our goal for the group is to transform who members will become. You will meet people who want the right kind of support so you can get through this part of your separation together.

Group Details:
Co-ed membership
San Francisco Group: 5:30pm - 7:00pm Tuesdays
Intake therapy session required to join

name: Perl 6 Informal Study Session
description:
This is an informal series of study sessions focused on Perl 6 (aka Rakudo), a break from the past of Perl 5 and one of the contenders for language of the future.

Let's get together for a few hours on Sunday afternoons over at the Oakland Museum cafe, and start messing around with Perl 6.

This is a relatively unstructured gathering focusing on chatting and shoulder-surfing, without a lot of planned presentations-- though if you've got something you'd like to show off, by all means bring it with you.

We've been working with the Moritz Lenz books as well as the on-line docs, and now there's the new "Learning Perl 6" book to work with...

There's free wifi at the cafe, but you'll probably want to install Perl 6 before hand: https://perl6.org/downloads/

I also like having a saved copy of the documentation (converted into a single giant web page): https://docs.perl6.org/perl6.html

name: SMART Recovery San Francisco
description:
SMART (Self-Management and Recovery Training) Recovery is a non-profit organization, dedicated to helping individuals gain independence from addictive behavior. SMART Recovery is a science based, secular alternative to 12-Step programs. We understand addictive behavior to include problems with substances like alcohol, drugs and food, as well as problems from activities like eating, shopping, procrastinating, gambling and sexual behavior.

• Meetings are held every Monday, Wednesday, and Friday from 7:00PM - 8:30PM at St. Francis Memorial Hospital at 900 Hyde Street, San Francisco, CA on the 2nd Floor.

Mondays and Wednesdays are scheduled in the Hoffman Room. Fridays are scheduled in the Weyerhaeuser Room. Both rooms are on the second floor.

All meetings are free, however we do ask for donations.

Holidays: SMART Recovery meetings are held on holidays including Christmas and New Years

Michael is the coordinator of SMART Recovery San Francisco. He can be reached at[masked] (with 24/7 voice mail) or by email at [masked]

Our facilitators include: Michael, Mark, Aaron, and Jim.

Who should attend: Anyone who has engaged or is engaging in addictive behavior and would like to change those behaviors or their family and friends who would like to support them.

What you can expect: Our meetings include the introduction and practice of specific science based exercises aimed at helping us change our thinking related to addictive behavior. We also include open conversation about the challenges we encounter in making this change.

Please note: Many of our regular participants do not use Meetup. Please don't be deterred if you only see one or two people signed up. Our meeting attendance is generally between 5 to 12 people.

For more information please see: http://www.smartrecovery.org

name: Gratuitous Smash 132
Awesome Big Island Hawaii Cultural & Adventure Experience !
description:
Steve is not doing this trip this year.

This super fun trip is 8 days & 7 nights of all or most of the listed Itinerary.

Things to know about this island: It has 11 different climates. It is twice the size of all the other 7 islands combined. It is still growing. It has the most variety . (take a helicopter tour & really be blown away) From snow to rivers of lava. This is one Awesome Island !

Included: Pickup & drop off at Kona airport. All tours. Great Snorkeling . Lava Tube exploring. Volcano & lava viewing. Whale & Dolphin watching. Breathtaking Volcano Caldera Treks. Waterfall hikes. Warm thermal steam vents & pools. Black , Green, real White Sand beaches. Jungle & river treks. Manta Ray dives & observations. Water safari to Island lagoon & swim with fish & giant Green Sea Turtles.

Sunset fish & sea Turtle lagoon walk. (On day of arrival) Queen's bath & underground lava tube swim. Amazing sunset photo trip to the top of Mauna Kea volcano. (Worlds' tallest Mtn. from its base) . Snowball fight on top anyone ? This other worldly excursion will leave you breathless. (physically & emotionally) NOTE: On our last trip we left Mauna Kea sunset & on the way back in the pitch dark we were treated to the most amazing Stars & meteor shower of a Lifetime !!
Cultural locations. Botanical gardens, Volcano Winery, Zip Lining & Hawaiian history & Festivals.
Awesome hike down into the "Valley of The Kings" & explore the Black sand beaches, waterfalls, scenic jungle river & maybe find some of the Wild Horses that roam free there. I'll show you sea caves, Sea Arches, The unique lava Elevator pools, & the 4000 ft. Cloud Forest Coffee farm & tour. Cool old farmer's markets, old Hawaiian Art towns, & shopping Historical sights & so much more.
Note: This is not a sit on the beach with a Mai Tai tour. But we will be on great beaches. If you get tired; you may stay back & chill out at the pool or beach.
Our private(Hawaiian Style) Villa/home is private & gated with ocean view at about 1300 ft. No AC needed. There will be room sharing with several different bedrooms. The best part are the 4 unique Jungle outdoor showers attached to the corner units of the home.
**Also Hoping to have one of our great private chefs with us again.
**This trip is all inclusive except for maybe one evening out for dinner & airfare purchase. Snorkel gear is also included.
**Indie Tom
More info & what to bring later.

name: Amazing Australia
description:
http://www.photoflytravel.org/australia-group-tours/

The Land Down Under

March 27th - April 7th 2019

Our friends at PhotoFly Travel Club (http://www.photoflytravel.com/) have invited us to this amazing new adventure!

Go here to sign up: http://www.photoflytravel.org/australia-group-tours/

E-mail us at [masked] for the daily itinerary!

This amazing part of the world has been long overdue for another adventure! This time we will explore the beauty, beaches, & iconic buildings of Sydney, The Great Barrier Reef around the stunning Whitsunday Islands, & the history, food, & cultural epicenter that is Melbourne! Our tour leader and travel club founder, Steve Juba, used to live in Sydney and has explored much of the “Land Down Under”. We’re excited to show you some of our favorite parts of the great country of Australia!

* 11 nights/12 days throughout the best of Australia

* Breakfast Everyday

* 1 lunch, 2 Dinners

Sydney: 3 Nights

As Australia’s largest city, Sydney embraces its harbor, taking the sea and natural waterways to its heart. The grand style of the Sydney Opera House has made the city the landmark of the South Pacific. Sydney, with some 4 million people is the oldest, biggest, and liveliest city in Australia. Sydney’s facilities for sightseeing and holiday activities are unequaled by any other Australian city. It is a paradise for surfers, swimmers, yachtsmen, fishermen, and golfers. Full of history and great nightlife, the choice of things to do in Sydney is endless.

- Privately Guided City Tour throughout highlights of Sydney (Opera House, Sydney Harbor Bridge, Darling Harbor, “The Rocks” historic district, Parliament House, Kings Cross, Watson’s Bay, Bondi Beach)

- Free time to explore the streets and world class beaches Sydney has to offer.

Port Stevens & Nelson Bay Full Day Adventure:

* Discover the beautiful North Coast region of Port Stephens, with its diverse blue water paradise, its pristine waterways, golden sandy beaches, eco diverse marina, and National Parks.

* Port Stevens Dolphin Watch Cruise: Search for pods of bottlenose dolphins and watch as they play on the bow waves.

* 4WD Sand Dunes Adventure: Experience the grandeur and tranquility of this local desert wilderness and try sand- boarding, a thrill you will never forget.

The Whitsunday Islands & Great Barrier Reef: 4 Nights

A great way for you to experience everything the Whitsundays and the Great Barrier Reef has to offer. Witness the whitest sand in the world on Whitehaven Beach, feast your eyes on the most exotic marine life in the beautiful waters of the Great Barrier Reef, and get up close and personal with a collection of native animals including koalas, kangaroos, crocodiles, wombats and various reptiles at Wild Life Hamilton Island.

- Great Barrier Reef Full Day Adventure

The Great Barrier Reef is truly one of the great wonders of the natural world and a “must-see” for any visitor to Australia. Getting there is half the fun onboard ‘Seaflight’, the 37-metre wavepiercer, ideally suited to outer reef cruising.

name: Mobile Application Testing Boot Camp – 2 days of hands-on training
description:
Mobile Application Testing Boot Camp in the Bay Area

</a>

<a href="http://renttesters.com/mobile-application-testing-bootcamp/">

</a>

<a href="http://renttesters.com/mobile-application-testing-bootcamp/">

</a>

Rapid growth of mobile will continue to transform the software industry in 2016 and beyond. Nearly 70% of startups building mobile apps or plan to enter the space in the near future. Ensuring quality is the greatest challenge (and key to success) in mobile industry. As a result, organizations are prioritizing testing and implementing many key quality processes and tools across the application lifecycle. Producing quality products is the #1 greatest challenge for succeeding in the mobile space.

Nearly 80% of consumers would delete a mobile app if they encountered a single bug.

In our Mobile Application Testing Boot Camp you will:

• Understand what makes mobile application testing different from standard software testing

• Learn some of the underlying technologies behind mobile devices and how those technologies affect testing

• Discover how mobile applications work and different techniques for testing  them

• Explore the different types of mobile applications and how to test for each

You will learn how to identify common issues in mobile applications and how to test the unique aspects of a mobile application testing. In this course you will learn how to test  usability across multiple platforms and resolutions, network and security testing, creating application unit tests, mobile UI automation, and performance testing for various devices over various networks and carriers.

Course Outline:

• Introduction to mobile testing

• What is mobile testing?

• Why is mobile testing important?

• What do you need to know to be a good mobile tester?

• Emerging trends in the mobile marketplace

• Types of mobile applications

• Mobile application SDLC

• Mobile testing platforms

• Mobile specific testing

• Network testing

• Data storage testing

• Security testing

• Understanding how the operating system affects testing

• Testing special device capabilities

• Usability testing for mobile devices

• Testing mobile web applications

• Application testing strategies

• Testing native applications

• Tools for testing native applications

• Testing hybrid applications

• Tools for testing hybrid applications

Hands-On Mobile App Testing

In this Boot Camp you will learn about mobile application testing through hands-on activities, exercises, discussions, and demos. You will explore mobile testing techniques on your mobile device, so a mobile device, smartphone, or tablet is required (BYOD).

Who Should Attend

This course is appropriate for both novice and experienced software testers who are new to mobile application testing. Technical support, business analysts, and test managers may also find this course helpful. A background of basic software testing principles is required.

Agenda:

9:00am-9:30am.....Breakfast Social (continental breakfast provided)
9:30am-12:00pm.....Class Time 
12:00pm-1:00pm.....Lunch Break (bring your own lunch) 
1:00pm-6:00pm.....Hands-On Testing

Please visit our website to register: <a href="http://renttesters.com/mobile-application-testing-bootcamp/">http://renttesters.com/mobile-application-testing-bootcamp/

Cost: $350

We hope to see you soon in our Mobile Application Testing Boot Camp and share our knowledge with you!

name: Galapagos Islands Cruise! * SOLD OUT*
description:
*SOLD OUT!!! Email [masked] if you are interested in next year's trip.*

QUITO + Galapagos Islands Cruise (9 days / 8 nights)

Trip Dates : November 12 - November 21, 2018

-OR-

MAINLAND ECUADOR + Galapagos Islands Cruise (13 days / 12 nights)

Trip Dates : November 8 - 20, 2018

More details below :

The Galapagos is not considered a 'cheap' destination. You can cut corners to make it more affordable by staying in land-based hotels and then do day trips out to some of the islands, but you would not get to see the more far flung islands this way. We have opted for a cruise because a land-based tour in the Galapagos puts you with many other tourists which can make each boat transit time as long as 2 hours one way (or more) on dinghy.

We chose a cruise rather than a land-based experience, so that we can go to the more far flung islands that land based tourists will not get to see. We'll sail at night and then wake up at our next destination. The cruise is 5 days/4 nights. Most cruises are either a 4, 5 or 8 days. The 4 day cruise is a bit too short and the 8 day a bit too long. The 5 day cruise allows for just the right amount of time to explore the Galapagos. If you would like to look at the boat we'll be sailing around the islands, please click on the link below. The maximum amount of travelers on the boat we take is 16 people and there are 9 rooms available. This is a first-class, luxury boat and is one of the top 3 boats that sails in the Galapagos!

Our boat in the Galapagos : http://www.alya-cruise.com/

The reason a smaller boat is better is because of the ease in which to do day excursions. Many tour groups opt for larger boats and in doing so you will have 50 - 100 other people that will be with you on the beaches and hikes making for a not so serene hike or tons of people in your pictures on "deserted" beaches.

Also, you must load into a dinghy to get from the cruise boat to the islands and with over 50 people, the load time can take over an hour. So when you are on a small boat with a maximum of 16 travelers, it allows for a genuinely private tour.

Your round-trip flight Quito - Galapagos is included in the cost of the trip, which is approximately $600. Most tours start in the Galapagos, so that means no taxi transfers, internal flights or hotel rooms are included. These can all come to a total of $1,000 or more. This trip has it all included and the only thing you must book is your international flight to and from Quito.

There are 2 options for the Galapagos Cruise :

Option 1 : QUITO & Galapagos Cruise
http://globe-drifters.com/tour/galapagos-cruise/

Price : $4,400

Option 2 : MAINLAND ECUADOR & Galapagos Cruise
http://globe-drifters.com/tour/galapagos-islands-cruise/

Price : $5,100

If you're only interested in the Galapagos cruise, Option 1 is best. If you would like to see Ecuador as well, Option 2 is best.

If you compare these trips to the larger tours and see what is and what is not included, these trips are the best deal. Plus, you'll be sailing around the Galapagos Islands on a first-class, luxury boat! :-)

Both January and February 2018 trips sold out quickly as many are a bit worried about the rumors that some of the islands might shut down in the Galapagos due to negative impact tourism has had on the environment as of the last 2 years. Which islands will be shut down or when or if any at all has not yet been announced, so the November 2018 itinerary will remain the same.

If interested, email : [masked]

name: Spokenvote Code Hacking Session
description:
This meetup combines forces with Spokenvote, a project written in AngularJS, Coffeescript and Rails! Come see why the Spokenvote team is so passionate about this open-source Javascript and Rails consensus project. In this meetup we will discuss the list of open tickets and do some hands-on coding. Spokenvote is written in the AngularJS Javascript framework, so it's an excellent opportunity to take your Javascript skills into the front lines of the Javascript revolution. Many think of AngularJS as Google's bid for HTML6. Come see what all the excitement is about.

More about Spokenvote . . .

Spokenvote is a tool to help groups of any size, from a local school board to an entire nation’s people, reach consensus with radical efficiency. We think the process should be intuitive, fun, and democratic. Deeply inspired by Wikipedia, Spokenvote is an open source non-profit tool intended for small groups today, but over time to reach national politics. It starts with spontaneously capturing ideas as they occur to us. When we do that as a diverse group, a “power of the crowd” effect is introduced. The result is often a revelation of common sense that is difficult to discover from a top-down approach. The working project can be found at spokenvote.org.

Are you witholding your gifts from the world because you think you are not good enough or you worry about people think?

Let go of stress + resistance and get back in the zone in your biz and life.
Let go of the past and tap into your vision.
Find out how tapping can help you change your life, shine and follow your dreams.

Tapping provides relief from chronic pain, emotional problems, disorders, addictions, phobias, post-traumatic stress disorder, and physical diseases. While Tapping is newly set to revolutionize the field of health and wellness, the healing concepts that it’s based upon have been in practice in Eastern medicine for over 5,000 years. Like acupuncture and acupressure, Tapping is a set of techniques which utilize the body’s energy meridian points. You can stimulate these meridian points by tapping on them with your fingertips – literally tapping into your body’s own energy and healing power.

Your body is more powerful than you can imagine… filled with life, energy, and a compelling ability for self-healing. With Tapping, you can take control of that power.

Release what is not working and move in the direction of your dreams.

We will spend the evening tapping away blocks to new beginnings, setting intentions and visualizing. This will be a powerful way to get focused, release blocks and tap into magic in your biz and life.

In the workshop you will:

1. Set your intentions

2. Tap away resistance, fear, limiting beliefs and more + create a new beginning.

3. Do a visualization and get back in the zone.

4. Pick an angel card

Come and tap it all away!
Presale $25 / Doors $30

name: Is there more to reality than mere things?
description:
We have had a year long debate on this question and we are finally doing the reading required to pursue it with care. Using deceptively simple language, the question is whether there are more than mere things. Take all the fundamental individual things, including their fundamental properties and relations. Is anything left unspecified? Are two possible worlds, identical in all their individual specifics, themselves identical? The thesis called Humean Supervenience answers, yes, as does Rodrigo and the author of this week's paper "Humean Supervenience" by David Lewis. Kenny, cautiously reluctant to assent to any metaphysical claims that seem to hazard a priori reasoning, is concerned that this claim leaves important questions about chance, universals, laws, norms, and other metaphysical notions out in the cold.

We are all beginners this week. Help us learn some Lewis!

http://www.andrewmbailey.com/dkl/Humean_Supervenience_Debugged.pdf
https://philpapers.org/rec/LEWHSD-2

name: Does science needs laws, as well as the mere things?
description:
This week we followup from the last with a reinforcement. Against the view that science needs a robust realism of laws, independent of the mere things the laws govern, Barry Loewer defends the thesis. We'll read his "Humean Supervenience".

http://rci.rutgers.edu/~loewer/papers/Humean_Supervenience.pdf
https://philpapers.org/rec/LOEHS

Entrepreneurs from around the world have come to attend Pitch Globally’s Sharktank Style Pitch & Networking events. Pitch Globally (www.pitchglobally.com), counts among our strategic partners, PitchForce (whose founder is key member of the Keiretsu Forum, known for being the first program where senior executives work for startups on equity during fundraising) and US Angels( the founder, also a member of Keiretsu Forum, Harvard Business Angels, and other funds). We host investor events which are a leading curated platform for local and global startups to connect with investors in Silicon Valley.
Members of major angel and reputed VC funds in Silicon Valley participate in our events. Based on demand from our partners in other cities and countries, we have developed Silicon Valley Week as a forum where startup founders obtain exposure to investors over the course of the first three days. On the fourth day, attendees will participate in a one-day bootcamp, "How to Master Silicon Valley Funding and Mindset" featuring lectures and hands-on workshops by mentors from the Vault SF and other subject matter experts. name: Mitsuye and Nellie: Asian American Poets - Q & A with Nellie Wong
description:
This absorbing documentary examines the lives of Asian Americans through the inspirational poetry of Mitsuye Yamada and Nellie Wong. Interviews, rare archival footage, intimate family scenes and a lively dialogue between these fascinating women underscore the different histories of Chinese and Japanese Americans, but also shared experiences of biculturalism and generational difference. Produced by Academy Award winners Allie Light and Irving Saraf.

Film will be followed by discussion with Nellie Wong.

Doors open - 2:00; Program begins - 2:30
Donations appreciated.

Arrive early to get a good seat.

(I plan to arrive at 2:00. There will be a vegetarian lunch provided for $7. I will post a note with what I am wearing to make finding me a bit easier.)

This event is sponsored by the Bay Area Freedom Socialist Party. For more information, please visit http://socialism.com/about-fsp/

description:
One of the most anticipated literary nights of the year, San Francisco's Lit Crawl is a massive, one-night literary pub crawl throughout the city’s Mission District. Lit Crawl SF brings together 500+ authors and close to 10,000 fans for the world’s largest free pop-up literary event. Started in 2004, Lit Crawl cultivates a unique, resonant brand: smart and silly, worldly and wacky events presented in venues usual (bars, cafes, galleries, and bookstores) and unusual (police stations, tattoo parlors, barbershops, and laundromats).

name: BenchMark in Oakland
description:
Are you interested in having more fun? Better friendships? All different types of people come to BenchMarks which makes it a unique experience every time.

BenchMarks are a fun way to get to know people, even if you've been friends with them for years. Imagine going to a party, but instead of the usual "How's it going?" "What do you do for work?" type of questions, you got to ask anything that you were interested in. BenchMarks aim to get below the surface and have people really get to know each other.

A BenchMark is a structured social evening that is comprised of 4 different games based around communication. Through these games, people can give and get as much attention as they want, find out about more about the other people there, and let people get to know them, too-- if they so choose.

This event is $11 or whatever. Please arrive a few minutes early, we'll be starting on time. You're welcome to bring friends - we look forward to meeting you!

name: Deep Learning  101
description:
This event is organized by:

www.idea-to-ipo.com

The deadline to register and pay online is 2 pm the day of the event.

PLEASE READ THE ENTIRE EVENT DESCRIPTION.

There is a cover charge for this event.

A "YES" RSVP on our meetup site does not confirm your reservation.

Space is limited. Please only RSVP "Yes" if you will be attending.

Take advantage of early responder pricing!

Slots are limited. First come, first served!

First Responders $9 plus Eventbrite fees

Second Responders $12 plus Eventbrite fees

Third Responders $15 plus Eventbrite fees

In order to attend, you must register and pay here:

https://www.eventbrite.com/e/deep-learning-101-tickets-50892023412

Please bring your printed ticket to the event.

Or, pay $20 (cash) at the door.

The speaker will provide a primer on deep learning for both technical and non-technical entrepreneurs.

The following topics will be covered:

1) What is deep learning?

2) What is deep learning capable of and what are the limits of deep learning in terms of technological advancement?

3) How is deep learning related to machine learning and artificial intelligence?

4) How did deep learning originate and progress to it's present state?

5) How does deep learning work?

6) How can deep learning lead to the automation of intellectual and non-intellectual tasks and processes?

7) What are some barriers to entry for deep learning entrepreneurs and how can these barriers to entry be overcome?

and more!

Please come with your questions and comments.

Agenda

6:30 pm to 7:00 pm Check In, Food, Networking

7:00 pm to 8:30 pm Presentation, Q & A

8:30 pm to 9:00 pm More Networking

About the Speaker

Alex Tsyplikhin, PhD, has been working in the area of data science for fifteen years, building consumer and enterprise products. Alex is with Graphcore, a company that has designed a processor that’s 10x more efficient for machine intelligence workloads – an Intelligence Processing Unit (IPU).

Alex holds a PhD in Speech Biometrics from MIPT and is passionate about improving businesses and lives using advances in technology.

If you have questions about the content of this presentation, email Alex at:

name: Berkeley October 21st Family Constellations
description:
We all long for closeness and connection.

How does that get broken in families? Modern neuro-scientists understand that closeness and connection is an inherent part of the human experience. In families where closeness has caused hurt, we can lose touch with the easy availability of intimacy. Constellation work re-establishes that intimacy, making it available for all of us.

We will have two family constellations. We meet from 6:30-9:30pm. Let me know if you are interested in being a client or a participant.

Please come a little early! It helps our process immensely when we can start on time, and not have interruptions in the constellations as people arrive.

Cost: Only $5.00 for participants.

More information: To find out more, go to www.conviviumconstellations.com.

Parking: There is ample parking around Rudramandir, particularly west of 6th Street. However, out of respect for the residential neighbors, they ask that guests follow these guidelines:

Park directly in front of the building or on 6th Street between Bancroft Way and Addison (the block north of our building, towards University).

Park on Bancroft Way, between 6th and 4th Streets (west of 6th).

Park on 5th and 4th Streets between Channing and Addison.

PLEASE DO NOT PARK EAST OF 6TH STREET. Those streets are in a residential area and parking is reserved for our neighbors.

Also, please be careful not to block driveways.

name: SFUAC Traditional Thanksgiving weekend in Tahoe [North Lake Tahoe][Members]
description:
Please register here for the event: https://urbanadventureclub.com/event-3092163

Why spend Thanksgiving in a small apartment in SF when you can spend it in a big beautiful house in Tahoe? We have a spacious 4 bedroom house (with a hot tub) booked for Thanksgiving weekend, and you are invited to celebrate this traditional American holiday and party with us!

This house has a huge great room where we can hang out and relax. There's a big screen tv, a fireplace, and lots of comfortable seating.
The new hot tub is on the back patio for easy access. We will chill in it and soak away our stress from the day while enjoying beautiful views. Since it's Thanksgiving weekend, we will all make a traditional Thanksgiving meal together. Think turkey, stuffing, gravy, mashed potatoes, yams, cranberry sauce, and apple pie.

Hopefully by Thanksgiving there will be plenty of snow for us to play around in. We can get lift tickets to a nearby mountain (Northstar, Squaw, or Boreal) for skiing and snowboarding. No matter what skill level you are, you can find someone to hit the slopes with.

We had the best time on this trip last year so I'm happy to bring it back. Don't miss out on this amazing experience!

Click Here to Follow Our Events Calendar (https://www.calendarx.com/calendarpage/cw71248)

Host: Andy Huang

Registration Price
Premium Members: $349
Free Members: $379

This includes:
- Carpool transportation to Tahoe and back
- 4 nights in a comfortable bed in our awesome ski house
- 9 meals, only excluding lunch on Friday and Saturday
- Traditional Thanksgiving dinner including turkey and all the fixin's
- Snacks (fruits, veggies, cheese, crackers, and desserts)
- All alcohol (beer, cider, wine, champagne, and mixed drinks)
- All beverages (water, tea, coffee, soda, and sparkling water)
- Games (board games, party games, and video games)
- Parties (karaoke and dance party)

The Plan
Wednesday
- Carpool to Tahoe and arrive at our Tahoe mansion
- Settle in with a welcome drink and snacks
- Meet everyone else on the trip
- A light meal will be served
- Celebrate the start of our holiday weekend!

Thursday
- Breakfast at the house
- Play games like Monikers, Codenames, and Taboo
- Watch Thanksgiving football (optional)
- Make Thanksgiving together like a family
- Thanksgiving dinner with turkey, stuffing, mashed potatoes, cranberry sauce, yams, biscuits, and pie
- After dinner drinking games and hot tubbing
- Karaoke party where we sing our favorite songs!

Friday
- Breakfast at the house
- Skiing/snowboarding or other snow sports (if there's snow)
- Hiking around lake Tahoe (if no snow)
- Lunch by the lake at Jake's on the Lake
- Relax in the hot tub before dinner
- Play party games like Jenga, Joking Hazard, or Twister
- Let's burn off some Thanksgiving calories with a dance party!

Saturday
- Breakfast at the house
- Skiing/snowboarding, snow sports, or hiking
- Exploring the North shore of Lake Tahoe
- Go for a scenic drive around the lake and beaches
- Relax in the hot tub session before dinner
- Drinks, games, and dancing or karaoke

Sunday
- Breakfast at the house.
- Pack up and check out by 11AM
- Exploring or snow sports
- Carpool back to SF
- Optional group lunch/dinner on the way home

If you do not ski or snowboard there are plenty of other things to do in Tahoe including snow tubing, snow shoeing, snow mobile riding, gambling, shopping, or just chill at the house.

name: Opening NASA's Mission Control
description:
From the iconic mission control center in Houston that guided astronauts to the Moon, to the control centers for robotic explorers that extend our senses to the solar system and beyond, mission control serves as the nerve center for decisions, planning, science, command, and control for our journeys into space.

Centers of technical excellence, and also symbols of our explorations, mission control has evolved with time, technology, and new missions. Of course, cathode ray tubes have given way to flat screens and touch screens. But has mission operations fundamentally changed from the glory days of Apollo? The closed world of mission control is starting to open, with open data and open-source software projects that allow anyone — citizen scientists and engineers — to participate.

Our speaker for this FREE presentation is Jay Trimble, computer scientist in NASA's Intelligent Systems Division at Ames Research Center. He has also served as Lead Operations Director for Space Radar Lab at the Jet Propulsion Lab, and Shuttle Mission Controller at NASA Johnson Space Center.

name: Sketching in October @ the Emeryville Celebration of the Arts [SUNDAY date!]
description:
New and exciting Sunday date!

Enjoy the great weather and interesting architecture in Emeryville. From new modern housing to old industrial buildings, this area has mini-parks, streetscapes and walking paths. An added bonus is the Emeryville Celebration of the Arts exhibit, which is free and open from 11-6pm.

Emeryville Celebration of the Arts
* http://www.emeryarts.org/2018/directions.html

At the meetup:
Meet at the South-west corner of Powell and Hollis. There is a large antennae-looking sculpture in the small park.

• We'll meet at 11:00 and kick off with a group warm-up activity, then spread out and sketch some cool stuff and check out the art exhibit.

• At 2:30 pm we'll meet back at the starting point for group gallery and feedback.

• Feel free to stay after and sketch more.

Notes:

Materials: Bring your own materials: pencils, paper, paints, pens.

Also recommended: stool or chair, hat, sunscreen, a snack and water.

Just in case of rain or wind: jacket, umbrella, clips for your sketchbook.

Transit & Facilities:
* Parking available in nearby lots and street parking
* Area served by AC transit, and the Emery-go-Round offers a free shuttle from MacArthur BART
* Public restrooms are located at the art show and in local businesses.
* Free admission to the art exhibit

Hope to see you there!

name: Balance Your Energy / Heal Your Life
description:
Hello Everyone,

Hope this finds you doing well and thriving. Or if you find yourself in a very interesting place; at least you can take the next step forward on your path.

We are starting something new with the meetup. Instead of a weekly meeting we are offering a seven-week course based on balancing your life by healing the energy structure of your being. Please read the course description below.
Many thanks.

Balance Your Energy / Heal Your Life
A Seven Week Course for Your Seven Chakras

Life can be challenging. That is for sure! There are relationships problems; difficult emotions from the past, financial worries, health issues, etc, etc. All calling for your attention.

What if there was a way to simplify and consolidate all these issues and heal them from the inside? Heal them from their root causes?

There is ancient wisdom that is surfacing in 21st century America, wisdom that is showing us more skillful ways to be a human being. This deep traditional awareness is telling us that we are, at our core, energy bodies. It is also telling us we when regulate and harmonize the flow of our internal energy our life can start to come into balance.

At the center of this system are seven major wheels of spinning energy called chakras. They stretch along your spine from the tailbone to the crown of your head. Between them, they represent the full range of human experience; from the tooth and claw struggle of survival to the ultimate bliss of uniting with the universe. For most of us, we fall somewhere in between and are a hodgepodge mixture of slightly imbalanced chakras. But instead working to harmonize this foundational system we put most of our efforts on the struggle to control the outside experiences of our lives.

However, in this seven-week course we will work to start to harmonize our lives from the inside out. Each week will focus on the issues of one of the chakras. We will build a basic understanding of the dynamics of that chakra and then open-up time for everyone to express their relevant personal experiences. We will then we break into smaller groups and do interpersonal exercises which will give you more insight into your issues around that chakra. Finally, we will use hands-on meditative and other energy techniques so that you can learn control and best balance that chakra.

We are asking, that instead of joining these seven groups in a hunt and peck manner; that you sign up for the seven classes as one unit so that you can build a more stable energy structure for yourself and also that we will have a cohesive and supportive group to help everyone in this intimate journey.

We hope you can join us in this exploration into the fascinating and powerful dimensions that lie within us all.

All the best,

Cindy and Paul

Place: Sima Space, 1918 Bonita Ave, Berkeley
If you need the security code to get in the front door, call one of the numbers below. Also if you do not see the signs posted telling you which room we are meeting in, you can also call the numbers below.
Time: Wednesday evenings 6:30 PM to 9:30PM Wednesday, Oct 24 and running through December 12. We will be skipping Wed 11/21 as it is the night before Thanksgiving.

Price: Suggested donation for all seven classes is $175.

Contact: Paul,[masked], Cindy:[masked]

Cindy Mayne: I am a Clinical Hypnotherapist, Burris Life Coach and Reiki Master and I specialize in addictions, anxiety and letting go of weight. I also enjoy doing inner child work and finding the issue from childhood that needs to be healed. I believe that recovery from anything, anxiety, depression, and addictions is a journey and not a destination.

Paul Winternitz: is dedicated to the spiritual path. On this road, he has learned much about healing through the caring for his own wounds.
He has worked as a counselor for over 18 years and has been a volunteer chaplain. He also works as an artist.

name: Spiritual Chat | Your String of Life: How to stay balanced?
description:
********** Your String of Life: The Middle Path ***********
It’s about detachment, being neither too much for nor against anything—the middle path. Living does entail putting ourselves into life. But not blindly or rashly.

Emotions are a fundamental, good, and necessary part of our human makeup. They add warmth and color to living. However, too much or too little of a good thing, including our expression of emotions, comes with a price. Tests show that people who suffer the loss of a loved one but cannot get over the worst of the pain in a short time put their own health at risk. The same holds true for other situations of loss, like a bitterly contested break-up, the loss of a friend, a pet, or a job.

Our spiritual attitude toward change determines, in the end, how well and quickly we pick ourselves up from the dirt. To make a new beginning.

Join us at The Center (548 Fillmore St) this Friday, November 9th from 3:30-4:30p.m. for a spiritual chat on 'How to Stay Balanced?' over a cup of flavorful tea and refreshments. Look for the Meet Up sign, drop by for a brief meet and greet or hang out with us for longer. No reservation needed.

description:
NLP tools for removing the blocks to living your best life and being your best self.

I invite you to look deep inside and ask yourself, “What is it that I truly desire in my life that I don’t have yet?”

*Optimal health?

name: Discuss "Station Eleven" by Emily Mandel
description:
Join us for a discussion and conversation about "Station Eleven" by Emily St. John Mandel.

From Goodreads (https://www.goodreads.com/book/show/20170404-station-eleven):

"An audacious, darkly glittering novel set in the eerie days of civilization's collapse, Station Eleven tells the spellbinding story of a Hollywood star, his would-be savior, and a nomadic group of actors roaming the scattered outposts of the Great Lakes region, risking everything for art and humanity.

One snowy night a famous Hollywood actor slumps over and dies onstage during a production of King Lear. Hours later, the world as we know it begins to dissolve. Moving back and forth in time—from the actor's early days as a film star to fifteen years in the future, when a theater troupe known as the Traveling Symphony roams the wasteland of what remains—this suspenseful, elegiac, spellbinding novel charts the strange twists of fate that connect five people: the actor, the man who tried to save him, the actor's first wife, his oldest friend, and a young actress with the Traveling Symphony, caught in the crosshairs of a dangerous self-proclaimed prophet.

Sometimes terrifying, sometimes tender, Station Eleven tells a story about the relationships that sustain us, the ephemeral nature of fame, and the beauty of the world as we know it."

Location for this meetup is currently TBA. Prompt RSVPs are greatly appreciated so we can get a sense of the group size and select an appropriate venue. Looking forward to seeing everyone!

name: Everest Base Camp Trek
description:
Famous for its spectacular mountain peaks and the loyalty and friendliness of its inhabitants (the Sherpas), the Everest region (Khumbu) is one of the most popular mountain destinations. The best times to visit are from the beginning of March to mid-May and from September to mid-November.

The 15-day trek would begin in Kathmandu with a local sightseeing trip. We then fly to Lukla and embark on an exhilarating trek to the Everest Base Camp soaking in some of the most magnificent mountain ranges to grace the planet.

With our emphasis on safety and comfort, we take acclimatization breaks at Namche Bazaar (3440m / 11286ft) and Dingboche (4410m / 14469ft) before proceeding to the Everest Base Camp at 5364m / 17598mft. No technical climbing is involved and as long as you have a heart for adventure and reasonable fitness, you should be able to enjoy it. For the climbing enthusiast, the optional summits of Chhukung Ri and Kala Pattar should provided added thrills.

The cost for this trek is USD[masked]

This includes

a) Airport transfers in Kathmandu
b) Three nights hotel accommodation in Kathmandu with breakfast
c) Sightseeing trip in Kathmandu
d) Flight from Kathmandu to Lukla and back
e) All applicable park fees and local permits
f) All lodging and meals during the trek
g) Guidance and info sessions by our US based guide in preparation for the trip

Nepal visa, international flights to Kathmandu and back, meals other than breakfast in Kathmandu, travel insurance and gratuities are not included.

Please visit our EBC page ( http://miyaradventures.com/trip/everest-base-camp/ ) for more details. Please email to [masked] or call [masked] if you have any questions.

name: Aconcagua climb
description:
Aconcagua ("White Sentinel") at 22841 feet is the tallest mountain in the Southern and Western hemispheres. One of the seven summits of the world, it is also the tallest non-technical summit in the world. The climb is exhilarating for any adventure enthusiast, offering breathtaking views of the Andean range in the Chile - Argentina border.

I will be leading an Aconcagua expedition in January 2019. We will start from Mendoza and take the Normal (Plaza da Mulas) route through the Horcones valley. While non-technical, the climb by no means should be approached lightly. Aconcagua has a reputation for treating the casual hikers very harshly. We will take 18 days for our expedition, with plenty of time for acclimatization and allowing us two buffer days for the summit attempt to account of inclement weather and other circumstances.

PRICE INCLUDES
- 2 nights hotel in Mendoza (breakfast included)
- 1 night hotel in Penitentes (Dinner & breakfast included)
- Led by US-based MIyar Adventures guide in assistance with Professional & bilingual local guides. Guide to participant ratio: 1:2
- All the meals during the expedition (except in Mendoza City)
- All shared equipment for the expedition (Tents, stoves, etc)
- Complete base camp services (meals, dining tent, bathrooms, storage etc)
- Airport Transfers (in/out)
- Penitentes Transfer (in/out) in private van
- Mule transportation of the equipment
- Permanent VHF radio communication and Expedition Tracking by Spot,
InReach-Delorme
- Professional first aids kits and pulse oximeter for daily updates of acclimatization progress

PRICE DOES NOT INCLUDE
- Climbing Permits
- Optional Altitude Porters.
- Any cost if the climber abandons the trip
- Meals in Mendoza
- Drinks in Mendoza and Penitentes
- Personal gear, medications, ground or air evacuations, room services, laundry, beverages, phone communications and items of personal nature, insurance liability, hospitalization or medication of any kind,
