name: Travel to Cuba - LGBTQ TRIP
description:
If you're interested in traveling to Cuba, there are some amazing trips coming up this year. Groups will be mostly solo travelers and small, usually between 7-10 people and truly local, as we will be staying in local bed and breakfast style accommodations. Email [masked] if interested or if you have questions.

All of the non-LGBT trips are open to everyone and usually about a quarter to half of everyone on each trip are LGBTQ travelers.

TRIP DATES :

- December 26, 2018 - January 3, 2019 (LGBTQ Trip)
*6 SPOTS LEFT! 1 solo male looking for a roommate.*

- November 17 - 25, 2018
*6 SPOTS LEFT! 1 solo male looking for a roommate.*

Trip details can be seen on the website : globe-drifters.com/tour/cuba

PRICE (excluding flights) :

Regular Season - $2,400 (February - November)

Peak Season - $2,600 (December - January)

Single Supplement is $550

REVIEWS :

See past travelers' Yelp reviews by clicking here : https://www.yelp.com/biz/globe-drifters-san-francisco-2

ITINERARY :

Days 1-3 : HAVANA

• Classic car convertible ride to Fusterlandia (famous artist neighborhood) and Revolution Square.
• Drinks in Old Havana and live music at El Floridita, Buena Vista Social Club and other hot spots!

Days 3-5 : VINALES

• Organic farm visit and dinner at local farmer's home.
• Local tobacco farm tour and cigar rolling demonstration.
• Your choice of optional activities : cooking class & local market visit, horseback riding, or caving at one of the many caves in the area (at your own expense).

Days 5-6 : PLAYA LARGA

• Swimming or snorkeling at Bay of Pigs & Bay of Pigs historical museum visit.
• Sunset dinner & drinks at Playa Larga.

Days 6-8 : TRINIDAD

• Hike to and swim at waterfall w/ a stop at a local farmer's house for tea.
• Beach time at Playa Ancon.

Days 8-9 : HAVANA

• Say adios to Cuba with one last dinner at a local paladar!

For more information, please visit : http://globe-drifters.com/tour/cuba/ or email : [masked]

name: World Pride NYC Group Trip 2019
description:
In 2015, New York announced that Interpride, the organization that puts on World Pride, had selected the City to host World Pride in 2019. This marks the first time out of the 5 previous events that World Pride hosted that the event will take place in the United States.

This allows both New York City and the LGBTQ Community to mark the 50th Anniversary of the Stonewall Riots which took place over 6 nights after New York City Police Officers raided the Stonewall Inn and “attempted” to arrest many of the patrons for doing nothing but living their truth. This lead to the modern movement for both LGBTQ Acceptance and LGBTQ Rights as well. Something that we are still striving and working towards in 2018 and 2019.

June of 2019, NYC Pride welcomes WorldPride as we mark the 50th Anniversary of the Stonewall Uprising and the work that we have gone through in the same time for the LGBTQIA+ liberation.

The events scheduled for 2019 edition of NYCPride and WorldPride will mirror the scope and inclusive nature of both the city itself as well as our LGBTQIA+ community. From the epic size of the NYC Pride March and the Rally which is the Largest Pride events not including previous World Pride events, as well as the other events including events designed to entertain you, inform you and bring us together in celebration and protest.

http://www.travelinpride.com/world-pride-2019/

The Paramount Hotel is a 597-room New York City hotel in Midtown, just half a block from Times Square. Discover our fascinating history, which dates back to the 1920s, and learn what people are saying about us today. If you have any questions or comments, we would love to hear from you. And when it’s time for a visit, please refer to the driving directions and other transportation information provided for your convenience.

We have a discount Group Rate setup with almost a 20% off of the standard rate for the same dates. So take in Pride, save some money and we will shuttle you to most major World Pride Events

Hotel Rate: $219 plus tax per night for Petite Broadway Queen Room.

Deposit Due to Hotel: One Night plus Tax

Deposit due for Shuttle Services; $50

More Information to come

name: World Veg Festival in San Francisco
description:
World Veg Festival in San Francisco
October 27th at the SF County Fair Building in Golden Gate Park
Tickets and more info here: http://www.worldvegfestival.com/

For 18 years the San Francisco Veg Society has been organizing the World Veg Festival to educate and inspire more people about the benefits of plant-based lifestyle for healthy, ethic, and sustainable living..

The first World Veg Festival in San Francisco happened in 1988 and has run annually ever since. It was initially launched to celebrate World Vegetarian Day, observed worldwide on October 1st.

WVF brings together vegetarians and vegans, as well as curious non-vegetarians and flexitarians, to celebrate World Veg Day, featuring plant-based nutrition experts, dynamic speakers, cooking demos, great veg products that the whole family can enjoy.

Check the site for the full schedule of amazing speakers and get tickets here: http://www.worldvegfestival.com/
Be sure to see Chef Love at 4PM teach how to make No Bake, No Sugar, No Gluten, No Refined Flour, No Animal Products --- Coconut Kiwi Pie

name: Relax Refresh Rejuvenate at Hot Springs and Living Food Retreat
description:
Relax, Refresh and Rejuvenate Hot Springs and Living Food Retreat

Relax, Refresh and Rejuvenate at lovely natural hot springs resort surrounded by picturesque views of the Sierra Nevada Mountains and set only 18 miles from South Lake Tahoe. Learn to prepare Raw and Vegan Cuisine from Certified Chef Jillian Love. Rejuvenate your body and mind as you spend your days enjoying delicious healthful meals, learning to prepare nourish recipes and relaxing in the on-site hot springs mineral pools. Enjoy a spa treatment, splash around in the swimming pool or take a scenic drive through the mountains for hiking, picnicking, horse riding or golf. If you're feeling like enjoying a night on the town it's just a short drive to Reno for casinos, shows and great restaurants.

THE LOCATION
David Walley’s Hot Springs Resort is based at the foothills of the Sierra Nevada Mountains and located in the historic town of Genoa, Nevada which is 20 miles south of Lake Tahoe. The spa condominium resort features five hot spring pools, full-service spa, fine dining at 1862 Restaurant & Saloon, and special event services. This resort is close to many recreational and entertainment hotspots such as Lake Tahoe, Carson City and Reno.
"The hot springs are home to some of the area’s most long-standing history. You’ll enjoy the same hot springs that served as the muse for none other than Mark Twain. His words are still true today:

Walley's Hot Springs
One of the healing geothermal pools.
“It is with greatest pleasure that I contribute an article in your valuable paper in regard to Walley’s Hot Springs, situated one and a half miles from Genoa, Douglas County, Nevada. These springs, without a doubt, have no equal on this coast for the cure of rheumatism and all afflictions that necessitate me visiting them. I now leave without crutch or cane, entirely well, not only relieved from pain but gained in spirit.”
–Mark Twain, 1887"

Resort Highlights:
Five natural hot springs/pools
Two outdoor swimming pools
Steam rooms
Dry saunas
David Walley’s Spa
Fitness center
Laundry facilities
1862 Restaurant & Saloon
Harriets Café
Bike Rentals
Business center
Billiards

HIGHLIGHTS
This Retreat will provide you with and opportunity to
Rest, Relax and Rejuvenate in Mineral Hot Springs
Refresh your body with nourishing plant based whole foods
Unplug and enjoy the peace and beauty of nature
Rejuvenate your physical energy, mental clarity & focus
Renew your radiance and vitality with sauna, steam and spa treatments
Lose excess weight, reduce bloating and puffiness
Enjoy fresh delicious plant based (mostly raw) vegan meals
Optimize your digestion and flood your body with nutrients
Learn to prepare easy healthy recipes you (and your family) will LOVE
Connect with like minded community

ACTIVITIES INCLUDED
This 7 day retreat includes:
- 7 nights Accommodation at Hot Springs Resort
- Daily access to Mineral Pool Hot Springs
- Daily access to Sauna and Steam Rooms
- Daily Superfood Smoothie Breakfast Bowls
- Plant Based Lunches and Dinners
- Hands On Raw Vegan Culinary Classes with Certified Raw Vegan Chef Jillian Love
- Raw Vegan Cheeses Workshop
- Raw Vegan Desserts Workshop
- Raw Vegan Pasta Workshop
- Plant Based Nutrition Optimization Talks
- Retreat Recipes Ebook
- Group Activities including Movie Nights, Hiking, Yoga Classes
- Use of Chi Machine
- Use of Body Vibration Plate
- Access to Spa Services including massage, hyperbaaric oxygen, mud bath *Not Included in retreat fee
- Local activities include hiking, golf, horse riding, skiing, casinos, shopping, restaurants and more. *Not Included in retreat fee
- Downtime to rest, relax, soak or explore

Please remember that everything is OPTIONAL - You can read a book and soak in the tub all day if that's what your body needs!

More details and purchase tickets HERE: https://www.eventbrite.com/e/hot-springs-and-living-food-retreat-with-chef-love-tickets-49790696313

name: San Francisco Resist Trump Tuesday Meetup with Senate Staff
description: Lets Meetup at 1 Post St. in McKesson Plaza below the office of Senator Diane Feinstein's office each Tuesday at noon- directly above Montgomery BART. Senate staff is expected to join us at 12:30pm. Why fret over politics, when we can come together weekly, to push our Senator(s) to do right by us. We will fix the root problems of our time with HJR 48, The We the People Amendment to the US Constitution, to overturn Citizens United and establish that: corporations are not people, and that money is not speech. We will have the highest respect for each other and all living things. We will express ourselves with an open mic. We will attempt to channel joy and contentment in this challenging time, as we work to make things better and more fair. Music, song, art and creativity are much appreciated. Bring your message, note or letter for your Senator, and/or from your neighbors too. See you soon.

name: [3 Day Training Course] Machine Learning
description:
More details are http://bit.ly/2JRNN01

Why this training?
In this three-day course you will be given clear explanations of machine learning theory, practical scenarios of machine learning algorithms, linear and non-linear regression, overfitting, regularization, loss functions, neural networks, introduction to the backpropagation algorithm and best practices in using different neural networks architectures.

The participants will gain experience in machine learning techniques, neural network configuration and model optimization in R and Python. This course is based on hands-on exercises and gives developers an extended overview of various tools, services and frameworks which become essential in machine learning.

More details are here: http://bit.ly/2JRNN01

name: [5 Day Training Course] Neural Networks and Deep Learning
description:
Find the detailed agenda here: http://bit.ly/2Iez2ip

This five-day hands-on course is designed for data scientists seeking a better understanding and knowledge of main technology trends driving Deep Learning.

Attendees will get a clear understanding of Deep Learning technology, practical scenarios to build, train and apply algorithms of fully connected Deep Neural Networks, strategies to configure the key parameters in a neural network's architecture.

---------------------------------------------------

Late arrivals policy:

All admissions into class will close at 10:55 am. We don't and can't allow students late into class for two reasons:

1. First 15 mins of class is the crucial part of warming up and stretching your important muscle groups before we start the intense dance cardio routines. If you miss first 15 minutes, you are more prone to injuries and we definitely don't want that. All exercise classes in the area follow the same policy.

2. Since we are doing this purely for charity, our instructors are doing this for free and dedicating their time for a good cause. We don't have full time staff to attend to late registerations and/or stand by the lobby waiting for late arrivals.

Thanks for understanding! We appreciate your support and commitment to these classes every Sunday!

**** Attending the Bollywood Cardio Classes constitutes an acknowledgement that you are in proper physical condition to participate in the Cardio Class. Further, you waive any and all claims for yourself and your heirs against Bollywood Cardio, its volunteers, its officers and employees, sponsors of Bollywood Cardio and any groups or individuals associated with this event for injury or illness including death that may result from your participation in this event. ~~~~~~~~~~~
Some of the text from the email sent out by http://hrcsf.org/
~~~~~~~~~~~
Last Tuesday, almost 50 Veritas tenants, tenant advocates, Supervisor Fewer, and even a candidate for supervisor in District 6 showed up at Pine and Powell Streets for a press conference to announce new legislation that would stop landlords from passing on their mortgage and property tax to tenants.

After the press conference, tenants marched and chant to the Greentree office at 724 Pine, where we entered the lobby and 634 Powell tenants read a letter requesting a meeting to negotiate all pending operating & maintenance passthroughs across the city not covered by the legislation.

I want to acknowledge all the tenants who came out and everyone who helped out for the event, including Jeanne, Tish, and Nikki who helped with the press release, Ray who made a bunch of amazing signs (see attached photos!), Fe who led us in chants, Amina who MCed, Lenea who took photos, Charles who passed out flyers and stickers, Sandi, Engin, Theo, and Ferminita who shared their stories, and many others!

I want to highlight an important thing from the event. Right before we were set to start, Veritas contacted Supervisor Peskin's office and said that if he did not attend the event, then Veritas would sit down and negotiate all pending O&M passthroughs across the city. I spoke with Sup. Peskin's office about this decision, and Sup. Peskin decided to not attend to keep that option on the table while ensuring the press conference would still continue.

That was a VICTORY for us, as it gave us new leverage to negotiate pending passthroughs for buildings that won't benefit from the legislation!

Then, the Veritas lobbyist called Supervisor Fewer and begged us to call off the march to Greentree's office. Because of organizing this action, we suddenly gained leverage. I brought the issue to the tenants who were there, and tenants voted to continue with the press conference and march.

As a result of this action, we got leverage to negotiate other buildings' pending passthroughs AND we saw what weakens Veritas: organized tenants, public action, and media exposure!

For the legislation, it was introduced that day, April 3. We are now in a 30-day waiting period before it goes to committee for a public hearing. During this time, we need to talk with our supervisors. I'm going to send a separate email tomorrow with more info on this strategy and how to get involved, but for now, if you don't know your supervisor, please click HERE to type in your address and find your district number and supervisor. That's the first step.
~~~~~~~~~~~
Link to property map: http://propertymap.sfplanning.org/
~~~~~~~~~~~

name: Life Support
description: Expect to relax and settle in for an hour of going deep into introspective conversation about yourself and others. Group size kept small for quality experience. For Tickets: https://lifesupporttickets.eventbrite.com

name: Weekly Run.
description:
Join us for a our weekly run club where we'll go for a 3 to 5 mile run. Each week, they'll be a specific focus for each run to help develop your skills.

Details:
• Arrive by 6:00pm at J Bodyworks. Run starts at 6:15pm.
• We start with mobility and the focus for the week.
• After the run they'll be a light stretch and time for questions.

FAQ's:
Q, What if I'm not a runner?
A, That's not a problem! We'll teach you how to run. Whether you've been running for years or you've been curious about it, this is for all levels. The whole point is to have fun.

Q, My_____ hurts when I run,
A, Come early and we'll see if we can help you get on the road with us.

Q, I'm training for a _____
A, Great! This will be perfect for you. Bring any questions or inquiries to our running coach Enrique and he'll make sure your running needs and concerns are answered.

Q, Where do I leave my stuff?
A, Your stuff will be safe at the studio. We have water to drink, a place to change your clothes and even take a shower!

We can't wait to see you here and have you run this town with us!

Click on the link bellow to sing up:
https://bit.ly/2oeRdgi

name: Learn How to Defer Capital Gains Taxes WITHOUT 1031 Exchange!!!
description:
• What we'll do
This group is for people who are tired of paying and dealing with Capital Gains Taxes. They don't want to deal with tenants anymore and they don't want to purchase another property.

No need to do a 1031 Exchange and this works for Primary Residences, Investment Property, Land, Businesses and more.

Our meeting is a presentation for the first half hour then we will discuss about tax strategies.

• What to bring
Pen and Paper to take notes.

name: Improv Drop In
description:
https://www.eventbrite.com/e/improv-drop-in-tickets-49961131088

My Drop-In classes are an opportunity to explore the fundamentals of great Improv - Presence, Connection, Listening, Commitment, Expressive Range - in a fun and supportive environment.

Each class is a unique collection of Improvisers from all over the Bay Area and beyond. If you are an improviser passing through town and you need an improv fix, please drop on in.

Classes take place at a bright & airy studio in the SoMa neighborhood of San Francisco. Doors open a half hour before class for chilling and chatting in the Groove Lounge.

No two Drop-In classes are the same but every class is a joy fest!

Love to see you there, Improv Genius!

Prerequisite: This class is for Improvisers who have a grasp of the Improv basics and beyond. No absolute beginners please.

name: Push each other around-- nicely.
description:
All styles, all traditions, all levels welcome! Friendly partner training on Sunday afternoon at 3pm at Mission Playground on the lawn at Linda and 19th St.

Meet on the lawn in (https://goo.gl/maps/S54e6C6xGKn)

Please remember to:

• Warm up and stretch out. This isn't a structured activity so it's up to you to get your body ready to move and be moved.

• Tell your partners about any injuries you have and if they need to be careful.

• Ask your partners what they'd like to do together.

• Try different things! Don't get stuck doing the same activity. There are many different forms of Push Hands (eg fixed step, fixed pattern, moving, freestyle) which cultivate skills in different ways.

• Change partners. Everyone moves in different ways. Different body types require different approaches. Thank your partner and move to the next when you're ready to try something else.

• Push somebody! We're all learning from one another so don't be afraid to try something that doesn't work, or to embarrass someone. Just keep it friendly and fun.
